loans.name: Felicita

texts.en:
Felicita is 57 years old and is a divorced mother of 2 children. With much effort, she managed to educate them while they were growing up. The eldest now works in construction, and the youngest is still studying in high school.

She started to work with a capital of $60US buying clothing, which she resold traveling house to house. Later she was able to purchase a booth in a municipal market in the city of Itá from which she began selling clothing.

Currently, she continues to engage in commercial activities selling various household products from her small store. To open this store she obtained a loan of $400US which she used to start the business out of her home. She wishes to obtain a new loan to buy more merchandise to sell from her store such as flour, rice, sugar, soft drinks, and more.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.en:
Herbierto is 67 years old and has been married for 41 years to his wife, Teófila, with whom he has 5 children. All of his children are grown, married, and working in various professions.

He lived in the neighboring country of Argentina for 11 years where he worked as a contruction worker until he decided to return to Paraguay. Currently he owns a large piece of land from which he cultivates tapioca, lettuce, sugar cane, and his primary product, strawberries. He also owns a small store which he runs out of his home and sells pre-cooked chickens on weekends and weeknights.

Herbierto has worked hard his whole life and has been successful in his endeavors. He is requesting a loan to pay for seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides to cultivate his strawberry crop.

loans.use: Purchase of insecticides, fertilizer, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia is a single mother. She lives in her own home with her two working-age children. Antonia supports herself and her family selling new and used clothing at Santa Cruz's various markets. It is a very competitive business, but with seven years of experience Antonia understands what locations are profitable. She treats her customers well and has a knack for sales. At this time she is asking for a loan to buy clothing for men, women and children. The cost of the items varies according to their quality. Antonia has a good track-record with this institution and no other outstanding debts.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Antonia es una madre soltera que trabaja como comerciante de ropa nueva y usada en las diferentes ferias ambulantes de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, esto con el fin de mantener a su familia que está conformada por sus dos hijos, quienes también ayudan económicamente a la familia ya que trabajan de manera independiente.Todos viven juntos en el inmueble de Antonia. El comercio por menor de ropa es un mercado bastante competitivo en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, pero los siete años de experiencia con los que cuenta Antonia en este rubro, le permiten tener conocimiento de los mejores lugares para ofrecer la misma, además de la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes y lo más importante el poder de convencimiento que posee le permiten ser bastante competitiva. La presente solicitud tiene como objeto la compra de mercadería variada, ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, los precios varían de acuerdo a la calidad de las prendas. Los antecedentes crediticios de Antonia son buenos en nuestra Institución, actualmente no tiene otras deudas más.

loans.use: To buy new and used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Denia Yanet

texts.en:
Denia is a young married woman who is living with her husband and her three-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a salesman in a little store in order to pay the rent for their modest house. She buys wholesale silver-plated jewelry and resells it in smaller quantities to women in her community who retail the jewelry.

The entrepreneur applied to borrow $475.00 with the aim of expanding her business and increasing her income to improve her family situation and set some money aside for her daughter's needs.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan, 48 years old, and his wife, 47, were married 11 years ago and have a 12-year-old son who is studying in the 6th grade of primary school.

Juan works selling goods of many kinds but primarily sells furniture. He started working thirty years ago selling bags and did this until he could earn the capital to start a business selling furniture. With time he was able to purchase 2 trucks and 2 motorcycles that today help him with his daily work. Juan said with pride that, although he could only study until the 6th grade, today he is a successful merchant who makes a good income and can support his family with his sales.

With this loan Juan hopes to be able to buy more merchandise in order to meet the demand of his customers, and to further expand his business.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture, mattresses, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo O., 62, is married with 5 children. Her husband works buying and selling cows - earning approximately $2 a day. Of their 5 children, 3 work at the garment factory and the other 2 are students. Keo O. will use the money from this loan to purchase more cows for their business.

loans.use: To purchase more cows

loans.name: Dum

texts.en: Mrs. Dum S. is 57 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Dum S. currently earns $4 a day selling the vegetable morning glory at a local market. Her husband earns $3 a day breeding ducks. Dum S. would like to use this loan to expand her husband's business, as this will increase the family's total income. She intends to use the $700 to purchase more ducks.

loans.use: To purchase ducks

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Dum Simun and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Mrs. Khoun S., 53, lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Between them they have 5 children, of which 4 are employed at a company and make $200 per month between them, and the 5th is a student. Her husband works selling sugar cane juice, earning $3.60 a day. Mrs. Khoun S. herself earns $3 a day selling various rice dishes. She is now looking to expand her business by selling a greater variety of rice dishes and also diversifying into soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils and soft drinks for business expansion

loans.name: Bun

texts.en: Mrs. Bun S. is 47 years old and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Bun Soroueun earns $5 a day selling fish at a market, whilst her husband earns $10 a day selling timber. Bun Saroeun is applying for this loan in order to purchase an electric saw which will increase the amount of wood that her husband can chop in one day. It should also make the work less labour intensive.

loans.use: To purchase a saw to chop wood more effectively

loans.name: Ni Luh

texts.id:
Although living with her husband and one child, Ni Luh P. has to work extra to make a family living. Her husband's income as a laborer is not enough to cover daily expenses. Because every day mother P. has to spend Rp 15,000 (about US$1.60) for her child's school expenses, and daily family living. She bought one pig breeder with an initial capital of RP 700,000 (about $75), and within six month until this breeder produced 9 offsprings, which she sold for Rp175,000 (about $18) per baby offspring. For that she profited Rp 875,000 (about $90), that she used to support family living expenses needs, and little by little Luh P. used it to repair her house, although it is still in semi permanent phase.

Walaupun hanya tinggal bersama suami dan satu anaknya Ni Luh P. harus bekerja extra untuk menghidupi keluarganya. Penghasilan suaminya sebagai buruh kasar dirasa kurang cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari., karena setiap harinya Ibu P. harus mengeluarkan biaya Rp. 15.000,- untuk biaya sekolah anaknya dan kebutuhan hidup keluarganya. Dengan modal usaha Rp. 700.000,- Ibu Luh P. membeli 1 ekor babi penginduk untuk dipelihara dan dalam waktu enam bulan melahirkan 9 ekor anak yang laku dijual Rp. 175.000,- per ekor, sehingga dari hasil penjualan ini Luh P. memperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp 875.000,- . keuntungan dari usahanya itu dipakainya untuk menunjang kebutuhan keluarganya dan sedikit demi sedikit Luh P. memperbaiki rumahnya walaupun sekarang masih dalam tahap semi permanent.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal Food

Membeli bibit babi dan makanan ternak

loans.name: Ni

texts.id:
M. W. is a pig farmer in her house to help her husband who is a building laborer to support family expoenses and to pay for schooling of their 2 children. M. W. started her business by buying 2 pig breeders for Rp 1,500,000 (about $160), which she raised for six months, and was able to produce 14 offsprings, which she sold for Rp175,000 (about $18) per baby offspring. For that she profited Rp 950,000 (about $100), that she used to pay for her children's education, and a small portion she used to renovate her very modest home. M. W. plans to expand her business by taking care of 2 fattening pigs, so that with the extra capital she hope to receive from DINARI she would use to buy animal feed for the 2 breeder pigs and also the fattening pigs that she would raise, so that her meager income could also expand.

M. W. memelihara ternak babi di rumahnya untuk membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan memenuhi kebutuhan hidup keluarganya dan juga untuk menyekolahkan 2 orang anaknya. Ibu M. W. megawali usahanya dengan membeli 2 ekor bibit penginduk dengan harga Rp. 1.500.000,- yang kemudian dipeliharanya selama enam bulan dan berhasil memproduksi 14 ekor anak babi dan dijualnya dengan harga Rp. 175.000,- per ekor sehingga keuntungan yang diperolehnya Rp. 950.000,-. Dari keuntungan uasahanya ini M. W. membiayai pendidikan anak-anaknya dan sebagian kecil disisihkan untuk merenovasi rumahnya yang masih sederhana. M. W. berencana mengembangkan usahanya dengan memelihara 2 ekor penggemukan, sehingga tambahan modal dari Dinari dipakainya untuk membeli kebutuhan pakan bagi kedua penginduk dan juga penggemukan yang akan dipeliharanya sehingga pendapatan juga semakin bertambah.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use:
To buy animal feed

Membeli makanan ternak

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng K., 58, and her husband, 62, work making and selling traditional medicine to people in their community. From this, they earn around $2 a day. They have 2 children, who both work at the garment factory, earning $4 a day between them. Seng K. intends to invest this $400 in buying more herbs and plants for her business.

loans.use: To purchase herbs and plants to make into natural medicine for their business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Seng Kim has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Kep

texts.en: Mrs. Kep T., 38, lives with her husband, 37 (pictured) in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Kep T. earns $3 a day making and selling sausages to people in her community. Her husband works buying and selling cows. She would like to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi service when he is not engaged in buying and selling cows. The couple expects that this will bring the family an extra $2 a day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate a motor-taxi service

loans.name: Lesili

texts.en: S. Lesili is a 61-year-old married woman, and her business is growing and selling peanuts. She is also the mother of five children. Mrs. Lesili is an older woman in her community, and she is very supportive of her hard-working husband. The two of them are working to support not only their family, but also to fund the education of their grandchildren. Twice a week S. brings 20-30 packets of peanuts to the New Market  from which she can make $200 to $300. Mrs. Lesili will use the loan to purchase farming tools such as knives and spades, as well as fertilizer for the peanut plants.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, fertilizers, knives, spade

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia S. is a supportive wife and the mother of six children. Her business is growing and selling vegetables. She sells her vegetables from the front of her house, and she also brings her fresh goods to the market twice a week, where she makes $250 to $300. Mrs. S. uses the money to support her family and to pay her children’s school fees. Rosalia will use the loan to buy chemicals and fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and fertilizers

loans.name: Wayan

texts.id:
Wayan M. raised 2 fattening pigs that she always take care every morning and evening. Those two small pigs she bought for Rp 400,000 (about $45), and after she raised them for six months, she was able sell them for Rp1,800,000 (about $200), for a gross profit of Rp1,400,000 (about $155). She used that profit to help ease the burden of her husband, who is only a tenant farmer to pay for family expenses, including her children's education, and a small home renovation. With the loan she would receive from DINARI, Wayan M. plans to increase the number of fattening pigs she would take care, with the hope that additional income could be generated, and they could live a slightly better life.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Wayan M. memelihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan yang selalu dirawatnya setiap pagi dan sore hari. Kedua ekor babi tersebut dibelinya dengan harga Rp 400.000 dan setelah dipeliharanya selama enam bulan dijualnya dengan harga Rp Rp 1.800.000 sehingga keuntungan kotor yang diperolehnya Rp 1.400.000. Keuntungan tersebut sebagian besar dipakainya untuk membantu meringankan beban suaminya yang hanya seorang petani untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya termasuk juga untuk menyekolahkan anaknya dan perbaikan rumahnya. Dengan pinjaman yang diperolehnya dari DINARI Wayan M. berencana menambah jumlah ternak babi yang dipeliharanya dengan harapan supaya hasil yang diperoleh juga bisa bertambah dan mereka bisa hidup lebih baik.

loans.use:
To buy pig stock and animal feed plus taking care expenses

Membeli bibit babi dan bahan makanan serta biaya perawatan

loans.name: Kadek

texts.id:
Kadek M. A. has been a pig farmer for several years. At the beginning she only raised fattening pigs, and afterwards she could already raise 3 pig breeders. Each breeder that she raised could produce 20 offsprings each year, which she could sell for Rp150,000 (about $16) per baby offspring, so that she profited Rp 3,000,000 (about $320) per pig breeder. With those efforts Kadek M. A. paid the expenses for her children's education who are still in Grade school, and helping her husband to pay for daily household expenses. Her wish is to expand her business and make her more entusiastic, especially with the extra capital she obtain from DINARI to be used to feed needs and repair of the animal stalls.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Menjadi peternak babi sudah dijalani oleh Kadek M. A. selama beberapa tahun. Pada awalnya hanya memelihara penggemukan dan akhirnya saat ini sudah bisa memelihara 3 ekor penginduk. Setiap penginduk yang dipeliharanya bisa memproduksi 20 ekor anak babi setiap tahunnya dan dijualnya dengan harga Rp 150.000 per ekor, sehingga keuntungan yang diperolehnya Rp 3.000.000 untuk satu ekor penginduk. Dengan hasil usahanya itu Kadek M. A. menanggung biaya pendidikan anaknya yang masih di sekolah dasar dan membantu suaminya mencukupi kebutuhan rumah tangganya setiap hari. Keinginannya untuk mengembangkan usahanya membuatnya semakin bersemangat dalam mengelola usahanya apalagi setelah memperoleh pinjaman modal dari Dinari yang dipakainya untuk mencukupi kebutuhan pakan dan memperbaiki kandang ternaknya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock dan animal feed

Untuk membeli bibit babi dan makanan ternak.

loans.name: Ni

texts.id:
K. T. is a widow who is responsible for all her family needs, including her children schooling, after her husband passed away. Therefore she has to work hard in today's very difficult economic's condition, and decided to be a pig farmer. K. T. started her business with one pig breeder that cost her Rp7000 (about 80 US cents) daily for feeding expenses. This one pig breeder she took care was able to produce 8 baby offsprings, and after she sold it, she was able to profit Rp 700,000 (about $75). From this profit K. T. finance her family living and her children's schooling. K. T. wishes that she could expand her business from the loan she hope to receive from DINARI.

K. T. adalah seorang janda yang harus menanggung semua kebutuhan keluarganya termasuk menyekolahkan anaknya setelah suaminya meninggal. Hal ini membuatnya harus bekerja keras dalam situasi ekonomi yang sulit seperti sekarang dengan mengambil keputusan menjadi peternak babi. K. T. memulai usahanya dengan memelihara 1 ekor penginduk yang setiap harinya memerlukan biaya pakan Rp. 7.000,- setiap harinya. Penginduk yang dipeliharanya itu mampu memproduksi 8 ekor anak dan setelah dijual K. T. mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. Rp. 700.000,-. Dari keuntungan yang diperolehnya inilah K. T. membiayai hidup keluarganya dan menyekolahkan anaknya. K. T. berharap keinginannya mengembangkan usahanya bisa terpenuhi lewat pinjaman yang diberikanoleh Yayasan DINARI.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal Food

Membeli bibit babi dan makanan ternak

loans.name: Ketut

texts.id:
Although she is a wife of a company employee, Ketut P. is very determined on her life struggle, proven besides owning a small Pig Farm mother Ketut P. still has a side business by owning a small food kiosk in front of her house. Mother Ketut P. bought one pig breeder for RP 700,000 (about $75), and it would take up to six month until this breeder could produce 7 offsprings, which she sold for Rp1,400,000 (about $150). From that sales Ketut P. paid for schooling for her child, who still attend Grade school to ease her husband's food kiosk business which would also benefit from this micro pig farming. Loan from Dinari would be used to expand her pig business for buying food to fatten the pigs.

Walaupun sebagai istri seorang karyawan sebuah perusahaan, namun Ketut P. sangat ulet dalam menjalani kehidupannya, terbukti selain mempunyai usaha ternak babi Ibu Ketut P. juga mempunyai usaha sampingan yaitu membuka warung kecil di depan rumahnya. Ibu Ketut P. membeli 1 ekor penginduk dengan harga Rp. 700.000,- dan diperlukan waktu sampai enam bulan bagi penginduknya bisa berproduksi, dan anak yang dihasilkan berjumlah 7 ekor yang kemudian dijualnya Rp. 1.400.000,- . Dari hasil penjualan ini Ketut P. membiayai sekolah anaknya yang masih duduk di sekolah dasar untuk meringankan beban suaminya dalam menhidupi keluarga Usaha warungnya juga dicukupi dari hasil beternak babinya ini. Pinjaman dari DINARI dimanfaatkannya untuk mengembangkan usahanya yaitu dengan membeli pakan untuk penggemukan.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

loans.use:
To buy pigs stock and animal feed

membeli bibit Babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Ni Ketut Kasih

texts.id:
Ketut Kasih is a Pig Farmer who is dtermine and hardworking to help her husband who is a farmer to provide food on the table. Ketut Kasih also has a son who is still studying. Ketut Kasih buys her piglet for each at Rp. 350.000, and sells each with a profit of Rp 100.000. From the little profit that she gain, Ketut Kasih has to pay the household expenses as well her son's education expenses. Ketut Kasih hopes that the financing help from Kiva will enable her to expand her business.

Translated from bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ketut Kasih seorang peternak babi yang ulet dalam mengelola usahanya untuk membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga setiap hari selain membantu suami yang seorang petani.Hal ini dilakukannya karena Ibu Ketut Kasih juga ikut serta memenuhi kebutuhan pendidikan puteranya yang masih SMP. 2 ekor babi penggemukan yang dibelinya dengan harga Rp. 350.000,- dipeliharanya dengan baik setiap hari selama 2 bulan dan dijualnya kepada pelanggan yang memiliki usaha babi guling sehingga Ketut Kasih mendapat Keuntungan bersih Rp 100.000,- tiap ekornya. Dari keuntungan yang diperoleh ini Ketut Kasih membiayai kehidupan keluarganya termasuk juga untuk perawatan rumah sederhana yang ditempatinya bersama suami dan puteranya. Katut Kasih bersyukur dan berharap dengan adanya pinjaman modal dari DINARI bisa membuat usahanya lebih maju lagi.

loans.use: membeli bibit babi untuk penggemukan dan pakan ternak - To buy pig feedings and a pig stile

loans.name: Ketut

texts.id:
Ketut P. dreams to be a successful animal farmer. This is what made her working hard in her 10 year old pig farming business done the traditional way. Buy buying a mother feedstock pig for Rp700,000 (about $78) Ketut P. runs her business. Within 6 months the produced piglets totalled 10, and she sold them for Rp1,750,000 (about $190), and left her with a profit of RP1,050,000(about$117), and she used it to expand her business which is to sell animal feed, and opening a food stall, others were used for schooling expenses of her 2 children. Because Ketut P. with her husband and 2 children live in their own hut, they only did repairs to parts that started to deteriorate only. DINARI's loan made her more enthusiastic, and will be used to buy needed animal feed for own use and to further re-sell to the sorrounding society.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ketut P. bercita-cita menjadi peternak yang sukses. Inilah yang membuatnya tekun dalam menjalankan usaha beternak babi yang sudah dijalaninya lebih dari 10 tahun secara teadisional. Dengan memelihara 1 ekor penginduk yang dibeli seharga Rp.700.000,- Ketut P. menjalankan usahanya. Dalam waktu enam bulan anak babi yang mampu diproduksinya berjumlah 10 ekor dan dijualnya dengan harga Rp. 1.750.000,- sehingga keuntungan yang diperolehnya Rp. 1.050.000,- dan itu dipakainya untuk mengembangkan usahanya yaitu dengan menjual pakan ternak dan membuka warung, sebagian lagi dipakai untuk menyekolahkan dua orang anaknya. Karena Ketut P. bersama dengan suami dan kedua anaknya menempati rumah sendiri, mereka hanya melakukan perbaikan atas bagian-bagian rumah yang sudah mulai lapuk. Adanya pinjaman dari DINARI membuatnya lebih bersemangat lagi dalam usahanya karena Ketut P. akan menggunakannya untuk membeli kebutuhan pakan untuk ternaknya sendiri maupun untuk dijual kembali kepada masyarakat disekitarnya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit Babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Kadek

texts.id:
As a pig farmer Mother Kadek W. was able to run her business well, this is shown from whatever she has done with he raised animals. With a capital of Rp800,000(about US$90) Kadek W. bought 4 piglets to be fattened that she raised patiently every morning and evening. After 6 months these raised pigs are ready to be marketed. From that sales Kadek W. profitted Rp300,000 (about $33)/piece. This profit fulfilled her hopes to provide schooling for her 8 year old son, and also used to repair the condition of her pig stall, since Kadek W. plans to increase the number of her animals, so it would need a larger stall. This plan would be financed by a loan that she wish would be granted.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai peternak babi Ibu Kadek W. mampu mengelola usahanya dengan baik, ini terbukti dari apa yang dilakukannya dalam memlihara ternaknya. Dengan modal Rp. 800.000,- Kadek W. membeli 4 ekor bibit penggemukan yang dengan telaten dirawatnya setiap pagi dan sore hari dalam waktu enam bulan sampai siap untuk dijual. Dari hasil penjualannya Kadek W. mendapat keuntungan Rp. 300.000,- per ekornya. Keuntungan yang diperolehnya itu mampu memenuhi harapannya untuk menyekolahkan puteranya yang masih berusia 8 tahun dan juga dipergunakannya untuk memperbaiki kondisi kandangnya karena Kadek W. memiliki rencana untuk menambah jumlah ternaknya, sehingga memerlukan kandang yang lebih luas. Rencana ini dikerjakannya lewat pinjaman modal usaha yang diperolehnya.

loans.use:
To buy piglets for fattening and animal food

Membeli bibit babi penggemukan dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Wayan

texts.id:
An age of over half a century does not dampen Wayan N. to still be productive. Her wish to provide education as high as possible also pushes her will on her pig farming business that she has started years ago. By raising 4 piglets to fatten Wayan N. provide a living for her family from the profit she made. Every 6 months Wayan N. could profit Rp1,200,000 (about $130) that she used for daily living expenses and schooling expenses for her daughter who is still in Middle school. To repair her non permanent hut situation also was done so that the family could live more proper. Wayan N. is very thankful for the DINARI loan, so that her plans to increase the number of her animals, and to raise a mother feedstock could be fulfilled.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usia yang sudah melewati setengah abad tidak menyurutkan semangat Wayan N. untuk tetap bekerja. Keinginan untuk bisa menyekolahkan putrinya setinggi-tingginya juga memacunya untuk tetap menjalankan usaha beternak babi yang sudah dijalaninya bertahun-tahun. Dengan memelihara 4 ekor penggemukan Wayan N. memenuhi kebutuhan hidup keluarganya lewat keuntungan- keuntungan yang diperolehnya. Dalam setiap enam bulan Wayan N. mendapat keuntungan Rp 1200.000,- yang kemudian dipergunakan untuk mencukupi biaya hidup sehari-hari dan biaya sekolah putrinya yang masih di SMP. Memperbaiki keadaan rumahnya yang belum permanen juga sedang diupayakannya supaya keluarganya bisa menempati rumah yang nyaman. Wayan N. sangat berterimakasih atas pinjaman modal usaha yang diberikan Dinari sehingga rencananya untuk menambah jumlah ternaknya dengan memelihara penginduk bisa terpenuhi.

loans.use:
To buy piglets for fattening and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi penggemukan dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Helena Estefano

texts.pt:
Location: Chali area - Maputo
Client: Helena Estefano S.
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 10,000.00 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 400.00)
Use: Purchase products for resale
Start date: 08/26/2007
End date: 11/17/2008

Helena Estefano S. was born in Maputo in 1951. She attended school only up to the 6th grade due to her family's financial situation. Her father worked as a servant for the Ministry of Planning and Finance and had many children.

At the age of 22, she married and had 4 children. However, her marriage only lasted 8 years. After her separation, she studied typing and found a job right away as a typist. She held this job for 3 years but had to leave it due to the long distance between her home and the workplace. In order to survive, she became involved in small businesses and in 1989 obtained another job at the Ministry of Agriculture, where she worked until she got back on her feet. Even while she was working, she continued to run her business which in turn led to the creation of three new jobs. She currently sells peanuts and has two public telephones (One Cell). Thanks to the loan she was able to increase the sales volume of her business. The impact of her business is well known -- besides having created more jobs, she provides access to peanuts (an essential product) and communication services for the community.

In the future she plans to further her business and become a successful entrepreneur like other women who started out like her.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chali - Maputo
Cliente: Helena Estefano S.
Actividade: Comércio
Valor de Empréstimo: 10,000.00MT (400.00US$)
Aplicação: compra de Produtos para revenda
Início: 26/08/2007
Fim: 17/11/2008

Helena Estefano S. Nasceu em Maputo em 1951, Estudou apenas até 6ª classe devido a debilidade finaceira dos progenitores pós este trabalhava como servente no Ministério de plano e Finanças e tinha muitos filhos .

Aos 22 anos contraiu o matrinomio o qual resultou em 4 filhos mas no entanto o seu casamento durou apenas 8 anos, depois da separação formou se em Datilografia tendo em seguida conseguido um emprego como datilógrafa,onde trabalhou durante 3 anos e veio a disitir do emprego devido a longa distância que lhe separava da casa ao posto de trabalho. Para a sua sobrevência dedicou se a pequenos negocios e em1989 conseguiu outro emprego no Ministério da Agricultura onde trabalhou até a sua reforma mas mesmo trabalhando nunca deixou de desenvolver a actividade comercial a qual criou 3 postos de trabalho. Actualmente vende Amendoim e possui dois telefones públicos ( one cell),com o valor de crédito aumentou o volume do seu negócio. O impacto da sua actividade é notório póis para além de ter criado mais posto de trabalho fornece o amendoim( produto básico) e providencia serviço de comunicação acessiveis para a comunidade.

Futuramente pretende desenvolver mais o seu negócio e tornar se numa grande empresária como outras que começaram com ela.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her shop

loans.name: Neima Sintia Virgili

texts.pt:
Location: Malhangalene area - Maputo
Client: Neima Síntia Virgilio M.
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 40,000.00 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 1,600.00)
Loan use: Purchase decorating products for resale
Start date: 08/08/07
End date: 11/30/08

Neima Síntia Virgilio M. was born on May 21, 1983, in Maputo. The daughter of an engineer and consultant father and a businesswoman, she was able to count on her parents’ support throughout her studies, obtaining her degree in environmental law and recycling. After her education, she worked as a promoter of discussions about the environment for ISCTEM (Mozambique Superior Institute of Science and Technology). With the money she earned, she decided to redecorate her room, which sparked a passion for decorating. From then on, she started doing small jobs for friends and acquaintances, which brought her the income and experience necessary to define her business, although she was still without a permanent location.

Through her mother who is a businesswoman in Catembe, she became aware of HLUVUKU, where she obtained a loan of 40,000.00 MT to acquire various articles for her business and rent a space to display her products.

She plans to specialize in the areas of decorating and dressmaking in order to minimize production costs. She would then like to explore the area of recycling, helping those in need discover their artistic side.

Her business has had a positive impact on the community by providing decorating items in the city's market and furthermore creating jobs for people in need.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Malhangalene- Maputo
Cliente: Neima Síntia Virgilio M.
Actividade: comércio
Valor do empréstimo: 40.000,00MT (1,600.00US$)
Aplicação do empréstimo:compra de produtos de decoração para revenda
Início: 08/08/07
Fim: 30/11/08

Neima Síntia Virgilio M. nascida aos 21 de Maio de 1983 em Maputo. Filha de pai Engenheiro e consultor e de Mãe negociante cresceu com os pais, tendo merecido um bom acompanhamento nos estudos até a sua Licenciatura em Direito do ambiente e reciclagem. Apos sua formação trabalhou como promotora de palestras sobre ambiente no ISCTEM e com o subsidio que recebia sentiu a necessidade de decorar o seu quarto ganhando assim um fascinio pela decoração. Desde então começou a fazer pequenos serviços para amigas e pessoas mais proximas o que lhe dava rendimento e experiência para se definir no negócio embora ainda de forma ambulante.

Através da mãe que é negociante na Catembe, veio a conhecer a HLUVUKU onde recorreu a um empréstimo de 40.000,00mt para aquisição de diversos artigos para o seu negócio e arrendar um espaço para expor os seus produtos.

Como perspectiva pretende especializar-se na area de decoração, corte e costura de modo a minimizar os custos de produção, para além de pretender explorar a área de reciclagem ajudando pessoas vulneráveis a ocuparem-se bem como explorar o seu lado artistico.

A actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade na medida em que fornece objectos de decoração ao mercado da cidade para além de prever a criação de postos de trabalho para pessoas vulneráveis.

loans.use: Decorations Sales

loans.name: Ilda Leonor Paulo

texts.pt:
Location: Guachene area – Catembe
Client: Ilda Leonor Paulo M.
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 10,000 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 400.00)
Use: Purchase products for resale
Start date: 08/16/2007
End date: 11/07/2008

Ilda Leonor Paulo M. was born in Maputo in 1966. She attended school only until the 7th grade due to her father’s early death. Her mother was not financially able to cover the costs of her children's schooling as she was unemployed. At the age of 18 she married her husband with whom she has 5 children. She tried working as a housekeeper but couldn’t stand it, so she started her own small business at the age of 19. She has been running it since then.

She currently has a small commercial space and two public telephones (One-Cell). According to Ilda, the business is contributing positively to her family’s needs since she is able to help her husband in supporting the children and covering the household expenses. She currently works with one of her daughters and one employee. With the help of the loan, she was able to strengthen her business by increasing the volume of products and acquiring one additional public telephone.

Her business has had a positive impact on the community by providing communication services and essential products, thereby reducing the distances traveled to obtain these services. In the future, she plans to build a shop and a beauty salon and become a successful businesswoman, creating jobs for others.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Guachene- Catembe
Cliente: Ilda Leonor paulo M.
Actividade : Comércio
Valor de Empréstimo: 10.000,00mt (400.00US$)
Aplicação: compra de Produtos para revenda
Início: 16/08/2007
Fim: 07/11/ 2008

Ilda Leonor paulo M. , nasceu em Maputo em 1966, estudou até 7ªclasse isto porque perdeu o pai muito cedo tendo ficado a viver com a mãe e esta não tinha condições para custear os estudos dos filhos uma vez que era desempregada. Aos 18 anos juntou-se com seu marido com qual tem 5 filhos. Tentou trabalhar como empregada doméstica e não aguentou , tendo iniciado o seu pequeno negócio já com 19 anos, actividade esta que desenvolve até então.

Possui neste momento um pequeno estabelecimento comercial e dois telefones públicos ( one-cell) segundo ela , o negócio está contribuir positivamente no aumento da renda familiar uma vez que consegue ajudar o seu marido no sustento dos filhos e nas despesas da família , actualmente trabalha com uma das filhas e um empregado. Com o crédito reforçou o seu negócio aumentando o volume de produtos e a dquiriu mais um telefone público.

A sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade pelo facto de estar a providenciar serviços de comunicação e produtos de primeira necessidade, reduzindo a distâncias anteriorimente percorridas em busca dos mesmos serviços Futuramente pretende construir uma loja e um salão de beleza e tornar se numa grande comerciante e criar postos de trabalho para outros.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her business

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Location: Chamissava area - Catembe
Client: António D. Conceição
Activity: Retail
Loan amount: 13,000 Mozambique Meticais (MT) (US$ 520.00)
Use: Purchase products for resale
Start date: 08/06/2007
End date: 11/28/2008

António D. Conceição was born in Maputo in 1974 and attended school only until the 9th grade as his parents were not capable of paying for his school. He married young, and at the age of 18 he was faced with the need to obtain employment to support his studies and his family. He found a job as a mechanic's assistant.

He currently has 3 children and lives with his wife of 14 years. The mechanic shop was not a sufficient source of income, so he had to start his own business as a way to better provide for his family.

He currently operates out of a small rented commercial space where he carries out the sale of essential products. With the 13,000 MT loan ($520.00) he plans to increase his volume by acquiring a diverse range of essential products. He runs the business himself and has had a positive impact on the community by placing the product closer to the client, thereby shortening travel distances for the residents of his area while increasing his family's monthly income.

In the future he plans to develop his business further and become a successful merchant.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chamissava - Catembe
Cliente: António D. Conceição
Actividade : Comércio
Valor de Empréstimo: 13,000.00mt (520.00US$)
Aplicação: compra de Produtos para revenD.
Início: 06/08/2007
Fim: 28/11/ 2008

António D. Conceição nascido em Maputo em 1974 , estudou até 9ªclasse porque os pais não tinham condições para custear com os seus estudos. Juntou se muito cedo e aos 18 anos sentiu se obrigado a a ter que arranjar emprego para suportar os seus estudos e para o sustento D. sua família, tendo começado trabalhado como ajudante de mecânica.

Tem actualmente 3 filhos e vive com com a sua esposa já a 14 anos.Dado que o serviço de mecânica não estava a render lhe o suficiente , teve que iniciar o seu próprio negócio de forma a incrementar a renD. familiar.

Actualmente opera num pequeno estabelecimento comercial arrendaD. onde desenvolve a sua actividade comercial de venD. de produtos D. primeira necessidade. Com o crédito de 13,000.00MT pretende incrementar o volume do seu negócio adquirindo diversa gama de produtos de 1 necessidade. Ele gere o negócio pessoalmente e a sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade pois coloca o produto mais perto do cliente incurtando deste modo a distância para os moradores D. sua zona , bem como aumenta a renD. mensal familiar.

Futuramente pretende desenvolver o seu negócio tornando se num grande comerciante.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

loans.name: Antonio Jose

texts.pt:
António José S. is 24 years old. He was born in Catembe in September 24th in 1982. He lived with her mother and 8 brothers. He studied until the 5th grade. António moved to South Africa from 1999 to 2005 in search of a job. He returned to Moçambique in 2005. Since it was difficult to find jobs in the city, he rented a small stand to sell groceries. He was introduced to Hluvuku by her sister. Her first loan was of 15.000 MT which he repaid.

With the loan of 20.000mt António plans on diversifying and increasing his inventory. His business has a positive impact in the community because it brings the product conveniently closed to the community. In the future António plans on opening his own store.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Chamissava - Catembe Cliente: António José S. Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 20.000,00 MT (800.00US$) Aplicacao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade Início: 27/08/07 Fim: 14/12/08 António José S., de 24 anos de idade, nasceu na catembe aos 24 de Setembro de 1982, sempre viveu com a mae e seus 8 irmaos, estudava e concluiu a 5ª classe e posteriormente de 1999 á 2005 foi a África do Sul a procura de emprego como forma de ajudar a família e trabalhava como operário numa fábrica de sofás. Teve contacto com crédito na África do Sul quando um banco Sul africano o contacta para aceder a esses serviços financeiros para compra de Bens de Consumo. Retorna em Mocambique em 2005 e como era difícil arranjar emprego na Cidade, aluga um pequeno estabelecimento comercial para venda de diversos produtos alimentícios. Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku através da irmã e o 1º crédito de 15.000 MT pagou-o sem problemas. Com o crédito de 20.000 MT pretende apetrechar e diversificar produtos de mercearia como forma de atrair e oferecer alternativa aos clientes. Ele e o irmão mais novo é que trabalham na barraca. O empreendimento tem impacto na comunidade como alternativa para compra de vários produtos, também aos fins de semana é local preferido para lazer devido ao tipo de serviços fornecidos e a reduzida distancia da comunidade utente. Futuramente pretende ter sua merecearia construída com material convencional e se possível ter viatura para transporte de mercadoria por forma a vender produtos a grosso.

loans.use: To increase stocks in his shop

payments.comment: Antonio has successfully repaid this loan in advance in order to request a new loan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stocks for her business

loans.name: Sakina Juma  And

texts.en: Sakina Juma 41, (in glasses) and L. J. (40) are two close business partners. Together they call themselves The Peace. The have been working together as business partners for the past three years. Sakina is a tailor and keeps poultry as well and L. is a cook and owns a restaurant in the Buguruni area. They have both received business training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. They are together in need of USD 700, with Sakina in need of USD 450 and the rest in need by L. to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Sakina and Lwiza would like to upgrade their businesses in tailoring and cooking.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Rosa B. is a widow and mother of two children. On is 15 and the other 5 years old. She was born in Xai-Xai in the Gaza province on Novemeber 30th, 1968. She is 39 years old. She was raised by her parents. Her family had limited economic means and her father immigrated to South Africa in search of work. She studied until the 7th grade, and worked as a seamstress to help the family. She married in 1985 and lived with her husband for 14 years. Her husband did not allow her to work outside the home. In 1999 her husband passed away. Rosa experienced many difficulties. She then found a job in the Móbil. She saved from the small income for 4 years in order to build a home. With help from a partner Rosa had a space in Ndlavela where she sells different products including drinks.

She was introduced to Hluvuku credit program by her aunt. She then requested a loan of 15.000MT in order to buy different products and increase her inventory. Rosa’s work has a positive impact in her community because it provides employment for Rosa, and brings goods closer to her community. In the future, Rosa plans to expand her business to include selling food, chickens and meats.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Ndlavela - Maputo Cliente: Rosa B. Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 15.000,00 MT (600.00US$) Aplicacao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade e refrigerantes Início: 27/08/07 Fim: 18/11/08 Rosa B., é viúva e mae de 2 filhos o primogénito de 15 anos e 5 anos respectivamente, nasceu em Xai-Xai na Província de Gaza a 30 de Novembro de 1968, tem 39 anos de idade, cresceu e viveu com os pais, numa família com poucos recursos financeiros, o pai emigrou para África do Sul para trabalhar com Pasteleireiro porque não conseguia arranjar emprego no País. Estudou e concluiu a 7ª classe, trabalhou como costureira para a ajudar na renda familiar. Casou-se em 1985 e viveu com o marido durante 14 anos e este nunca aceitou que fizesse alguma coisa como forma de ocupar-se e ajudar na renda familiar. Em 1999 perdeu o marido, tendo atravessado momentos conturbados e no ano 2000 consegue uma vaga na Móbil como servente da Take away durante 4 anos e com magro salárioconsegui poupar até construir uma casa e comprar diversos bens e ainda poupou mais algum que veio usar para a compra de um contentor em 2004. Com ajuda do seu parceiro em 2007 compra um espaço em Ndlavela onde coloca o contentor e apetrecha com diversos produtos de mercearia incluindo bebidas.

Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku através da tia, tendo decidido a proximar e pedir auxílio no valor de 15.000 MT , para incrementar o volume do seu negocio adquirindo diversificados produtos de mercearia incluindo bebidas. Actualmente emprega um trabalhador e a sua actividade tem um impacto positivo na comunidade pois para além de constituir uma fonte de emprego, reduz as distâncias em cerca de 50% das que eram percorrida em busca destes serviços, constitiundo deste modo uma alternativa segura para os clientes. Com os rendimentos do negócio garante o sustento familiar e dar respostas as diversas necessidades pontuais que possam surgir. No futuro planeja reguer uma esplanada no quintal para venda de comidas, frangos e carnes assadas e melhorar cada vez mais seu negócio para atrair mais clientes.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her business

loans.name: Adam Majidu And

texts.en: Mr. Adam Majidu (30) and Mrs. H. S. (55) are close neighbors in Buguruni and together call themselves UJAMAA. Their businesses are located in the same area. Adam owns a video hall and video library, while H. is widowed with old enough children and sells charcoal. Adam has been doing this business for the past year, but with increasing laws regulating the video halls coupled with most people now owning television sets and desks, the business is not progressing and he is now changing it to selling hardware. H. is also diverting to a less tasking business of selling traditional attire (vitenge), as the charcoal business is not health friendly. Together they are in need of USD 700, which they are to share equally so as to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Adam and Habiba would each like to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Suhartatik

texts.id:
Suhartatik has a business making Lontong. Lontong is rice cake wrapped in banana leafs, and usually eaten with lamb curry, soto soup, sate meat shewers, etc. With a capital of Rp100,000 (about US$11) Suhartatik buys rice, banana leaf, etc, that she then processed into lontong. Everyday from 8:00 AM to 5:00PM Suhartatik could produce 20-30 packages of lontong. These lontongs would then be delivered to foodstalls. The profit she made for Rp50,000 (about US$5.50) was used to support her husband to pay for hosuehold expenses, electricity, water of about Rp70,000(about US$7.70)/month. Suhartatik and her husband lives in a simple house built by themselves from beton and cement floor. All three children have their own family, and live on their own. Loan from DINARI will be used to increase her capital, with the hope that her income would increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Suhartatik mempunyai usaha membuat lontong. Lontong adalah nasi yang dibungkus dengan daun pisang yang biasanya dimakan dengan gule kambing, soto, sate dan lain-lain.. Dengan modal Rp. 100.000,- Suhartatik membeli beras, daun pisang, dan sebagainya yang kemudian diolah menjadi lontong. Setiap hari dari jam 08.00 wita sampai jam 17.00 wita Suhartatik dapat membuat 20-30 bungkus lontong. Lontong-lontong itu kemudian diserahkan ke warung-warung. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp. 50.000,- yang digunakan untuk membantu suaminya memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya, yaitu membayar listrik dan air PDAM sebesar Rp. 70.000,- perbulan. Suhartatik dan suaminya tinggal di sebuah rumah sederhana yang dibangun sendiri dengan bahan beton dan lantai semen. Ketiga anaknya sudah berkeluarga dan mempunyai tempat tinggal sendiri. Pinjaman dari DINARI dipakai untuk menambah modal usahanya, dengan harapan penghasilannya meningkat.

loans.use:
To increase capital for buying items like food ingredients

Untuk menambah modal usaha seperti membeli bahan makanan.

loans.name: Siti Jumasih

texts.id:
Since Siti Jumasih living quarters is near the Gilimanuk harbor, Siti chose to be a Carry-on sales person. Siti sells light food and drinks in that harbor. With a capital of Rp1000,000 (about US$110) Siti could profit Rp40,000(about $4.50) from her work that started at 17:00 and ended at 02:00AM in the morning. From that work, Siti helps her husband who is a salesman, and help her child who is in 2nd grade. Siti also has to pay for electricity and water for about Rp60,000($5.50)/mo. Siti lives in a semi-permanent hut that was self built, the building is from woven bamboo sheets, and sand floor (no tiles). Loan from DINARI will be used to increase her capital to offer more goods, and the hope that her income might increase.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Karena lokasi tempat tinggal sangat dekat dengan pelabuhan Gilimanuk maka Siti memiih untuk menjadi seorang pedagang asongan. Siti menjual berbagai makanan kecil dan minuman yang bertempat di pelabuhan. Dengan modal Rp. 1.000.000,- siti bisa memperoleh keuntungan Rp 40.000 tetapi pekerjaan ini baru dimulai jam 17.00 wita sampai jam 02.00 Wita dini hari.Dari hasil tersebut Siti bisa membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai pedagang dan juga ikut menyekolahkan anaknya yang baru kelas 2 SD .Siti juga harus membayar listrik dan air PDAM sebesar Rp. 60.000,- perbulan.Siti tinggal di sebuah rumah semi permanen yang dibangun sendiri dan sangat sederhana dengan bangunan yang terbuat dari “gedeg” dan lantainya tanah. Pinjaman dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah modal usaha dan membeli dagangan untuk dijual, dengan harapan penghasilannya akan meningkat.

loans.use:
To buy light food and drinks and other passenger's need at the harbor

Membeli makanan, minuman ringan dan kebutuhan para penumpang yang ada di pelabuhan.

loans.name: Supriyati

texts.id:
Supriyati is a seamstress. Her husband works in a motorcycle repair shop, however his earnings is not sufficient to cover all of their family expenses. So Supriyati works as a seamstress to help her husband support the family. She needs $50 funds to purchase supplies like cloth, threads, button, yarn, etc. On a 9 am to 5 pm workday, she can work on 2 pieces of clothing and earn $8 profit that is used to supplement their family income. Most of her money is used to buy milk for her 1 year old infant child. During the Moslem's holiday season, Supriyati feels blessed because usually she gets many more orders than usual, considering that on some regular days she doesn't get any orders at all.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Supriyati adalah seorang penjahit pakaian. Suaminya bekerja di bengkel sepeda motor. Namun hasilnya tidak mencukupi biaya hidupnya sehari-hari. Oleh sebab itu Supriyati membantunya dengan bekerja sebagai penjahit pakaian. Dengan modal Rp. 500.000,- untuk membeli kain, benang, jarum, dan sebagainya, dan mulai menjahit dari jam 09.00 sampai jam 17.00 dan dapat menyelesaikan 2 potong baju.Dari 2 potong baju yang diselesaikan Supriyati mendapat keuntungan Rp. 80.000,- yang dipakai untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari dan membeli susu untuk anaknya yang masih berumur 1 tahun. Setiap kali hari raya datang itu merupakan berkah tersendiri buat Supriyati karena secara otomattis orderan jahitan bertambah banyak, berbeda dengan hari-hari biasa terkadang tidak ada orderan jahitan.

loans.use: To Purchase Supplies Like Buttons, Thread, etc.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en: Mrs. Sin S. is a 50 year old, married mother of three children. The children are all in school, and they live in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works as a teacher, earning around $2.50/day in revenue. Her husband (he is pictured) is a motor-taxi driver and generally earns around $1.50 a day. He would like to sell ice-cream in his community, which would enable him to make more money than driving a motor-taxi, but he faces a financial problem. To do so, he has applied for a loan amount of $500 to purchase a cart to attach to his motorcycle to operate a business.

loans.use: To purchase a cart to attach to a motorcycle, to sell ice cream in their community.

loans.name: Mashavu Yange And

texts.en: Mashavu Yange (right) is 55 and A. S. is 29 (they call themselves Songambele) and they are business partners who have been working together for the past 4 years. They both sell used clothes and traditional attire (commonly know as vitenge), and both have received business training organized by Youth Self Employment Foundation. Together they want to open up a bigger shop in the Buguruni area which they will share to sell their items. Together they are in need of USD700, which they will share equally so as to achieve their goal.

loans.use: Asha and Mashavu would like to expand their businesses selling clothes.

loans.name: Nur

texts.id:
Every morning, at 6 am (Central Indonesian Standard Time), Nur I. prepares snail crackers, a kind of local delicacy, that her husband sells to local small vendors as their clients. With $50 capital, Nur I. purchases the crackers from Java, that she orders 2x per day. She has run this business since 2006. Currently, Nur I. has 30 vendors as client, with $2 profit per day, the crackers are distributed to those vendors from 8 am to 2 pm. This income can barely support her $50 per month family expenses. With $75 loan from Dinari, Nur can increase her capital base to $110 to add more inventory and expand her client base to 75 vendors. Most of Nur I.'s business profit is used to support her family, especially to pay school fees for Ariska, her daughter who is currently in 5th grade.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Setiap pagi jam 06:00 Wita , Nur I. menyiapkan dagangannya berupa kerupuk siput yang akan dibawa suaminya keliling ke warung -warung langgangannya. Dengan modal usaha Rp. 500.000, Nur I. membeli barang dagangannya berupa kerupuk siput dari Jawa yang di pesan setiap 2 hari sekali .Usaha ini dijalankan di daerah Gilimanuk sudah sejak tahun 2006. Saat ini Nur I. mempunyai langganan sebanyak 30 warung, dengan keuntungan Rp. 20.000,-/hari.kerupuk siput ini diserahkan kewarung-warung mulai dari pukul 08:00 Wita s/d pukul 14:00.Wita.Penghasilan ini hanya mampu memenuhi biaya hidup keluarganya yang besarnya Rp.500.000,-/bulan tetapi saat ini belum bisa menabung. Modal usaha yang didapat dari DINARI sebesar Rp. 600.000, - .Dengan tambahan modal tersebut Nur mempunyai modal usaha sebesar Rp.1.100.000,-.untuk menambah barang dagangannya dan bisa menambah langganannya menjadi 75 warung . Keuntungan yang Nur I. dapatkan saat ini berkisar Rp. 50,000,-/hari yang di gunakan untuk menghidupi keluarganya khusunya biaya pendidikan anaknya “ Ariska “ yg duduk dikelas 5 SD.

loans.use: Capital to purchase snail crackers from Java

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married with a 4-year-old daughter. He lives in Berdyansk with his family. Andrei has a small business where he sells paintings, office supplies, and toys and offers copying and computer services in one of the departments of the local mall. He has always had a passion for art which is why he has chosen this sphere of trade.

Andrei is a skillful entrepreneur – knowledgeable in commerce, consistent, polite and friendly with customers and a true man of integrity. Moreover, Andrei also has a unique talent – he can captivate a client which helps him compete with other businessmen working in this same area of trade. He has been in business for just one year. However, he already has about $7,000 in inventory. His monthly turnover capital is around $5,000.

Andrei is requesting a loan of $500 to increase his inventory and turnover capital. He is hoping to invest generated profit in his daughter’s medical treatment. His little girl has suffered ill-health since she was born. Andrei is also planning to spend a portion of his business income on the construction of a Christian church where he is a pastor. He believes his main goal as a Christian believer is not only to share his passion for art and painting with his customers, but also to share his faith in Jesus with them. We believe Andrei’s serious approach to business matters, his wise stewardship and honesty will ensure prompt repayment of this loan.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with two children. She lives in Stryi, western Ukraine. Nataliya used to work as a science teacher at one of the local schools in her town. However, she couldn’t support her family with what she was earning. Moreover, her husband was abusing alcohol and didn’t help her provide for the family. One of Nataliya’s friends suggested she start a business selling men’s outer wear at one of the local markets.

Nataliya has now been in business for 7 years. Presently, she has a wide assortment of clothing in her kiosk. Nataliya has been able to expand her trade due to loans she has received from Nadiya Ukraine in the past 3 1/2 years. Currently, Nataliya has about $8000 in inventory. Her monthly profit is about $400.

Nataliya is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase seasonal clothing such as jackets, sweaters and pants for the upcoming fall. This will give her a chance to attract more customers and boost her sales, gaining additional profit. Nataliya is planning to use any additional income to pay her house utilities and buy everything her daughter will need for school. Moreover, some extra money will help Nataliya take better care of her nephew who lives with her family and whose mom is abroad earning her living. One of Nataliya’s long-term plans is to open a store selling men’s clothing in downtown Stryi.

loans.use: To purchase assorted inventory for the fall season

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is married with two grown children. She runs a small business selling household supplies in the central market of Pavlograd. The wide range of merchandise offered for sale in Margarita’s kiosk makes shopping easy for every customer who chooses her stall. Margarita’s natural friendliness and polite manner are significant factors that have boosted her sales.

Margarita has been in this business for 11 years. Currently, her turnover capital is about $2,000. Her monthly gross income is about $3,000 and her daily net profit is about $20-30.

Margarita would like to get a loan of $1,200 to construct a new kiosk and make it more accommodating for her customers. In the future she plans to invest part of her generated profits in purchasing an apartment for her son. Margarita is a very accurate, energetic and sensible entrepreneur. She has fully repaid all previous loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. A stable income and the sustainability of Margarita’s business guarantee her integrity and capability to repay this current loan.

loans.use: To construct a new kiosk to house her business

loans.name: Eni

texts.id:
Eni H. owns a business selling beef meatballs and soto ayam (Indonesian chicken soup). With $35 capital she purchases meat, herbs and other ingredients to make her own meatballs. She sells those meatballs and soup in Gilimanuk port every day from 1pm to 11pm. Each day Eni H.'s business sells about 2kg meatballs that earn her $5 profit. During the Muslim fasting month and holiday season, Eni needs to purchase more ingredients to make more meatballs to satisfy increased demand and make more profit. Eni hopes that she can get enough additional capital funding so she can save to purchase her own house and increase her future prospect.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Eni H. mempunyai usaha menjual bakso sapi dan juga soto ayam dengan modal Rp. 350.000,- untuk membeli daging, bumbu, dan bahan lainnya. Daging yang telah dibeli, kemudian diolah sendiri menjadi bakso yang kemudian siap dijual di pelabuhan Gilimanuk setiap hari dari jam 13.00 Wita sampai jam 23.00 Wita. Setiap harinya Eni H. bisa menghabiskan 2 kg pentol bakso dengan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 50.000,- apalagi saat ini menjelang bulan puasa dan juga menjelang mudik lebaran tentu eni membutuhkan lebih banyak lagi modal agar bakso yang dijualpun bisa lebih banyak. Eni berharap agar dia mendapatkan modal yang cukup untuk meningkatkan pendapatan dari setiap usahanya agar supaya bias menabung untuk memiliki rumah sendiri dan untuk masa depan yang lebih baik.

loans.use: Purchase Meatball Ingredients

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yarloslav started his business around seven years ago out of a desire to work and bring financial stability to his family. He sells a variety of household products including house shoes and other items. His business is the only source of income for him and his wife, Ivanna, and their two small daughters. In a typical month, Yaroslav makes about $270 in profit.

Yaroslav attributes the growth in his business to four loans he has received from Nadiya Ukraine. He is grateful for the financial resources that have been made available to him. Yaroslav has requested a loan of $1000 to give him more working capital for his business. He hopes to continue developing his business and be able to open new sales locations in the future.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Susiati

texts.id:
In this time of high unemployment, Susiati feels tremendous economic pressure in her poor family. Susiati started a small convenience store that sells daily household goods, like rice, vegetables, spices. Each day she needs $20 capital to buy goods to be sold. She usually earns $5 daily profit. She uses earnings from her store to pay for daily expenses totaling $2, including school fees for her children who is in 3rd grade and to feed her 1 year 8 months infant child. Susiati and her family lives in their own home. Susiati hopes that her business will grow to be able to sustain her family's economy, and support her children to higher education levels.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Tekanan ekonomi bagi keluarga kurang mampu sangat terasa akibatnya sekarang ini, pekerjaan yang sulit, apalagi bagi kehidupan Susiati, meskipun begitu Susiati membuka usaha warung di rumahnya dengan menjual berbagai macam jenis barang dagangan mulai dari Sembako sampai keperluan sehari –hari. Modal usaha yang dibutuhkan per hari Rp 200.000,- dan dari modal tersebut bisa mendatangkan keuntungan Rp 50.000 Dari hasil berjualan itu ia gunakan untuk biaya hidupnya Rp. 20.000,- perhari termasuk biaya sekolah anaknya yang baru kelas 3 sekolah dasar dan yang seorang lagi baru berumur 1 th 8 bln. Susiati dan keluarganya tinggal di sebuah rumah milik mereka sendiri. Susiati berharap usahanya kelak akan berkembang untuk menunjang perekonomian keluarganya serta menunjang akan cita-cita anaknya dapat sekolah sampai ke tingkat yang lebih tinggi.

loans.use: Purchase Household Goods to be Sold

loans.name: Soum

texts.en: Mrs. Soum N. is a 57 year old mother who works with her husband on their plot of farmland growing vegetables. However, she can typically make only a meager sum. To help supplement their household income, one of their children and their son in-law are employed at a garment factory, earning together around $180 per month. Now, Mrs. Soum N. is requesting a loan to purchase fashionable clothes for her children to resell to their coworkers at a good price.

loans.use: To purchase fashionable clothes to sell to their coworkers at a good price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second hand shoes stock

loans.name: Samijon

texts.ru:
Samijon lives in a small village called Xamirchui. Here he owns a small kiosk that sells meat. Samijon purchases cattle at local markets and then sells the meat in his village. Business is going well and the meat doesn’t stay with him for a long time. Samijon is 53 years old, married and has 3 children. Meat sales are the sole source of the family’s income. Samijon’s wife does not work. He has been borrowing from MicroInvest for one year. With the help of a loan he greatly increased his working capital. Samijon would like to get a new loan to further expand his business. He will repay the new loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Òîðãîâëÿ èäåò õîðîøî è ìÿñî ó íåãî íå çàëåæèâàåòñÿ. Ñàìè÷îíó 53 ãîäà îí æåíàò è ó íåãî òðîå äåòåé. ïðîäàæà ìÿñà ÿâëÿåòñÿ åäèíñòâåííûì èñòî÷íèêîì ñåìåéíîãî áþäæåòà. Åãî æåíà íèãäå íå ðàáîòàåò. loans.use: to expand business

loans.name: Kuch

texts.en: Mrs. Kuch S., 36, lives with her husband (pictured) and 6 children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Kuch S. and her husband are both engaged in selling pork rice, noodle soup, coffee and soft drinks, earning them $30 a day. Of their 6 children, one is a mechanic, one is a garment worker, and the rest are students. Their home is currently in a very bad condition - the roof is made of palm leaves and lets the monsoon rain in - which further damages the house. For this reason, they would like to take out a loan to build themselves a new brick house. They feel it will provide them and their family with a safer and more comfortable environment. In the future they hope to have enough money to expand their business and provide a good education for their children.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam O., 37, and her husband live in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with their 3 children. Sam O. is a grocer and earns $5 a day, whilst her husband is a fisherman and earns $3.50 a day. Of their 3 children, one works at a garment factory and 2 are students. Sam O. is requesting this $600 loan so that she can repair her house, in order to provide her family with a safer and more comfortable environment. In the future she would like to open a stall at the local market for her grocery products.

loans.use: To repair their house

loans.name: Ngurah Sastra

texts.id:
There is high demand for pork meat, especially during Hindu feast days. This is a good business opportunity for some Balinese that Mrs. Ngurah Sastra saw. She has been providing ceremonial animals for religious ceremonies. She farms chicken, duck and pig. Currently Mrs. Ngurah Sastra farms 4 growing pigs. The pigs that she farms is local variety that is used only for religious ceremonial use. Different from other farmers. The pigs are sold according to the ceremonial use for good price regardless of weight. Each 3 month old pig can be sold for about $40. So during "good days" for religious ceremony, she can earn up to $15 for each pig per month.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva volunteer

Kebutuhan akan daging babi di Bali sangat banyak khususnya pada saat hari raya atau upacara adat agama Hindu. Ini merupakan peluang usaha yang baik bagi masyarakat Bali. Ibu Ngurah Sastra melihat peluang ini. Ibu Ngurah Sastra selalu menyediakan sarana untuk upacara – upacara agama. Mulai dari ternak ayam, bebek dan babi dipeliharanya . Saat ini Ibu Ngurah Sastra memelihara 4 ekor babi penggemukan. Babi yang dipelihara adalah Babi jenis lokal yang dipelihara hanya untuk keperluan upacara agama. Berbeda dengan peternak babi lainnya. Babi ini dijual sesuai dengan kebutuhan upacara. Babi dijual dengan harga yang baik tanpa melihat beratnya. Satu ekor babi bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 400.000,- meskipun baru berumur 3 bulan. Jadi pada saat ”hari baik” untuk upacara agama ia bisa mendapat keuntungan dari menjual ternak babi sampai Rp. 150.000,-/ ekornya setiap bulan.

loans.use: Buying more pigs to be grown

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng N., 44, lives with her husband and 4 children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. She earns $5 a day selling the vegetables that her husband grows on their land. She has applied for this loan in order to dig a well and buy a water pumping machine to irrigate their land and increase the amount of crops that will grow. This hardworking couple intend to continuously expand their business in the future.

loans.use: To dig a well and buy a water pumping machine for irrigation purposes

loans.name: Odinahon

texts.ru:
Odinahon is 31 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is earning money in Russia. In order to supplement the family budget Odinahon raises cattle at home. This brings good profits. After getting a loan from MicroInvest she purchased a bull. After feeding it for a while she sold it and used the resulting profits for family expenditures. Today Odinahon plans to get a new loan which she plans to use for the purchase of another bull.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Îäèíàõîí 31 ãîä, ó íåå 3 äåòåé. Åå ìóæ íàõîäèòñÿ íà çàðàáîòêàõ â Ðîññèè. ×òîáû äîïîëíèòü ñåìåéíûé áþäæåò Îäèíàõîí çàíèìàåòñÿ îòêîðìîì ñêîòà ó ñåáÿ äîìà. Ýòî ïðèíîñèò õîðîøèé äîõîä. Ïîëó÷èâ çàéì â Ìèêðîèíâåñò îíà ïðèîáðåëà áû÷êà. Íåìíîãî îòêîðìèâ åãî îíà ïðîäàëà è ïîëó÷åííûé äîõîä ïîòðàòèëà íà ñåìåéíûå ðàñõîäû. Ñåé÷àñ îíà ñîáèðàåòñÿ ïîëó÷èòü íîâûé çàéì, êîòîðûé îíà ïîòðàòèò íà ïðèîáðåòåíèå åùå îäíîãî áû÷êà.

loans.use: to buy 1 bull

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more second hand ladies clothes to sell

loans.name: Kung Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Kung Sam O., 36, and her husband run a small business which recharges vehicles batteries. They earn approximately $10 a day from this. The couple has 6 children - 3 of whom are married, one is a garment worker and the others are students. They would like to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to assist in transporting the batteries from their clients' homes to the business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to assist in transporting their goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 28 years old. He has 3 children, and two of them are in school. He has a general store in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new ice box and more goods for the shop to increase his income and save for a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: To purchase new ice box and more goods

loans.name: Celeste Incassane

texts.pt:
Celeste Cossa Cumbula was born on May 3rd, 1961, in the city of Catembe. She is 46 years old, married. She is the mother of 5 children the oldest is 25 and the youngest is 13 years old. She was raised by her parents in the neighborhood of Catembe, and attended school until the 4th grade. Celeste married in 1980, and worked in agriculture. Due to the war, they had to seek refugee in the neighborhood of Xipamamine in the city of Maputo. She bought mangoes from Vatembe and sold them in Maputo during those years. In 1986, after the death of her mother, Celeste and her family moved back to Catembe, where she started to work in a small business selling rice, beans, peanuts, oil and other groceries from her home. She sought credit opportunities from an organization in Ponte-Catembe. This was not a good experience because the opportunity of acquiring credit was small, and members had to assume responsibility for other members’ loans in case they defaulted.

Celeste was introduced to Hluvuku through a neighbor. She requested her first loan of 10.000MT in hopes to increase her inventory. Celeste and her daughter attend to business together in order to increase the family income. In the future Celeste hopes to have her own stand and to acquire savings.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Incassane -Catembe Cliente: Celeste Cossa Cumbula Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 10.000,00 MT (400.00US$) Aplicacao: Compra de produtos de 1ª necessidade Início: 23/08/07 Fim: 14/12/08 Celeste Cossa Cumbula, nasceu aos 03 de maio de 1961 na Catembe, tem actualmente 46 anos de idade, casada com 5 filhos o mais velho tem 25 anos e o mais novo 13 anos, viveu e cresceu num ambiente familiar com os pais no bairro chamissava na Catembe, frequentou a escola até 4ª classe. Casou-se em 1980 e como não tinha alternativa de trabalhodedicava-se a agricultura. Devido a guerra de desestabilização tiveram que abandonar a casa e refugiar-se no bairro Xipamamine na ciadade do Maputo e no final de cada ano atravessava a Catembe para a compra de mangas e posterior revenda em Maputo. Em 1986 depóis da morte da mãe tiveram que voltar a Catembe difinitivamente e é dai que começou com pequenos negócios de venda de arroz, amendoim, feijões, óleo, etc no seu quintal. Teve o primeiro contacto com crédito com uma pequena organização sediada na Ponte-Catembe que ofereciam créditos em grupos, não tendo sido uma experiência boa porque para além dos valores cedidos serem menores tinham de assumir responsabilidade de pagar o empréstimo em casos de um dos constituintes do grupo não efectuasse o pagamento.

Conhece a Hluvuku, através de conversa com a Vizinha e dai se aproximou e solicitou o empréstimo, com este empréstimo de 10.000 MT, pretende incrementar o volume do seu negocio, adquirido mais mercadoria. Actualmente está explorando um pequeno estabelecimento emprestado, mas sendo a único no local que oferece um bom ambiente de negócio. Tem contribuido para colocar o produto mais perto do consumidor reduzindo desta forma os custos de deslocação Ela dirige pessoalmente o negócio e na sua ausença a filha é que tem tomado a conta do mesmo e com os rendimentos do negocio incrementa a renda familiar. A perspectiva futura é ter barraca própria e poupar algum dinheiro para momentos críticos do negócio.

loans.use: To increase stocks in her business

payments.comment: Celeste has successfully repaid this loan in advance in order to request a new loan.

loans.name: Ni Putu

texts.id:
Mrs. Putu R. has three children of school ages. The eldest is in junior high school, while her second and third children are still in elementary school. So she has to spend a lot for her kids' school fees and supplies. Mrs. Putu R. has to spend about $30 each month, excluding food. This need cannot be fulfilled with only her husband's earnings who is a contract farmer. This creative lady doesn't want to depend on her husband, so she started her own pig far. With 3 pigs that she farms, Mrs. Putu R. can increase her family's income by $70 per 3 months. Mrs. R. plans to add her more pigs to her farm up to 6, so she can earn more money.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ibu Putu R. mempunyai tiga orang anak yang semuanya sudah bersekolah. Anak yang paling besar sudah SMP, sedangkan yang kedua dan ketiga masih di Sekolah Dasar. Dapat dibayangkan berapa besar biaya yang harus dikeluarkannya setiap hari untuk pendidikan dan uang saku anaknya. Ibu Putu R. harus menyiapkan dana Rp.300.000,- ditambah untuk kebutuhan dapur. Kebutuhan ini tidak dapat dipenuhi hanya dari hasil kerja suaminya yang hanya seorang buruh tani. Ibu yang kreatif ini tidak mau hanya meminta dari suaminya tetapi ia juga mempunyai usaha ternak babi. Dengan 3 ekor ternak babi peliharaannya Ibu Putu R. bisa menambah penghasilanya Rp.700.000,- / 3 bulan. Ibu R. berencana menambah ternaknya sampai 6 ekor supaya lebih banyak mendapat hasil.

loans.use: Purchase more growing pigs

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
Teresa N. was born on November 20th, 1968, in the city of Maputo. She is married, mother of a 22 years old son. She was raised by her aunt in Vila Marinha, where she studied until the 8th grade. Teresa married in 1985 and moved to the city of Matola. There she started to work in a small business of selling bread and other baked goods from her front yard. She moved to Catembe in 1999, to the neighborhood of Chali. She worked as a maid for 10 years. She saved from her little income in order to start a used clothes business. Teresa was introduced to Hluvuku credit program through neighbors. With the loan of 11.000 MT, Teresa plans on buying used clothes, mattresses and beds to increase her inventory. Teresa’s work has a positive impact in her community because she is the only one selling that kind of product in her neighborhood. In the future she hopes to diversify her inventory to include children’s clothes, and furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro Guachene- Catembe Cliente: Teresa N. Actividade:Comércio Valor de empréstimo: 11.000,00 MT (440.00US$) Aplicacao: Compra de roupa usada Início: 23/08/07 Fim: 14/12/08 Teresa N., nasceu a 20 de Novembro de 1968 em Maputo, casada maritalmente com 1 filho de 22 anos cresceu e viveu desde pequena com sua tia na Vila da Marinha onde estudou até 8ª classe. Casa-se em 1985 e foi viver na cidade da Matola e lá começa a desenvolver pequenos negócios de fabrico de bolos e pãezinhos que os vendia no seu quintal e também vendia comidas e bebidas. No entanto muda de residência passa a residir na Catembe em 1999 no bairro Chali e trabalha na cidade como empregada doméstica durante 10 anos e com pouco dinheiro que ganhava poupava algum e decide deixar de trabalhar e inicia o negócio de venda de roupa usada. Teve conhecimento da Hluvuku através de colegas e vizinhos os quais incentivaram-na a ter crédito como forma de melhorar seu negócio. Com o crédito de 11.000 MT pretende comprou fardos de roupa usada, colchões, camas. A actividade tem impacto pois no bairro é a única que vende este tipo de produto, e também diminui a distancia e tempo que tinham que percorrer para a cidade. O verão é tempo mais apropriado para venda de roupas e as mais preferidas são das crianças. No futuro almeja diversificar ainda amais sua actividade com enfoque para roupas para crianças e montar um estabelecimento para venda de cadeiras plásctica, camas, colchões.

loans.use: To increase stocks in business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 23 years old, and he has one child. After his father died, his mother and sister came to live with him. He has a shoe and bag shop. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new modern goods for the shop. He wants to increase his income and improve his living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new modern goods for the shop

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
From Hà Nội, along route 3 toward Việt Bắc (windy city), there's a restaurant in the town of Nỉ-Trung Giã ran by Ms Tạ Thị Thịnh. This is where you can have authentic vietnamese dishes. As soon as you step inside the restaurant, you will be warmly greeted by the owner. All the dishes featured on the menu are prepared by Ms Thịnh with the help of her husband, a retiree.
