At the age of 47, after 9 years as a participating member of "Quỹ Tình thương" fund, Ms Thịnh has gradually built up her restaurant to be a viable business. Her 2 children are attending university. She is requesting a loan of 575 USD to buy more products/drinks for her restaurant

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Từ Hà Nội, ngược theo quốc lộ 3, về thăm chiến khu Việt Bắc, thủ đô Gió ngàn, dừng chân tại phố Nỉ-Trung Giã, ghé vào quán ăn của chị Tạ Thị Thịnh bạn có thể cảm nhận ngay được hương vị quê hương tỏa ra từ những món ăn dân tộc trong quán. Bước chân vào quán ăn bạn sẽ được đón tiếp bởi vẻ mặt rạng rỡ tươi cười của bà chủ cửa hàng. Các món ăn ở đây đều do chính bàn tay chị Thịnh thể hiện cùng với sự hỗ trợ của chồng là một quân nhân đã nghỉ hưu. Bước vào tuổi 47, sau 9 năm tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, chị đã xây dựng được một cửa hàng ăn khang trang, điều kiện bảo quản vệ sinh đầy đủ. Hiện nay chị có 2 con đang học đại học. Với mức vốn xin vay là 575 USD, chị dự định mua thêm thực phẩm và đồ uống để đáp ứng nhu cầu ngày càng lớn của khách hàng.

loans.use: buy food and drink for her restaurant

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
H. is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and two children at Soc Son district, Ha Noi. Being an attractive lady, she is mindful that she should make herself and her society beautiful. Ten years ago she opened a fabric shop in the ‘Flanel Market’. With her flourishing business, and the increasing capital that she could borrow over the years, in 2005 she opened another store to sell ready-made clothes. Her store is a well known address to the women who need to look good. Her next project is to open a cosmetic shop and for that she is requesting for a loan of $1200.

Translated from Vietnamese by Hien Lam, Kive Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị H. năm nay 47 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Sóc Sơn, Hà Nội. Bản thân là một phụ nữ có nhan sắc, chị luôn tâm niệm phải biết làm đẹp cho mình cũng như xã hội, chị đã mở 1 quầy hàng kinh doanh vải vóc tại chợ Nỉ cách đây hơn 10 năm. Công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi cộng với số vốn được vay tăng dần qua các năm, năm 2005 chị mở thêm một quầy hàng bán quần áo may sẵn. Cửa hàng của chị đã trở thành địa chỉ quen thuộc cho những phụ nữ có nhu cầu làm đẹp cho mình. Dự định của chị sắp tới sẽ mở thêm quầy hàng mỹ phẩm và có nhu cầu được vay thêm 1200 USD.

loans.use: add a cosmetic shop to her existing business of clothings.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru:
Mastona sells children’s clothing and footwear in the central market of Isfara. She has 10 years of experience in this business. Her husband is working in Russia and sends money home. The business adds to the family budget. Mastona is 32 years old and is raising three children. She started borrowing money through MicroInvest in April of this year and has shown herself to be an exemplary client. Mastona plans to use the new loan to purchase fall clothing and footwear.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mastona çàíèìàåòñÿ ïðîäàæåé äåòñêîé îäåæäû è îáóâè íà öåíòðàëüíîì ðûíêå ãîðîäà Èñôàðû. Åå îïûò â ýòîé äåÿòåëüíîñòè óæå 10 ëåò. Åå ìóæ íàõîäèòñÿ íà çàðàáîòêàõ â Ðîññèè è ïðèñûëàåò äåíüãè. Äîïîëíåíèåì ê ñåìåéíîìó áþäæåòó ÿâëÿåòñÿ áèçíåñ. Ìàñòîíå 32 ãîäà è îíà âîñïèòûâàåò òðîèõ äåòåé. êðåäèòîâàòüñÿ â Ìèêðîèíâåñò îíà íà÷àëà â àïðåëå ýòîãî ãîäà è óæå ïîêàçàëà ñåáÿ êàê îáðàçöîâàÿ êëèåíòêà. Íîâûé çàéì îíà ñîáèðàåòñÿ óïîòðåáèòü íà çàêóï îñåííåãî àññîðòèìåíòà îäåæäû è îáóâè.

loans.use: For purchase of autumn assortment of clothes and footwear

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị D., 50 years old, is a participating member of the "Quỹ Tình thương" fund since 10/1999. After 8 years, she now has enough confidence to request a big loan to invest into her business. Started from a small stand selling clothes, she now runs a clothing store that offers a lot of variety, especially children fashion wear. Her husband passed away due to illness in 2000. She was left with 2 kids to raise by her self. Her children are now all grown up: her son is married and is a state employee, her daughter is independent and has a stand selling goods in her home. Despite the facts that she doe not have to take care of her children anymore, Ms D. does not want to abandon her business, she does not want to depend on her children. With a revenue of 200 USD, Ms D. is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy more clothes for her store

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị D., 50 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ tháng 10/1999. Qua 8 năm tham gia Quỹ chị đã mạnh dạn tăng dần mức vốn vay để đầu tư buôn bán. Từ 1 quầy hàng nhỏ, mặt hàng đơn điệu, đến nay chị đã mở rộng cửa hàng với nhiều loại sản phẩm đa dạng, phong phú, đặc biệt là thời trang trẻ em tại chợ Nỉ, Sóc Sơn. Chồng chị mắc bệnh qua đời năm 2000 để lại cho 2 con còn đang độ tuổi đi học, một mình chị đã cố gắng nuôi 2 con khôn lớn trưởng thành. Đến nay con trai chị đã xây dựng gia đình và hiện đang là cán bộ kiểm toán nhà nước tại Hà Nội. Con gái đang bán hàng tạp hóa tại nhà riêng. Mặc dù hai con đều có công ăn việc làm ổn định nhưng chị D. không có ý định bỏ công việc kinh doanh quen thuộc của mình để sống dựa vào con cái. Với mức thu nhập hàng tháng 200 USD, chị đang xin vay 1200 USD để mua thêm quần áo tăng lượng hàng bán ra trong thời gian sắp tới.

loans.use: buy clothes for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her electronic sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her food vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more shoes and handbags to sell.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface K. is 31 years old and married with one child. He lives in Mlolongo town along the Mombasa-Nairobi Highway. Apart from his immediate family Boniface also takes care of his mother who lives in a rural area.

Boniface started his retail shop business in the year 2006. This was after he had saved Ksh 15,000.00 (US$ 220) from his previous employment at a company by the name Kapa Oil Refineries. Boniface decided to invest his savings by buying 50 crates of eggs at a market known as Wangige which is located on the outskirts of Nairobi city. He later rented a stall at Mlolongo.

The egg selling business was going on well but people continued impressing on him to open a one-stop shop so that they could be making all their purchases at his shop which would save them time and effort by not having to move from one shop to another.

Boniface's business has been doing well recently due to the rapid growth of the population in this town. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of US$ 825. Given this loan, Boniface will add to the already existing stock at his shop which includes items like beans, rice, sugar, wheat flour, cooking fats and margarine. He believes that nothing will make his customers happier and keep them coming back than having a variety of items in one shop. The repayment period for his loan will be 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for cereal shop including beans, rice, sugar, wheat flour, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring cloth materials

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James N. is 46 years old, married with one child. He lives and operates a butchery at Embakasi Division along the North Airport Road, within Nairobi. James started his business in the year 2004. This was after he researched butcheries in Embakasi Division and found that there was only one butchery in the whole neighborhood. Being a business-minded person, James therefore decided to take a risk and open his own butchery. In order to do this, he sold his old pick-up truck for Ksh.250,000 (US$ 3,680).

Using this money as his initial capital, James constructed a small stall on an undeveloped piece of land that he had purchased earlier. During this time, many residents in the neighborhood encouraged James to open the butchery quickly, since the only other butchery operator used to cheat his clients by selling less meat, since he purposely used faulty scales. Some of the customers also suspected that they were eating un-inspected meat, which during this time may have included donkey meat and some wild game, which is illegal in Kenya.

Due to James' honesty and friendly nature, many customers flock to his butchery, where he sells high quality meat. Apart from that, the area where his business is located is highly industrial, hence many company workers flock to his butchery to have some "nyama choma", "mbuzi choma" or "kuku choma", (these are traditional Kenyan delicacies of roasted beef, roasted goat meat and chicken respectively) together with ugali (a thick paste made from corn flour) and chips (potato fries), which James introduced some eight months ago upon the request of his customers.

Due to the increased number of customers, James intends to expand his business so as to satisfy his customers’ demand for beef, chicken and fish. James is kindly requesting a loan of US$ 1,200). Given this loan, James will be able to purchase a deepfreeze for storage purposes, a chips warmer, and chairs and tables, which will help him to cope with the increasing demand for quality meat. He promises to provide his loyal customers with better services. The repayment period for his loan will be 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase a deepfreeze, chips warmer, 15 chairs, 4 large tables, and a small tent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 50 chairs, 10 tables, & a big cupboard

loans.name: Herminio

texts.en:
Herminio is 47 years old, and he and his wife of 23 years, Isabel, have 4 children together. When he was 27 he started working cultivating his land. At this time he and his wife decided to take their small savings of US $160 and invest it to create a small garden where they cultivated various types of vegetables.

Thanks to their effort and enthusiasm, after 20 years they continue to dedicate themselves to the same business which they have now expanded into a large production where they grow an enormous variety of agricultural products. All of the children help them on the farm in addition to 19 employees who help with different activities such as irrigation, cultivation and plowing the land.

Currently he distributes his products to various supermarkets. His dream is to construct an artesian well for the irrigation of his cultivations. At the moment Herminio is asking for a loan to build a greenhouse to increase his output.

loans.use: Construction of a greenhouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sink, a portable bathtub and 2 sitting benches

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin N. N. is 39 years old. He is married and has one child. Martin started his business in the year 2003. This was after selling out his fruit-selling stall in Githurai town, in the outskirts of Nairobi. Martin made the decision to sell his fruit stall due to the huge losses he had because fruit is perishable.

Martin decided to venture into the furniture business because he had skills in this area after training in carpentry in the year 2002 at Christian Industrial Training Centre in Nairobi; hence he had confidence that he had all the skills needed.

In the year 2003 Martin purchased a second-hand plainer machine worth Ksh 28,000 (US$ 430). This machine was to help him with cutting and shaping the wood. He has been using the machine ever since, though it is prone to breaking down often, due to wear and tear, and this slows down his work.

Recently Martin got a contract to supply furniture to one of the major hotels in the city by the name of Kikwetu Hotel. This was due to the fact that Martin had earlier supplied the hotel with some beds, which were of high quality and had a one-year warranty. The contract he got recently is to supply the hotel with high quality chairs, beds, and tables. Though Martin is happy he got the contract, he is a very worried man because he may not be able to beat the deadline to supply said furniture, due to the persistent breakdown of his plainer machine. Martin is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 1,200.

With this loan Martin will be able to purchase a new plainer machine and a portable tent, which will truly help him beat the deadline of the awarded contract. This will translate into more income and he will be able to employ two people full time who are currently working for him on casual basis, therefore creating employment for the two. The repayment period for this loan will be 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase a Plainer machine, a motor and a portable shed

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 40 years old and lives with his Brazilian wife and their 3 children who are 15 years, 13 years, and 11 months old. The two eldest children attend high school.

Juan started working as a tailor approximately 16 years ago when he was invited by two of his brothers to travel to the neighboring country of Brazil to work. He learned everything that he knows working there for a dressmaking company and later managed to start working independently as soon as he was able to buy his own sewing machine. Three years later he decided to return to Paraguay and start his own dressmaking shop out of his home where he employed three people to help him with his business.

Currently he makes clothing for a well-known athletic clothing company. His dream is to one day be able to buy a good vehicle to use in the transport of his merchandise. At the moment he is in need of a loan to buy more material to fulfill his many orders.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is 27 years old and lives with her boyfriend and 2 children who are 3 and 6 years old. The eldest goes to school, and is in the first grade. Her boyfriend works for a potable water company where he has worked for 10 years and supports the household with his monthly salary.

María is a young entrepreneur who started her business, a store selling an assortment of goods, 3 years ago. She said that it was thanks to luck that she one day won a lottery prize of US $200 which she invested in the purchase of merchandise to begin supplying her store.

Her wish is to see her children grow up to be professionals, and she works hard every day without rest to ensure this happens. Now María needs a loan to buy more merchandise for her store, such as flour, rice, sugar, and soft drinks, in order to expand her business and help make her wish come true.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Elena C. lives with her husband and children, ages 12, 10 and 1, in their own home in the Munaypata neighborhood, on the north face of the city of La Paz. Elena and her husband run a small diner where they serve lunch every day of the month.

They previously received a loan from IMPRO to build a side fence on the property line bordering their neighbor. Due to the area's topography and the lack of fences, their home was prone to being burglarized.

The proceeds of this loan will be used to build the back fence surrounding their property, which will give Elena and her family a greater measure of security and safety. Elena has been a client of IMPRO since 2005 and has received 2 previous loans, both of which she has repaid in full. The socioeconomic analysis conducted by IMPRO qualifies Elena and her husband to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Elena C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Munaypata ladera norte de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo y sus hijos de 12, 10 y 1 año de edad; la señora Elena junto a su esposo atienden una pensión de su zona ofreciendo almuerzos todos los días del mes. En anterior ocasión fueron beneficiados con un crédito de IMPRO para la construcción del muro lateral de su casa que colinda con el vecino, ya que dada la topografía y la falta de muros perimetrales de sus vecinos, su vivienda corría el peligro de sufrir robos. El crédito ahora solicitado será destinado a la construcción de el muro perimetral en la parte posterior de la vivienda que les dará mayor seguridad. La señora Elena C. es nuestro cliente desde el año 2005 y desde entonces ha sido favorecida con dos créditos con nuestra institución, los cuales a la fecha están completamente pagados. El análisis socioeconómico realizado muestra un estado financiero favorable y la califica perfectamente para acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To build a fence around home

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 30 years old and is married with 2 daughters, one who is 5 and the other just turned 9 months. Her husband, Paulino, works purchasing and selling bricks, a business which he carries out in the capital city.

Nelly is a hairdresser and has worked in this profession for the past 8 years. Coming from a poor family, she was only able to study up to her third year in high school. For this reason, she decided to study hairdressing and work in this profession to earn a living.

Due to her hard work and entrepreneurship, she has established a good clientele and has even managed to acquire another location that she is currently working on furnishing. Nelly needs a loan in order to purchase things like mirrors, chairs, and sinks so that she can open this new branch of her business.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture for a beauty salon

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Mr. Felipe M. lives with his wife and three children in their own home located in the Pasanqueri neighborhood on the western face of the city of La Paz. Felipe works for a small construction company in the city and his wife is a homemaker. The family was previously granted loans to prepare the lot and later build the 2-room house where they currently reside.

This loan will be used to add an additional two rooms to the home, which will be used as bedrooms. Felipe has been a client of IMPRO since 1999 and has been granted four loans, which he repaid in full and on time. This identifies him as an excellent client who qualifies to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Felipe M. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasanqueri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus tres hijos; el señor Felipe se dedica a construcción en una microempresa de la ciudad y la esposa es ama de casa (es decir que se dedica al cuidado de su hogar). La familia del señor Felipe obtuvo créditos para la estabilización de su terreno y construcción en obra fina de de dos habitaciones en planta baja, en las que actualmente residen. El crédito que ahora solicita será destinado a la construcción de dos habitaciones más que forman parte del proyecto de su vivienda, y que serán destinados a dormitorios. Felipe es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 1999 y hasta la fecha ha obtenido cuatro créditos con nuestra institución, los cuales han sido pagados completamente mereciendo la calificación de cliente excelente. Estos antecedentes crediticios y el análisis socioeconómico actualizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use: To build home addition

loans.name: Anadeli

texts.es:
Anadeli is 23 years old and has one child. In order to help her spouse out with the household costs, Anadeli sells clothes and prepares food typical to her region. She sells these items out of her mother-in-law’s house who also helps her with these sales. Anadeli belongs to the group Compañerismo 5 together with Ms. Pascuala Lopez Perez (who sells food) and Maria Luisa Caballero Silva (who also sells food). With this loan they hope to implement their businesses buying utensils for the kitchen and improve the condition of the places where they sell their food.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Pendleton, Kiva Volunteer.

ANADELI TIENE 23 AÑOS UN HIJO Y PARA APOYAR A SU ESPOSO EN EL GASTO FAMILIAR , VENDE ROPA Y PREPARA COMIDA TIPICA DE LA ZONA Y LA VENDE EN LA CASA DE SU SUEGRA QUIEN TAMBIEN LA APOYA EN LA VENTA.PERTENECE AL GRUPO COMPAÑERISMO 5 JUNTO CON DOÑA PASCUALA LOPEZ PEREZ ( VENTA DE COMIDA) Y MARIA LUISA CABALLERO SILVA (VENTA DE COMIDA). CON EL PRESTAMO ESPERAN IMPLEMENTAR SUS NEGOCIOS COMPRANDO UTENSILIOS DE COCINA Y CONDICIONAR MEJOR LOS LUGARES DONDE VENDEN SU COMIDA .

loans.use: Sale of food typical to the region

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter M. is a 32-year-old man. He is married, and has one child of three years. He also lives with and takes care of his younger sister. He is originally from Kirinyaga district of Kenya, but now lives in the Ngong town area, and operates his business from the Kenyatta market area. 

Peter enrolled into Kigali Teachers College where he studied for one year. He then went through a very difficult period after his mother passed away after his first year in college. Unfortunately his father could not support him, since he now had another family. Due to this difficulty, he dropped out of college. He then went out and started off a small business selling groceries, but his working capital was small, and since he was still quite young, he was unable to manage the business properly and it collapsed. He then went to one of the slum areas called Kawangware, where he was employed to manage a beer pub. After about six months he was laid off. 

Peter then approached his uncle for help and fortunately his uncle took him in. His uncle then introduced him to selling second hand jeans at the Kenyatta market area. He started off here by working as a broker, whereby he would sell trousers on behalf of his uncle, and would then be given a small commission. With time, in the year 2001, he managed to put aside a little money from the commissions i.e. Ksh. 500 (USD 8), which he used as his initial capital to purchase four pairs of jeans trousers.  He sold them and was able to buy more jeans. One of his distant relatives suggested that he should consider selling stretch jeans since they would soon be coming into fashion, and he took the advice. For about seven years now he has specialized in the sale of stretch jeans, and he is glad he took the advice, since stretch jeans have become a favourite for many women who now form the bulk of his customers. 

Peter finds that the only reason he has not been able to expand his business is lack of capital, since he doesn’t have collateral that would enable him to borrow from formal banks. He has so far managed to attract a regular flow of customers, and would like to increase his stock, so as to provide a better variety for them. Peter is therefore requesting a loan of USD75, with which he will buy additional jeans trousers in order to boost his stock. He intends to repay the loan over a period of 5 months.

loans.use: To purchase second hand jeans

loans.name: Albino

texts.en:
I have a small business selling used clothes and tennis shoes. My sales are strong, but I would like to invest in clothes for the new season, as I have been unable to meet my customers' demand due to a lack of capital. I am requesting a loan in the amount of $1,000 to invest in inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo una venta de ropa usada y tenis mis ventas son muy buenas, pero me gustaría invertir un poco más en ropa de temporada ya que mis clientes me piden cosas que no he podido comprar debido a que me cuestan más caras”. Solicito 1,000.00 dlls para invertirle a mi negocio.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachel A. is 32 years old and married with two children. She lives in Umoja estate, one of the many estates in the eastern part of Nairobi city.

Rachel operates a tailoring stall at a market known as the Umoja Market situated within the estate where she lives. Rachel started her business in the year 2002 and at this time, she operated her business from her house. She used to make tablecloths which she sold in the town of Meru, in the Eastern Province of Kenya. Rachel continued selling her tablecloths in Meru town until the year 2004 when she decided to introduce a new line into her business, by selling ladies suits after two ladies in Meru town commissioned her to make them suits. She made six additional suits to test the market and to her surprise, all the six were sold very quickly. From then on, Rachel decided to become a full time tailor specializing in ladies clothes.

Rachael has managed to employ several orphaned young women who help her with the tailoring work. Rachel now intends to expand her business by stocking tailoring materials and accessories so that her tailoring colleagues and customers do not have to travel all the way to the city center to buy these items. Rachel is therefore requesting a loan of USD750 that she intends to repay within 12 months. With this loan, Rachael will be able to boost her income by supplying tailoring materials and accessories such as lining, buttons, rings, canvas, thread biers and laces. These additions will greatly boost her income.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials and accessories including lining buttons, rings, thread, laces etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase assorted prescription drugs

loans.name: Senia Ruth

texts.es:
Senia is the young mother of a 7 year-old girl. Her desire to improve her daughter’s quality of life has led her to do a variety of jobs. Three years ago she began a small grocery store in her house, taking advantage of the huge demand of her neighbors for basic goods. With the income that this small store generates, she is able to meet her family’s basic needs and also educate her daughter.

Due to the fact that her customers are always requesting a larger number and variety of products, Senia finds herself in the situation of needing to increase her stock so that she can provide good service to her customers. In order to do this, Senia is requesting a loan of S/. 600.00, which she is committed to repaying over a period of 6 months. Senia hopes you will be able to help her so that she can begin her project.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Senia, es una joven luchadora madre de una niña de 7 años. Los deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su hija la han llevado a desempeñarse en diferentes oficios. Hace 3 años inauguró una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su localidad aprovechando la masiva demanda de sus vecinos por los artículos de primera necesidad.Con el ingreso que genera a diario esta pequeña bodega, puede solventar las necesidades más urgentes de su familia y otorgarle una adecuada educación a su pequeña.Debido a que sus clientes cada vez exigen mayor cantidad y variedad es que Senia se ve en la necesidad de ampliar su stock con el deseo de brindarles un adecuado servicio a sus clientes. Por esta razón solicita un préstamos de 600 soles que se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses para poder ingresar mayor cantidad de artículos a su bodega. Senia espera tu pronta ayuda para iniciar su proyecto.

loans.use: To buy a greater stock of products for her grocery store, so that it can become one of the most popular in the neighborhood

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. is 26 years old and married.  He is also a born again Christian and stays at Kinanie town in Athi River District, 80 kilometers from Nairobi. 

It is a common saying among people that when the business bug strikes a person there is no turning back. David M. is a case in point. In 2004, David took half a sack of beans and another half of maize to Kinanie market. He was able to sell his goods within two hours of his arrival at the market, which gave him the confidence and funds he needed to start his own business. David continued to take his cereals on a bicycle to Kinanie Market each day, until late 2004 when David secured a stall at the market. This was a milestone in David’s life after many days of praying and fasting. David now devotes most of his time to running the stall and his business is doing very well. Recently too, Kinanie has started to expand and the population is growing at an alarming rate, which is an encouraging sign to the people in the business sector. 

David’s stall is a beehive of activity as people scramble to buy his cereals, which are always fairly priced. David now needs to expand his business and is seeking a loan of USD825 to purchase a larger variety of cereals including maize, beans, rice, dried peas, green grams, black eyed peas, etc.  By expanding his range, he believes that he will have enough stock to meet the demands of all his customers, and will no longer have to turn away customers due to lack of stock. The repayment period for his loan will be 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase assorted cereals including maize, beans, green grams, rice, dried peas, black eyed peas, etc.

loans.name: Hermelinda Luz

texts.es:
The school cafeteria has become an important source of income for Hermelinda’s family. She has three children, and it is because of this business, which they occasionally help her with, that they are able to study. Hermelinda’s friendly manner has maD. the cafeteria into a place that is very popular with the school children.

Due to the requests she receives day after day from her regular customers, she wants to increase her stock of products and also expand the space she occupies. In order to do this, she is requesting a loan of S/. 600.00, which she is committed to repaying over a period of 6 months. She hopes you will be able to help her, so that she can begin her project as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

L. cafetería escolar se ha convertido en una importante fuente D. ingreso para L. familia D. Hermelinda, elL. tiene tres hijos y gracias a esta actividad, que desempeñá en algunas ocasiones su compañía, ellos pueden estudiar con satisfacción.L. cordialidad que posee L. ha convertido en una D. los lugares más concurridos por los niños.Y a raíz D. las exigencias que le dan día a día sus asiduos clientes es que desea ampliar su stock D. productos y también el espacio que ocupa. Por ello solicita un préstamo D. 600 soles con el compromiso D. retornarlos en un lapso D. 6 meses. Por esta razón recurre a cada uno D. ustedes con L. esperanza D. poder recibir su ayuda; para emprender D. manera inmediata su proyecto

loans.use: To increase her stock and expand her space in the school cafeteria where she prepares and sells food

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Mrs. Imelda R. has sold new and used clothing for more than 20 years. "This business is the only source of income for my family ; my daughter works with me. I thank God that this business has allowed me to support my daughter and give her an education. I would like to invest in winter merchandise, for which I am requesting a loan of $500."

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Imelda R. tiene ya más de 20 años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia en el trabajos mi hija y yo. Gracias a dios este negocio me ha dado para sacar a mi hija delante y darle los estudio necesario, quiero invertir le mas de mercancía de temporada de frió. Por el cual solicito un préstamo de $500.00 dlls para la compra de mercancía.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Humberto Vicente

texts.es:
In spite of frequently inclement weather, Humberto keeps up a tenacious fight to continue doing what has given him enormous satisfaction for many years—farming potatoes. He learned and inherited this occupation from his parents. Due to fact that he has a large family, he can’t, and doesn’t, let the weather or other adversities overcome him. His beloved wife does whatever she can to help him and together they have decided to increase the number of crops they plant so that they can generate a larger income. They will invest this in their land and improve their family’s quality of life. In order to do this, Humberto is requesting a loan of S/. 1300.00, which he is committed to repaying over a period of six months. He appeals to your generosity so that he can begin this family project.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

A pesar de las inclemencias del tiempo, Humberto lucha tenazmente por seguir desarrollando la actividad que por muchos años le ha dado enormes satisfacciones, la siembra de papa, esta actividad la ha aprendido y heredado de sus padres. Debido a la numerosa familia que posee no puede ni deja que el clima y las adversidades que se generen en su entorno lo derroten.Su querida esposa no escatima esfuerzos para acompañarlo y juntos se han propuesto ampliar la cantidad de productos para sembrar y generar mayores réditos para seguir invirtiéndolos en sus tierras y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.Por ello la solicitud de Humberto es por un monto de 1300 soles con un compromiso de pago durante un período de 6 meses. Acude a tu generoso corazón a fin de poner en marcha su proyecto familiar.

loans.use: To plant a greater diversity of crops so that Humberto can minimize losses caused by inclement weather

loans.name: Saadeh

texts.en: Saadeh is a 31 year old woman living in the South of Lebanon in the village of Al Hibarieh. Saadeh owns a small beauty shop where she provides hairdressing and make up services, and she is also a good tailor who proposes sewing services in the village. She is her family's head of house and financially provides for her retired parents as well. Saadeh is very dynamic in the village community and is part of the local women's association. She would like a $1200 loan to purchase new equipment and to make aesthetic improvements to her salon.

loans.use: Saadeh would like to purchase new equipment and make aesthetic improvements to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Jesus William

texts.es:
Jesús is an entreprenurial cattleman who, through hard work, has grown his capital little by little. He yearns to make his small business into a big family business so that he can improve the quality of life for his wife and children. He currently has 5 cows and grows his own feed for them, in order to improve the quality of the milk that they produce. His desire to grow has led him to improve his production techniques, so that he can distribute the milk to his clients in a timely manner.

Jesús wants to buy another cow to increase the amount of milk produced and gradually establish a store in his house where he will sell high-quality dairy products. In order to begin this project, Jesús is requesting a loan of $425.00, which he is committed to repaying over a period of 6 months. With your help, Jesús will be able to get another cow and improve the cattle’s feed. Let’s work together so that Jesús can make his dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús es un impetuoso ganadero que a través de su trabajo a ido incrementando poco a poco su capital y anhelo de hacer de su pequeño negocio una gran empresa familiar para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y esposa.Actualmente tiene 5 vacas y también se dedica a la siembra de pastizales para incrementar la calidad de la leche que producen sus queridas amigas. Su interés y deseo de crecer lo han llevado a tecnificar su producción para distribuirlo oportunamente a sus clientes. El deseo de Jesús es comprar una vaquita más para acrecentar la cantidad de leche y poder establecer paulatinamente en las instalaciones de su hogar una planta en la que ofrecería productos lácteos de excelente calidad.Para iniciar este proyecto, Jesús, solicita un préstamo de 425 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda Jesús podrá adquirir una vaquita y mejorará el alimento que consumen a diario. Hagamos juntos que ese corazón soñador convierta en realidad sus anhelos.

loans.use: To buy a cow, which will bring Jesus closer to his dream of expanding his small business into a larger one

loans.name: Oswaldo Melquíades

texts.es:
Oswaldo is a man who, from the time he was very young, loved working with cattle. When he was growing up, his parents taught him many values, but above all, those of perseverance and work. His affinity for working with cattle led him to have a barn with a good number of cows, from which he gets a considerable amount of milk everyday. He makes the milk into cheese, yogurt, butter, and other dairy products. His family helps him with sales and with caring for these generous cows because it is thanks to the income they generate that the family is able to satisfy its basic needs.

Oswaldo wants to improve the barn so that the cows can have a more comfortable place to live. In this way he can thank each one of them for the happiness they have provided his family for such a long time. For this reason, Oswaldo is requesting a loan of $100.00, which he is committed to repaying over a period of 6 months. Oswaldo and his family thank you for your generosity, which will allow them to complete this project.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Oswaldo, es un hombre que desde muy pequeño sintió mucho amor y apego al trabajo ganadero; en su hogar le inculcaron muchos valores pero sobre todo la perseverancia y trabajo. Actualmente esta inquietud por la actividad ganadera lo ha llevado a tener un establo con un buen número de vacas de las que obtiene todos los días una cantidad considerable de leche con el que puede fabricar queso, yogurt, mantequilla y demás derivados.Su familia lo ayuda con la venta y cuidado de sus generosas vaquitas ya que gracias a los réditos que generan pueden satisfacer sus necesidades más urgentes. El deseo de Oswaldo es mejorar el lugar que habitan para que puedan permanecer con comodidad; de esa manera podría agradecerles todas y cada una de las alegrías que han brindado a su familia durante mucho tiempo.Debido a este hecho es que Oswaldo solicita un préstamo de 100 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses. Oswaldo y su familia agradecen tu generosidad para llevar a cabo este proyecto.

loans.use: To improve the barn where Oswaldo's cows live

loans.name: Hermelinda Francisca

texts.es:
Hermelinda is a single mother who, despite difficulties she faced living in her home town, decided to fight to keep her family together and far away from violence. For this reason, she decided to move to another town and establish herself there. Shortly afterwards, she lost her husband and was left alone with three children. Through much effort and hard work, she managed to educate them so that they are able fulfill a variety of activities in society. Things have never been easy for Hermelinda’s family, but thanks to their sense of unity and dedication to each other, they have been able to regain the peace and calm that had been taken from them.

Hermelinda currently raises pigs and guinea pigs in a part of her house that she has adapted for this purpose. She has been selling them to friends and family, but due to advice that many people have given her, she has decided to install a small food stand outside her house for the purpose of selling to the general public. In order to proceed with this plan, she is requesting a loan of $400.00, which she is committed to repaying over a period of 6 months. This way she will be able to begin her project and improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Hermelinda es una madre que a pesar de las dificultades que le tocó vivir en su ciudad natal decidió seguir luchando por mantener a su familia unida lejos de la violencia.. Por ello decidió migrar a otra ciudad y establecerse en ella; a poco tiempo de haberlo hecho perdió a su esposo y se quedó sola con sus 3 hijos; a base de esfuerzo y mucho trabajo los educó a fin de que puedan desarrollar diversas actividades dentro de la sociedad.Las cosas nunca fueron fáciles para la familia de Hermelinda pero gracias a la unión y compromiso de cada uno de sus miembros han podido recobrar la paz y calma que les habían arrebatado.Hermelinda actualmente cría cuyes y cerditos en un espacio de su casa que ha acondicionado especialmente para esta actividad. Los ha ido vendiendo a amigos y familiares; pero gracias a muchos consejos ha decidido instalar un pequeño stand de comida típica en las afueras de su hogar a fin de ofrecerlos al público en general.Para llevar a cabo este proyecto, solicita un préstamo de 400 dólares con un compromiso de pago durante un periodo de 6 meses para poner en marcha su proyecto y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Hermelinda will install a food stand in front of her house, where she will serve typical food so that the entire community can enjoy her wonderful cooking.

loans.name: Iraida Aurelia

texts.es:
Iraida has a five year old daughter. In order to provide for her better she decided to invest her savings and open a small shop in her home. Though it began very modestly, the shop has prospered thanks to Iraida's good cheer and patience. It is now one of the most popular shops in the neighborhood. With more customers, Iraida would like to expand the products she offers so she can better serve the community. She is asking to borrow $100 and promises to repay the loan in 6 months. Please help make Iraida's dream a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Iraida, es madre de una pequeña niña de 5 años y por el deseo innato de brindarle lo mejor, decide implementar con un monto pequeño que tenía como ahorro familiar, una bodeguita en su casa. A principio la bodeguita no parecía ser un negocio rentable pero, Iraida, con la amabilidad y paciencia que la caracteriza la convirtió en un a de las más visitadas.El número de clientes que tiene se ha ido incrementando y con ellos la demanda de más cantidad y variedad de productos por ello es que ha decidido acrecentar la cantidad de productos y servicios que ofrece en este pequeño espacio a su comunidad.A raíz de este hecho es que Iraida, solicita un préstamo de 100 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos es un lapso de 6 meses para iniciar la implementación y compra de productos para su pequeña tienda. Hagamos que el sueño de Iraida, se haga realidad con tu ayuda podremos lograrlo.

loans.use: To stock a grocery store with more varied merchandise.

loans.name: Yolla

texts.en: Yolla is a 42 year old woman living in the village of Lebaa in the South of Lebanon. She is multi-talented and creates different works on her own such as embroidery, chocolate packaging, painting, accessories and creation of faux-bijoux. Yolla lives with her sick mother and is the sole financial provider of the household. Yolla is an ambitious woman and very dynamic in the village community. With a couple of friends who are also micro-entrepreneurs and with the help of Al Majmoua, she has opened a small shop where they can exhibit and sell their products and handicraft work. Yolla is a group lending client.

loans.use: Yolla would like to purchase working capital for her embroidery, such as different kinds of yarn and fabric.

loans.name: Tamam

texts.en: Tamam A. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Fizuli region. She settled with her family in Baku city in 1993. She is 49 years old, married and has four children. She began her business with $400 loan from Normicro in 2002 and rented the place to use as bathroom for IDPs. The second time she borrowed $600 and she used it to buy bathroom tile and other equipment and did some renovation. The loans were paid back timely. Now, Tamam would like to receive $800 loan to buy a water pump for the bathroom. She thinks that this investment will increase her business turnover which eventually help her to improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: To buy a water pump.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Don Luis, as he's affectionately called in the neighborhood, continues to work in the woodworking shop he founded many years ago despite falling demand for his carefully handcrafted furniture. He is very hard-working and eager to do his best for his loyal customers but in order to continue making furniture he needs to replace his old tools and purchase wood. This woodworking shop is the only source of income for the family. Don Luis hopes to borrow $325 and promises to repay the loan in 6 months. He and his family thank you and eagerly await this loan.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Don Luis como cariñosamente lo llaman en el barrio desempeña su labor en una carpintería que construyó hace ya muchos años, a pesar de que la demanda por los artículos hechos a base del material que él moldea con sus ingeniosas manos, ha disminuido. Su ímpetu y clientes más antiguos siempre requieren de él.Las herramientas que adquirió años atrás; necesitan ser renovadas y también requiere mayor inversión en materia prima para seguir fabricando hermosos muebles a solicitud de sus clientes. El único ingreso familiar con el que cuenta día a día, se lo otorga su pequeña carpintería.Debido a ello Don Luis solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares que se compromete a retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses, con este dinero él podrá adquirir herramientas nuevas para seguir fabricando los magníficos muebles a los que están acostumbrados sus asiduos clientes. Él y su familia apelan a tu generoso corazón para recibir noticias pronto.

loans.use: To buy new woodworking tools and wood.

loans.name: Lucia Violeta

texts.es:
Lucia is a very enterprising woman. When her family's financial needs were not being met, she decided to open a business selling "puchero", a typical stewed dish from her town Huancayo. Starting with a small amount of her own savings, she began preparing puchero and selling it on the street. Many people enjoy Lucia's home cooking and she now has a loyal following. At this time Lucia would like to borrow $200 to buy a cart and some kitchen implements. This will make it easier for her to transport the stew so she can better serve her customers thereby increasing her family's income and quality of life. She promises to repay the loan in 6 months and thanks you in advance for your generosity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Lucía, es una mujer muy emprendedora que decidió iniciar su negocio con la venta del riquísimo plato típico de Huancayo, “el puchero”. Emprendió el desarrollo de esta actividad debido a que las necesidades primarias de su familia no estaban siendo cubiertas satisfactoriamente.Con un pequeño capital se dispuso a salir a las calles de su ciudad y poco a poco; gracias a su excelente sazón fue adquiriendo asiduos comensales. Actualmente su propósito es adquirir un carrito para mejorar las condiciones y desplazamiento de tan exquisito potaje y renovar sus utensilios de cocina para incrementar su calidad en la preparación. Por ello solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares a fin de llevar a cabo su propósito y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia con el ingreso monetario que genere la venta de comida, se compromete a retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses y por esta razón apela a sus generosos corazones.

loans.use: To buy a food service cart.

loans.name: Nazile

texts.en:
Nazile G. is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict zone, Lachin district. She settled with her family in Sumgait city in 1993. She is 43 years old, married and has two children. Nazile works with her husband and she began her business with $300 own capital in 1999. She used to have difficulty in covering her family's consumption needs for medication, clothes, school etc. 

Nazile first borrowed $300 from Normicro and with it she began to sell meat. The second time she borrowed $500 and she used it to rent a trade place to sell the meat. The loans were paid back timely. The third time she applied for a loan of $800 from Normicro and bought a work place. She expanded her business and increased the income of her business and improved her family's livelihood. 

Now, Nazile would like to receive a $1,000 loan in order to acquire 3 small calves and food for them. She thinks that this will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: Nazile would like to increase business in her butcher's shop.

loans.name: Maurelia

texts.es:
Maurelia has worked since she was a young girl. She has three school-age children and works hard to provide for them. When the family income wasn't enough to meet even their basic needs she took to selling candy on the streets of her hometown. Her dream is to be able to rent a small space and open a stand where she will feel safe and she can offer her customers a greater assortment of products. In order to achieve this she asking for a loan of $325 promising to repay the amount in 6 months. She eagerly awaits news that you have generously decided to help her fulfill this dream.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Maurelia, ha trabajado desde muy pequeña y su empeño y dedicación han hecho que pueda obtener una cantidad pequeña de capital, para invertirlo en su pequeño negocio. Ella tiene a tres pequeños niños en etapa escolar y su iniciativa de trabajo se generó por la insuficiencia del ingreso familiar para cubrir los gastos de primera necesidad de su familia. Desempeña esta labor en las calles de su ciudad natal y su anhelo es alquilar un pequeño local para ofrecer sus servicios desde un establecimiento fijo, de esta manera se sentiría más segura y procuraría a sus clientes mayor variedad y cantidad de artículos. Por esta razón ella solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Maurelia espera tu ayuda generosa para iniciar este proyecto.

loans.use: To rent a small space and open a stand selling sweets.

loans.name: Kifayet

texts.en: Kifayet M. is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict from the Gubadli region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. She is 32 years old and the mother of two children. Kifayet began her business with $400 in 2005. At first she was selling industry goods and earning little money. She has been busy with the mobile industry goods trade for 6 years. This money has been enough for only some of her family's basic needs. She has had difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school etc. Kifayet wants to improve her business by increasing the number of her clients and income. She needs $700 to expand  her goods assortment. She thinks that this expansion will improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Kifayet would like to expand her business selling mobile industry goods to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Patisepa

texts.en: Patisepa F. is 21 years and the mother of a three-year-old child. Initially Patisepa got her income from selling goods at s flea market, but now she has added ice cakes to her business as well. She says that it is a very successful business because of the hot weather. In fact, each day she runs out of ice cakes. She tries to make enough for a day, but still the demand from her customers is much more than she can produce with her current materials. Specifically she’s using a freezer that is too small. Patisepa sells her cakes for 70 cents, and due to the limited space in her freezer, she can only make 50 cakes a day. With a new refrigerator, which she hopes to buy with a loan, she will be able to stock more cakes and boost her daily income from $35 to $105 per day. She will use the loan to buy a new freezer and purchase more ingredients for her ice cakes.

loans.use: Buy a new freezer and ingredients for her ice cakes.

loans.name: Margot Rosalía

texts.es:
Margot lives with her husband and three children in Juliaca, a beautiful city in which they chose to settle for the sake of her husband's work. The need to provide for her childen and especially their education prompted Margot to open a wine shop. At first she sold within her circle of acquaintances but she soon found other customers and now supplies various local restaurants in addition to members of the community. Faced with growing demand Margot finds herself in need of more capital to increase her stock and expand her product line. She is asking for $650 and promises to repay the loan within 8 months. She is counting on your help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Margot, actualmente radica en Juliaca junto a su esposo y tres hijos, por motivos laborales del jefe de familia decidieron establecerse en esta bella ciudad y emprender sus proyectos juntos. Debido a las exigencias que genera la educación y manutención de sus tres pequeños hijos decide iniciar el negocio de la venta de vinos.Esta actividad en un principio la realizaba dentro de su entorno amical únicamente pero conforme iban comprando esta bebida iba incrementando también su demanda y recomendación.Ahora los ofrece a los restaurantes y demás pobladores de su comunidad. A raíz de este acontecimiento es que Margot se ve en la necesidad de incrementar su capital; para invertirlo en la compra de más variedad y cantidad de vinos a fin de copar la demanda de sus clientes satisfactoriamente. Su solicitud es por un monto de 650 dólares con un compromiso de pago por un período de 8 meses y para iniciar su proyecto desea contar con tu ayuda.

loans.use: To expand the product line of her wine shop.

loans.name: Losi

texts.en:
It’s hard to keep a plantation growing when you don’t have the tools and the right supplies to assist it. Losi M. of Faleasiu is experiencing this, and for her to make it happen; she has asked for a loan amount of $300 to facilitate her plantation.

Losi's husband is a security guard and his income can not cover all the family's expenses. With any luck, borrowing this amount of money from SPBD will help Losi and her husband take better care of their plantation. This in return can provide them with good supplies for the consumers and also alow them to have a good turnover to support the family.

loans.use: Buy tools, chemicals, and weed killer

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde learned the craft of weaving as a small girl. With the help of her family she mounted a small workshop in her home where she makes sweaters, ponchos, and caps. She and her husband sell the work on Sundays and Mondays at a small stand at the Laguna Temporal market in Juliaca and with the income provide for their two small children ages 8 and 12. The children even lend a hand with the family business on top of attending school every day. The family is proud to report that five other people are employed in the shop, this in a country facing problems of unemployment. The hours are long and the work sometimes tedious but the workers are upbeat and grateful for the opportunity to provide for their families. Matilde's dream is to raise the quality of her work such that she can export her garments and make the shop a prominent employer in her city. She is asking for a loan of $650 and promises to repay the sum within 6 months. Matilde and her family are counting on your generosity to help this dream become a reality.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Matilde, gracias al oficio que aprendió desde muy niña y con ayuda de su familia; construyó en el interior de su vivienda una pequeña fábrica de artesanía dónde confecciona chompas, ponchos, chalinas y gorras; con el ingreso que obtiene por la venta de estos productos, que los ofrece en compañía de su esposo los días domingos y lunes en un pequeño puesto del mercado “Laguna Temporal”de Juliaca; mantiene su hogar y cubre las necesidades de sus dos pequeños niños de 8 y 12 años quienes también ayudan con el trabajo diario de sus padres además de asistir diariamente a la escuela. A través de esta actividad también les otorga trabajo a 5 personas y de esta manera contribuye a disminuir la tasa de desempleo en nuestro país. Hay días que el trabajo es arduo y cansado pero su espíritu optimista y deseos de progreso la impulsan a luchar día a día por el bienestar de los suyos. El anhelo de Matilde es mejorar la calidad de sus productos para poder exportarlos a otros países y convertirse en un foco de empleo dentro de su ciudad. Debido a ello solicita un préstamo de 650 dólares que se compromete a pagarlos en 6 meses. Por esta razón recurre a sus corazones generosos a fin de reunir la cantidad solicitada y poner en marcha su sueño

loans.use: To expand a home weaving shop employing 5 people.

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en:
Sefulu L.’s family is one of those families evolving out of deep poverty with no proper house as yet. She joined us last month and she is one of the ladies who really needs our help. With no access to loans from other banks, Sefulu is using every opportunity to support the SPBD programme which is her only hope of getting credit to improve her micro-business prospects.

As you can see in the picture, Sefulu’s cabbages will soon be ready to be picked and brought to the market, at which point she must have more under cultivation. She has three kids who are not yet in school, and she is dealing with feeding and taking care of them.

Sefulu is hard-working and she is willing to extend and improve her business in the future for more income for her family.

loans.use: Buy cabbage seeds, spades, knives and a crowbar

loans.name: Mataniu

texts.en: Instead of planting taro as most women do, Mataniu prefers to grow taamu (a bigger rootcrop) instead. She is requesting her first loan of $300 and this loan will be spent on supplies for her plantation. She is one of our new members and she is about to supply her products to the market.  Mataniu is a hard-working lady and she is willing to extend her business in the future so that she will earn more. She has only got one son working but she clearly explained that the money she is expecting to get from her business will help to pay for the things she has never been able to do before. She is honest about repaying the loan and she is looking forward to continuing to get loans from SPBD.

loans.use: Buy weed killer and also other chemicals and fertilizers for her plantation

loans.name: Hana

texts.en: Hana M. is a new member of the programme who just joined in the last month. This lady already has the skills needed for her agriculture business.  She has an existing vegetable garden which earns her a living of about $100 per week.    She has been unemployed for several months but now she realised that by expanding her vegetable garden she can earn more than the salary she used to get when she was employed.  With a little loan of $300 she expects  to earn an additional $100 per week.

loans.use: Buy cabbage seeds, knives, spades and other tools for her business

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastacio A. is 41 years old. He comes from the Roque Gonzalez city (a city next to Carapegua). He is married to Mrs. Estela Duare and have three children. Together they have a pantry where both of them work at. They started it by buying coal at wholesale and packing it in smaller bags to sell to the public. They used a bicycle to distribute it throughout the town. That's how they built capital to open a small warehouse.

After some time he had a tough experience, one of his children got sick and he almost lost everything. He had a house and his own lot but due to the medical expenses that he carried and overwhelm by the situation, he had to sell both. His wife had to travel to Argentina to work as a domestic employee (maid) because it was the only solution for them at that moment.

Today their quality of life has improve due to the fact that all of their children have a career and in this way they contribute to the well-being of the family. Today they have establish their warehouse out of their home and they sell all kinds of staple groceries. The loan is for buying sugar, herbs, noodles, bread, and milk to supply their pantry.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer>

Anastacio A. tiene 41 años es de la ciudad de Roque González (ciudad aledaña a Carapeguá) está casado con la señora Estela Duarte y tienen tres hijos. Tienen una despensa que junto con su esposa llevan adelante, se han iniciado comprando carbón por cantidad y empaquetando en bolsas pequeñas, tenía una bicicleta y lo distribuía por el barrio así se hizo de capital y se animó a abrir un pequeño almacén. Tiempo después tuvo una dura experiencia, se enfermó su hijo y perdió casi todo. El tenía casa y terreno propio, pero debido a los gastos que acarreaba la enfermedad de su hijo y agobiado por la situación los vendió. Su esposa tuvo que viajar a la Argentina a trabajar como empleada doméstica porque era la única salida que encontró en ese momento. Hoy día su nivel de vida mejoró ya que sus hijos tienen profesión y de esta manera colaboran con el sustento de la familia. Hoy tienen ya establecido su almacén en su casa y vende todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad. El crédito es para compra de azúcar, yerba, fideo, pan, leche.

loans.use: Buying groceries like: sugar, noodles, milk , bread, and herbs to supply his pantry.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
Angelina B. is 43 years old and lives in the Tajy Loma de Carapegua community. She is married to Mr. Calixto Rodriguez and they have two children that actually are attending college. She weaves artisan quilts and on the weekends she goes door to door selling them with the help of her husband.

Since young, she has dedicated herself to this activity which she learned from her mother. She comes from a humble family that due to their sacrifices was able to improve her quality of life. Due to low sales of crafts at one point, they had the opportunity to travel to Argentina to look for work. Over there Angelina worked as a domestic employee (maid) and her husband worked as a bricklayer.

After some time they were able to save a good capital and had the opportunity to go back to their country to dedicate themselves again to their commercial activity. The loan that they are applying for will be used to buy yarn for weaving.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Angelina B. tiene 43 años, vive en la compañía Tajy Loma de Carapeguá, está casada con el señor Calixto Rodríguez tienen dos hijos que actualmente están cursando sus estudios universitarios. Ella es tejedora de sobrecamas artesanales y los fines de semana junto con su marido realizan la venta ambulante (casa por casa). Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a esta actividad ya que lo ha aprendido de su madre. Proviene de una familia humilde que gracias a su sacrificio logró mejorar su calidad de vida. Debido a la poca venta de artesanía, en una oportunidad tuvieron que viajar a la Argentina en busca de trabajo, allí la señora trabajó como empleada doméstica y el señor como albañil, luego de un tiempo lograron reunir un buen capital y tuvieron la oportunidad de regresar al país para dedicarse nuevamente a su actividad comercial. El crédito que solicita lo utilizará para la compra de hilos.

loans.use: Buying weaving yarn.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Mr. Concepcion C. is 61 years old and single. He doesn't have any children and he has been a merchant most of his life. Since his young age, he has dedicated himself to business. He is an only child and has always been enthusiastic about work and dedicated to support his motther who is bedriddendue to an incurable disease.

He is very active and has a pantry and a small butcher shop. His customers loved him because he is very kind and helpful. Concepcion remembers that the most diffcult moment that he has to go through was when his mom was diagnosed with this disease. Since he was her only child, Concepcion had to close his business temporarily to be able to be with his mom during these difficult and hard times.

It got to the point that he almost liquidated his business until a friend lend him a hand and offer him capital to start his business again. He took advantage of that opportunity and thanks to his efforts, he raised his business again. Today, his pantry is well supllied and is the only one on the zone that he lives. The loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil, and flour to sell at his pantry.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Concepción C. tiene 61 años es soltero de profesión comerciante y sin hijos. Desde temprana edad se dedicó a los negocios ya que es hijo único y se ha esmerado siempre en trabajar y mantener a su madre ya que ella está en cama por padecer de una enfermedad incurable. Es muy activo tiene una despensa y una pequeña carnicería es muy querido por sus clientes ya que es muy amable y servicial. Recuerda Concepción que el momento más difícil que tuvo que atravesar fue cuando su manifestó la enfermedad de su madre y él como era único tuvo que cerrar por un tiempo su negocio para poder acompañarla ,fueron momentos muy duros ; llegó al punto de casi liquidar su negocio hasta que un amigo le tendió la mano y le ofreció capital para volver a iniciar su negocio fue así como aprovechó ese momento y gracias a su esfuerzo levantó cabeza y hoy día su despensa es bien surtida y es la única en esa zona. El destino del crédito es para compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite , harina.

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar, oil, and flour to supply his grocery/pantry business.

loans.name: Ape

texts.en: Ape S. is one of the members of Aleisa A center. Her business as mentioned above is growing vegetables such as cabbages, beans, spring onions, green pepper and cucumbers. Ape is one of the old ladies in this center and she is a hard working lady. This family also has no one working but all relies on the vegetables for survival. One thing good about this lady is that she is supplying one of the supermarkets in town name Lynn’s supermarket.

loans.use: Buy seeds, fertilizers but especially for the equipments needed

loans.name: Ana Fati

texts.en: Aleisa is one of the most productive lands on the south west of Upolu Island. This special part of the island where  vegetables  and flower are grown. Ana Fati W. is one of the SPBD members that uses and make use of these lands. Ana’s family contains of seven members altogether. She got only one son who is not working and only one daughter who is mentally retarded. There is no one of the family working, the husband also not working and no other source of income for her and the family. Ana being a sixty seven year old woman stands out if you look at her environment. This is her business, she grows vegetables such as cabbages, spring onions and also a variety of flower plants that surrounded and decorates the appearance of the small unpretty house. Her sale for the week is $170 but if the supplies increase then sales also gets up to $250 a week for both flowers and vegetables. She is one of the very successful business women and her dream is a market overseas for her products.

loans.use: To buy timber and roofing to improve her green house for her flower business and additional gardening equipment.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma P. is a selfless hard-working mother with high hopes of providing a better life for her two small daughters, ages 6 and 9. She's determined to put behind her the painful memory of when her husband left her when she was pregnant with her youngest daughter, leaving Norma without any support. This act did not deter her, and she decided to consolidate the haberdashery she started some years back, selling items like pins, needles, elastic and dyes. She has now been in business 10 years, selling products in her city's streets. Norma’s goal is to increase her stock with a wider variety of products to offer to not only her clients in the city but also to new customers living in small towns in the outskirts. In this way she will generate more income and be able to improve the quality of life of her two daughters. Her day begins at 4:30 a.m., when she prepares Jennifer and Cinthya's meals for when they return from school, cleans the home and makes preparations for when she goes to work.

Norma is requesting a loan of $150, which she plans to repay within six months. This will help her purchase higher-quality products and offer a wider selection to her customers, fulfilling her goal. Norma is waiting for your support and friendly hand.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Normita P., es una madre trabajadora y abnegada con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a sus dos menores hijas de 6 y 9 años; ávida de olvidar un penoso episodio que le causó mucho dolor ,hace años atrás, cuando esperaba la llegada de su última niña; su esposo decidió abandonar su hogar y dejarlas sin ningún amparo. Este hecho no hizo que Norma se amilanara y decidió consolidar el pequeño negocio que había emprendido hace ya varios años atrás, la venta de mercería (pasadores, agujas, cintas de elástico, tintes para ropa, ganchos para ropa, peines, etc.). Actualmente lleva realizando esta actividad 10 años de forma ambulatoria en las calles de la ciudad donde reside desde muy temprano y su deseo es adquirir mayor cantidad de artículos para tener un stock más amplio y variado para ofrecérselos no sólo a sus clientes citadinos sino también a sus nuevos clientes que habitan los pueblitos aledaños a su localidad. De esta manera generará mayores ingresos y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dos pequeñas niñas.Sus actividades las inicia desde las 4.30 am.con la preparación de los alimentos que consumirán Jennifer y Cinthya, cuando retornen de la escuela, la limpieza de su hogar y los preparativos de las cosas que llevará con ella para ofrecérselos a sus clientes. Su solicitud es por la suma de 150 dólares con un compromiso de pago de 6 meses, que la ayudarán a tener mayor cantidad y variedad de productos para iniciar el cumplimiento de su meta. Ayudémosla juntos, Norma espera de tu apoyo y mano amiga.

loans.use: Purchase more and better products for her haberdashery to increase her sales radius and help her provide a better life for her children.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela B. is a young, optimistic and hard-working mother of three. She is determined to contribute to her family's income. A little while back, after welcoming the newest member to her household, she decided to start a business selling sandwiches in a spot she set up in her home. Little by little, she become better known, thanks to her excellent seasoning and patience to make works of art in the kitchen, and demand has grown. With the help of her husband and her savings, they set up the shop together, but they are still dealing with a very small space. This activity has brought much joy to Manuela and also her family. Her goal is to convert this small shop into a restaurant where she'll be able to offer not only typical dishes but also make the varied requests from her customers.

Manuela is requesting a loan of $650, which she plans to repay with eight months. This will help her improve her business and also allow her to hire six people and in this way help diminish the high rate of unemployment in her city. She appeals to generous hearts to help her achieve her goal of having a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Manuela B., es una joven madre D. 3 niños, optimista y trabajadora ávida D. contribuir con el ingreso familiar. Hace poco tiempo y con la llegada D. un miembro más a su hogar decidió iniciar el negocio D. la venta D. sándwiches en un espacio que acondicionó en su vivienda. Para contribuir activamente con la responsabilidad D. su esposo.Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida, debido a la excelente sazón y paciencia que posee para hacer D. la cocina un arte y la demanda se fue incrementando. Con ayuda D. su esposo y sus ahorros fue acondicionando el lugar pero aún así se fue convirtiendo cada vez en un espacio muy pequeño. Esta actividad le ha generado muchas satisfacciones a Manuela y también a su familia. Por ello su deseo es convertir ese pequeño espacio en un restaurante dónD. podrá ofrecer no sólo los potajes acostumbrados sino también las variadas solicitudes D. sus clientes. El pedido D. Manuela es por la suma D. 650 dólares que se compromete a pagarlo en un período D. 8 meses, con este préstamo además D. obtener beneficios personales también podrá otorgarles trabajo a 6 personas más y D. esta manera contribuirá a disminuir la tasa D. desocupación en su ciudad,Manuela, apela a sus corazones generosos para emprender la carrera hacia su meta.

loans.use: The best small eatery in Juliaca wants to build a restaurant in the city to satisfy the growing demand from their diners.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
About three years ago, Lourdes decided to open up a small convenience store with the hope of contributing to and improving her household's income. After a lot of effort and countless hours of work, she began offering other services to meet the demands of her clientele. Inside her shop she set up a small number of computers to provide Internet service, and she also has a photocopier and pay phones so her clients can communicate from her shop to any part of the world. Due to the fact that there is insufficient space and there is a large amount of affluence in her neighborhood, Lourdes wishes to increase the number of computers and the size of her shop to make it more serviceable for her customers. For this reason, she's requesting a loan of $275, which she plans to repay within six months. Her objective is to increase her income and provide a better education and quality of life to her children. She and her family await your quick response.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hace aproximadamente 3 años Lourdes decidió abrir una pequeña tienda de venta de abarrotes, con el deseo de contribuir y mejorar el ingreso económico de su hogar. Después de mucho esfuerzo y horas interminables de trabajo fueron ofreciendo también otros servicios atendiendo la demanda de su exigente clientela. Dentro de las instalaciones de la tienda ha acondicionado un número pequeño de computadoras para ofrecer el servicio de internet, además de una fotocopiadora y teléfonos monederos para que los clientes hagan uso de estas herramientas y puedan comunicarse desde ese lugar a cualquier parte del mundo. Debido a que no existe espacio suficiente y hay mayor cantidad de afluencia pública a su local, Lourdes, desea ampliar el número de computadoras y el espacio para brindarles mayor comodidad a sus clientes.Por esta razón solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en 6 meses, y el objetivo de incrementar sus ingresos, mejorar la educación y calidad de vida de sus hijos. Lourdes y su familia esperan tu pronta respuesta.

loans.use: Lourdes wants to increase the size of her convenience store and add more computers to provide more services and comfort to her demanding customers.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Ever since she was very young Rosa María has had an immense passion for dressmaking. She learned the trade at a young age, and set up her small shop in her home after having her first baby, who now works with her. Her quality of work, kindness and knowledge of the craft has made her one of the most wanted and requested seamstresses. She decided to repair one of her sowing machines and give it to her eldest daughter so that she could learn this trade alongside her mother. Demand for her dressmaking, especially on the higher end, has increased, and for this reason Rosa María wishes to acquire a semi-industrial sewing machine and another standard sewing machine to easily satisfy her clients' requests. For this, Rosa María is requesting a loan of $325, which she plans to repay within six months, with the goal of starting a small business of high-end dressmaking with the help of her daughter. Rosa María is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa María, desde muy niña posee un inmenso amor por la confección de prendas. Gracias a esta vocación desde muy joven; luego de tener su primer bebé inicio el acondicionamiento de un pequeño taller en las instalaciones de su hogar. Su calidez, amabilidad y conocimiento la han convertido en una de las más queridas y solicitadas.Hace poco y observando las inconveniencias por las que atravesaba la familia de su hija mayor decidió reparar una de sus máquinas y regalársela para que también desarrolle esta actividad junto a ella. La demanda de más y mejor confección de prendas se ha incrementado y por esta razón el deseo de Rosa María es adquirir una remalladora semi industrial y una máquina de coser para satisfacer sin dificultad la solicitud de sus clientas. Debido a ello es que solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses con el propósito de iniciar una mini empresa de alta costura con ayuda de su hija en las instalaciones de su hogar.Rosa María, aprecia y agradece tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase a semi-industrial sewing machine and a standard one to realize the dream of having a small business of high-end dressmaking in her city.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
"I have unfinished construction and I need to build another room as welll as put up a fence for protection. It has been a little difficult for me due to the lack of money, but I am working a lot to earn it and increase my quality of life." I am requesting $1000 to make another room and build a protective fence.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar y necesito hacer otro cuarto así como poner una barda y las protecciones, me ha sido un poco difícil por falta de dinero pero estoy trabajando mucho para lograrlo y ampliar más mi vivienda” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para hacer otro cuarto, poner una barda y protecciones,.

loans.use: Construct a room and a security fence.

loans.name: Faleupolu

texts.en:
Faleupolu S.’s business is a taro plantation and a fruit farm. Faleupolu is now fifty-five and used to be very bad at counting money. This problem delayed her intention of wanting to start a small business. She has six children who were all raised and supported on her husband’s income of $16 a day from his work. Apart from his work, he also does fishing for extra earning for his children’s school fees. Two of their children have now graduated and are employed in Government Departments.

When Faleupolu actually joined our program, we took extra time to really teach her how to run a business and handle cash. She is now handling her business alone without any help, and is aiming for future improvement in their family business.

loans.use: Buy materials for home improvement and fertilizers for her vegetables

loans.name: Faautu

texts.en:
Faautu is a 48-year-old mother of six children from the village of Matatufu. Her business is selling fresh flowers. She has paid off her previous loan and is now requesting her next loan, planning to use it to pay her daughter's school fees and buy more flower seeds and fertilizer.

Faautu is really excited and is interested to stay with our program because she is now holding cash that she never did before. Fortunately, she is smart enough to save up some of her income for bad days, because she believes that not all days are good, but it’s good to save now, so that when bad days come, she will be well prepared for them.

loans.use: Pay her daughter’s school fees and buy more flower seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Seiaute

texts.en:
Seiaute T. is a married woman with six children. Her husband who works as a cleaner at a nearby hotel used to run a village shop but the income was not enough to put their children through school and put food on the table for their family.
