The first loan Seiaute took out only covered her for a few months and now she has made a request for US$ 900 to add more stock of different varieties to suit the consumers' needs which can only result in profit that will allow her to better provide for her family.

Seiaute explains that her business is improving slowly due to competition in her village; she tries her best to offer the best price to her village and good service so that her business will grow for the future.

loans.use: Restock her shop

loans.name: Maria Del Refugio

texts.es:
Maria is married and her husband helps with her business. Her daughter lives in the USA and Maria looks after her young granddaughter. Due to this and because of her age, Maria could not find a job, and so decided to start her own business. She started off selling soft drinks and some snacks from home. The shop has been steadily growing thanks to the small amount of capital with which she started and the effort and help of her husband. They started 10 years ago, but they wish to continue until their granddaughter is older so that they can give her a good education and better quality of life.

Maria would like a loan of $1100 to buy merchandise so that she can have a larger variety of products to offer her clients. She will repay this loan in 6 months. Maria and her family thank you for the support that you can offer them to help them, especially their granddaughter.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

María es una mujer casada y su esposo la ayuda en el negocio, su hija se fue a vivir a los Estados Unidos de Norte América y le dejo a su pequeña hijita, por lo que se quedo a cargo de su nieta y por ello y por su edad ya no le daban empleo por ello es que decidió poner su propio negocio empezando a vender refrescos y algunos abarrotes en su casa. Ella con el pequeño capital que empezó fue surtiendo poco a poco su tienda y crecer con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de su esposo, fue ya hace 10 años que tiene su negocio pero desea continuar creciendo ya que su nieta está más grande y desea poder brindarle educación y mejorar su calidad de vida.

María esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 1,100 para comprar mercadería y poder tener mayor surtido de productos que le solicitan sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le brindas para poder sacar adelante a su familia en especial a su nieta.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Comprar mercaderia

loans.name: Raul

texts.es:
Raul is married with 4 kids and his wife does the domestic chores and takes care of the kids. He started off working in a hardware store as an employee and he learnt how to run the business. For this reason, three years ago he decided to start his own hardware store. His business has steadily grown and this has allowed him to support his family, in particular his kids, 3 of which are still school age.

Raul would like a loan of $925 which he will pay back in 6 months. He will use this loan to buy merchandise for his store so that it will grow and he can achieve his goals. He would also like to attract more clients this way, and he would like his store to craete more jobs in the future too. He and his family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Raúl esta casado y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y cuidar a sus pequeños hijos. Él empezó trabajando en una ferretería como empleado y aprendió como se maneja el negocio y quiso también poder tener su negocio propio, fue así que decidió poner un negocio de ferretería con la cual ya tiene tres años. Poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su negocio y así ha podido mantener a su familia pero quiere continuar creciendo con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos que son pequeños y están 3 de ellos en edad escolar.

Raúl solicita un préstamo por US $ 925 a 6 meses para pagar, utilizando este préstamo para comprar mercadería para su negocio y hacerlo crecer para poder lograr sus metas, y así también captar más clientes y hacer de su negocio algo que en un futuro genere mayores empleos, él y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que les das.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Comprar mercancia

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia is married with 3 kids of 12, 14 and 16 years of age. Her husband is a salesman and she used to live off his salary too. However, when their kids started to grow so did their expenditure and there was not enough money. Claudia therefore decided to sell her kids old clothes, and when she saw that it was a good business idea she started to sell new and used clothes, and this is how her business started. She now only sells new clothes and specialzes in women's and kids' clothing. She is very hard-working and would like her business to grow to improve her family's quality of life.

Claudia would like a loan of $750 to buy more merchandise and to start selling men's clothes in order to obtain more clients and to earn more. She could therefore give her children a better education and a better life. She will repay the loan in 4 months. Her and her family thank you for your support so that her business can continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Claudia es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijos de 12, 14 y 16 años de edad respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como vendedor y ella vivía del sueldo de su esposo pero como ellos fueron creciendo los gastos también y no les alcanzaba por ello decidió vender la ropa que dejaban sus hijos, empezando así a vender ropa usada y vio que era un buen negocio y así fue como comenzó con su negocio, poco a poco fue vendiendo poca ropa nueva y actualmente ella solo vende ropa nueva y se especializó en ropa para damas y niños, ella desea hacer crecer su negocio y continuar mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora.

Claudia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 750 para surtir de más mercadería e incursionar en la venta de ropa para caballero y así ampliar su mercado y clientes, para mejorar sus ingresos y lograr brindarles a sus hijos educación y una mejor calidad de vida, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 4 meses, y junto con su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para poder continuar y crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercaderia

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is married and his wife is a saleswoman. They have 2 kids of 4 and 2 years of age. He started his own business selling clothes from home and as it went very well he was able to open a small shop to continue his business. he would like to improve it so that he can give his family a better quality of life and so that he can be a successful entrepreneur.

Antonio would like a loan of $650 to buy more merchandise for his shop so that he can win more clients. He will pay it back in 6 months. Antonio and his family thank you for your support which will enable his business to keep going and grow.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Antonio es un hombre casado y su esposa es comerciante, ellos tienen 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad respectivamente, él inicio con su negocio vendiendo ropa fuera de su casa y luego con sus ventas que fueron mejorando pudo abrir un local pequeño para continuar con su negocio el cual quiere mejorarlo y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y tener un negocio que le permita ser un emprendedor de éxito.

Antonio está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 650 para surtir de más mercadería su negocio y poder tener una mayor clientela, él ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Antonio y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para poder continuar y crecer con su negocio

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Comprar mercaderia

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
38-year-old Merita is a mother of three and wife of a small farm owner. She owns a handicraft flea market where she sells Samoan handicrafts in a variety of styles and designs. Handicrafts all start from knowledge of the land and people and that’s what attracts so many outsiders to such beautiful art work.

Merita works hand-in-hand with her husband in supporting their family. She has requested a loan of US$ 900 in order to purchase more handicrafts, fabric materials, glue sticks and needles. The profit from her handicraft flea market goes towards paying school fees, household bills and especially toward her weekly loan repayments. In future, Merita hopes to look for an overseas market for her products, so that she can expand her sales to overseas countries.

loans.use: Buy more Samoan handicrafts

loans.name: Senerita

texts.en: Senerita is a married woman of 53. She has 8 children, 4 schooling, 4 working. Senerita is also the Centre chief for Samalaeulu Centre. She has been doing sewing all her adult life, and from her sewing she has been able to send her children to school and assist in supporting her family. With four working children, she's very glad that she has been able to do a lot to support her family and develop their standard of living.

loans.use: To assist with her sewing business

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete is a widow of 51. Her husband passed away a year ago and so she's living with her parents and one child. Supporting her family has been a hard task for Pelenatete, especially since she had not been working outside her home to support her child before her husband died.

Pelenatete decided to join SPBD and with her first loan she bought herself a sewing machine. She's planning to develop her sewing business into a bigger one, and hopefully, to display her own designs and fashions in future.

loans.use: To expand her newly started sewing business

loans.name: Thi Cuc

texts.vi:
D. Thi Cuc is 40 years old and has been a participating member of the “Quy Tinh Thuong” since 3/1999. Together with her husband, Le Van Sy, they own a company that manufactures wood products at Bac Phu state, Soc son district, Ha Noi. During the eight years participating in the program, her family always borrowed the maximum amount to invest in the manufacturing of beds, chairs, tables, dressers, things that every family must have. Her family receives a monthly income of about $310 from this business which has been in operation for 11 years. It has 4 employees, each earning $75/month. In addition to working on the orders received the company also cuts woods for other companies in the area.

She is requesting for a loan of $1200 to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Hien Lam, Kive volunteer.

Chị Đàm Thị Cúc, 40 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ tháng 3/1999. Chị cùng với chồng là anh Lê Văn Sỹ là chủ một cơ sở sản xuất đồ gỗ tại xã Bắc Phú, huyện Sóc Sơn, Hà Nội. Trong 8 năm tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương gia đình chị luôn vay mức vốn cao nhất để đầu tư vào việc đóng giường, tủ, bàn ghế … những vật dụng không thể thiếu được trong mỗi gia đình. Thu nhập từ hoạt động này mang lại cho gia đình chị bình quân mỗi tháng 310 USD. Hiện tại cơ sở sản xuất của anh chị đã hoạt động được 11 năm và có 4 công nhân làm việc với mức lương 75 USD/tháng. Ngoài việc sản xuất theo đơn đặt hàng anh chị còn nhận làm thêm dịch vụ xẻ gỗ thuê cho các cơ sở khác. Gia đình chị đang muốn vay thêm 1200 USD để mở rộng sản xuất.

loans.use: buy wood to make bed, table, wardrobe ...

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia's husband has been a fisherman all his life. This has been the family's main source of income. Malia is married with 7 children. Having a big family brings a lot of responsibilities. The hardest part for her is to pay for her children's education.

Malia decided to join SPBD because she wanted to buy some more equipment for their fishing business. Malia is planning to have a fishing boat in future and to own more equipment to help them so that it will make the work easier.

loans.use: To assist in developing their fishing micro-business

loans.name: Tutoatasi M.

texts.en:
Tutoatasi is 47 years of age and came from a family of 12 brothers and 1 sister. She is married with 3 children herself. Having a lot experience in elei printing, she decided to join SPBD because she thought by having a business of her own, she would be able to earn money for herself and her family.

With her first loan, Tutoatasi managed to buy the materials and elei paints needed for start-up. She's hoping that in future she will manage to own a flea market stall where she could display all her creations, especially her own designs.

loans.use: To start with her elei business

loans.name: Thi Kim

texts.vi:
Being an active business woman, D. thi Kim, 37 years old, always captures the need of people in her area. She invested the first loan of $200 in a fruit stand and sell to the people in her district. In 2005, when the local construction project expanded, she and her husband opened a metal company to manufacture conveying belt for sand. Thus, the manual workers can be freed to work in companies that produce construction materials such as pebbles, sand. Actually, her metal company located at Trung Gia state, Soc Son district, Ha Noi, has attracted many customers in the local and neighboring areas. The business has provided stable employment and high compensation for 6 workers each earning $95/month. She is requesting for a loan of $1200 to invest in the metal manufacturing company.

Translated by HienLam, Kiva volunteer.

Là một người phụ nữ năng động trong kinh doanh, chị Đỗ Thị Kim, 37 tuổi, luôn nắm bắt được nhu cầu của người dân trong vùng. Khi được vay số tiền 200 USD ở vòng vốn đầu tiên, chị đầu tư buôn nhiều loại hoa quả tươi để phục vụ cho mọi nhu cầu sinh hoạt của người dân trong thôn, xã. Năm 2005, khi việc xây dựng tại địa phương phát triển, chị đã bàn với chồng vay thêm vốn để mở xưởng cơ khí sản xuất băng chuyền vận tải cát, giải phóng sức lao động thủ công cho những lao động làm thuê cho các chủ kinh doanh cát, sỏi vật liệu xây dựng. Hiện tại xưởng cơ khí của gia đình chị tại xã Trung Giã huyện Sóc Sơn đã thu hút được nhiều khách hàng trong vùng và các địa phương lân cận. Xưởng luôn tạo việc làm ổn định và trả lương cao cho 6 lao động (95USD/tháng cho 1 lao động). Hiện tại chị muốn vay thêm 1200 USD để đầu tư cho xưởng cơ khí.

loans.use: to invest in the metal manufacturing company

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: Lili is 35 and married with 2 children. Her husband's income every fortnight is not sufficient to support their family. Lili has decided to do something herself about this situation. She has joined SPBD with the intention of getting financial assistance so as to better be able to supply her family's needs in future. She's very appreciative of  the support; she's planning to start up a take-away fast food stall in her town area.

loans.use: To start up a small business

loans.name: Vaivasa

texts.en: Coming from a tailoring background, Vaivasa, aged 57, decided to join SPBD. She has two children, ages 13 and 15. Her husband died 5 years ago, and since then it has been hard for her to raise her children. Vaivasa had been sewing all her life, and from her first loan she was able to buy herself a sewing machine. With the help of her family, she's planning to build a spare room especially for her sewing business beside their home .

loans.use: To start up a sewing business

loans.name: Tasileta

texts.en: Tasileta is married and is 42 years of age. She has 2 children and three adopted children. Tasileta's husband is a farmer, and they have been in business for a long time. Tasileta decided to join SPBD because her husband wanted to have a plantation of their own. They moved away from their family owned plantation, and developed their own plantation. Her first loan she used to buy a back sprayer and some farm equipment, and they developed the plantation well. In the future, they plan to develop their plantation and to help it grow bigger.

loans.use: To assist with the family's plantation.

loans.name: Ioana

texts.en: Ioana just got married recently, and she is 28 years of age with one child. Her family lives on a taro plantation, and this is their main source of income. Since her father passed away 5 months ago, it left a lot of responsibilities on them. Ioana and her husband took over the plantation, and her first loan she used to buy some equipment like a back sprayer, fertilizers, a spade, etc. Ioana has no problem looking after their family, and at the moment she's planning to build a small market in front of her home where she can sell her taros and some other fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To assist with the family's plantation.

loans.name: Maliumai

texts.en: Maliumai is married with 5 children. She's living with her relatives and her elderly mother. Her father, unfortunately, became very ill and could not work anymore. Maliumai was always interested in a vegetable garden, so she stepped in to continue. Her first loan she used to buy some fertilizers, chemicals, and to pay for the laborers to help clear the area. She's very pleased with the help given, and she also plans to have a table in the new market to sell her vegetables.

loans.use: To assist with her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Auteletoa

texts.en: Auteletoa is a married woman of 28 years of age. They have had their shop for a long time, and she decided to join SPBD. Her intention is to buy more goods for her shop, because this is the only shop in this area. Auteletoa's shop used to be run by her mother, but unfortunately she's very old and it was hard for her to look after the shop day and night. Auteletoa's first loan she used to buy many things to fill the shelves, and with the help of her husband she managed to grow their business. In the future, Auteletoa is planning to expand the size of her shop and to increase the amount of goods sold each day.

loans.use: To assist with her business

loans.name: Gogosina

texts.en: Gogosina is 37 years of age and married with 5 children. Her parents run a small retail shop in the village. About a year ago, Gogosina's father passed away, and left her with her mother and two grown-up sisters. She's looking after the shop, which is why she decided to join SPBD. With the help of SPBD she managed to expand her shop, and she managed to sell enough goods. Some of the women in the village are using Gogo's shop, as she is known, to display their goods, for example, cabbage, beans, coconuts, etc.

loans.use: To assist with the family's shop

loans.name: Ruhadiyah

texts.id:
Ruhadiyah and her husband, Sunarto is in the business of buying to be recycled (junk) products to be sold to the Recycler. They live with one of their daughters, Suniarti who is 12 years old, but could not afford to go to school. They live in a rented room, for which they pay Rp 140,000.00 (about US$15)/month. Every day the left at 6:00AM with their push cart, which also function as storage for the to be recycled products (more like trash condition) they bought on the route they found. Everyday they push the cart and buy junk goods for about 2 km, by walking, and for that every day they could profit about Rp 50,000 (about $6), and that money is used to pay for daily expenses. Their hope was for a better life, their children could go to school, and live in their own house.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ruhadiyah bersama dengan suaminya, Sunarto, menjalankan usaha membeli barang-barang rongsokan untuk dijual ke pengepul. Mereka tinggal bersama serorang putri mereka, Sumiati yang berumur 12 tahun namun tidak sekolah. Mereka tinggal di kos-kosan yang dikontrak dengan membayar Rp 140.000,00/ bulannya. Setiap hari mereka berangkat jam 6 pagi dengan menggunakan gerobak yang berfungsi sebagai tempat barang-barang rongsokan yang mereka beli di setiap perjalanan yang mereka temui. Setiap hari mereka berkeliling menempuh jarak kurang lebih 2 kilo meter dengan berjalan kaki dan setiap harinya mereka bias menghasilkan keuntungan Rp 50.000,00. yang nantinya dari uang tersebut akan dipakai untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari. Harapan mereka adalah kehidupan yang lebih baik. Anak mereka bisa bersekolah dan memiliki rumah sendiri.

loans.use:
To buy to be recycled (junk) products and repair push cart

Membeli barang-barang rongsokan dan memperbaiki gerobak

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
At 45, Siti is still in her 5 year old business which is making wet cakes and sell it. From 03:00 AM Siti started to process the ingredients she bought , so that by sunrise all cakes are ready to be marketed. Those cakes are delivered by Siti to food stalls, and other customers who work with Siti. Siti profitted about RP50,000 ($6)/daily from her business. That profit are used to pay for daily expenses, and some savings for unexpected needs. Siti lives with her husband Abdullah by renting a room for Rp120,000(about $13)/month. In that room Siti processed and market her cakes. From her expertise Siti raised 3 children. Her hope is to move to her own house and to expand her business as her hopes for the future.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Diusianya yang ke 45 tahun Siti tetap dengan usahanya yang Ia jalani sejak 5 tahun yang lalu yaitu membuat kue basah dan menjualnya. bahan-bahan yang dibeli oleh Siti mulai diolah pada pukul 03.00 subuh sehingga ketika matahari mulai menampakkan sinarnya semua adonan kue telah siap dipasarkan. Kue-kue tersebut nantinya akan diantar Siti ke warung-warung dan para langganan lainnya yang biasanya bekerjasama dengan Siti. Siti mendapat keuntungan dari usahanya adalah 50.000 rupiah/hari, keuntungan tersebut digunakan untuk biaya hidup setiap hari dan sebagian disimpan untuk keperluan yang tidak terduga. Siti tinggal bersama suaminya yang bernama Abdullah dengan mengontrak kos-kosan dengan biaya 120.000 rupiah/bulannya dan ditempat inilah Siti mengolah kue yang dipasarkannya. dengan keahliannya ini Siti mampu membesarkan ketiga anaknya impian untuk mempunyai rumah sendiri dan usaha yang berkembang merupakan harapan Siti dimasa yang akan datang.

loans.use:
To buy ingredients to make cake

Membeli bahan-bahan untuk membuat kue

texts.en: K. is a 49-year-old widow. After her daughter died, she began to support her one grandchild. To meet the daily expenses, she rounds the village on foot selling clothes. She has been running her business for six years. From her business she gets a net profit of $5 each day, and she expects to elevate her earnings with this loan. She will use the profit for her grandchild's education.

loans.use: $100 will be used to buy more clothes

loans.name: Selafina

texts.en: Selafina is the oldest member of Samalaeulu Centre. She is 70 years of age with 8 children and 24 grandchildren. She has been a tailor since she was young, With the help of her mother, who passed away ages ago, she was able to sew, cut, and learned how to join cuttings into dresses, shirts, and pants. She has decided to pass on her talent to her children, especially her granddaughters. She decided to join SPBD, where she thought she could build her own business, and even her daughters could join whenever they wanted. She bought herself a new sewing machine, and some materials for making dresses and shirts. She is planning to teach her daughters, so that when she dies, she is happy that she has shared her talent with her children. Selafina is a widow.

loans.use: To start a sewing business

loans.name: Taufaiesea

texts.en: Taufaiesea is a married woman of 41 years of age. She has 6 children and 2 family relatives living with her. Her husband is a farmer, and sometimes she has problems looking after her family, especially their daily expenses. The income from what they sell every week is not sufficient. Taufaiesea decided to start something of her own. Instead of relying on the farm, she opted to try selling ice cakes. She lives close to the school, so it was a great start for her. She used her first loan to buy business equipment, and she is very happy that she has utilized her time properly and focused on developing her family's living.

loans.use: To start her ice cake business.

loans.name: Moli

texts.en: Moli is a grandmother of 52 years of age. Her family has lived on the plantation all of their lives. They use the same land which their father used to cultivate with many crops. Moli's husband decided to concentrate on a taro plantation, as compared to other crops it takes less time to grow. Moli's first loan she used to buy cramoxone chemical, a wheelbarrow and other things needed for the plantation. Her plan is to grow the plantation and hopefully to export to neighboring countries.

loans.use: To assist with the family's plantation

loans.name: I Ketut

texts.id:
The older the better, an accurate slogan for this grandfather of 4. This 62 year old I Ketut W. is still strong and enthusiastic, although his beloved wife was called home earlier by the Lord. Although staying with the oldest son, W. does not want to be a burden to him. All his children have their own families. To support his food and daily needs, W. is dependent on the animals he raised, initialy it was cow farming. However after his wife passed away, W. had to sell his cow to pay for her funeral ceremony cost. Since 2 years ago W. change profession by raising pigs. With 2 mother pigs, W. could profit nett Rp 350,000 (about $37)/month. This income was used to pay for his daily food expenses. With a loan from DINARI for Rp 130,000 (about $150) W. wants to buy 1 other mother pig, and the rest to buy animal feed. Afterwards W. would not be afraid to shortage of his income, since sales of his baby pigs could reached Rp750,000 (about 80)/month, and with that he could fulfill his daily needs, and maybe even save a little.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Semakin tua semakin jadi, slogan ini sangat tepat di tujukan kepada kakek yang sudah mempunyai .4 orang cucu ini. Lelaki yang lahir 62 tahun silam yang bernama I Ketut W. tampak masih begitu kekar dan bersemangat walaupun istri yang di cintainya sudah lebih dahulu di panggil sang pencipta, tinggal bersama anak sulungnya W. tak mau menjadi beban anak-anaknya yang semuanya sudah memiliki keluarga sendiri. Untuk biaya makan dan kebutuhan sehari- hari W. sangat tergantung pada hasil ternak peliharaanya yang pada awalnya adalah ternak sapi. Tapi setelah di tinggal oleh istrinya, W. harus merelakan sapinya dijual untuk biaya ngaben. sejak 2 tahun lalu W. berubah profesi memelihara babi. Dgn 2 ekor induk babi saat itu W. bisa mendapat keuntungan bersih Rp 350.000 per bulan. uang inilah yg W. gunakan untuk memenuhi kebutuhan makan sehari hari. Dengan Pinjaman Dari DINARI sebesar Rp 1.300.000 W. membeli 1 ekor induk lagi dan sisanya di pergunakan untuk biaya pakan ternaknya. Kini W. tak kuatir lagi dengan penghasilannya karena dari hasil penjualan anak babinya sekarang yang mencapai Rp 750.000/ bln W. bisa memenuhi kebutuhan sehari-hari dan sisanya di tabung.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Pinelo

texts.en: Pinelo is 43, and married with 3 children. Just about a month ago, they started with their plantation. Her husband and two family relatives are working very hard to cultivate the area with 100 banana tops. She used her first loan to buy cramoxone chemical and banana fertilizers. In the future, Pinelo is planning to export her bananas overseas and hopefully to get more demand locally.

loans.use: To assist with Banana Plantation

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is a poor mother of 32 years of age, married with 2 children. Her husband is not working and raising her children has always been a problem for her. She heard about SPBD through other village ladies so she thought this was a good opportunity to start something of her own. She used her first loan to buy what she needed for the business, and she is very pleased with the assistance she was given in terms of financial support. Eseta sells her German buns in the village and also in school. If everything goes well, she is planning to do something as a second business.

loans.use: To start her German Bun business

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena is 31, and married with 4 children. She is very poor and sometimes she cannot send her children to school because she cannot afford school fees and bus fares. Mena heard of SPBD through the village women. She decided to join, so she could try and do something of her own. Selling ice cakes is an easy and cheap business for her and so she gave it a try. She is selling her ice cakes to the village people, especially the village school. She is hoping to earn good money, so she can upgrade her family's living.

loans.use: To start her ice cake business

loans.name: Meresaini

texts.en: Meresaini is from Samusu and they have lived there for more than 5 years. Her family lived on a taro plantation, which was their main source of income. She is married with one child and she is living with her mother and three family relatives. Meresaini's husband is very hard working, and from Meresaini's first loan they managed to install water pipes inside the plantation. Meresaini is planning to grow her plantation bigger and hopefully in the future she will be able to export her taros overseas.

loans.use: To assist with her plantation

loans.name: Ni Made

texts.id:
Senior age did not lowered Made P. to expand her business. In the 50's even increased her efforts to add 2 pigs from 2 mother pigs that she has long worked on. Now Made P. owns 4 mother pigs that was bought from a loan she obtain from DINARI for Rp 1,300,000 (about US$150). All this she does since she is now not strong enough to help Wayan Mawan her husband as a tenant farmer working the land. However Made P. still wants to help add extra income to pay for the 3 children that are still within their responsibilities, by raising pigs, that do not need a lot of extra efforts, it is enough to feed them twice a day morning, and evening, and to take care of the baby pigs to keep them healthy. From the 4 mother pigs Made P. own, every six months she could profit an average of Rp 4,200,000 (aboutUS$ 450), so that her contribution income by raising pigs are about Rp700,000 (about $75)/month. From that she ease her husband's burden, and could save a little for her children and old age.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Usia yang lanjut ternyata tidak menyurutkan semangat Made P. untuk mengembangkan usahanya. memasuki usia yang ke 50 tahun ini justru memicu semangatnya untuk menambah 2 ekor lagi dari 2 ekor induk babi yang sudah sejak lama di tekuni. Kini Made P. telah memiliki 4 ekor induk babi yang di beli dengan menggunakan uang pinjaman yg di peroleh dari DINARI Rp 1.300.000 hal ini dilakukannya karena sadar bahwa Made P. tak kuat lagi untuk bekerja membantu Wayan Mawan suaminya sebagai petani untuk menggarap tanah. namun begitu Made P. juga tetap ingin membantu memporoleh tambahan penghasilan untuk membiayai ketiga orang anak yang masih menjadi tanggungan keluarga ini dengan jalan memelihara babi yang tidak membutuhkan tenaga ekstra, dengan memberi makan 2 kali sehari pagi dan sore dan merawat anak –anak babi agar tetap sehat itu sudah cukup. namun hasil yang di dapat cukup lumayan . dari 4 ekor induk yang di miliki Made P. setiap enam bulan menghasilkan keuntungan rata –rata Rp 4.200.000 sehingga penghasilan tambahan yang di dapat oleh Made P. dari memelihara babi sebesar Rp 700.000/bln. dengan hasil inilah Made P. bisa membantu meringankan beban suaminya bahkan sekarang dia sudah bisa menabung sedikit demi sedikit untuk anaknya dan hari tuanya .

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock for fattening, and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi untuk penggemukan dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina lives with her parents and two brothers. She is 29 years of age, and married with two children. Sina decided to have a plantation of her own, so she used her first loan to pay for three laborers to clear the area. Her plantation has been growing well and she has already been selling taros. Sina is thankful to SPBD, because she has managed to have a plantation of her own, and also managed to upgrade her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To assist with her plantation

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 34 years of age, and is married with 3 children. Her husband works for one of the spare parts companies in the town area, and also works on their plantation during weekends. But most of the time Nora is in charge. She decided to give 100 percent of her time to the plantation, since she knew her husband's fortnightly income was not sufficient to support the whole family. She used her first loan to buy a back sprayer, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, and more taro tops. Nora is a very hard working woman, and in the future she hopes her business will grow bigger, and her biggest plan is to earn good money so she can improve their family home.

loans.use: To assist with her taro plantation

loans.name: Serkardar

texts.en: H. Serkerdar  is 43 years old and married with three children. He is a farmer by trade, but is currently a refugee from the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict territory in the Khojavand region of eastern Azerbaijan. Right now, he and his family live in Baku. He started his meat business in 1997, when he purchased one sheep with money he had saved up. The work is interesting, but time-consuming and takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary he earns is not enough to cover all of his family's expenses. Serkerdar would therefore like to borrow $500 to buy 7 small sheep plus some food for them. He will repay the loan within 12 months and hopes that it will expand his business.

loans.use: To buy 7 sheep

loans.name: Ketut

texts.id:
To live peacefully and modestly is the hope of every family. Although living in a small hut with bamboo weaved walls, Ketut K. family seems to be peaceful and happy. Her husband work as a tenant farmer. He is very responsible towards his family. His hard work is not wasted by Kakek Budi, his children was able to finish high school. After marrying Ketut K. never stopped raising pigs though in very small numbers, only 1 or 2 each time, and even that done the traditional way by putting the pig on leash under a tree. Morning and evenings the pigs were fed with food obtained from the fields: leaves or talas roots that was cooked and sometimes mixed with rice shells during rice-harvest. After 3 months the pigs could be sold for Rp350,000 (about $38)/each. With the loan to be obtained, Ketut K. will add another pig, and the rest to buy better foods like rice shells, concentrate or polar so that the pigs could grow faster. Also with the lengthy dry season reserve feed from the fields are getting difficult to obtain. With one additional pig and better feed, Ketut K. is convinced that she could get Rp300,000 (about $35)/month nett, and this would add to daily family living expense, which average Rp20,000 (about $2.10) /day.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Hidup rukun dan bersahaja merupakan idaman bagi setiap keluarga, walau dengan gubuk kecil yang berdindingkan gedek bambu keluarga Ketut K. kelihatan rukun dan sangat bahagia. Suaminya yang bekerja sebagai petani sangat bertanggung jawab terhadap keluarganya. kerja kerasnya ini juga tak di sia-siakan oleh Kadek budi antara anak nya untuk menyelesaikan pendidikannya sampai tingkat SMA. Sejak menikah Ketut K. Tak pernah putus memelihara babi walau hanya dalam jumlah yang kecil yaitu 1 sampai 2 ekor saja, dan itupun dengan cara yg masih tradisional Babinya di ikat di bawah pohon, pagi dan sore ternaknya diberi makanan yg di buat/diperoleh dari sawah berupa daun daunan dan pohon ubi talas yg di masak. dan kadang-kadang di campur dedak kalau lagi musim panen padi. Setelah tiga bulan babinya laku di jual Rp 350.000/ekor. Dengan pinjaman yang di dapat Ketut K. akan menambah lagi satu ekor ternaknya dan sisanya di pergunakan untuk membeli pakan yg lebih baik Seperti Dedak, Konsentrat dan juga Polar supaya ternaknya lebih cepat besar, di samping juga persediaan pakan di sawah mulai susah didapat karena musim kemarau yg panjang. Dengan tambahan 1 ekor ternak dan pakan yang juga berubah sekarang Ketut K. yakin bisa mendapatkan hasil bersih panen ternaknya Rp 300.000/ bulan, dan hasil ini cukup membantu menambah biaya kebutuhan hidup keluarganya yang rata -rata Rp 20.000 Perhari.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit Babi dan Pakan ternak

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en: Amelia is a young married woman of 28 years of age. Her husband looks after their plantation, and he is a very hard working husband. Amelia's plantation has many different crops. The taro blight discouraged her husband from growing taro, but the chemicals used for taro blight are now available in Samoa. Now her husband is spending more time on the taro plantation because he knows taro is always in demand. Amelia used her first loan with SPBD to buy some fertilizers, blight chemical, and paid for two laborers who helped her husband. Amelia is a happy mother now, as she is selling her taro in the new market twice a week. She hopes that she will have enough profit so she can improve her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: To assist with her plantation

loans.name: Eve

texts.en: Eve is a solo mother of 27 years of age. Living with her parents all of her life was the reason why she decided to start something of her own. Her father has been supporting her and her son, so it was a large burden on him. Eve heard of SPBD through the women in her village. She thought of running an ice cake business, but the problem was she would need to have a fridge to store them. Eve decided to start with pancakes since no one in the area was running a pancake business. She used her first loan to buy the equipment required, and on her first day of selling pancakes she managed to earn $100.00 tala. Eve is planning to run an ice cake business as a second business.

loans.use: To start her pancake business.

loans.name: Ni Made

texts.id:
To be a tenant farmer is the main occupation of Ni Made M., mother of three, from the marriage to Nengah Tono, also a tenant farmer. Their income are barely enough to pay for daily food expenses, so that their children has to quit middle school, and help work as tenant farmers. From such background Mur (her nickname) like to have additional income to support her family expenses. As the case with many ladies in her village, Ms. Mur started this pig farming business. She choose this business since start up cost was not that high. With Rp500,000 (about ($60) Mur could buy 2 baby pigs that she could raise the traditional way by leashing these pigs under a tree, which was found as safe; and to raise these pigs won't take too much of her time, not more than 1 hour in the morning before she leaves for the paddy fields, and also in the evening back from work, and so on. Mur's efforts is growing, especially after obtaining a loan from DINARI for Rp1,300,000 (about $150) that she used to buy feedstock, and making a modest stall, so that her animals could be protected from the heat and rain. She has 4 pigs to raise now. Mur expect to profit Rp200,000 ($22)/month. With this business she hope that the family's economical situation would improve.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Menjadi petani adalah pekerjaan utama dari Ni Made M., ibu dari tiga orang anak hasil perkawinannya dengan Nengah Tono yg juga sebagai petani. Penghasilan yang di peroleh keluarga ini boleh dikatakan pas-pasan untuk biaya makan sehari - hari saja sehinga anak-anaknya pun harus putus sekolah pada tingkat SMP dan membantu bekerja sebagai buruh tani. Berangkat dari latar belakang inilah Mur begitu orang sering memanggilnya ingin mendapat hasil tambahan untuk menopang biaya keluarganya. Sama halnya seperti ibu-ibu lain di desanya sejak 2 tahun belakangan ini Mur mulai menekuni usaha ternak babi . Usaha ini dipilih karena biaya/modal yang di perlukan tidak begitu banyak dengan modal Rp 500 000 Mur sudah bisa membeli 2 ekor bibit yg kemudian di pelihara secara tradisional dgn mengikatnya di bawah pohon yg di anggap aman disamping itu memelihara babi tidak akan menyita banyak waktunya, tak lebih dari 1 jam di pagi hari sebelum berangkat ke sawah dan juga sorenya setelah pulang dari kerja begitu seterusnya. Usaha Mur berkembang cukup pesat, apalagi setelah mendapat pinjaman dari DINARI sebesar Rp 1.300.000 yang dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit dan membuat kandang yg sederhana sehingga ternaknya terhindar dari panas dan hujan . Dengan 4 ekor Ternak peliharaannya saat ini, Mur memperoleh keuntungan rata – rata Rp 200.000 Per bulanya. Dengan usaha ini perekonomian keluarganya diharapkan menjadi lebih baik.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Untuk membeli bibit babi dan makanan ternak

loans.name: Filipina

texts.en: Filipina is a young mother of 25 years of age. She is married with 3 children. The taro plantation has been their family income for all of their lives so she and her husband have a lot of experience in taro farming. She heard of SPBD through the women in the village, so she decided to join. She has been wanting to buy some farm equipment, but money is her biggest problem. Filipina and her husband have been upgrading their farm and they are happy with what they earned when they first sold their crops. Filipina is planning for her business to grow bigger and hopefully to have some changes not only for her family but for her farm as well.

loans.use: To assist her plantation.

loans.name: Dunyamin

texts.en:
H. Dunyamin is 31 years old and married with three children. He is a refugee from the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict territory in the Khojavand region in eastern Azerbaijan. Today, he lives with his family in Baku. He started a meat business of his own in 1999. He buys sheep from wholesalers of livestock and sometimes goes to other regions to purchase sheep, whose meat he sells in his butcher shop.

He now needs money to buy more sheep to build up stock for his shop. He is a previous client of Normicro's Baku branch, having already borrowed four loans from Normicro. He is now requesting a $700 loan with which he will buy 15 sheep as a long term investment for his business.

loans.use: To buy 15 sheep

loans.name: Koreti

texts.en: Koreti is married with 3 children. She is 47 years of age, and coming from a poor family background, she decided to join SPBD. She heard more about the programme through the women in the village and she thought this is where she could be able to get financial support. She used her first loan with SPBD to buy for cramoxone chemical, some fertilizers, and other equipment needed for the farm. Koreti and her husband are working very hard on their farm and they continue to grow more taros to keep increasing their farm's yield.

loans.use: To assist her taro plantation.

loans.name: Faafouina

texts.en: Faafouina is a young mother of 25 years of age, married with 1 child. She is living with her parents, and her husband works with one of the companies in the town area. Her husband's weekly salary is not sufficient to support all of them. She decided to join SPBD so she could do something of her own. She has always been interested in a vegetable garden. She thought of trying a cabbage farm due to the size of land they are using. She used her first loan to buy fertilizers and cabbage seeds. In the future, she plans to have her own small market in front her home.

loans.use: To start her cabbage farm

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en: H. Rasul  is 39 years old. He is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory in Khojavand region in Eastern Azerbaijan. Right now, he lives with his family in Baku. He started his meat business in 2001. He buys sheep, slaughters them and sells the meat. He needs some money to help him buy more sheep for his business. He heard about Normicro loans and decided to apply for a loan. This is his first loan. He has applied for a $500 loan to buy 10 sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Ni Luh Sekarini

texts.id:
For Luh Sekar who works as a shop tender in her sister's mart, raising pigs is a promising and entertaining side job. Beside getting additional income, there are other benefits such as obtaining organic fertilizer from the manure or even for decompressing after spending a whole day tending the shop. The mother of Ni Putu Murniasih began her business since six years ago with one sow. She obtains a decent income because she raises the animals constantly. She is able to turn around the pigs quickly so in three months Luh Sekar could harvest two times with an average profit of 100,000 IDR (1 USD ~ 9,000 IDR). Luh Sekar has a full support of her husband. His job as a farm labor was felt insufficient to cover the needs of four-person family so he also helps her to market the pigs and or to find the cheapest piglets. The loan is used to add two more sows and the remaining is used to do maintenance for the pen. She hopes to increase her profit by twice as much and use the profit to cover the basic needs and to pay for their children's education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Bagi Luh Sekar yang keseharianya bekerja sebagai penunggu warung milik kakaknya Beternak babi adalah suatu pekerjaan sampingan yang sangat mengasikkan dan menjanjikan. Di samping ada hasil tambahan, banyak manfaat lain yg di dapat seperti pupuk kandang bahkan kadang-kadang bisa menghilangkan pikiran yang jenuh setelah seharian menunggui warung. Dengan 1 ekor babi Ibu dari Ni Putu Murniasih ini mulai usahanya sejak 6 th yang lalu walau hanya 1 ekor babi yang dimiliki hasil yg di peroleh cukup lumayan, karena pemeliharaanya dilakukan tanpa putus-putus. Begitu dapat untung di jual dan langsung beli lagi tanpa memperhitungkan waktu panen sehingga dalam waktu 3 bln Luh Sekar bisa panen sampai 2 kali dengan keuntungan rata-rata Rp 100.000 perbulan.Usaha Luh Sekar juga mendapat dukungan dari Putu Yarta suaminya. pekerjaannya sebagai buruh tani dirasakan belum cukup untuk membiayai ke butuhan 4 orang dalam keluarga ini sehingga dia sering membantu memasarkan ataupun mencarikan bibit yg lebih murah. Setelah mendapat pinjaman Luh Sekar menambah babinya menjadi 2 ekor dan sisa uangnya dipergunakan untuk menservice kandang. Keuntungan yang Luh Sekar dapatkan sekarang menjadi 2 kali lipat dari sebelumnya dan diharapkan bisa memenuhi biaya hidup setiaphari dan biaya sekolah anak-anak mereka.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Malia

texts.en: Malia is one of the oldest members of the Amaile Centre. She is married with 6 children and 12 grandchildren. Her husband passed away 5 years ago, so she has been looking after her family by herself. Malia heard of SPBD through other women of the village. She has been running her shop for almost 10 years. She used her first loan to buy more goods for her shop, and she is also expanding the size of it. Malia is planning to run a flea market if she receives another loan.

loans.use: To assist with her shop

loans.name: Nengah Juli Sudarmi

texts.id:
Raising pigs is a hobby and a source of additional income for the young mother of two. 27 years old Juli, the name she goes by, began pig farming after dropping off from school. Even though she only finished elementary school, the wife of Made Ardika, a Java-bound truck driver, is very energetic and experienced on raising pigs, from feeding the stocks, cleaning the pen to caring the piglets. From two sows Juli can produce 40 piglets per year. One piglet is sold for 170,000 IDR (1USD ~ 9,000 IDR). She could earn a gross margin of 6,800,000 IDR per year. With one additional sow from DINARI loan, Juli could still manage to multi-task as a homemaker and as a member of her village community. Their house is owned by her in-law, which motivates Juli to work even harder so she could save enough money to reach her dream to own her small house and to pay for her children's education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Memelihara babi merupakan hobi dan sumber pendapatan tambahan dari ibu muda yg telah dikaruniai 2 orang anak ini. Diusianya yang ke 27 tahun Juli begitu panggilan akrabnya mulai menekuni usaha beternak babi sejak masih muda, setelah putus sekolah karna faktor ekonomi keluarga. Meskipun hanya tamatan SD istri dari Made Ardika yang kesehariannya bekerja sebagai sopir truk Ke Jawa itu sangat gesit dan berpengalaman lebih –lebih dalam hal beternak, hampir separuh waktu yg dimilikinya di pergunakan untuk mengurus ternak-ternak yg dimiliki. Mulai dari memberi makan babi membersihkan kandang hingga merawat anak babi. Dengan 2 ekor induk babi Juli bisa meghasilkan 40 ekor anak (bibit) dalam satu tahunnya. Satu ekor bibit babi dijual Rp.170.000,- .Keuntungan kotor bisa didapatkannya sebesar Rp. 6.800.000, pertahunnya. Dengan tambahan 1 ekor Induk lagi dari pinjaman DINARI, Juli masih merasakan cukup waktu untuk mengerjakan pekerjaan lainya baik itu selaku Ibu Rumah tangga maupun kegiatan lain di desanya. Rumah yang mereka tempati merupakan rumah milik mertuanya yang sangat mendorong Juli bekerja lebih giat untuk bisa menabung dan mewujudkan impiannya untuk memiliki sebuah rumah kecil dan membiayai pendidikan anaknya.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Made Wantri

texts.id:
In addition to their daily routine as homemakers, Balinese housewives typically have a second job to support their family's income. So does Made Wantry, the wife of Kadek Suparma who works as a rock-carying truck driver. Living in Tukadaya village that is very remote from the city helps her current pig farming business. Starting with 250,000 IDR (1USD ~ 9,000 IDR) borrowed from her brother/sister in-law, Made bought two piglets that she raised for three months and sold for 750,000 IDR. After subtracting the cost of animal feed for three months, Made earn a margin of 200,000 IDR. Albeit the small scale, Made is very excited to grow her business. With the loan from DINARI, she could pay off the money borrowed from her brother/sister in-law and bought additional three piglets. She has a high hope that with additional capital she could gain even better return, so she could further help her husband to pay for their children (one in elementary school and another one is still a toddler) and to cover their basic needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Di samping melakukan aktifitas rutin sebagai ibu rumah tangga, Ibu-ibu di Bali pada umumnya memiliki suatu pekerjaan sampingan untuk menambah pendapatan keluarganya. Begitu juga yang dilakukan oleh Made Wantri istri dari Kadek Suparma yang bekerja sebagai sopir Truk pengangkut batu ini, Tinggal Di Desa Tukadaya yang sangat jauh dari kota sangat mendukung usaha ternak babi yang sekarang ini sedang di tekuninya. Mulai dari modal yang hanya Rp 250.000 itupun hasil pinjaman dari kakak iparnya Made membeli 2 ekor bibit babi yang di peliharanya selama 3 bulan, yang kemudian laku dijual dengan harga Rp 750 000 .Setelah di hitung dan di potong biaya pakan yg dihabiskan selama 3 bulan Made mendapat kelebihan Rp 200 000. meskipun sedikit hasil yang diperoleh, Made tetap semangat untuk mengembangkan usahanya ini. Dengan pinjam dari DINARI sekarang Ia telah mampu mengembalikan uang kakak iparnya dan membeli lagi bibit babi sebanyak 3 ekor besar harapan Made dengan tambahan modal ini akan memperoleh hasil yang lebih baik, sehingga dapat membantu suaminya dalam membiayai seorang anaknya yg duduk disekolah dasar dan satu lagi yg masih balita, disamping juga untuk biaya kebutuhan sehari-hari.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To replace all four tires on his lorry and to buy farm produce to sell.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan is 42 years old, married and has 2 children. He lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. Elshan has been running his own farm for 15 years.He is applying for a loan of $475 to buy pesticides to improve his farming business.

loans.use: He would like to buy  pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Farkhad

texts.en: Farkhad lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. This 54-year-old man is married and has 4 children. He started farming 14 ago and now requests a loan of  $475 to buy pesticides for his farm.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy M. is 24 years old. She is married with one child. Nancy lives in Mlolongo town along the Mombasa-Nairobi highway. Though young, Nancy takes care of her younger brother who is in standard eight, and looks after three of her nieces after their mother died as a result of HIV/AIDS . 

Nancy started her business in 2006 after being retrenched from the company she was working for.  With her retrenchment money of Ksh 100,000.00 (USD 1540), Nancy immediately rented a shop and opened the salon and cosmetic shop. The business has been doing very well up to now and Nancy has been able to generate a good income from it. She now wants to increase the stock in her shop, which will enable her customers to have a better variety of cosmetics to choose from, and they will be able to get any products they require at her shop. She also hopes to get additional help in order to manage her shop better, and therefore intends to employ two orphaned girls who are currently being trained at her salon.

Nancy is therefore requesting a loan of USD 1175 which Nancy will use to purchase much-needed products like shampoo, chemicals, braids and petroleum jelly for her shop. The repayment period for her loan will be 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of beauty products including hair shampoo, braids, chemicals, petroleum jelly, etc.

loans.name: Alikhan

texts.en:
Alikhan has been farming for 8 years. He is 42 years old, married and has one child. He lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region.
He requests a loan of $725 to buy pesticides to improve his farm.

loans.use: Tp purchase pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah M. is 30 years old. He is married, and has three children aged nine, six and three years. He also takes care of his brother in law who lives together with his family. They reside in Kayole, an informal settlement on the Eastern side of Nairobi. 

Jeremiah started his hardware shop in March 2007. Before this, he was employed in a hardware store since 2004, after which he decided to open his own shop. Jeremy (as his friends call him) was not new to business, since he had tried his hand at running his own business immediately after he had completed his high school, back at home in Kisii, in Gucha District. There, he started a small shop at his home where he sold an assortment of fruits and vegetables. However, he felt that he could do more in order to get a higher income, and that is when he decided to come to Nairobi to build his business. While in Nairobi, he lived with his uncle, and he immediately started off another shop selling potato chips (fries) and bananas. Once this business picked, he left it for his wife to run, and it continues to run today. He often helps his wife in the shop in the evenings before closing for the day. 

Jeremy now runs a hardware shop that he started off early this year, using some savings amounting to Ksh. 200,000 (USD 3075) that he had put aside from his chips business, together with some of the money he got from his previous employment in the hardware shop. As the business grows, Jeremy has found that he needs to have more stock in his shop, since there is an overwhelming demand from his customers who are mainly carpenters, drawn from the environs of Kayole. Since his operational capital is quite low, he finds that he is not able to buy goods in big bulk, hence he misses out on good discounts. At the same time, he is forced to travel often to the centre of Nairobi City in order to provide what his customers require. 

Jeremy is therefore requesting a loan of USD 1175, with which he intends to buy additional stock for his business, including wood, ply wood, paints, veneer, block boards, velvet materials, cushions and nails. He believes that this loan will enable him to have a higher operating capital, and hence enable him to buy more things in bulk.  He will also spend less on transport, and of course will receive better discounts. He intends to repay the loan within a period of 8 months.

loans.use: To purchase hardware materials including: wood, ply wood, veneer, paints etc.

loans.name: Krouch

texts.en: Mr. Krouch P., 41, is married with 2 children, who are both students. His wife earns $2 a day renting out a house, while he earns $8 a day as a taxi driver. However, recently his taxi has fallen into disrepair and he is requesting this $1000 to repair his car so he can continue running his business. In the future he would like to purchase another car to expand his business and generate more profits.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Mrs. Ven C., 46, is married with 3 children. One is a mechanic, one is a student and the other is married and lives away from home. Her husband works as a construction worker, earning $2.50 a day. Ven C. is currently a housewife, but in the future she would like to run a shop selling beef soup and Chinese noodles.

loans.use: to repair house

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Mrs. Seang S., 43, lives with her husband (pictured) and children in the Prey Ven Province of Cambodia. She owns a grocery store which earns her $10. She is requesting this loan because she would like to sell a greater variety of products to more effectively meet her client’s needs. Meanwhile, her husband works as a tyre repair man, earning $2.5 a day and her 2 employed children earn $75 a month as truck drivers. Her other 5 children are students.

loans.use: to add more products to her inventory to meet her cients needs

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en: Fuad has his own farming business. He is 26 years old and single. He lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. Fuad has 4 years of experience in this business and now requests a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Yoen

texts.en: Mrs. Yoen Chuum, 44, lives with her husband and 4 children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She earns $1.70 a day selling vegetables, whilst her husband earns $10 a day buying and selling motorbikes. Two of her children are employed at a nearby garment factory, earning $80 a month each. The family's income is pooled and they all look after each other. She has applied for this loan in order to repair their house. In particular, she would like to fix the leaking roof.

loans.use: to repair home

loans.name: Alisakhib

texts.en: Alisakhib A. is a 47-year-old married man with 2 children  who lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Alisakhib has his own vineyard and 13 years of experience in this business. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer. He plans to develop his vineyard and increase his yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Mrs. Seak N. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and three young children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. Her husband is employed and earns around $2 each day, whilst Mrs. Seak N. wholesales grocery items to the people in her area and typically earns up to $50 each day in revenue. She has applied for a loan to increase her inventory, so that she will be able to meet the growing demands of her clients.

loans.use: To increase her inventory and meet clients' demands.

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Seak Norm start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Da Veit

texts.en: Mrs. Da Veit L., 44, lives with her husband, 47, and 3 children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. Da Veit L.'s husband is employed as a policeman and is paid $1 a day. Da Veit L. herself earns an additional $11.50 a day running a laundry service and renting housing. She has applied for this loan because she wants to expand her rental business by building more rooms to rent to the people in her area.

loans.use: to build more rooms to rent to people in her area

loans.name: Sirila Vizcaina

texts.en:
Sirila is 29 years old and has 5 children. She’s living on the upper slopes of Yamasá hill where she runs her business. She buys special cloth and with a sewing machine she makes mosquito nets that she sells in the surrounding community and Santo Domingo, the capital. From a quintal of cloth (approximately 100 pounds), she can make 60 mosquito nets in 15 days.

Sirila is requesting a loan of U.S $225.00 to expand her business and to have the capacity to reach more people, since the demand for this kind of product is increasing. Her product can prevent diseases caused by mosquito bites like dengue which has been very frequent during the last six months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Doeu Tek

texts.en: Mrs. Doeu Tek L., 46, is a widow who works selling pet fish for $3 a day. She has 3 children who are all married and support themselves. Doeu Tek L. now wants to act as a middleman buying and selling soya beans. She knows where she can get very cheap soya beans in the Provinces and she can sell them for a higher price in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: to buy soya beans from the countryside for resale in the city

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en: Kamila is a mother of 4 children. She is 57 years old and lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. She started her business 20 years ago.  She initially had 3 calves and she sold two of them at market. Now she requests a loan of $1200 to buy baling presses and cotton-seed to continue fattening her cattle for market.

loans.use: To buy baling presses and cotton-seed

loans.name: Amid

texts.en: Amid  is 23 years old, single and lives in the Khaladj village of the Salyan region. He has his own farming business. Now he requests a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides. He has 2 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Chingiz

texts.en: Chingiz has had his orchard business for 10 years.  This 43-year-old man lives in Khaladj village, in the Salyan region. He is married, has three children. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides.

loans.use: to buy pesticides

loans.name: Coleta Laurencio

texts.en:
Coleta (54 years old) is engaged, with her husband’s help, in selling basic foodstuff and other goods in her ‘colmado,’ a typical Dominican small store where simple goods are sold. The couple has 5 children who are unemployed. For more than four years, her business has had a positive impact in the community, since it brings in a convenient manner goods that otherwise people would obtain in the town, which requires a walk of more than two hours.

Coleta wants to purchase new types of products in order to increase the variety of goods that her business brings to the community, so that people can have access to a wider range of basic goods. She also aims to augment her profit so that she can better face her family issues.

loans.use: To expand and diversify the business

loans.name: Elshad

texts.en: Elshad is 29 years old, married and has one child.  He lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. He has his own orchard where he has grown grape vines since 2001. Now he plans to buy vine-props and requests a loan of $1200.

loans.use: To buy vine-props for his vineyard

loans.name: Vurgun

texts.en: Vurgun is 27 years old, single and lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. He has 3 years of experience in this buisness. Now this young  man needs a loan of $475 to buy a plot of land to open an Orchard farm. of his own.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Agarza

texts.en:
Agarza has 2 children and lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. He is 42 years old.  He started his farming business 8 years ago.
Now he needs a loan of $600 to buy pesticides for improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Juana María

texts.en:
Like many other women of Yamasa, Juana María, 23 years old, is running a business of mosquito nets. She began her business 3 years ago and still keeps working hard to help her husband cover the expenses for their 3 children (two boys and a girl).

Juana María applied to borrow U.S $375.00 with the intention of boosting her business and purchasing the necessary quantity of cloth (materials) to make the mosquito nets. She is also thinking of repairing her very old sewing machine, in order to manufacture more mosquito nets and sell a large quantity of her products. She will repay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To buy materials for the business

loans.name: Guloglan

texts.en: Guloglan is 44 years old, married andhas 2 children. He lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. He has run his farming business  for 10 years and now requests a loan of $725 to buy pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Djabrayil

texts.en: Djabrayil is 56 years old , married  and has 4 children. He  lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. 20 years ago he started his farming business and now requests a loan of $475 to buy pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Elisa Maria Mingane

texts.pt:
Elisa Maria Mingane C. is 49 years old. She is married mother of 3 children. She lives in the city of Matola, Maputo province. Elisa joined the program in September 2005. She took a loan of 6.000mt. She is responsible for her home's expenses. She supports the home by selling chickens. Elisa paid her loans on time and in full.

Elisa is now on phase 4 of the program and she is requesting a loan of 20.00mt to be paid back in 12 months. She will apply this credit to her chicken business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Elisa Maria Mingane C. tem 49 anos de idade e vive maritalmente com o seu esposo e três filhos na cidade da Matola, província de Maputo. Entro para o programa em Setembro de 2005, tendo tomado um empréstimo de 6.000MT.Ela tem dependências arrendadas na sua residência e também cria e vende frangos e, este último negócio ela expandiu após entrada no programa. Comportou-se muito bem nos empréstimos anteriores e demonstra ser uma pessoa de bom carácter.

Vai ao 4º ciclo de empréstimo e vai tomar 20.000MT para pagar em 12 meses.

loans.use: Improve chicken business

loans.name: Felizarda Luísa

texts.pt:
Felizarda Luísa G. is 39 years old. She is a single mother of 3 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Infulene in Maputo. She raises chickens and sells clothes to support her family. Felizarda joined the credit program in April 2007. Her first loan was of 6.000mt. She is in the second phase of the program, and requests a loan in order to increase her inventory and grow her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Felizarda Luísa G. tem 39 anos de idade e é mãe solteira de três filhos. Vive no bairro do Infulene em Maputo.Cria frangos e vende roupa. Entrou para o Programa em Abril de 2007 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT. Vai para o 2º ciclo e vai voltar a tomar o mesmo valor para pagar em 5 meses. É ainda prematuro falarv e crescimento do negócio uma vez que está a pouco tempo no programa.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Felizarda Luísa

texts.pt: Felizarda Luísa G. tem 39 anos de idade e é mãe solteira de três filhos.Cria frangos e vende roupa. Entrou para o programa em Abril de 2007 com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT. Vai para o 2º ciclo e vai voltar a tomar o mesmo valor para pagar em 5 meses. É prematuro falar do crescimento do negócio pois está muito pouco tempo no programa.

loans.use: Aumento do Stock

loans.name: Laura Francisco

texts.pt:
Laura Francisco M. is 34 years old. She is married with 4 children. They live in the neighborhood of Magoanine in Maputo. She has a small store where she sells various products. She joined the program in November 2006, and requested a loan of 3.000mt which she paid in full. She is now in the 3rd cycle of the credit program. Laura is requesting a loan of 6.000mt to be repaid in 5 months. She plans on increasing inventory and strengthening her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Laura Francisco M. tem 34 anos de idade e vive maritalmente com o seu esposo e 4 filhos no bairro de Magoanine em Maputo.Tem uma mercearia em casa onde vende uma diversidade de produtos.Entrou para o programa em novembro de 2006 e tomou como 1º empréstimo 3.000 MT.Vai para 3º ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 6.000MT para pagar em 5 meses, o qual pretende reforçar o seu negócio que tem vindo a registar um modesto crescimento.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Zacarias

texts.pt:
Zacarias Chiláuleis married. He is 54 years old and father of 8 children. He has a small store in his home in the neighborhood of Magoanine in Maputo. He raises and sells chicken. He joined the program in November 2006, and requested loan of 3.00mt. He is now in the 3rd cycle of the credit program and is requesting a loan of 8.000mt to be repaid in 6 months. Zacarias has noticed an improvement in the business since he joined the program. He used to be able to raise 400 chicks, now he can raise 1500. He also improved his home with the income.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Zacarias Chiláule vive maritalmente, tem 54 anos de idade e é pai de 8 filhos. Tem o seu negócio e residência no Bairro de Magoanine em Maputo. Cria francos e vende a grosso e a retalho. Está no programa desde Novembro de 2006 e tomou como 1º empréstimo 3.000MT. Vai agora para o terceiro ciclo e vai tomar de empréstimo 8.000MT para pagar em 6 meses. Nota-se um crescimento em termos de negócio e na sua vida pessoal: quando entrou para o programa conseguia criar de cada vez 400 Pintos e agora consegue trabalhar com 1500 ;comprou alguns bens para a sua casa e ampliou a mesma com os lucros do negócio.

loans.use: Improve his business of raising and sellking chicken

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia is married with 3 kids of 19, 14 and 12 years of age. Her husband is a driver for a construction company in the city. She started her business as her husband's salary was not enough to meet their needs, and as their kids were growing up they needed more money too. She therefore decided to contribute to the household by selling used clothes. She started 2 years ago and she originally bought from Villa Hidalgo and then from the USA. She now has a lot of faithful clients and she would like her business to grown even more.

Celia would like a loan of $275 to buy more merchandise so that her business will continue to grow. She will repay it in 6 months. She and her family thank you for the support that you offer so that they can keep going.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Celia es una mujer casada y tiene 3 hijos de 19, 14 y 12 años respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como chofer para una empresa constructora en su ciudad , inició su negocio debido a que con el sueldo de su esposo no le alcanzaba para poder cubrir el gasto familiar, ya que sus hijos iban creciendo y por ende los gastos también, así que decidió hacer algo para colaborar en la economía familiar y hace ya mas de dos años ella empezó vendiendo ropa usada que pudo comprar trayéndola inicialmente de la ciudad de Villa Hidalgo y con el paso del tiempo tuvo la oportunidad de poder proveerse de su mercadería desde los Estados Unidos, ahora ya tiene una clientela fija y desea continuar con su negocio y crecer con el mismo.

Celia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar más mercadería y así continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer poco a poco, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le brindas para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercaderia

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is 50 years old and is single. She has to look after herself, and so 4 years ago she decided to start her own business selling food. She already knew how to make good seasoning and this has helped her business to succeed and grow. She lives off her business and would like it to grow and become more stable so that she can serve her clients better.

Juana would like a loan of $750 which she will repay in 4 months. She will use it to buy raw ingredients and to increase her sales so that she can have her own mexican diner. She thanks you for your support as this is what will make her business succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juana es una mujer soltera de 50 años de edad, ella tiene que ver por su mantenimiento ya que no tiene quien la ayude, hace 4 años atrás ella decidió poner su negocio de comidas ya que es lo que ella sabe hacer y tiene buena sazón para sus comidas, por lo que esto la a ayudado al éxito de su negocio y a crecer con el poco a poco, con su negocio ella puede tener ingresos para su manutención, pero también desea crecer y poder tener un establecimiento fijo y en buen estado para sus comidas y mejorar el trato a sus clientes.

Juana está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 750, que ofrece pagarlo en 6 meses, con el cual invertirá en materia prima e incrementar sus ventas y así poder crecer y llegar a tener su local propio de comidas mexicanas, te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das ya que ella dice que con este apoyo y con sus ganas de trabajar podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy raw materials/Compra de materia prima

loans.name: Mónica Diana

texts.es:
I have over fourteen years dedicated to the business of sewing. This business has given me a way to help my three children advance in life. Thanks to God I have had a lot of work, but I am lacking fabric and thread to finish my orders. I am requesting a loan of $1,000 dollars for the purchase of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Tengo ya mas de 14 años dedicándome a al oficio de la costura. Este negocio me ha dado para sacar a mis tres hijos adelante. Gracias a dios e tenido mucho trabajo pero me esta haciendo falta tela y hilos, para terminar los pedidos que tengo. Solicito un préstamo de $ 1,000.00 Dlls para la compra de mercancía.

loans.use: Purchase thread and fabric.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is 53. She is a mother and a grandmother. For many years she made and sold pork rind snacks, a business she learned from her parents. The business served her well and made it possible for her to raise two children. Now she cares for her 7-year-old granddaughter, who spends every day helping her grandmother. Not long ago, after losing her husband, Graciela faced the need to increase her income and took to raising hogs. She used her savings to buy good breeding stock and hopes now to keep them healthy and growing so she can see some return on her investment. She is asking for a loan of $650 and promises to repay the sum in 6 months. The loan will pay for balanced hog feed. Graciela and her granddaughter await your prompt and favorable response.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Graciela es madre y abuela tiene 53 años y el oficio de la venta de chicharrones al que se dedica desde hace muchos años lo aprendió y heredó de sus padres. Esta actividad le ha dado muchas satisfacciones y gracias a el ha podido educar con mucha satisfacción a sus 2 hijos. Actualmente vive y pasa el mayor tiempo posible con su nietecita de 7 años, quién la acompaña a desarrollar sus actividades de crianza y venta todos los días. Hace poco la separación física de su esposo la alentó a iniciar un negocio aún más rentable, la crianza y venta de cerdos y adquirió algunos ejemplares e inició su proyecto con el ahorro que contaba; ahora su deseo es mantenerlos sanos y fuertes para poder recuperar su inversión e incrementar su capital. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo de 650 dólares con un compromiso de pago durante 6 meses para comprar comida concentrada y balanceada a fin de tenerlos sanos, cuidados y bien alimentados. Graciela y su nietecita aguardan tu pronta respuesta.

loans.use: To buy hog feed.

loans.name: Clotilde Mercedes

texts.es:
Clotilde is the mother of four. She has endeavored in many ways to provide for her family but found that she has a real gift for knitting so she has decided to dedicate more time to it and to perfect her craft. For a long time she only made sweaters and caps for special order but she has now expanded her product line and offers a full range of woolen garments to the public. Her products have been very well received and Clotilde has decided to open a small workshop where customers can come and see the work and place orders. Her dream is to buy another knitting machine and expand her shop, growing it in a short time into a small factory. She is asking for a loan of $350 and promises to repay the sum in 6 months. Clotilde and her family await your generous help.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Clotilde, es madre de 4 hijos su deseo de realizar alguna actividad para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia la llevó por muchos senderos; pero cuando reconoce la habilidad que tenía para la confección de prendas a base de lana decide explotarla y dedicarle mayor tiempo a esta actividad; para perfeccionar sus técnicas. Durante mucho tiempo sólo fabricaba chompas, chullos y gorras a solicitud de sus clientes ahora realiza prendas de todo tipo que ofrece al público en general. La acogida ha sido muy buena y agradable y a consecuencia de este hecho a decidido implementar su pequeño taller para que las personas al visitarla puedan observar las cosas que hace y elaboren sus listas de pedidos. .Ahora el anhelo de Clotilde es adquirir una máquina para tejer más y mejores prendas a fin de que la demanda de sus clientes se incremente y ella pueda ampliar el espacio del taller para convertirlo en poco tiempo en una fábrica. Para este propósito ella solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses.Clotilde y su familia aguardan tu generosa ayuda.

loans.use: To buy a new knitting machine.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
The will to better her two little one's quality of life has made Bernardina sell candies on the street since eleven years ago - because she knew that her husband's daily wages would become more and more insufficient.

Little by little and with a lot of effort she started her business and now she can offer her products in a stable place close to her home. It took her no time to become the neighborhood's favorite candy-lady.

Today,with her experience, she wishes to improve her business' condition and increment her stocks in order to provide her clients with more variety.

In order to start this project, Bernardina requests a loan of $275 dollars and compromises to repay them within six months. Furthermore, she is convinced that, with the extra income she will generate through this project, she will be able to afford a better quality of life for her children.
