Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

El ímpetu por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus dos pequeños hijos ha hecho que Bernardina hace 11 años incursione en la venta de dulces en las calles de la ciudad que habita debido a que el ingreso que le proporcionaba diariamente su esposo cada vez era más insuficiente. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo fue implementando su pequeño negocio y ahora puede ofrecerlo en un lugar estable cerca de su domicilio. Fue poco el tiempo que tardó para convertirse en la favorita de su barrio. Ahora y en base a la experiencia que ha adquirido desea mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y ampliar el stock que tiene para ofrecerles mayor variedad a sus clientes. Para emprender este proyecto Bernardina, solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares con el fin de llevar a cabo su propósito y se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses. Además está convencida de que con el ingreso que genere el incremento de productos podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase products for a candyshop

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a 40 year old mother  and has been running a small grocery shop for the past three years. She owns a shop in Kigogo area, a Dar Es Salaam City suburb, where she sells food items such as rice, cooking oil, maize flour, and cosmetics. She wants to expand her shop, increase stock and start rearing poultry for sale. She is also a recipient of the Youth Self Employment Foundation organized business and entrepreneurship skills training. Anna is in need of $550 to help her expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is a 41 year old mother of four schoolgoing children, all of whom are in secondary school. For the past four years, she has run a shop selling mainly food items such as maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil and others. She also rears poultry to supplement her income. Sophia is a recipient of the Youth Self Employment Foundation organized business and entrepreneurship skills trainings. She is in need of $350 to help her expand her grocery store.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Husna

texts.en: Husna is a 27 year old mother of four living in Buguruni Community. She has been running a business for the past two years and is a recipient of the Youth Self Employment Foundation organized business training sessions. She sells bedsheets, traditional attire (known as 'kanga' and 'Vitenge') and used clothes. She now wants to expand her business and open a bigger shop in Buguruni area, and increase her stock. She is in need of $400 to help her expand her business

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria and her husband have a seven year old boy. They repair bicycles at a small space that they have set up in their rented apartment.

They both wake up early every day in order to attend to their clients. They have a very high demand because most of the people in their area use the bicycle as their main transportation method.

Their repair tools have started to show imperfections and the workshop looks smaller every time.

This is why Maria wants to extend her workshop and acquire more tools to improve their services. She requests for a $275 dollar loan which she compromises to repay within 6 months, in order to start the project and to be able to give their son a better quality of life. Maria and her family look forward to your generous help.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

María y su esposo tienen un niño de 7 años y desempeñan su trabajo diario en un espacio que acondicionaron para reparar bicicletas en un domicilio alquilado hace ya varios años. Todos los días desde muy temprano ambos se preparan para atender a sus clientes; la demanda que tienen es muy alta debido a que la mayoría de las personas en esta localidad utilizan estas herramientas para desplazarse de un lugar a otro. Los instrumentos que utilizan para realizar las reparaciones están presentando desperfectos hace poco y el espacio en el que desempeñan esta labor cada vez se ve más pequeño. Por esta razón María desea ampliar el espacio en el que se encuentra el taller y adquirir nuevas herramientas para mejorar el servicio que ofrece. Su solicitud es por un monto de 275 dólares que se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses a fin de iniciar su proyecto y poder brindarle con los ingresos que genere esta actividad una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo. María y su familia esperan tu generosa ayuda.

loans.use: More tools and better distribution for Maria's workshop

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a 41 year old father of four, living in Buguruni area in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Juma has been running a used clothes sales business for the past five years. He and his wife run their shop, located in Buguruni area and their business booms during festival seasons. He has also received training in organized business and entrepreneurship skills from Youth Self Employment. He is in need of $350 to help him boost his business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is married and has 2 kids of 7 and 9 years of age. Her husband works as a messenger, and as he works on commission sometimes his wages are not enough to meet their household needs. Juana therefore decided to help out with their income, and 3 years ago she started to help someone to sell their products, earning commission. She then decided to go it alone and, with the financial help of her sister, started her own business selling bedclothes and towels. It has gone very well and she has a lot of clients which helps her earn more for her home.

Juana would like a loan of $325 to buy merchandise so that her business will continue to grow. She will repay it in 3 months. Her and her family thank you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Juana es una mujer casada y tiene dos hijos de 7y 9 años de edad respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa de mensajería, ella inició con su negocio, por que a su esposo le pagaban por comisiones y lo que ganaba era muy poco para mantener su hogar, así que ella decidió ayudarlo con los gastos del hogar y empezó hace 3 años ayudándole a una persona a vender sus productos y ganaba una comisión por la venta, así que decidió independizarse, una de sus hermanas le presto un pequeño capital para que empiece con su negocio de venta de blancos que son ropa de cama y toallas, y ahora con el tiempo ha ido mejorando con su negocio y a tener más clientes, lo que le permite obtener un mejor ingreso para su hogar.

Juana está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 325 para poder comprar mercadería y así poder continuar y crecer con su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho por tu apoyo en su crecimiento.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Comprar mercaderia

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha is separated and has 4 kids. The youngest two (24 and 19 years odl) live with her. Her husband abandoned them 15 years ago and, in order to raise their kids, she had to start working. She decided to start selling used clothes and her employer at the time (she was a domestic employee) gave her the financial backing to start her business. She originally got clothes from her employer, but then she became independent. She now has many clients and she has been able to bring up her kids. It is a lot of effort, but she wants to keep going so that her 2 youngest can finish their education.

Bertha would like a loan of $325 to buy merchandise so that her business can grow and go forward. She will repay it in 3 months. She thanks you for your support.

Translated by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Bertha es una mujer separada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 2 viven con ella y son los más pequeños de 24 y 19 años de edad, su esposo los abandono hace 15 años atrás y fue por eso que para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos se vio en la necesidad de trabajar y decidió poner su negocio de venta de ropa usada, ella empezó como empleada doméstica y su patrona fue la que la ayudo con algo de dinero para que ella pudiera comenzar con su negocio y así lo hizo, ya que inicialmente ella le conseguía la ropa a su patrona, pero luego se independizo, ahora ella a tiene varios clientes y ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos con su esfuerzo, pero desea continuar con su negocio para terminar de educar a sus dos últimos hijos.

Bertha está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 325 para poder comprar más mercadería y así poder continuar con su negocio y salir adelante como lo ha ido haciendo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercaderia

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.en:
Juana María O. has lived with her husband and 3 children in their present home for the past 2 years. They built the house together in a remote area of the Yamasa township…("El Ranchito" community, some 30 minutes away, over very rough terrain).

In order to make a living, the family depends mostly on Juana’s mosquito net fabrication facilities, which presently renders an income of some USD$300 equivalency a month (this equates to less than USD$2 /p.per day, usually quoted by the U.N. as the cut-off point for ‘extreme poverty’). 

Her Mosquito nets are mostly sold in the capital city of Santo Domingo; cost of her raw materials range from USD$125-150 equivalency per hundredweight (100 pounds) approximately, depending upon the quality of the cloth she gets. Normally she will buy cloth of different colors, which characterize the end mosquito net product she turns out.  Normally a net will weight approximately 1 pound/unit, and will sell for anywhere from USD$3 to 4, depending on volume of nets bought by customer (usually sells to wholesale buyer). These numbers will give her about a 100% return on her sales, which is a usual margin for these products.

She has applied for a USD$375 loan which will allow her to buy about 3 times what she has been able to presently. This will allow her to do some USD$700 a month worth of her business' net income. As well, she plans to be able to fix a motorcycle which her husband would use in order to transport her to town, where she can sell her product. Otherwise the cost of going to the city is about another 3 times what it will cost them to furnish their own transportation facilities (usually some USD$5 –two way, per person). Since the family wouldn’t be able to feed themselves with the present level of income, when we visited her home for the Kiva reporting purposes interview, we noticed the husband was feeding the youngest child with a cow’s milk. Upon questioning, they reportedly own the cow. Additionally they are able to supplement their income with her husbands’ nearby some 20 orange tree plantation.

loans.use: To purchas mosquito making cloth and fix motorcycle.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando is married; his wife is a homemaker and they have 2 children who are 6 and 4, respectively. He has always been a hard worker, someone who started at an early age helping his family with their clothing business and contributing his earnings to them from the time he was 15. When he married, his expenses increased and he had to strike out on his own to build a business that would support his own family. With the help of his father, he started his own clothing-sales business and his wife helped him in her spare time. His business has grown little by little but he wants to continue to grow in order to give his young children a good education and a better quality of life.

Fernando is asking for a US$750 loan to buy merchandise for his business so that he can continue to grow it. He offers to repay the loan in 6 months. He and his family are very grateful for the support you are providing to help them get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Fernando es un hombre casado y su esposa se dedica a su hogar, ellos tienen 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años respectivamente, él es un hombre muy trabajador, que empezó desde chico ayudando a su familia que también se dedicaba a la venta de ropa y el desde los 15 años estuvo apoyándolos, cuando se caso sus gastos se incrementaron y tuvo que independizarse y tener un negocio para poder mantener a su familia, así con la ayuda de su padre, empezó con la venta de ropa por su cuenta y su esposa le ayuda en sus ratos libres , y como sabe del negocio lo ha hecho crecer poco a poco, pero desea continuar creciendo para poder brindarles a sus pequeños hijos una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Fernando solicita un préstamo por US $ 750 para poder surtir su negocio y comprar mercadería y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia están muy agradecidos por tu apoyo ayudándolo a salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Norma Alicia

texts.es:
Norma lives with her partner. She decided to set up her own business when she had the opportunity to get a "traspaso de negocio"; in other words, someone offered to give her the business for a nominal investment and she took it. Little by little, her hard work and dedication has increased the size of her small grocery business, something that has helped her to get ahead and improve her family's quality of life. She very much likes running a business and she wants to continue growing it.

Norma is asking for a US$475 loan that she offers to repay in 6 months. She will use the loan to buy merchandise for her business so that she can offer a wide range of goods to her customers. She thanks you for helping her continue to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma es una mujer que vive en unión libre con su pareja y decidió poner su propio negocio por que tuvo la oportunidad de obtener un traspaso de negocio, es decir, le ofrecieron darle el negocio a una mínima inversión y lo tomó, con un esfuerzo inicial, pero poco a poco lo ha hecho crecer con mucho trabajo y dedicación al mismo, su tienda de abarrotes le ha ayudado a salir adelante y poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y a ella le gusta mucho el comercio, por ello desea continuar con su negocio y seguir haciéndolo crecer.

Norma solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 que ofrece pagar en 6 meses, ella utilizará el préstamo para compra de mercadería para su negocio y así poder ofrecer más surtido a sus clientes, ella te agradece mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

texts.en: E. is member of Yamida. She lives in Cariu in Bogor and is a widow with one child. To provide for her family, she is running a business selling food and soft drinks. From her business, she earns $90 per month. She has four years of experience in running her business. Now she needs a $100 loan to expand the business. She will use $30 to buy more goods, $50 to buy food materials, and $20 to buy beverages. The loan will elevate her earnings so that her life will be better.

loans.use: To purchase more food materials and beverages

texts.en: T. (34) is a member of Yamida. She lives with her husband and two children. To supplement her husband's earnings, she is selling food and soft drinks in her place. She has six years of experience running this business, and she believes that it will be a good business. From the business she earns $2, and her husband earns $50 per month. Now she would like to expand the business, so she needs to borrow $100 to increase her earnings with additional products.

loans.use: To buy more products to run her business

loans.name: Fausto Antonio

texts.es:
"The condition of my house's roof is now very insecure due to the humidity that is in all our walls, which is also causing ilnesses in my family." I am requesting $1200 to waterproof the roof of my home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Las condiciones en las que esta el techo de mi casa ya son muy inseguras ya que la humedad esta por todas la paredes y provoca enfermedades para mi familia”. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para impermeabilizar el techo de mi casa.

loans.use: Waterproof house's roof

loans.name: Valentina Paulina

texts.es:
Agriculture and cattle are two of the activities that Valentina performs and she has great knowledge about. The dedication and effort that she put into them had to be put on a second plane when her husband suffered a terrible accident that left him disabled for twelve years.

Valentina made him receive innumerable treatments for him to recover his vitality and his desire to continue fighting, next to her, for her children.

Due to this unfortunate accident all the advances they had made from their joint work got reduced. Now, regardless of all the tough and sad moments they lived through, they have decided to start their business of agriculture and cattle to give their family a better quality of life.

Valentina is therefore requesting a $200 dollar loan that she compromises to return within six months. Valentina and her family thank and hope for your generous support.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

La agricultura y ganadería son dos de las actividades que desempeña Valentina y de las cuales posee amplio conocimiento. La dedicación, empeño y esfuerzo que les había consagrado durante mucho tiempo, pasó a segundo plano cuando su esposo tuvo un terrible accidente que lo dejó inhabilitado por 12 años. Valentina hizo que recibiera innumerables tratamientos a fin de que recuperará su vitalidad y deseos de seguir luchando, junto a ella, por sus hijos. Debido a este infortunado hecho es que los avances que obtuvieron con el trabajo conjunto, se vieron disminuidos y ahora a pesar de los momentos muy tristes por los que tuvieron que atravesar, han decidido iniciar después de 12 años el proyecto de repotenciar su negocio agrícola y ganadero para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. A raíz de este hecho es que ella hace una solicitud de 200 dólares para impulsar su propósito con ayuda de su esposo e hijos y se compromete a retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Valentina y su familia agradecen y esperan tu generoso apoyo.

loans.use: Potentiating agriculture and cattle activities

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
"I still need to build a security fence for the side of my house that will give more security to my family, because there have been lots of robberies in the neighborhood where we live. Also, I would like to buy some blocks to make a little room in the back part of my home." I am requesting $500 to put up a fence and buy blocks to make a little room."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Me hace falta levantar la barda que esta al lado de mi casa para darle más seguridad a mi familia, ya que han robado mucho en ese fraccionamiento en donde vivimos, también me gustaría comprar algunos blocks para hacer un cuarto pequeño en la parte de atras”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner una barda y comprar blocks para hacer un cuarto.

loans.use: Build a fence for security and buy construction blocks.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
"I would like to build a protective fence around my house to give more protection to my family and primarily for my children." I am requesting $500 to make this fence for my home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Me gustaría hace una barda en mi casa para darle más protección a mi familia pero principalmente a mis hijos”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para hacer una barda en mi casa.

loans.use: Construct a protective fence.

loans.name: Laura Lorena

texts.es:
"Due to the lack of money, I have not been able to put a roof on three rooms in my home. I would like to complete that construction so that we can live in those rooms because my house is very small." I request $1,200 to finish the construction on my home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Debido a la falta de dinero no he podido poner el techo en tres cuartos de mi casa y me gustaria terminar esa construcción para poder habitar esos cuartos ya que mi casa es muy pequeña” Solicito $1, 200.00 dlls para poder terminar la construcción en mi vivienda”.

loans.use: Concrete roof for three rooms.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
"I hope to build a protective fence around my home because I have little kids and I feel that they would be safer this way." I am requesting $500 dollars to put up this fence.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Tengo la intención de levantar una barda en mi vivienda ya que tengo hijos pequeños y siento que estarían más seguros” Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner una barda en mi vivienda

loans.use: Construct a protective fence.

loans.name: Irma Eugenia

texts.es:
Irma and her husband cultivate their lands. This has been their sole source of family sustenance. By selling their crops, they have been able to give their children an excellent education.

Irma's children are still studying in college at their country's capitol city. Irma and her husband miss their children and they often travel to and from their lands to visit them and enjoy some moments of their company.

Due to these travels, they've seen the need to increase their products' quantity and quality. They want to be able to increase their commercial action radius and sell their products in the city where their offspring is currently living.

Irma is requesting a $200 dollar loan which she compromises to return within 6 months. She wants to be able to start this project and thanks in advance your uninterested generosity.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma y su esposo, cultivan sus tierras y desde hace muchos años este ha sido el único sustento familiar, con las ganancias que obtenían por la venta de los productos que cosechaban les brindaron a sus hijos las herramientas necesarias para que tuvieran una excelente educación. Ellos en la actualidad siguen estudios universitarios en la ciudad capital de su país y por la falta que les hacen constantemente Irma y su esposo se desplazan a este lugar a fin de visitarlos y poder disfrutar algunos momentos en su compañía. Debido a este hecho es que se han visto en la necesidad de mejorar la cantidad y calidad de sus productos; a fin de poder ofrecerlos también en la ciudad donde se encuentran sus retoños para ampliar su radio de acción comercial. Por esta razón, Irma solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses para iniciar el desarrollo de su proyecto y agradece desde este momento tu desinteresada generosidad

loans.use: Bettering the quality and quantity of the offered products and increasing their commercial action radius

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla is married. Her husband is employed and they have two small children, a 3-year old and a 6-month old. She started her business three years ago when her husband was unemployed and they couldn't cover household expenses. Her sister-in-law, a street vendor, offered to make Perla her assistant, and once Perla learned the basics of street vending, she struck out on her own. Now she is also a street vendor, selling clothes and footwear, and she's been doing very well now that she has a list of regular customers. She's a hard-working woman and she wants to keep on growing with her customers and her business.

Perla is asking for a US$325 loan to be able to buy seasonal merchandise for her business and, in that way, continue to grow it. That will provide her with a way to improve her children's quality of life and to look ahead to future expenses that will grow as her children get older. She offers to repay the loan in 5 months. She's very grateful for the help that you're giving her to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Perla es casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado y tienen dos hijos pequeños de 3 años uno y el otro de 6 meses, ella inicio con su negocio hace tres años atrás cuando su esposo quedo desempleado y no podían cubrir los gastos del hogar, fue así como ella decidió ayudar a su esposo y su cuñada la invito a vender con ella como su ayudante y luego ella aprendió y se independizo y ahora ella vende ropa y calzado y le ha ido bien ya que ahora tiene una cartera de clientes fijos y ella desea seguir creciendo con sus clientes y su negocio ya que ella es una mujer muy trabajadora.

Perla esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 325 para poder comprar mercadería de temporada para su negocio y así poder continuar con el mismo y crecer para ofrecerle una mejor calida de vida a sus niños y poder enfrentar los gastos futuros que se incrementan cuando los niños crecen, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella te agradece mucho en el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y como emprendedora.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Rodelia Admira

texts.es:
Rodelia is a mother who has had innumerable obstacles to tackle.

Soon after she got married, she suffered the terrible loss of her husband. After being able to overcome her sorrow, she got engaged again. Things were going very well with her second husband. Their love for each other gave them 4 little ones. However, when everything at home was reaching a true stability, destiny had another obstacle for her.

The man who Rodelia thought loved her so much ran away with her children and Rodelia's sister. Until then, Rodelia had been in charge of the field labor. Obtaining the fruit of the earth without hurry nor pressure. Today, she has a goal who is soaked in love: to increase her potato sowing and increase her cheese production so she can offer them to her clients. In this way, she can save some money to go find her children.

Her inmense motherly love motivates her every day to achieve her goal. She is asking for $500 dollars which she commits to pay back within 6 months. Rodelia is sharing her goals with you. She is coming to you to help her dream come true. Lets help make Rodelia enjoy many joyful moments next to her little children.

Translated by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Rodelia, es una madre que ha tenido innumerables obstáculos que sobrepasar. A poco tiempo de haberse casado sufrió la pérdida de su esposo; posteriormente y luego de haber superado tan terrible pena, decidió comprometerse una vez más; con su segundo esposo, las cosas marchaban muy bien y fruto del amor; tuvieron 4 pequeños. Sin embargo cuando ya creía que las cosas en el interior de su hogar habían cobrado verdadera estabilidad. El destino le tenía preparado un obstáculo más .El hombre que pensaba la amaba mucho; huyó llevándose a sus hijos en compañía de la hermana de Rodelia. Hasta ese entonces ella realizaba sus labores en el campo, obteniendo la producción de su tierra en menor escala y sin ninguna premura o presión. Ahora tiene un objetivo empapado de puro amor; incrementar su siembra de papa en el campo y elaborar mayor número de quesos para poder ofrecérselos a sus clientes. De esta manera afianzaría la suma de dinero ahorrada y podría ir en búsqueda de sus pequeños. Su inmenso amor de madre la motiva día a día para alcanzar su meta; su pedido es por un monto de 500 dólares que se compromete a devolverlos en un período de 6 meses. Habiendo hecho de su conocimiento el propósito que se ha trazado recurre a ustedes a fin de hacer realidad su deseo. Hagamos que Rodelia pueda disfrutar muchos momentos llenos de alegría junto a sus pequeños niños.

loans.use: Increase potato and cheese production to be able to look for her missing children

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Julian is married and his wife is a homemaker. Starting very young, he learned baking and pastry skills from the grandmother who raised him. He helped her in any way that he could and when she died, he took over her business and helped to support his 3 siblings. That was 10 years ago and, in that time, he has pulled the business forward and helped his siblings to get ahead. He's a very hard worker and now he wants to grow his business and clear his family's expenses. He's placing his hopes on your support.

Julian asks for a US$650 loan to buy basic ingredients that will help him to continue his business. He offers to repay the loan in 6 months. He and his family thank you for the support that you're giving them and he knows that with this help, he will be able to continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Julian es un hombre casado y su esposa se dedica al hogar como ama de casa, él desde muy pequeño aprendió lo que es la panadería y repostería por su abuela con quien se crió, y la ayudaba en todo lo que el podía, cuando su abuela murió el se hizo cargo del negocio y ayudaba a mantener a sus 3 hermanos, esto sucedió hace 10 años atrás, así el ha sacado adelante el negocio y ayudado a sus hermanos a salir adelante, es muy trabajador y desea crecer con su negocio y poder solventar los gastos de su familia, y por ello tiene mucha esperanza en su apoyo.

Julian solicita un préstamo por US $ 650 para comprar materia prima y continuar con su negocio, ofreciendo pagar este préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le das y sabe que con este apoyo podrá continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy basic ingredients for bakery business.

loans.name: Galu

texts.en: Galu is a married mother of four. Her business is bingo, run by her with help from her sisters. She is one of the founding members of the centre at Ulumasinave, which opened in 2005. She is applying for another loan of $500.00 to help her with the school fees for her kids and other family necessities, as well as to buy supplies for the bingo.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the bingo

loans.name: Fiti

texts.en:
Fiti V. belongs to Mulivai Leauvaa centre. She is a strong married mother of nine kids. She was employed at one of the companies in Apia but she resigned because of so many kids, no one look after them.

Fiti gets more money from selling cocoa to the village and shops in town than the pay she gets for a week. She brings in 1-2 bags of cocoa once a week for sale and she gets $100.00-$120.00. She uses that money to pay school fees, family expenses, and for her business.

loans.use: To buy more chemicals, knives, fertilizers, and a crowbar

loans.name: Fialelei

texts.en: Fialelei is a married mother of eight children, who lives at Leloto Leauvaa. She is now 56 years old. She is the one who started the centre with just twelve members but now it has been extended to twenty-eight ladies. She is also the centre chief. Her business is selling ice cake and she gets $40.00-$60.00 a week from it.

loans.use: To buy cordial, a freezer, and sugar

loans.name: Faataape

texts.en: Faataape P. has been a member of Mulivai Leauvaa centre for a long time. She is now 63 years old. She has a very big banana plantation worked by her husband and some of her sons. She joined our program in 2006 when she needed help for her family and her plantation. She plans to pay off her loan of $300.00 and then apply for another loan of $500.00 to buy more stuff for her plantation and for her family expenses.

loans.use: To buy more chemicals, knives, and fertilizers

loans.name: Faaea

texts.en: Faaea has been a member of Mulivai Leauvaa centre for a long time. She is now 65 years old, but still has a feeling of wanting to support her family by doing her own gardening as a business, plus the help from her sons who work a taro plantation. Faaea sells 10-15 pineapples a day to the people of her own village and she goes to the market to sell more twice a month.

loans.use: To purchase gardening supplies

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Asia is a mother of 10 from the village of Asau Savaii, but married to a business man from Mulivai Leauvaa. She joined our program in 2006 when she needed help for her business. She is now applying for another loan to help buy more inventory for her shop and to pay her children's school fees. Asia is the best saver in our centre and a very good supporter for doing the centre's guarantees.

loans.use: To restock her shop and for school fees

loans.name: Julia Ernestina

texts.es:
Julia is a selfless working mother and grandmother who cares for her family. For many years she has worked, providing and education and clothing to her children since they have been in the home. Despite her advanced age, together with her husband she continues to create cheese and milk from the cows that have provided economic stability since they were purchased many years ago. Now, through her daily labor she is able to provide food and sustenance to her young grandchildren. For this reason, Julia wishes to obtain an additional cow to increase her production so that she can continue to support the beloved descendants of her children. She is requesting a $325 loan, which she has committed to repay within 6 months. She also plans on planting a potato crop in 3 months with the earnings that she obtains from milk production. With your assistance, Julia will be able to keep helping to provide for her children and grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Julia, es una madre y abuelita trabajadora, abnegada y preocupada por su familia. Que a pesar de la avanzada edad que tiene aún realiza, junto a su esposo, la actividad que por muchos años les ha otorgado educación y vestido a sus hijos, cuando estos se encontraban en el seno familiar, la fabricación de quesos y venta de leche que obtienen gracias a las vaquitas que compraron hace muchos años les ha podido otorgar estabilidad. y ahora a través del desarrollo diario de esta tarea pueden brindarles comida y bienestar a sus pequeños nietos .Es por ello que Julia, desea adquirir una vaquita más para poder ampliar su producción a fin de seguir apoyando a los queridos descendientes de sus hijos. La solicitud para llevar a cabo este deseo es por un monto de 325 dólares con un compromiso de pago durante 6 meses y también está en sus proyectos a mediano plazo iniciar el cultivo de papa con las ganancias que obtenga por la producción de leche. Julia puede seguir ayudando a sus hijos y nietos, no te olvides, ella te necesita

loans.use: The purchase of an additional cow will help Julia to continue supporting her beloved children and grandchildren

loans.name: Hayde Lourdes

texts.es:
Hayde has three school-aged daughters. She creates her sweaters, shawls, hats and other items at home so that she can give ample attention to the task of raising her little girls. Over time, her hard work has given her some notoriety throughout the city as a fine weaver. Because of the quality of her sweaters, and the varied designs of her bedspreads the number of orders from her clientele continues to increase. Hayde would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials to build up her stock of products and to meet the demands of her clients. To do this, she is asking for a $325 loan, which she has committed to repay within 6 months. With this investment she will increase sales and be able to continue to supply her current clientele, in order to increase the quality of life for her family. Hayde and her daughters await your help to begin development of this project.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Hayde tiene tres niñas todas en edad escolar. Debido a ello es que sus actividades de confección de chompas, chalinas, gorras y demás las realiza dentro de su hogar a fin de no descuidar la atención que le demanda la crianza de sus pequeñas. Durante mucho tiempo su ardua labor a hecho que su fama de excelente tejedora se extienda por la ciudad debido a la calidad de sus chalinas y diversos diseños de sus colchas sus clientes cada vez le hacen mayor cantidad de pedidos y el deseo de Hayde es invertir en la compra de materia prima para aumentar el stock de sus productos y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello su solicitud haciende a un monto de 325 dólares, los cuales se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses. Con esta inversión para aumentar la venta además de beneficiar a su exigente cartera de clientes podrá elevar la calidad de vida de su familia. Hayde y sus niñas esperan tu pronta ayuda para iniciar el desarrollo de este proyecto

loans.use: The manufacture of more sweaters and bedspreads will help Hayde to fulfill her clients' orders and improve her daughters' quality of life.

loans.name: Fonofaavae

texts.en:
Fonofaavae F. is a woman of forty-six years of age. She’s married with six kids and all of them depend on her for survival. In order to earn her living, Fonofaavae owns a small business of “elei printing.” She’s being doing this for years and she says she is able to earn enough money so that she and her family can depend on it.

Fonofaavae delivers her products to various shops in town and within her own area. She appreciates the help of S.P.B.D, lending her the money so that she can develop her business in order to gain more income from it. She is also thankful for her husband's and kids' support since they help out with her production during their free time.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for textile printing

payments.comment: SPBD is pleased to report that due to the success of Fonofaavae's business, she was able to repay her loan ahead of the loan term. Her success was greatly due to exporting her Elei materials to relatives and friends in New Zealand who were willing to pay a premium for her fine merchandise. She is a dedicated member of SPBD and is currently applying for another increased loan. She is thankful for the marketing and budgeting assistance that SPBD provides. Thank you Kiva Lenders for your loans and support for her and her family!

loans.name: Maria Clorinda

texts.es:
Maria is married and her husband works at a gas station. They don't have children. She owns a traditional grocery store that her sister opened to help with household expenses and was expanding with the help of their father who owned the house. Over time, they expanded the business and now she operates it. The business helps maintain the whole family. They began selling from a counter at the front of the house, then expanded into the yard and added a roof to make the store more appealing and sell more goods. Her business demonstrates what work can do to propel someone forward.

Maria is asking for a US$200 loan to buy merchandise and keep the business growing. She's offering to repay the loan in 3 months. She and her family thank you for the support that you're giving her to be able to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta casada, y su esposo trabaja como empleado en una gasolinera, no tienen hijos, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, la cual inicio su hermana para ayudar con los gastos de su casa y lo fue ampliando con ayuda de su papá que fue el dueño inicial, con el tiempo ellos ampliaron el negocio y ahora ella lo maneja y les ayuda para la manutención de toda su familia, empezaron vendiendo en una mesita en la entrada de su casa, y luego lo fueron ampliando al jardín y luego ya como les fue mejor techaron para poner su tienda más formal y vender más productos, su negocio muestra como con trabajo se puede salir adelante.

María está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para comprar mercadería y continuar con su crecimiento, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen por la ayuda que le das para poder continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Mrs. Dora O. is 46 years old, is married to Mr. Angel Espinoza (also 46 years old), and has three children: a 26-year-old who works in a communications company, and a 17-year-old and a 14-year-old who are both in high school. Dora´s husband drives a bus for a public transit company to help support the family.

Dora has had her sewing workshop since 1986, wherein she has tailored wearable garments such as shirts, skirts, pants, and blouses. She learned her profession working in a Korean-owned sewing shop in ¨”Market 4,” Asuncion´s largest and most bustling public market.

Dora wishes to invest the loan she has requested in the purchase of a new variety of fabrics and sewing materials such as threads and buttons, all for the production of clothing garments. In doing so, she will be able to meet the growing demands of her clients who are eager to purchase her high-quality products.

loans.use: Purchase linens and materials such as thread and buttons

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi A.-C. is a hard-working woman who scarcely rests from working with her husband at developing their plantation business. She is thirty years old and has four children and they are all attending school.

Striking hard for a better future for her children, Naomi sells anything from her plantation in order to make money. Products like bananas, coconuts, taro, and yams are what she sells at the market in town where most people come to buy. She uses her loans to buy equipment to help her make her work easier and faster. She earns more than a hundred tala (about US$ 40) a day from her selling. Naomi much appreciates the help of S.P.B.D for women who need a boost toward developing their micro-businesses.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for her little farm

loans.name: Reydo Enedino

texts.es:
Reydo is an optimistic, hardworking father. He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. In spite of the problems that his young daughter Melady experiences, Reydo perseveres with hard work and dedication to his crops. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. By doing this he can keep saving to continue the treatment of his child in the capital, so that she can accompany him doing what she loves, healthy and strong. He would like to increase the amount of vegetables which he plants so that he can meet his clients’ needs, give a better live to Melady, and optimize her treatment in the capital city of his country. He is requesting a 275 loan which he has committed to repay within 6 months. With the desire to realize his plan, Reydo appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Reydo, es un padre optimista y muy trabajador, trabaja sus tierras con cariño y dedicación todos los días para que produzca excelentes vegetales, a pesar de los problemas por los que atraviesa su pequeña Melady, Reydo no pierde el empeño y dedicación por su cultivo. Al contrario este hecho le otorga mayor fuerza y vitalidad para hacer de sus productos los mejores de su ciudad; de esta manera podrá seguir ahorrando para continuar con el tratamiento de su niña en la capital a fin de que ella mañana pueda acompañarlo a realizar la actividad que tanto ama, sanita y con muchas fuerzas .Su deseo es incrementar la cantidad de siembra de vegetales para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, otorgarle una mejor calidad de vida a Melady y optimizar su tratamiento en un hospital de la ciudad capital de su país. Por ello solicita la suma de 275 dólares que se compromete a retornarlos es un período de 6 meses. Con el deseo de llevar a cabo su propósito, Reydo, apela a sus generosos corazones para recibir pronta acogida.

loans.use: An increase in vegetable planting can help Reydo and Melady to improve their quality of life.

loans.name: Magda Adelia

texts.es:
Magda is married. Her husband works at an auto supply store and they have three children who are 12 years, 6 years and 10 months old. Her 12-year old daughter helps her with the business. She began the business more than a year ago when her husband was under-employed, driving a cab but not bringing in much money. She needed to clear the family's expenses so a relative gave her a small loan to set up a business selling sweets and cold drinks in the living room of her house, just to neighbors at first, but then expanding little by little.

Magda is asking for a US$325 loan to buy merchandise for her business and to continue growing it. She's offering to repay the loan in 3 months. She and her family thank you for supporting her growing business and for improving their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Magda es una mujer casada y su esposo trabaja como empleado en una tienda de venta de accesorios para automóvil, ellos tienen tres pequeños hijos de 12 años, 6 años y 10 meses de edad, siendo su hija de 12 años la que le ayuda en su negocio. Ella empezó con su negocio hace más de un año, cuando su esposo no tenia empleo fijo, ya que en ocasiones él manejaba un taxi y no obtenía muchos ingresos y necesitaba solventar los gastos de su familia, fue por ello que un familiar le presto un pequeño capital para que ella pusiera su negocio y empezó vendiendo dulces y sodas en la sala de su casa para solo sus vecinos, luego fue creciendo y amplió su negocio poco a poco.

Magda esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 325 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y continuar creciendo con el mismo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, ella y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo para continuar creciendo y poder salir adelante con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise V. is a middle-aged woman who works very hard for her family's living. She is thirty-three years of age and has five children. She lives together with her five children and her husband. Loise says that because of her husband's help, everything is easy for her. All of their five children are attending school.

Loise's micro-business is a vegetable garden. It is her talent from God to be good at growing green vegetables and other such things from which she earns a living. She plans to use her loan from S.P.B.D to buy more materials needed to develop and promote her micro-business. She praises and thanks S.P.B.D for lending her the money because without it, she would not be able to fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies for gardening

loans.name: Tafaga

texts.en:
Tafaga F. is a woman of forty-six years of age, currently living at Fagalii-Uta with her kids. Unfortunately, her husband passed away. She is now putting herself together to start up a business to cater for her family's needs. She’s confident in what’s she’s doing even though she struggles a great deal but she’s putting an effort into it.

Tafaga decided to have a plantation because she believes she will earn more money from it. She plans to use her loan from S.P.B.D to buy equipment to use to make her work easier. She sells her goods, e.g., taro, bananas, breadfruits, yams and such at the market. She earns more than a hundred and fifty tala (about US$ 60) a day.

loans.use: To purchase planting equipment

loans.name: Martha Silvia

texts.es:
Martha is a hard-working, entrepeneurial woman. She's single and works as a teacher but her salary is too small to be able to have a good quality of life. Since she likes selling, she began looking around for a suitable product and finally decided to sell from catalogs. A relative, seeing her ambition to get ahead, loaned her the money to get started. She's had the business for two years now, selling first to friends, then to co-workers and relatives, and now she has customers who have been referred to her by others.

Martha is asking for a US$375 loan to buy more products so that she has them on hand to show, making them easier to sell than simply showing them in a catalog. She's offering to repay the loan in 6 months. She very much appreciates the support that you're giving her to be able to go on and grow her business and to grow as an entrepeneur.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, esta soltera y trabaja como maestra, pero su sueldo es muy pequeño para poder tener una calidad de vida mejor, fue por ello que como le gustan mucho las ventas empezó a averiguar en que podía incursionar y se decidió a la venta por catálogo, un familiar al ver su empeño y ganas de salir adelante le presto un dinero para que pudiera con sus ventas y fue así como empezó con el negocio, ya tiene con su negocio aproximadamente dos años primero empezó vendiendo a sus amigos y luego a sus compañeras de trabajo y familiares y ahora ya tiene más clientes por recomendaciones.

Martha esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 375 para comprar más productos y tenerlos físicamente que se venden mejor a la vista que por catálogo, ofreciendo pagar el crédito en 6 meses, ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le das para poder continuar y crecer con su negocio y como emprendedora.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Victor Vidal

texts.es:
Victor and his wife, beginning very early in the morning every day, head out to cultivate their land in order to harvest excellent crops. Their two children decided to try their hand in the capital and now work in a textile mill. The knowledge and skill they have acquired over time has motivated them to want to undertake this business with their parents. Therefore, Victor wants to increase his sowing capacity in order to, with the yield generated from selling the corn he grows on his land, begin constructing a textile mill with his family's help. He is asking for a loan in the amount of 650 dollars. He will invest 100 percent of this money in his fields. He promises to repay the loan in 6 months and then will realize his family's dream of constructing a family textile mill. Victor and his family wait for your speedy action.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Víctor junto a su esposa y desde muy temprano todos los días, salen a cultivar sus tierras. Para obtener excelentes productos. Sus dos únicos hijos decidieron abrirse camino en la capital y hoy trabajan en una fábrica textil; el conocimiento y dominio que adquirieron con el tiempo los motivó a querer emprender este negocio junto a sus padres. Por ello el deseo de Víctor es incrementar la siembra con el propósito de que a través de los réditos que le genere la venta de maíz que siembra en sus tierras, iniciar la construcción del proyecto textil con la ayuda de su familia. Por ello solicita un préstamo de 650 dólares que los invertirá netamente en sus sembríos con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses para concretar el anhelo de construir su fábrica textil familiar. Víctor y su familia esperan tu pronto apoyo.

loans.use: Increased sowing will generate increased income in order to undertake the construction of a family textile mill

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en:
Fetu L. is a talented young woman of thirty-eight years of age. She is married and has four kids. Before they started their family, they were struggling so hard trying to get money to put their children through school. Finally they have what they'd been dreaming of, a small business of their own to support their family.

They now work very hard to plant many vegetables as they can earn more money. They sell their vegetables at the market and at their village shops. Fetu L. earns a good deal of money, almost two hundred tala (US$ 80) only from her selling each day. She plans to use her loan to buy vegetable seeds, bush knives, and gloves to make her work easier.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, knives, and gloves

loans.name: Pele

texts.en:
Pele A. is forty-seven and lives in Fagalii-Uta with her eight children and her loving husband. Three of her children above the age of twenty are working and the other five are in school.

Pele’s philosophy is you eat from your own hands, meaning you work for your own food and to feed your children. Pele and her husband strive hard to plant more bananas, taro, etc,. to sell at the market to earn their living. They are happy about having their own business. They earn hundred tala (about US$ 40) a day from her selling.

loans.use: To purchase planting equipment

loans.name: Sose

texts.en:
Sose F. is a young woman with a strong heart, searching for a way to help her family. She’s twenty-eight years of age and lives with her four children. Her husband is in New Zealand working; he sends over money to help her business and the kids.

Sose enjoys her work. She goes to her vegetable garden, one of her family lands she’s using for her business. She sells different kinds of vegetables such as cabbages, tomatoes, pumpkins, and peas at the market. She gets hundred tala (about US$ 40) a day from her selling. She’s thankful to S.P.B.D for making this business for her possible. Her purpose for this loan is to buy more seeds to plant and buy equipment to make her work much easier.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and planting equipment

loans.name: Alegría

texts.es:
The desire to actively contribute to his family's income during his free time has led Alegria to gain experience in selling fresh fish to his community. He begins very early in an air-conditioned space outside his home so that he can work and take care of household chores without any problem. Thanks to the income that his daily efforts generate, he can satisfy his household's most pressing needs and keep his family happy. Because keeping his product in optimal selling condition is essential, Alegria wants to purchase a freezer for his fish in order to sell hygienic fish in good condition. This is why he is requesting a 400 dollar loan that he promises to repay in 6 months. With your generous help, you can help make Alegria's dream a reality. Alegria and his family appreciate your support.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

El deseo de contribuir activamente en sus momentos libres, con el ingreso familiar ha llevado a Alegría a adquirir experiencia en la venta de pescados frescos a su comunidad. Esta actividad la desarrolla desde muy temprano en un espacio acondicionado en las afueras de su vivienda de esa manera puede trabajar y atender las labores de su hogar sin dificultad. Gracias al ingreso que genera su desempeño diario puede satisfacer las necesidades más urgentes de su hogar y mantener a su familia contenta.debido a que es imprescindible tener este producto en condiciones óptimas para la venta, es que Alegría desea adquirir una máquina para congelar los pescados con el propósito de ofrecerlos con higiene y en buen estado. Por esta razón ella solicita un préstamo de 400 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Con tu generosa ayuda podrás hacer que este deseo se convierta en realidad Alegría y su familia agradecen tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy a freezer to improve the conditions in which Alegria sells fish every day

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth's family is very committed to the daily work she does in their city. Each one in their own way contributes to the work so that it is less tiring and more productive. Every morning, accompanied by her eldest son, she sets out on a tricycle to sell different kinds of fish to the entire community. Riding the tricycle requires much effort, but her son's youth and strength makes travel quicker and stopping unnecessary. Realizing that she could drive if the vehicle was motorized, she has decided to purchase one so that her beloved assistant can invest all the time that he dedicates to helping her to improving his level of education. In order to realize her dream, she is requesting 575 dollars, a loan that she promises to repay in 6 months. Fulfilling this objective will help Elizabeth be able to give her oldest son more time to study as well as be able to improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La familia de Elizabeth está muy comprometida con el trabajo diario que ella desempeña en su ciudad. Cada uno de ellos de diversas maneras contribuyen para que la labor sea menos pesada y más productiva. Todas las mañanas en compañía de su hijo mayor sale provista de un triciclo a ofrecer pescados de diversas clases a la población entera, si bien es cierto la conducción del vehículo demanda mucho esfuerzo, pero la juventud y fuerza de su hijo hacen que su desplazamiento sea rápido y constante. Habiendo notado que la conducción la podría realizar ella si el vehículo fuera motorizado ha decidido adquirir uno para que su querido ayudante pueda invertir todo ese tiempo que dedica a ayudarle a mejorar su grado de instrucción. Con el deseo de llevar a cabo este anhelo; ella hace una solicitud de 575 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Llevando a cabo este propósito Elizabeth podrá otorgarle más tiempo a su hijo mayor para que pueda estudiar y mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: Buying a motorized vehicle would improve the service that Elizabeth provides her customers and community

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en:
Lagi S. is a hard-working woman of sixty-three, married with eight children. Her business is selling homemade donuts to school kids of her village. She’s been doing this almost two years now and she believes she’s doing fine.

Together with the assistance she gets from her husband and children, she is able to get her donuts ready to be sold early in the morning. She plans to use her loan to produce more products for her customers. Lagi appreciates the help of the S.P.B.D programme, lending her the money to help her with financing her business needs.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her donut stand

loans.name: Tali

texts.en:
Tali H. is a woman who works hard to support her family's needs. She’s forty years of age with four children. Tali’s husband is during most of the job outside the home, driving the whole day and night, earning money for their family. They both help each other to plan and budget their income from each day for their family needs and also their children's education.

Tali plans to use her loan to buy new tires, for petrol, and for licensing the taxi. She’s thankful to S.P.B.D's programme for making poor woman like her able to support their family.

loans.use: To purchase new tires, petrol, and for licensing

payments.comment: SPBD is pleased to report that due to the success of Tali's business, she was able to repay her loan ahead of the loan term.  Her loan allowed her to hire a local man to be the taxi driver for her taxi.  Thus, the loan was able to help two families.  Her husband augments their family income through his job as a policeman.  She is currently applying for another increased loan.  Profits from her business have paid for her children's educational fees.  In Samoa, families must pay for their children's education. Thank you Kiva Lenders for your loans and support for her and her family!

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia M. is a woman who works hard to help her family to fulfill what they need. Her business is a taxi service. Her husband works daytime and nighttime to earn money for their family, driving the taxi. She’s very happy about their business. She’s improving her business and she’s thinking of some day having two taxis to expand her business.

Olivia's business earns about three hundred tala per day (around US$ 120). She plans to use her loan from the S.P.B.D to buy tires, petrol, brake fluid and other sorts of things for the car in order to keep it in good condition. She’s thankful to the S.P.B.D for the programme that makes things easier for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase tires, petrol, and brake fluid

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en:
Virgina S. is twenty-six with four children; she lives with her husband in Fagalii-uta where they run their small business, a taxi service. Virginia used to struggle a lot back when she didn’t have a hope of supporting her family. Fortunately, when the S.P.B.D programme came to her area, she decided to get involved in it . Her husband does the taxi driving, spending most of his time, day and night time in the taxi. They earn almost two hundred tala (about US$ 80) a day and they are very happy about.

Virginia is thinking of expanding her business by having two other taxis sooner or later. She has nothing to worry about now. She has money to feed her children's hunger and put them in school. Her purpose for this loan is to buy tires, pay for licensing the car, petrol, etc.

loans.use: To purchase tires, petrol, and pay for licensing

loans.name: Lina Presentación

texts.es:
Lina is a selfless mother who, through her efforts and work, has brought up her children. She now feels very proud because she sees that all of her children practice the values that she has instilled in them at home. Currently she lives only with her husband and keeps busy 24 hours a day managing the snack bar she built quite a long time ago. The customers who visit her daily always recommend her to their friends and relatives. She sees her clientele increase daily but space get increasingly smaller. Due to this, she has decided to expand the snack bar. At the same time, she wants to offer other services to make her customers' visits more pleasurable. To fulfill this desire, she requests a 325 dollar loan that she promises to repay in 6 months. With this loan she will be able to realize her dreams and improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Lina es una madre abnegada que a base D. esfuerzo y trabajo ha educado a su hijos y ahora se siente muy orgullosa porque observa que cada uno D. ellos pone en práctica los valores que les inculcó en el seno D. su hogar. Actualmente vive sólo con su esposo y se mantiene ocupada las 24 horas del día con la administración D. una fuente D. soda que construyó hace mucho tiempo. Los clientes que la visitan a diario la recomiendan siempre con sus amigos y familiares y ella ha observado que cada día el número D. clientes se incrementa y el espacio se aminora cada vez más. Debido a este hecho es que ha decidido ampliar el espacio en el que se encuentra la fuente D. soda y a su vez desea brindar otros servicios para complacer la estadía D. sus clientes. Para llevar a cabo este anhelo solicita un préstamo D. 325 dólares y se compromete a retornarlos en un período D. 6 meses; con él podrá concretar sus deseos y mejorará la calidad D. vida dentro D. su hogar.

loans.use: This snack bar seeks to expand its facilities to offer more and improved service to its regular customers

loans.name: Vaalele

texts.en: Vaalele F. is a young talented woman who chose operating a taxi as her small business.  She’s twenty-six years old with four children.  Her husband does most of the job driving the whole day and night to earn money to fulfill the needs of her family and kids.  She earns more than two hundred tala a day.  She is very happy about her business, because she believed in herself that she would expand her business in the near future.  She is thankful to S.P.B.D for this programme to help poor women assist with their families' needs.  She will use her loan to buy tires for the car, brake fluid, oil, etc.

loans.use: To purchase tires, brake fluid, oil, etc.

loans.name: Silomaga

texts.en: Silomaga T. is a woman of forty-seven who is currently working hard at her plantation.  She’s happy for what she’s capable of doing.  Her husband lends her a hand to clean and sell their goods at the market.  Her business helps their family develop and also helps financially.  Silomaga T. earns an amount of one hundred tala a day.  She produces a variety of goods to sell to meet her customers' needs.  She will use her loan to buy equipment such as bush knives, cloves, seeds, etc. to help their business maintain its good condition.

loans.use: To purchase knives, cloves, and seeds

loans.name: Fogalele

texts.en: Fogalele L. is a widower of forty-six years of age with two children.  One of them is working and the other one is in school.  Mrs. L. struggles so badly trying to find a way to help out her family financially.  She’s thankful to the S.P.B.D for its programme to help poor women develop their families.  She gets one hundred and fifty tala from her sales each day.  She’s happy and feels confident in what she’s doing.  She works in the morning at her plantation weeding unwanted grass, planting more taro, banana, and yams to extend her plantation.  Her plantation covers half an acre of her land.  Her business is improving and has grown.

loans.use: To purchasing planting equipment

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel is a responsible and hard-working man. He's originally from Tampico [in the northeastern Mexican state of] Tamaulipas. He's married and has three daughters. He used to work in an auto repair shop but his salary was very low. In order to pull his family up, he decided 20 years ago to start his own business selling fast food. The good service that he offered helped him to grow the business and he now has three food carts. He also started selling natural products when he saw how they helped his sick wife and they've been well received by his customers.

To keep growing, Daniel now needs a US$650 loan that he will use to buy merchandise and to acquire basic materials to increase his production. He promises to repay the amount in 6 months. Daniel very much appreciates the change that you're giving him to improve and grow his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Daniel es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, es originario de la localidad de Tampico, Tamaulipas, está casado y tiene tres hijas, anteriormente él trabajaba en un taller mecánico pero su salario era muy bajo y para poder sacar adelante a su familia decidió comenzar su propio negocio con la venta de comidas rápidas hace 20 años, afortunadamente el buen servicio que ofrece le ha ayudado a hacer crecer su negocio y ahora ya cuenta con tres carritos. También ha iniciado con las ventas de productos naturales, porque ha observado buenos resultados en la enfermedad de su esposa y tiene muy buena aceptación de sus clientes.

Para continuar creciendo, ahora Daniel necesita un préstamo de $ 650 dólares, que empleará en la compra de mercancía, así como para adquirir insumos e incrementar su producción, él que se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Daniel agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Buy basic materials for food business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
By her own iniciative, when Esther was 14 she learned how to make clothing using a sewing machine. This activity has made it possible for her to contribute to her family's income and satisfactorily meet the most urgent needs of her two small sons. Every item of clothing she produces is superior, and due to this her orders have markedly increased. She has some very large orders so that many times it would be impossible to fulfill them if she didn't have an assistant. Her incredible energy, fortitude, and commitment to her clients drives her to offer them new and improved service. To this end, she wants to speed up her clothing production by purchasing a semi-industrial sewing machine. To accomplish her objective, she is asking for a 325 dollar loan to buy this machine and she promises to repay the loan in 6 months. With your help, you can make her dream come true. Esther thanks you for your gererous contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives.

Por iniciativa propia desde que tenía 14 años Esther aprendió el arte de elaborar prendas valiéndose para ello de una máquina de coser. Su desempeño en esta actividad ha hecho que pueda contribuir con el ingreso económico familiar y pueda colmar satisfactoriamente las necesidades más urgentes de su dos pequeños hijos. Los excelentes acabados que les da a cada una de las prendas que confecciona se han convertido en su propia recomendación, debido a esto es que su índice de pedidos se ha incrementado notoriamente y tiene pedidos muy grandes que muchas veces sería imposible de cumplir si no contara con un ayudante. Su increíble ímpetu, fortaleza y compromiso con sus clientes la impulsan a otorgarles cada vez un mejor y novedoso servicio por ello su deseo es agilizar la confección de las prendas con la compra de una máquina remalladora semi industrial para llevar a cabo su propósito Para el fin que persigue solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares para adquirir esta máquina y se compromete a retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás hacer que este deseo se vuelva realidad. Esther agradece tu generoso aporte.

loans.use: The purchase of a semi-industrial sewing machine for Esther's workshop could be the first step to building a successful textile mill

loans.name: Gracia

texts.es:
Gracia, 42, is originally from Tampico [in the northeastern Mexican state of] Tamaulipas. She's married and has three children, a 23-year-old and 21-year-old twins. Her husband is a construction worker. Graciela started her business two years ago so her children could continue their education. She initially sold costume jewelry, then added second-hand clothing and now she's established in the "mercados rodantes"--a kind of temporary street market--where her sales improve with each passing day. Graciela's strong character has helped her to provide a good service to her customers and to build her business.

Graciela is now asking for a US$275 loan that she promises to repay in 4 months. She'll use it to buy more merchandise to cover demand from her customers. Now is the time to help those most in need. Make the decision to help this family and contribute to the development of her business. Thanks very much.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Gracia tiene 42 años de edad, es originaria de la localidad de Tampico, Tamaulipas, está casada y tiene tres hijos, de 23 y unos gemelos de 21 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en la construcción y para que sus hijos pudieran continuar sus estudios Gracia emprendió su negocio hace dos años, inició con la venta de bisutería y poco después incorporó la venta de ropa usada, ahora se instala en los mercados rodantes y sus ventas mejoran día con día, el carácter de Gracia le ha ayudado a brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes y a hacer crecer su negocio.

En estos momentos Gracia está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses, con lo que podrá adquirir más mercancía para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y continuar con su preferencia. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien mas lo necesita, decídete a apoyar a esta familia, contribuyendo al desarrollo de su negocio, muchas gracias.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Maria Eneida

texts.es:
Maria, 51, is a widow. She has three children who no longer live with her. Maria is an enthusiastic and hard-working woman. She started her own business selling natural weight-control products three years ago, both to clear expenses after the death or her husband and to supplement her small pension. Fortunately, demand for the products is very good and her customers have seen good results from their use.

Maria is now asking for a US$275 loan to buy merchandise. She promises to repay it in 4 months. She hopes to continue growing her business and get ahead. You play an important part in Maria's life. She is very grateful for the opportunity you're giving her to improve her life and her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene 51 años de edad, es viuda y tiene tres hijos, que viven aparte. Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, desde hace tres años que falleció su esposo, para poder solventar sus gastos, Maria inició su propio negocio con al venta de productos naturales para control de peso, porque que la pensión que recibe es muy baja. Afortunadamente la demanda por estos productos es muy buena ya que ha tenido buenos resultados en sus clientes.

Ahora Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 275 dólares para la compra de mercancía, que se compromete a regresar en 4 meses, con esto espera continuar creciendo con su negocio y salir adelante. Se parte importante en la vida de Maria, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para mejorar su vida y su negocio.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Tapuotaota

texts.en: Tapuotaota T. is forty-six years of age.  She’s a widower and has nine children. Five are overseas, six are married and three are at home.  Her business is “Pig Sty”. She has more than twenty pigs in her pig sty not only female but also male.  Mrs. T. knows that having a pig sty is very important for funerals, and special occasions such as birthday parties, weddings, farewell parties, and much much more.  Her relatives and her children are giving her a hand to feed the pigs.  She gets three hundred tala a day from her business.  She’s happy and confident that her business will be expanded in the near future.  She will use her loan to buy equipments such as wire for the fence, nails, hammers, etc.

loans.use: To purchase wire, fencing, nails, and hammers

payments.comment: SPBD is pleased to report that due to the success of Tapuotaota's business, she was able to repay her loan ahead of the payment term.  In her village of Fagalii Uta, she is the centre chief, responsible for the loan repayments of all the other women in the village.  She continues to lead one of SPBD's best centres.  She is now applying for an additional increased loan with SPBD for a taro and banana plantation.  She has also hired some local men to assist with her business which spreads her profits to a greater outreach.  Thank you Kiva Lenders for your loans!

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Ruben, a responsible and hard-working man, lives in Tampico [in the northeastern Mexican state of] Tamaulipas. He's worked in sales from a very young age; twenty-six years ago, he decided to strike out on his own and start his own business. Ruben is married and has three children who are 8-, 10-, and 15-years old; they were the motive behind his drive to build his business selling household products. Thanks to the good service he offers, his sales improved greatly and he was able to buy a truck to transport his products.

Ruben now needs a US$650 loan that he will use to buy merchandise to cover demand from his customers. He wants to be prepared for the coming season. He promises to repay the amount in 6 months. Be part of Ruben's success.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Tampico, Tamaulipas vive Rubén, es muy trabajador y responsable, desde muy joven se dedica a las ventas y hace 26 años decidió independizarse e iniciar su propio negocio. Rubén está casado y tiene tres hijos de 8, 10 y 15 años de edad, ellos lo han motivado a esforzarse por hacer crecer su negocio donde vende diversos productos para el hogar, gracias al buen servicio que ofrece sus ventas mejoraron mucho y pudo adquirir una camioneta en la que hoy transporta sus productos.

En estos momentos Rubén necesita un crédito de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, él sabe que se acercan temporadas buenas y quiere estar preparado, se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Ruben.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Alo

texts.en: Alo V. is middle aged and works very hard to show off her talent of how to take good care of pigs for her family's living.  She is thirty-six years of age and lives with her husband and kids, and they run their small business to help out their family financially.  All of her four children are attending school. She will use her loan to buy materials to start off her business.  It is her dream come true for her and her family. She really appreciates the help from S.P.B.D for lending her the money so that she can manage to start her business.  Her husband is the key man for their business, and together they will meet their family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her sty

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth's business foresight and enterprising spirit have led her to construct a well in her home to store water and distribute it to her clients by way of a piping system. As we all know, this liquid resource is of vital importance for the survival of humans and facing a continual lack of this service in the homes of many people around her community, Ruth decided to start this business. The contribution that each member provides to carry out this activity is important. Since establishing this business at home, demand has increased daily but with the moving of many families to the area, service has become inadequate. Therefore, Ruth is asking for a 400 dollar loan which she promises to repay in 6 months. With the loan, she plans to buy more pipes and a water pump to facilitate distribution and be able to supply more families in less time. Let's help Ruth's business be able to continue to contribute to the well-being of many families in Pucallpa.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La visión de Ruth para los negocios y su espíritu emprendedor han hecho que lleve a cabo la construcción de un pozo en su domicilio para almacenar el agua y poder distribuirlo a sus clientes a través de redes tubulares. Como todos sabemos este líquido elemento es de vital importancia para la sobrevivencia de los seres humanos y ante la falta continua de este servicio en los hogares de muchas personas dentro de su localidad, Ruth decidió iniciar este negocio. La contribución que cada uno de los miembros brinda para desarrollar esta actividad es importante. Desde que estableció este negocio en su hogar la demanda se incrementaba diariamente pero es con el asentamiento de muchas familias en esta localidad que el servicio se ha vuelto deficiente. Por esta razón Ruth solicita un préstamo de 400 dólares y se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses; para poder comprar más tubos y una bomba de agua a fin de agilizar la distribución y poder abastecer a muchas familias en menor tiempo. Hagamos que el negocio de Ruth siga contribuyendo con el bienestar de muchas familias en Pucallpa.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and pipes in order to offer better service to the community where Ruth and her family live

loans.name: Lucy Sesega

texts.en: Lucy is a mother of two children and she is proud of her business of elei printing (a traditional Samoan way of printing fabrics).  She is also grateful for her business as it helps the family. Both of her two children are attending school, and that’s why she works so hard to help her husband improve their family's finances.  Lucy owns a permanent block at the Flea Market in town, where she sells her products from Monday to Saturday.  She has no doubts about what she’s doing, because the sales she makes in one week are outstanding.  She’s hoping to use her next loan to buy more materials, so that she can produce more clothing.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta O. is forty-four years old and has two children.  Marieta’s business is elei printing, a traditional Samoan way of printing fabrics.  She prints more than a hundred materials a day and sells it to the market, and shops around her village and in town.  She is very happy because she knows that her business is of a high standard, and will help her to become a better businesswoman in the near future.  Her husband helps her deliver the elei materials around the village and in town.
