She sells different kinds of clothes such as t-shirts, shirts, ielavalava, and other sort of materials - you name it and she will do it for you.  She will use her loan to buy materials for elei, such as paint colors, transcript papers, brushes, etc.  She earns more than a hundred and ninety tala a day from her selling.

loans.use: To purchase materials, paint colors, transcript papers, and brushes

loans.name: Maofa

texts.en: Maofa T. is twenty-seven years of age from the village of Fagalii-uta.  She’s married and has three children.  They both work so hard to develop their family, but since the S.P.B.D has introduced this programme, everything is much easier for her and her family.  Her business is a plantation; she works from the morning until the evening.  Her husband helps her out by weeding the unwanted grass, planting more foods such as taro, banana, yams, etc., and taking the products to sell at the market.  She earns more than two hundred tala a week from their selling.  She will use her loan to buy equipment to help her run their business and maintain its good condition.

loans.use: To purchase planting equipment and supplies

loans.name: Faasegi

texts.en: Faasegi S. is a businesswoman of fifty-five, and she has four children.  Her husband died three years ago. She wanted so much to have a business of her own to help her put her children in school and to develop her family.  Finally, she did what has she been dreaming of - having a plantation as a small business. Faasegi works so hard every day until the evening to clean and plant as many goods as she can to sell in order for her to earn money to satisfy the needs of her kids.   She’s happy of the way she runs her business even though her husband is not there to help out, but she has nothing to worry about as everything is going well.  She’s thankful to S.P.B.D for making the programme available for those who do not have a job to earn money.  She will use her loan to buy seeds to plant, and wire, nails, hammers, etc., for the fence.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, hammers, wiring, fencing, and nails

loans.name: Aimeamata

texts.en: Aimeamata P. is a young single lady of thirty-nine years of age who is not ready to tie the knot yet. She has worked really hard to help her parents with their family's living.  Her grandmother taught her elei printing when she was sixteen and now she is self-sustainable.  Her business is elei materials and sells them to the public stores for quite a good price.  Aimeamata is grateful to her grandmother for teaching her how to do this, as she now able to rely on it for a living.  She will use her loan to buy the materials needed to make her products more fancy.  She thanks the S.P.B.D for lending her the money so that she is able to go on with her business.  She has a strong heart and feels that she can do better and earn money, before she ties the knot.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Tuisugaigoa

texts.en: Tuisugaigoa I. is a hard working woman of thirty-one years of age and is married with three children.  Her business is a Flea Market, where she sells different kinds of products such as handicrafts, elei materials, puletasi, and also foods. Together with the assistance she gets from her husband and children, she is able to run her business. She will use her loan to produce more products for her customers.  Tuisugaigoa appreciates the help of the S.P.B.D programme for lending her the money to help her with financing her business' needs. She earns an income of one hundred and fifty tala a day from her selling.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and to restock

loans.name: Chung

texts.en: Chung P. Y. is a young talented woman of twenty-eight years of age. She is married with two children.  In the early days of their marriage, Chung and her husband worked in order to gain money.  She will use her loan to buy the equipment for doing the job, and she is so grateful for her husband for helping her do it.  She believes that they will succeed because they are both working together, and their expenses are low as their baby is just three years old.  Chung appreciates the help from S.P.B.D for lending her the money so that she is now able to make her business possible.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and equipment

loans.name: Faigasuega

texts.en: Faigasuega is a hard working woman of thirty-eight years of age.  She has three children and all of them are attending school.  In order to meet her family's needs, she worked very hard to run her business well.  She’s been doing this for almost two years and her husband is always behind her supporting her in every way.  Faigasuega is grateful for the help of S.P.B.D for lending her the money to make everything for her business possible.  She will use the money to buy the equipment needed to develop her business. She will increase her business, because she realizes that her customers' needs are growing.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and supplies

loans.name: Sifaga

texts.en: Sifaga is a happy and a friendly woman of thirty-six years of age.  She is married with five children; two of them are attending school and three are at home.  Sifaga has a shop where she offers her services to the people of her village.  It is one of four shops with in her area and there is tough competition.  Sifaga will use her loan to buy stock so that she can provide a good service to meet her customers' needs.  Her husband and the kids help out sometimes but most of time it is her part to play.  Sifaga has a strong heart and believes that she can do better because she’s being supported by her loan from S.P.B.D.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Nuufou

texts.en: Nuufou C. is a young hard working woman of twenty-four years of age.  She is a married with only one child.  Nuufou and her husband have struggled for a better family living, and as a result they have been able to open up a small retail shop.  So, with only one baby right now, they are able to manage their family's needs as they move along in life.  Nuufou is hoping for her next loan from S.P.B.D to buy more stock for her shop so she can really compete with other shopkeepers.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Ake

texts.en: Ake F. is a young woman with so many talents, but she has chosen one to be her future business.  Her business has helped to finance her family and put her children in school.  She’s confident and has no doubts about anything because she has her husband who is helping her to look after the shop when she is away.  She will use her loan to buy more goods to sell and paint her shop to attract more customers.  She’s thankful to the S.P.B.D for the help it gave for a poor woman like her.  She receives an income of two hundred tala a day from her selling.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en: Ruta P. is a talented young woman of sixty years of age.  She uses her sewing talent for her business, in order to earn money for her family's living.  She is married with six children and they are all attending school.  Her first loan was spent on buying the materials she needed to start her sewing business.  Due to the growth of her customers, she will spend her second loan on buying a new electric sewing machine. Ruta, who is now the best tailor with in her area, hardly rests.  She struggles so hard to meet her customers' needs and at the same time earn more money for her family.  Her husband and her six children also support her and that really encourages her in what she’s doing.  Ruta really appreciates the help of the S.P.B.D. office for lending her the money to make everything in her business possible.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and supplies

loans.name: Tuitapu

texts.en: Tuitapu is a mother of three children and she shows off her talent for sewing clothes through her business.  It is her loan from S.P.B.D. that has made this possible and she is so grateful for it because it has really helped her out.  All of her three children are attending school and that’s why she works so hard to help out her husband in providing money for their family's needs.  Tuitapu owns a permanent block at the Flea Market in town and that’s where she sells her products from Monday to Saturday.  She has no doubts about what she’s doing because of the sales she gets for one whole week. She’s hoping her next loan will buy more materials so that she can produce more to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies

loans.name: Poto

texts.en: Poto is a 29 year old mother of two children from Maagiagi. She set up a flea market business selling a variety of goods, such as shoes, hair gel, t-shirts, etc. With her first loan of $300 she has been able to open her flea market six days a week, and earn a profit of $60 less all expenses weekly.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en: This lady’s aim is to save for her children’s future.  Lagi joined S.P.B.D. in order to get a loan to start a small business.  With 3 young ones still at home and soon to start school, and her husband being the only supporter, she decided to help him by earning money to save for her children’s education.  She does this by selling clothes, t-shirts, and handicrafts at the flea market, six days a week.  This earns her a daily income of $60 after all expenses, and is more than enough to help her husband and to save for her kids' educations.

loans.use: Flea market and taxi business

loans.name: Evo

texts.en: Evo is one of the most determined members of Vaitele fou 2 center.  Being a divorced, single mother of one child, is the drive behind her tendency to become financially independent.  In order to support herself and her child,  she sells goods at the flea market, e.g. clothes and handicrafts, which gives her a profit of $44 daily, six days a week.  And she earns extra money every Sunday with her food vending business where she caters for the village people by selling meat pies and apple pies. She is now looking at moving up to the next loan step.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Taikoke

texts.en: Tiakoke has to wake up extra early every day. Her home is quite a distance from town, where her flea market business has been for almost a decade now.  One of the oldest members of Luatuanuu center, Atikoke has managed to expand her handicraft business by opening another stall. With her next loan she’s hoping to look at the overseas market to export her goods.

loans.use: To restock her inventory

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: This lady’s next loan step will be $500 with 3 kids to support.  She has to work extra hard to improve her business, which is doing very well and earning her a profit of $44 daily after all expenses. The competition is high because of the growing numbers of grocery shops around Vaitele. Anita has to be smart with her selling skills and pricing in order to attract more customers, so she can make more money, pay off her current loan and go up to the next step so she can expand her business.  She would also like to renovate her home.

loans.use: To expand her shop and also her flea market

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: With her children busy with their own businesses, 64-year-old Agnes from the village of Vailele helps out the family by selling ice cakes. Although her kids work to support the family as well, Agnes likes to be in charge of feeding her brood. Agnes makes and sells ice cakes to her fellow villagers 7 days a week, which provides her with a weekly profit of $180 after family expenses and weekly loan payments. She hopes to expand her business by adding new products such as pancakes and pies.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and for home improvement

loans.name: Silafaga

texts.en: Silafaga is a thirty-eight year old mother of three kids. She owns a convenience shop in her village of Alaoa. She started her business with a canteen selling ice cakes, cigarettes etc. And now she has expanded her business to a grocery shop. The income is used for multiple reasons, but her first priority is her payment every week as she wants to continue her relationship with SPBD. She earns $28 profit daily after all expenses.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Masi

texts.en: Masi is a mother of thirty-five years of age with three kids all in school. She started her business in 2004 from a small flea market in front of her house at Maagiagi and has expanded her range to elei print materials, puletasi, t-shirts, and different kinds of handicrafts, which she sells at the Savalalo flea market. She earns $52 profit a day from her flea market and it helps her to support her kids' education and also for paying off her loan.

loans.use: To expand range of products

loans.name: Fuatino

texts.en: Fuatino is 30 years old and has an existing business of selling popcorn to make a living for her and her family of three kids and her husband. She delivers to the village people and the primary school in Maagiagi. With three kids to put through school, she earns $60 profit weekly from her popcorn business. Apart from her business, her husband works in the NUS as a security guard, and he earns $48 to help with the family's living expenses, school bills, and also for her repayment every week.

loans.use: To expand popcorn business

loans.name: Afiafiese

texts.en: Thirty-eight year old Afiafiese from Vailele has succeeded in offering the local school in her village her ice cake service, and satisfying her community's needs. She’s a mother of six children, four in school, and two young ones. She works hard 5 days a week from Monday to Friday on her ice cake business. She earns $20 a day, and this helps her sons go to school and also with her loan repayment. Her husband works at the National Bank and he is helping them with their family's needs. She plans to use her next loan to expand her business and also to improve their home.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and materials

loans.name: Talaia

texts.en: Thirty-five year old Talaia has one child, and already has an existing business of selling bananas and fresh produce in front of her house in Vailele. Her sales make a profit of $72 which is used for different purposes, such as church donations, bills, food, but most of all she saves to expand her business into a big commercial supplier of banana and vegetables. Her husband helps her a lot, as he earns $60 a week from his work as a carpenter.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Tusifolau

texts.en: Tusifolau is a 56 year old mother of 7 children from Matautu Lefaga center. She joined SPBD in 2004, and was the one who created the center.  She started her business with a small stall and now she has opened a shop. It provides a much better income compared to the previous years. She’s looking forward to her next loan to expand her business and also renovate her home. She earns a daily profit of $48 and, apart from her business, her husband is responsible for their plantation and earns some more money to help their kids in school and cover other expenses like the telephone bill, electric bill, etc.

loans.use: Store expansion

loans.name: Lealofi

texts.en: Lealofi is able to make a Samoan dish, Faausi, to sell in her village to earn her living.  The small business operates 3 days a week, Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. Lealofi prepares 50 plates each day and sells each for $2.40 in her village and at Vaigaga Primary school.  She earns $72 profit after all expenses.  She now able to support her family. She says that anyone can achieve their goal if they have faith in what they do and whom they seek help from. She is grateful for SPBD whose objective is to help those in need.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and materials

loans.name: Rren

texts.en: Mrs. Rren N. , 29, lives in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia with her husband, 31, and 3 children. Rren N. and her husband are both employed at a private company, earning $2.50 a day each. They have applied for this loan in order to buy a motorcycle so that they can get to work without having to pay the fares of moto-drivers.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to get to work

loans.name: Preab

texts.en: Mrs. Preab T., 57, and her husband live together in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. Between them they have 3 children, one of whom works at an airport earning $200 a month, one as a construction worker earning $3 a day, and one selling souvenir products to tourists for $2 a day. They have applied for this loan so that they can build a house as there own house has fallen into disrepair.

loans.use: to build a house

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Preab Thongdy start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Imoa

texts.en: Imoa, 42 years old, of Manunu, has a sewing business. After she joined SPBD, she was able to run her own sewing business, which helps with the development of her family. Her husband has a plantation, which also supports the family, but Imoa now has her own source of income and can make her own children’s clothes. Imoa is also one of the many women that are grateful for SPBD’s assistance as she now has her own business. While she had the skills to sew, it was not until she received assistance from SPBD that she could now really put her sewing skills to good use.

loans.use: For a sewing machine, school fees, and home improvement

loans.name: Alasa

texts.en: Alasa, 37 years old, of Manunu, (pictured above) has a sewing business. She sews for her family and also gets sewing jobs from a number of families in her village. At times, she gets sewing jobs from neighbouring villages and from these sewing jobs, she now has her own income. She is seen here happily applying her skills and doing what she does best to earn a living. According to Alasa, the help of SPBD has really made a difference for her and her family as not only does she have an income, she is now able to save a lot of money from not having to buy ready made clothes for her family, and also from having to pay someone to sew her children’s school uniforms. She is very happy with her small business and she will continue to use the assistance from SPBD in the future.

loans.use: For sewing machine, school fees, and home improvement

loans.name: Sriyati

texts.id:
As a housewife Sriyati is not that busy taking care of her daughter, since she is already 14 years old and is in 9th grade. However daily expenses have increased. Sriyati's husband work in a machine shop and earns Rp8000,000 (about US$72)/month. Of course that kind of income was not enough to cover daily household expenses. The Laundry business mother Sriyati is working on was to supplement the family's income. The suggestions she has covers: washing machine and iron. Her capital plus capital she obtains from DINARI every 3 months was also to buy locally made detergent Rinso and its perfume as supplement. Every week she could earns about Rp150,000 (about $16.50). However their living expenses were Rp20,000 (about $2.20)/day. When added schooling expenses it cost her Rp150,000 (about $16)/mo. Therefore Sriyati's business helps her husband in the family income. Sriyati is doing this business in her rented room with cement floor, asbestos roof, and batako wall. Sriyati and her husband hope that their children could go to higher education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai ibu rumah tangga, Sriyati tidak begitu repot dalam mengurus putrinya karena putrinya sudah berusia 14 tahun dan duduk di kelas 3 SMP. Namun biaya yang dikeluarkan semakin besar. Suami Sriyati bekerja di bengkel dengan penghasilan Rp 800.000,00/bulan. Penghasilan tersebut tentunya masih belum mencukupi untuk memenuhi kebutuhan dalam rumah tangga mereka. Usaha Laundry ini ditekuni oleh Ibu Sriyati demi menambah penghasilan keluarga. Sarana yang dia gunakan antara lain : mesin cuci dan setrika. Modalnya sendiri ditambah dengan modal yang dia dapatkan dari DINARI setiap tiga bulan dia menyediakan rinso dan parfum sebagai stok. Setiap minggunya keuntungan yang bisa dia peroleh sekitar Rp 150.000,00. Sedangkan biaya hidup perhari mereka adalah Rp 20.000,00. Apabila ditambah dengan biaya pendidikan anaknya yang perbulannya Rp 150.000,00, tentunya usaha Sriyati akan sangat membantu suaminya dalam menambah pendapatan keluarga. Sriyati melakukan usahanya ini di rumah kontrakannya dengan lantai semen, atap asbes dan tembok batako. Sriyati dan suaminya berharap anak mereka tetap dapat melanjutkan sekolahnya ke tingkat yang lebih tinggi.

loans.use:
To buy laundry goods like detergents and perfume

Membeli perlengkapan Laundry seperti deterjen dan parfum.

loans.name: Ty

texts.en: Mrs. Ty N., 46, lives in the Siem Reap province of Camboida with her 4 children. She is a widow, and earns money for her family by selling souvenir products and earning $5 a day. 2 of her children are students, and the other 2 work as tour guides. Mrs. Ty N. has requested this loan because she would like to build a new house for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her inventory.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Ferolini

texts.en: Ferolini is a 31 year old married woman of Falevao who runs a retail shop at Falevao. Her retail shop is a product of the assistance that SPBD gives women like herself from across S.. She now reaps the fruits of this assistance and she hopes to continue utilising this assistance as needed. Her family now has another source of income that can assist not just with the needs of the family members, but more so for meeting the church and village obligations which they need to provide as members of this village community.

loans.use: To restock her shop and for school fees

loans.name: Tuamasaga

texts.en:
Tuamasaga of Samatau is married with 6 children and is pictured above with some of the products from her sewing business. Like many other women with sewing businesses, Tuamasaga now benefits from having the skills and materials to be able to sew. Nowsdays, it is very expensive to buy ready made clothes from the stores, and for Tuamasaga, her business is timely as her 6 children are now all in school and she does not have to worry about getting their school uniforms made.

The other event which she does not have to worry anymore about is White Sunday. This is a major event for the children and again, new clothing is one major cost for White Sunday. Now that she has her own sewing machine and business, those are now off her list of worries. She looks happy as she shows some of the finished products from the business, thanks to SPBD.

loans.use: For a sewing machine, school fees, and home improvement

loans.name: Nive

texts.en: Nive T., 56 years old, is married with 3 children, and lives in Saletele Fagaloa. She is pictured here in her retail shop. With the assistance from SPBD she was able to start a retail shop and this has meant a lot of help for her and her family. Before SPBD came along, she had no way of starting a retail shop for the financial institutions in town did not easily lend money to people like herself with no formal employment. With SPBD’s assistance, she not only has a retail shop, she can also support her own children, whereas before she relied a lot on her relatives overseas to send remittances for everything. She is also grateful for the assistance from SPBD which has helped her come this far in terms of development for herself and also for her whole family.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina T., a 37 year old married woman from Falevao has a look of contentment as she is pictured here with her children in her retail shop. Like the other women who have been assisted by SPBD, Felina is very thankful for SPBD and the assistance it gives. Felina shares the same sentiments that are seen in many stories told by women who have received help from SPBD.

Without the assistance from SPBD, there is no way Felina could have started a retail shop as financial institutions have very strict lending criteria. According to Felina, her children and her family have really benefited from her small business and SPBD is to be given thanks for that.

Before SPBD came along she depended to a large extent on her husband as the sole breadwinner for the family. Now she is able to stand on her own two feet without depending too much on her husband or on other members of their extended family for help. Like women from other centres, Felina said that she will continue to utilise the assistance from SPBD to help her with her business for as long as help is needed.

loans.use: To diversify her inventory

loans.name: Lamosa

texts.en:
Lamosa, 33, a married woman from Saletele, Fagaloa, runs her own retail shop, thanks to assistance from SPBD. A mother living in one of the remote villages in Upolu, Lamosa has really found the kind of support she needs from her little shop, given the location of their village. Not only does she now have a more stable source of income, she also does not need to come into town to shop for her family groceries all the time, as she can easily do this from her own small shop.

Lamosa understands the challenges of running a small retail shop and that you really need to separate yourself from the business so that you can make a profit and continue to buy stock for the retail shop.

While she has many church and family commitments, Lamosa knows she needs to ensure that these will not have negative implications on the future of her small business. Lamosa acknowledges the assistance from SPBD which has given her the opportunity to start this new small business venture for her family.

loans.use: To stock her shop and for school fees

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa, 46, married with 4 children, is from the village of Saletele Fagaloa. Here, she is pictured making “afa” one of the main materials used for producing handicrafts. Handicraft production has become the main source of income for Elisa and she started working on this small business enterprise through the assistance from SPBD.

Elisa and her family now enjoy the fruits of her own labour through the production of handicrafts which she sells at the market in town. She says she will continue to utilise the assistance of SPBD as needed for she cannot meet the requirements expected of “borrowers” at other financial institutions and this can put a lot of pressure on her as a borrower. She is therefore grateful for the assistance that SPBD gives as it has allowed women like herself, with no formal employment, to receive financial assistance to start their own small businesses that their families can now rely on for financial support.

loans.use: To cover overhead costs of her handicraft micro-business

loans.name: Talalei

texts.en:
Talalei S., 41 years old, of Vailoa-uta makes pudding for a living. Married with children, Talalelei and her husband have joined forces to earn their living. Since they were introduced to SPBD, they make and sell puddings for employment. These are being sold at the Fugalei Market where they have their own retail shop.

Talalei produces a maximum of 15-20 puddings a day and these are delivered to the market for sale. This has become a family business and Talalei’s husband has now learnt the skill of making a pudding. With an addtional capital of US$300 she and her husband is excited about the prospect of expanding their pudding business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her pudding business and pay for overhead expenses for her pudding retail shop in the market

loans.name: Surita

texts.en:
Surita, a married woman of 22 from Saletele Fagaloa, is pictured here with her craft work. She specialises in the weaving of the Samoan fine mat and this is her form of employment.

Surita is one of the many very young women who have utilised their skills in producing the Samoan fine mat as a form of employment. Today, a very good Samoan fine mat can go to about two thousand Samoan tala (about US$ 740). This is a lot of money, but it must be noted that the weaving and production process also takes some good 5 to 6 months.

The assistance from SPBD has provided Surita with the resources to produce a fine mat and she hopes to continue earning money through the production of the Samoan fine mat.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese P., 22, of Saletele Fagaloa, a single mother of two children specialises in handicraft production. With assistance from SPBD, she produces a range of handicrafts which include bags, jewellery, and other traditional crafts and this is the main source of income for her and her children.

Akenese has a stand at the Flea Market at Sogi and she is also one of the suppliers for Aggie Grey’s Gift Store and Samoa Pharmacy. Akenese has some good markets for her products and this is evidence of the quality of the handicrafts she makes.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her micro-business and for school fees

loans.name: Valavala

texts.en: Valavala U. of Saletele Fagaloa, 52, specialises in handicraft production. She is the Centre Chief for Saletele Fagaloa. Valavala as seen in this photograph is adding the final touches to the “nifo oti”, a traditional weapon used for warfare. Valavala supplies a number of outlets in town with her handicrafts and this is one of the major sources of income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her crafts and for home improvement

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona I., a 25-year-old mother of two from Faleapuna, is pictured above in her retail shop. Ramona is another success story of the SPBD programme. She has been able to utilise the assistance from SPBD to set up her retail shop, which now comprises the main source of income for her and her family.

As a young mother, Ramona realises the difficulties involved in raising a family without a stable income. She is aware that with the assistance from SPBD, she now has fewer worries in terms of supporting her family. She also has the support of her colleagues at the Centre as needed, for running a business is never easy. She wishes to acknowledge the help from SPBD, which has provided her with a stable form of income for her and her family.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en: Pictured here is another success story of SPBD’s programme. Faapaia sells homemade donuts at a school for a living, and she was able to start this small business with help from SPBD. Faapaia is from Samatau and she is enjoying her small business as she can work from home while earning a reasonable amount of money for her family. This helps with the daily needs of her family and she is very thankful for the help of SPBD. She says that she will continue to use the assistance of SPBD in future should she decide to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her micro-business

loans.name: Mamapo

texts.en: Mamapo, an unmarried mother of Samatau, is pictured here with the products she sells for a living. Through help from SPBD, she was able to get a loan of 750.00 tala (about US$ 280) to start a small business selling chips and ice cakes from her home. She looks very happy here as she goes through a typical day, selling her homemade goods for a living. She is thankful for SPBD’s assistance that has allowed her the chance to sell goods for a living.

loans.use: For store supplies

loans.name: Launiu

texts.en: Above is Launiu M., secretary of Samatau Centre. Like other colleagues at this centre, Launiu is selling vegetables and ice cakes for a living. She targets the families at Samatau and she is very happy with the assistance from SPBD as it has given her the resources to start a small business which now helps meet the needs of her family. She is grateful for SPBD’s assistance and she plans to continue to use SPBD’s assistance in future.

loans.use: For supplies for her little store

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en: Sesilia I. is a 40-year-old married woman from the West of Aleisa. She has four dependants and is currently the Centre Chief for Aleisa Fou.  Since being on board the SPBD Programme, Sesilia now has her own vegetable garden which provides daily income for her family. She was able to start a small business with the assistance she received and she has a stall at the Fugalei Food Market where she comes in during the week to sell her produce. Above, Sesilia is pictured with her son during a typical day for them at the Fugalei Food market.

loans.use: For gardening supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria N. of Aleisa, 28, and mother of 3 children is another success story of the SPBD programme. Maria’s small business venture is her vegetable garden and it is the only source of income for the family. Both Maria and her husband work in the vegetable garden and they also own a stall at the Fugalei Food Market where they sell their produce.

loans.use: For gardening supplies

loans.name: Nap

texts.en: Mrs. Nap V., 40, lives in the Siem Reap Province of Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and 4 children. She supports her family by making traditional Khmer bowed-string instruments called a 'Tro'. She would like to use the loan to purchase new tools for this business. In the future she would like to buy a shop to sell her instruments from.

loans.use: to purchase tools to make their instruments

loans.name: Ferila

texts.en:
Ferila K., a mother of two from the big island of Savaii, is now married to a hard man from Saletele Fagaloa on the island of Upolu. She's unemployed and her small business that provides her living is producing handicrafts. She also helps her husband planting kava and delivering it to the shop in town.

All this hard work turns into financial support for her family with the main financial assistance coming from S.P.B.D program. That’s where the progress started even though she has to pay back S.P.B.D; without their support this would never happen. Now Ferila is able to support her own family and also her parents and family on the island of Savaii. She is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to continue the dream.

loans.use: For purchasing supplies for her crafts

loans.name: Ivoga

texts.en: Ivoga never gives up. Even though she is divorced from her husband, she still fights for the betterment of her kids' future. She has sacrificed her life for her kava plantation because it’s the only source of income for her family now that her man has left her with the kids. She is still fighting to continue with this plantation, and she will use the financial support from S.P.B.D. to pay the laborers for their hard work at the plantation. She would like this loan so that she can continue to operate this business and produce income for her poor kids.

loans.use: To pay the laborers

loans.name: Vaimaila

texts.en: Vaimaila T. is in her mid 50s and she is now a member of the S.P.B.D programme. This loan will help her continue to expand her family business of fishing nets, as this is a good business in Samoa, and it produces very good income. It is also a very risky business because of bad weather, but she still pushes her kids not to give up. She is strong and willing to continue this dream, with the financial assistant from S.P.B.D., that her kids will follow her example.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en: Faaiuga is 45 year old lady from the village of Manono. She started her relationship with S.P.B.D. through Faleu Manono Centre, and as a member of this group, she is able to strengthen their fishing business . This is her first loan from this programme, and in the future, it will increase if she follows every guideline of this programme. Faaiuga said that she will use all of this financial support to continue building her business to a good standard, as it is the only income for her family.

loans.use: Fishing supplies

loans.name: Faauu

texts.en: Faauu is from the Mulifanua Fou Center. She will use her loan of $300 to pay for the overhead costs of a small shop located in the Mulifanua village plantation and farm area. She is very thankful for this microfinance assistance program, as without its support, she would not be able to start her business. She is looking forward to improving her business and her family’s future.

loans.use: To pay for overhead costs

loans.name: Easter

texts.en: Easter is from the Mulifanua village. She sells popcorn at the moment, and she is asking for $300 in order to expand her business. She will be attending training sessions in order to learn how to run a business, and she hopes that it will provide her with the skills and confidence to run her business. She is very thankful for this opportunity, and she hopes to improve her family’s future.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Suavale

texts.en: Suavale is 43 years old, with a family of three, and they run their plantation business with her husband. She sells taro and bananas at the market in Fugalei once a week on Fridays, and she makes a profit of $80, which helpsto take care of their family's needs, her child in school, and also for her repayment to pay back what she borrows from SPBD.

loans.use: To buy supplies and equipment

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: This mother of two works long hours in order for her business to make good money. And she does this is by looking after her shop 7 days a week from 6 am to 9 pm. In order to support her family and to improve their standard of living, her husband also works by doing carpentry work and earns them a profit of $48 a day after all of their expenses. This gives them enough to feed their family and make repayments in order for Joan to continue being a member of Papaigalagala centre, which provides her with financial support.

loans.use: To restock inventory and purchase supplies

texts.id:
M. (51) is a mother of 3 children, 2 boys and 1 girl. After her husband left her 2 years ago, M. supports her family by starting a rice milling business, with funds that her husband left her. Currently M. earns about $10-15 net profit per day from her quite successful business. She may even earn more profit during the Eid-ul Fitr holiday season. Currently M. needs $125 loan to repair and maintain her milling machine so she can serve more customer.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

M. (51) merupakan Ibu dari 3 anak, 2 diantaranya laki-laki dan 1 perempuan, setelah ditinggal suaminya 2 tahun lalu, M. menghidupi keluarganya dengan membuka Penggilingan Beras, dengan modal peninggalan suaminya, M. berhasil menjalankan usahanya sampai sekarang dengan pendapatan bersih per harinya $ 10 - $ 50. bahkan kalau menjelang hari raya Idul Fitri pendapatannya meningkat, Saat ini M. membutuhkan pinjaman sebesar $ 125.untuk melakukan pemeliharaan dan perbaikan mesin gilingnya sehingga dapat melayani pelanggan lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use:
$ 100 will be used for Maintenance
$ 25 will be used for buy more goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify her product line

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise and expand her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify the products offered

loans.name: Munirahon

texts.ru: Мунирахон и ее муж(на фото её муж) занимаются выпечкой традиционного таджикского национального хлеба – лепешек. Их пекарня расположена в 50 километрах от места проживания. Мунирахон приезжает туда из дому, а ее муж постоянно проживает рядом с пекарней. Их рабочий день начинается рано утром, когда начинается замешивание теста. Уже к восьми часам утра покупатели могут купить у них горячие лепешки. Каждый месяц Мунирахон ездит за покупкой муки и дрожжей на оптовый рынок в областной центр г. Худжанд. Купленного сырья хватает на месяц работы. В Микроинвест она получила займ также для покупки муки. Новый займ она собирается получить, чтобы закупить муку, которая в последнее время очень подорожала в цене.

loans.use: For purchase of a flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying more medical supplies

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Description of Business

Senora Maria has a small shop located in her home in her neighborhood of Flor de Bastion. She began her small business with a loan, and now sells all types of everyday products as well as ice cream which she makes and sells.

Use of Loan

She needs this loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale prices, as well to improve the image of her business by painting the outside of her house

Personal Information

Maria is 29 years old and has four sons, two of them are going to school. They live in a simple house made of reeds. They have a stable family life, and Maria's principal goal is to improve her business and be able to ensure a good future for her children.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Maria tiene una pequeña despensa ubicada en su domicilio en Flor de Bastión comenzó con su pequeño negocio con un préstamo, actualmente vende todo tipo de producto de primera necesidad y además hace helados que también pone a la venta.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas mercadería a precio de mayorista y además necesita mejorar la imagen de su negocio con una pintada de la fachada de su casa

Información Personal

Ella tiene 29 años y 4 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian su casa es de caña y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de mejorar su negocio para así asegurar un buen futuro a sus hijos

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Improve her business

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Description of Business

Jesus Maria has a business selling clothing and cosmetics from a shop set up in her home. She also sells empanadas in a school nearby. She began her business with the support of her cousin, her loaned her $80. She depends on her business to provide food and education for her children. She feels very proud of the fact that she can support her family in such an important way.

Use of Loan

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise, as well as to fix the floor of the shop. Right now there is only a dirt floor, which not only affects their health, but also the image of the business.

Personal Information

Jesus Maria is 40 years old and has three children, one of whom is a student. They have a stable family life and live in a simple cement house. Her main goal is to finish what is needed on the house, and grow the business.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Jesús se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos además vende empanadas en una escuela de su localidad. Comenzó su negocio por motivación de su prima que le presto $80. Ella depende en su negocio para proveerle comida y educacion a sus hijos. Ella se siente muy orgullosa del hecho que le puede apoyar a su familia en una manera sumamente importante.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella quiere el crédito para comprar mas mercadería y además arreglar el piso del local que ha acondicionado en su domicilio. En la actualidad el piso es de tierra y esto afecta no solamente a su salud, pero tambien a la aparencia de su negocio.

Información Personal

Ella tiene 40 años y tres hijos de los cuales 1 estudia su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de terminar su casa y mejorar su negocio

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Fix the shop floor and buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in clothing for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothes for her business at wholesale prices

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Description of Business

Gabriela has 6 years of experience as a seamstress. She learned this trade from her mother, and by attending sewing courses. Thanks to her savings she was able to buy a sewing machine. Her parents helped her with other machines. She works every day of the week, with her mother helping her in her business.

Use of Loan

With the loan, she will invest in thread, fabrics, zippers and hooks. In addition to skirts and blouses, she has requests to make gym uniforms as they are in the sports season in the schools.

Personal Information

Gabriela is 26 years old and single. She lives with her parents and her brothers in a simple house. She studies information technology at the university and will graduate soon. In the afternoons, she also works in a shop selling greeting cards. She hopes to improve her sewing workshop, bringing better service to her clients.

Descripción del Negocio

Gabriela tiene una experiencia de 6 años con su actividad. Aprendió el oficio de parte de su mama y asistiendo a cursos de costura. Gracias a sus ahorros logro comprar una maquina de coser. Sus padres la apoyaron con las otras maquinas. Trabaja todos los días de la semana realizando costuras. Su mama le ayuda en esta labor.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de telas, hilos, cierres. Tiene pedidos de elaboración de uniformes de gimnasia ya que estamos en la temporada de olimpiadas en las escuelas. Además de elaboración de faldas, blusas.

Información Personal

Gabriela tiene 26 años. Es soltera. Vive con sus padres y hermanos. Su casita es de construcción mixta. Ella estudia la carrera de informática en la Universidad y esta próxima a graduarse. Por las tardes trabaja en un local de venta de tarjetas de ocasión. Su deseo es poder adecuar su taller de costura. Brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy sewing materials

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Description of Business

Cruz and his wife have 8 years of experience in their business. Ever since he was young he has enjoyed this activity. They work every day of the week from 8am to 7pm in a small shop they have. He also travels to other villages nearby to sell merchandise during festivals.

Use of Loan

They will use the loan to buy costume jewelry and cosmetics for their business. They would also like to include a line of plastic products.

Personal Information

Cruz is 27 years old. He and his wife have four children, two of whom are students. They live in a small house made of reeds and they are renting the shop where they sell their merchandise. Their hope is to have the shop well stocked, and begin to construct a house of cement.

Descripción del Negocio

Cruz junto a su esposo tiene una experiencia de 8 años. Desde joven le gusto esta actividad. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. en el local que poseen. Su esposo se dedica también a la venta de mercadería viajando en los pueblos de la provincia cuando hay fiestas.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de bisutería y cosméticos para su negocio. Además de incluir la línea de productos plásticos.

Información Personal

Cruz tiene 27 años. Es casada. Tiene 4 hijos. Dos de ellos estudian. Su casita es de caña. Actualmente ellos alquilan el local donde tienen su mercadería. Su deseo es poder tener surtido su local. Y comenzar a construir su casita de cemento.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Invest in costume jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Elix

texts.es:
Description of Business

Elix has three years of experience in her business. She sells juics, sodas and water, and also makes jelly candies. She works from 7am until 9pm. In addition, in the afternoons she works in an eatery which pays her a salary. Her children are in charge of her business when she needs to go to work.

Use of Loan

With the loan, she will buy a new display case for her juices, sodas and water.

Personal Information

Elix is 39 years old and married. She has four children, but only two live with her. They study and help with the business. Her husband works as a teacher, as well as a locksmith. Their small house is made of cement. With the loan, they hope to improve their sales and their business.

Descripción del Negocio

Elix tiene una experiencia de 3 años con su actividad. Vendiendo jugos, colas, agua. Su horario de trabajo es de 7 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. Ella también prepara bolos, gelatinas. Además por las tardes ella trabaja en un comedor por el que recibe un sueldo. Sus hijos se encargan de atender el negocio cuando ella tiene que salir a trabajar.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de una vitrina. Surtir su negocio con artículos de bazar. Y colas, jugos, agua.

Información Personal

Elix es casada. Tiene 39 años. 4 hijos de los cuales solo dos viven con ella. Estudiando y ayudando en la atención del negocio. Su esposo trabaja de maestro contratista y realiza trabajos de cerrajería. Su casita es de cemento. Espera con la inversión que realizara poder mejorar sus ingresos y su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy a new glass case/display cabinet

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Description of Business

Antonio has 15 years of experience in his business. He has always worked selling grocery items. With his efforts, he has been able to secure a shop. He works every day of the week from 6am until 9pm. His children help him in the business. They also sell cooking gas from their home.

Use of Loan

With the loan, he will buy groceries, colas, juices, yogurts and beans, to be able to meet the demands of the people in his area.

Personal Information

Antonio is 51 years old, and married with four children. His wife has been working for three years packing boxes every day of the week. Their older children work and help with the household costs. Their small house is made of cement. They hope to improve their income with the investment they make.

Descripción del Negocio

Antonio tiene una experiencia de 15 años con su actividad. Siempre ha sido comerciante de víveres. Con su esfuerzo logro poner el local de venta de víveres. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 9 p.m. Sus hijos le ayudan en la atención del negocio. Además en su domicilio también vende gas de uso domestico.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de víveres, colas, jugos, yogurt, legumbres. Poder satisfacer la demanda que tiene de gente de su sector.

Información Personal

Antonio es casado. Tiene 51 años y 4 hijos. Su esposa trabaja hace tres años en una empacadora todos los días de la semana. Sus hijos mayores trabajan y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar. Su casita es de cemento. Espera poder mejorar sus ingresos con la inversión que realizara.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more merchandise to offer more products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase new equipment for salon.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.es:
Business Description

Betsy started her business two years ago. The products she offers include costume jewelry, school supplies and confections. Her store is open for business every day from 8 am to 9 pm.

Loan Use

Betsy needs a loan in order to purchase new jewelry, gift wrap accessories, toys and some clothing. By expanding her product line, she can present a new image for her business and offer a greater selection of goods to her customers.

Personal Information

Betsy is 23 years old and has a one-year-old son. She is separated from her husband, and uses a portion of her parents’ house from which to run her business. In addition to offering a wider variety of products, she would like to improve her business by making improvements to her business location..

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción D. Negocio

Betsy inicio su negocio hace 2 años. Los Productos que ofrece son: bisutería, útiles escolares y confites. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 8-a -9pm.

Uso D. Préstamo

Betsy necesita D. préstamo para adquirir: Nuevos modelos de bisutería, adornos para regalos, juguetes y algo de ropa. De esta manera ofrecer nueva imagen y variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Betsy tiene 23 años. Tiene 1 hijo menor. En la actualidad esta separada de su esposo. Betsy inicio con un pequeño capital prestado .Su local de trabajo ocupa una parte de la casa de sus padres. Por lo que necesita D. crédito para poder acondicionar y surtir de mejor manera su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase new products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add tents and tables to his business

loans.name: Jacobo

texts.es:
Business Description

Jacobo and his wife have a sewing workshop were they make bedspread sets. Aside from this business, Jacobo sells other kinds of household goods like dust covers, tents, sets of cooking pots, sets of dishes, and others. Jacobo’s workshop is situated in his own house where he takes care of customers from 8 am to 8 pm.

Loan Use

Jacobo is asking for this credit to buy rolls of fabric to make more bedspreads, and the household goods that costumers are looking for. Jacobo comments that he sells products not only in the city, but also travels to sell them outside the city.

Personal Information

Jacobo is 37 years old, married. He has three young children; two of them go to school. Jacobo and his wife are willing to develop their business because it is their source of income. They mention that they would like to keep building their home to make it a safer dwelling and to protect their business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Jacobo junto con su esposa tienen taller de costura su actividad específica es la elaboración de Juegos de Cubre Camas, adicional a este negocio Jacobo tiene la venta de artículos varios para el hogar como: Colchas, Toldos, Juegos de Ollas, Vajillas, y otros. Jacobo tiene taller en su domicilio atiende a sus clientes desde las 8: AM a 20: PM

Uso del Préstamo

Jacobo solicita el crédito para comprar mas rollos de tela para la elaboración de cubre camas y artículos para el hogar que le están solicitando. Jacobo nos dice que no solamente vende dentro de la ciudad sino que sale a vender sus productos fuera de la ciudad.

Información Personal

Jacobo tiene 37 años es casado y 3 hijos menores de edad de los cuales 2 están estudiando. Jacobo junto con su esposa está sacando adelante el negocio ya que lo consideran su fuente generadora de ingresos. Además nos indica que tienen anhelo de seguir construyendo su vivienda asid ara mejor seguridad y bienestar a negocio y hogar.

loans.use: Buying more fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy material to make uniforms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy an arcade machine and washing machine

loans.name: Michail

texts.en: Michail B. makes a living for himself and his family of three by transporting people around Ukraine from his home base in Ivano-Frankisvk. An energetic, positive fellow, he has been self-employed as a taxi driver for the past five years. He contracts with a radio dispatching company in Ivano-Frankivsk to help ensure that he has a steady supply of customers in need of transportation. Michail’s typical daily income is around 150-180 Ukrainian Hrivna or about $30-$35. Michail has requested a short term loan of $200 to purchase some new tires for his taxi-cab.

loans.use: Purchase tires for car

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.en: I. Savriniso has been running a business for the last 18 years.She is married and has 4 children. Her elder son and daughter help her in the business. She sells socks in the open air market in Gafurov, Khujand. She brings her goods from the wholesale market in Istaravshan, Khujand where she purchased them every week. She has many constant clients and she sells all the socks during the week. The current demand for socks is very high and she is requesting $800 for purchasing a new batch of socks; additionally she wants to include warm tights and gaiters to her assortment.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with a grown son. They live in Zaporozhye. Nataliya sells seasonal clothing at the central city market. She usually sells swimsuits in the summer and leather footwear in the fall and winter. Nataliya travels to Hungary to purchase swimsuits wholesale there. Her sister lives in Hungary which helps her save money each time she goes to buy another lot of inventory. Nataliya has been in this trade for 10 years. Presently, she has about $2,000–$2,400 in inventory. Her monthly profit is about $300-$400.   

Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase new inventory wholesale for further retail sale in her kiosk. Nataliya is an experienced entrepreneur. Her ultimate goal is to grow her business and introduce new clothing items which would be in demand among her customers. We believe her focused approach and integrity will ensure prompt repayment of this current loan.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory for the fall season

loans.name: Yuryi

texts.en:
Yuryi is a taxi driver from the Ivano-Frankivsk region in western Ukraine. He has been working as a driver for about four years and prior to that he had been a security guard. Yuryi is divorced and has one son who is seven years old.

A goal oriented, hard working business owner, Yuryi has some definitive plans for the future. He currently has a new car to use as his taxi but he would like to make some modifications to it so that it can run on cheaper fuel. He has requested a loan of $600 from Nadiya Ukraine to purchase the necessary parts to make the conversion. In the future, Yuryi also hopes to purchase a second car and hire another driver to work for him. We are glad for opportunities like this to assist hard working entrepreneurs such as Yuryi with their businesses.

loans.use: Modify car to run on cheaper fuel

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is a widow. She lives and works in Zaporozhye. Valentina sells inexpensive men’s and women’s clothes for elderly people in the central city market. Valentina has chosen this market niche because there are very few other businessmen who are working in this sphere of trade – despite the fact that the demand in this market segment is high. She has much experience selling clothing as she has been working as a market entrepreneur for about 6 years. Currently, Valentina has about $2000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $300-$400.  

Valentina would like to get a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional merchandise for the fall season. She believes that this will allow her to provide a variety of clothing and would meet the needs of her customers. Financial assistance helps Valentina sustain her business and herself. Like most of the retired people in Ukraine, Valentina has to look for additional income as her retirement pension is very small and is not enough to meet even her basic needs. We believe that this loan will be a considerable support for Valentina and will help her feel more secure financially.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for resale

loans.name: Zulaihon

texts.en: Zulaihon Mamadjonova has been running a business with her sister for over 5 years. She is married and has 3 children. Their business is located in the wholesale market Atushbazaar, in Khujand. Together, they rent one container and display their goods there. They sell slippers, plimsolls and galoshes for all ages. They buy their goods from Istaravshan and bring them in bags; one batch of shoes consists of approximately 100-400 pairs. Presently demand for plimsols and galoshes in Tadjikistan is very high; therefore people from neighboring districts come to Atushbazaar to purchase them. Zulaihon wants to purchase some more inventory and is requesting a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for business expansion

loans.name: Shikhzade

texts.en:
Shikhzade has been a poultry farmer for the past four years. He is 57 years old, married, and has four children. They all live in the town of Khachmaz.

In his current business, Shikhzade buys chickens and raises them for poultry sales. Now, he needs a loan of $600 to buy additional hens and chickens to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase hens and chickens

loans.name: Faiziniso

texts.en: Faiziniso A. is one of the active clients of MicroInvest. She started her business in 1995. Her son and her husband help her and sell her garments in Atushbazaar, in Khujand. (her husband is shown in the photo) Faiziniso buys goods from Israravshan, Khujand. She chooses her assortment herself and always tries to meet client needs. The diversity of her goods attracts new clients, who are left satisfied with the goods they buy from her. Today her stall is one of the known stalls in the area. For the upcoming cold season she wants to purchase modern warm clothes and is requesting a loan of  $1200.

loans.use: To acquire more inventory

loans.name: Agasi

texts.en:
Agasi is a 43-year-old man who is married and has two children. His family and him live in the town of Khachmaz. Agasi has his own cafe where he makes homemade kebabs. He has been in this business for six years.

Agasi buys rams from the villagers and uses the rams to make kebabs for his cafe. Now, he needs a loan of $600 to purchase additional rams in order to increase the number of his clients so that he is able to enhance his income.

loans.use: To purchase  rams

loans.name: Tofik

texts.en:
Tofik is a 56 year-old married man with two children, living in the town of Khachmaz. He sells dairy produce in the local market. Tofik mainly sells cheese; he prepares the cheese himself at his home.

Tofik has a total of six years of experience in this cheese sales business. Now, he needs a loan of $725 to buy additional dairy products for sale at the market.

loans.use: To invest in additional dairy produce

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en:
Mukaram has her own workshop of women garments. She opened it in 2004. She has previously studied fashion design. Several years ago, she took orders at home and had many clients. When she heard about MicroInvest she became a client and got loan in the amount of $150. She spent it for purchasing fabric and sewing them as national dresses for the market. Gradually she increased her loan and saved money for renting premises for a workshop. Today she has 4 sewing machines, one ironing board, one wide table for cutting details of clothes and one dummy at her workshop. She is requesting a loan to purchase mannequins to attract new clients to her workshop.  

In the photo you can see her mother who is a seamsress too.

loans.use: Purchasing of two mannequins

loans.name: Alimurad

texts.en:
Alimurad is a married man with two children and lives in the town of Khachmaz. Alimurad is 40 years old and has been breeding poultry for the past seven years.

Currently, he purchases chickens and raises them for sale. Now, he needs a loan of $600 to buy additional hens and chickens in order to further increase his income.

loans.use: To purchase hens and chicken

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim is 40 years old, married, has two children. He lives in the town of Khachmaz. Just four years ago, Nazim started his agricultural produce business. He brings the agricultural produce from the village and sells these in the local market.. Now, he needs a loan of $725 to buy agricultural produce in order to increase his current income.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Sorangel García

texts.en:
Sorangel is an experienced person in doing business. She is living with her husband and their beloved one-year-old daughter. For the sake of sustaining the family, her husband has a lottery bank and offers his services as a barber to the men of the township. Sorangel attends to the drink store of the couple. The store has its key activities at night, even though it’s open in the morning. The atmosphere is very pleasant, because there is good sound equipment, and almost all types of drinks are sold. Customers seize upon that time to play dominos and cards there.

Generally, Sorangel has to go to Santo Domingo, the capital, every weekend to buy wholesale drinks. Since the terrain is pretty rough, the delivery service of the drinks companies can’t easily take the goods to her business. So she’s obliged to rent an expensive truck and take the supplies to her.

Up until now, the business has been profitable. In fact, when we visited her store, we could observe that there was nothing left to sell. People in the township consume a lot of alcohol, especially during the weekends, and the demand continues growing.

Sorangel has applied to borrow US $375 that will help her buy more drinks in order to face the growing demand from the population. This way, she will be able to increase her income and use part of that additional to buy fuel for the two motorcycles of the business. She’ll also be able to save some money for other needs of the family.

loans.use: The entrepreneur will use the money to buy more products in order to reach more customers; and bear expenses for transportation.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is a 47-year-old woman living in Lebaa in the South of Lebanon. She has 3 children and her husband is a daily worker in the contracting industry.

Therese does pottery work, creates wood icons, and paints on fabric and glass. She now needs a loan for USD 200 in order to buy the special paint she needs to produce her handicraft work.

Therese is part of a group with other women. The group consists of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. Group lending is based on incremental increase of the loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaborative approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: Buy special paints used for painting on fabrics and glass.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette (standing at right in the picture) is a 40-year-old woman living in Lebaa in the South of Lebanon. She is married with no kids and is the sole financial provider of the household, as her husband is sick and unemployed.

Antoinette has specialized in handicraft and creates flowers arrangement using fabric as the main material. She also paints on fabrics and sells her work in the village community or through local exhibitions.

Antoinette is part of a group with other women. The group consists of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. Group lending is based on incremental increase of the loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaborative approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: Buy fabrics to produce handicraft flowers.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru:
Ali A. was born in 1970 in the village of Bidzho in Aksu region. Now, he lives in the village of Tekle. Ali has been engaged in cattle farming for 8 years. He has 2 children. In 2007, he applied to Aksu branch of Normicro for a business loan to purchase sheep.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Али Амрахов. Родилься 1970 году в село Биджо Аксуниского р.на. Сейчас проживает в деревньи Текле. Занимаеться скотоводством. Имеет двоих детей. 2007 году обратилься Нормикро Аксуниского филиала чтобы взять кредит . Али хочеть купить по больше овец.Он уже 8 лет подряд занимаеться этим бизнесом.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of animals

loans.name: Famil

texts.ru:
Famil M. was born in 1976 in Aksu. Recently, he got married. For 12 years, Famil and his older brother have been engaged in furniture production and repair. Famil has to buy new equipment to improve the quality of his products. He turned to Normicro for help.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мияни Фамиль родилься 1976 году в городе Аксу. Недавно женилься. 12 лет подряд со своим старшим братом занимаеться производством и ремонтом мебели. Для того чтобы сделать свою работу качественном, ему необходимо купить новые оборудование.За помощью он обратилься в Нормикро Аксуниского филиала.

loans.use: For procurement of new equipment

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. Francisco A. is a single 55 year old man with three children. His 24 year-old son lives and works with him; his 21 and 28 year old daughters both live with their mother in Japan.

Francisco buys charcoal in bulk quantities, divides it into smaller quantities and repackages it for resale in the city of Villa Elisa. He distributes his charcoal using a truck that he owns. Francisco wishes to invest his loan in the purchase of charcoal by the ton, in order to lower the cost of his merchandise and obtain a better profit margin on his sales. He looks forward to taking advantage of an offer he has received of a large quantity of bagged charcoal.

loans.use: Purchase of Charcoal

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.ru:
Ramiz V. was born in 1951. He has 2 children. Ramiz used to be a truck driver. For the last 2 years, he has been engaged in retail business. Ramiz has been constantly expanding his business. In 2006, he received a loan from Aksu branch of Normicro. Now Ramiz asks for another loan to purchase new inventory.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рамиз Велишов, 1951 года рождения. Раньше был водителям грузовика. Имеет двоих детей. Второй год занимаеться торговли . Ему необходимо было расширять свой бизнес. 2006 году он взял кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала.Сейчас ему нужен кредит чтобы увеличить обьем товаров.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Mr. Francisco F. Rojas is 43 years old, married, and lives with his wife and seven year old child. His wife is a teacher and also contributes to the household income.

As a young man, Francisco started up his own Microenterprise by acquiring a vehicle and working as a driver. Several years later, he sold the vehicle and had the opportunity to buy both a new automobile and a taxi station. His business has done very very well, aided by the fact that Francisco always keeps his vehicles in good condition. Furthermore, he consistently guarantees his clients safe and comfortable trips to their destination.

Francisco will use his credit to make repairs caused by daily wear and tear on his taxi. He plans to repaint, reupholster, and repair the motor.

loans.use: Motor repair of borrower`s vehicle

loans.name: Elchin

texts.ru:
Elchin E. was born in 1975. He lives in the village of Tekle in Aksu region. He has one child. For 15 years, Elchin E. has been engaged in cattle farming. Before getting his first Normicro loan, he had 3 cows and 5 sheep. His first Normicro loan Elchin E. used to buy a few more sheep. He asks for another loan to continue expansion of his cattle farm.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Эльчин Ехтибаров. 1975 года рождения. Проживает в село Текле Аксуниского района. Имеет одного ребенка. 15 лет занимаеться скотоводством. До получения первого кредита, он держал 3 коровы и 5 овец.После первого кредита полученного из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала купил еще нескольких овцов.Эльчин заново обратился за кредит.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of animals

loans.name: María

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Lidia, 57 years old, is a single mother of two. Her son is 22 years old and works in a Cooperative while her daughter is 20 years old and is in the United States studying and working at a camp for children with special needs. Maria says she really misses her daughter.

Maria has operated a mini-grocery store out of her residence for 18 years. She began selling candies and sweets out of a small hut. Later, she moved and constructed a commercial space which she has since fit out to be a grocery store selling all kinds of basic goods and supplies. These include milk, sugar, pastas, baked goods, and rice. She eventually equipped the store to house a meat shop.

Over the years, things have gone well for Maria; she hasn´t had any major difficulties. She only remembers one period of time, during an economic crisis, where she was much affected because she had numerous financial obligations, most importantly, the education of her children whom she felt she could not fail. Thanks to God and her perseverance, she was able to rise above the situation. Today, she finds herself in a stable position, one which encourages her to continue investing.

Maria says the credits are very useful since they allow her to achieve her objectives. She is currently planning to purchase bulk merchandise such as sugar, rice, flour, and pastas. Bulk purchases will lower her costs and increase her profit margin on sales.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for mini-grocery store

loans.name: Faradzhova

texts.ru:
E. Faradzhova was born in 1940 in the village of Tekle. She is married and has 8 children. For more than 20 years, E.’s large family has been growing cattle. Now, the children have grown up and can help their parents. The Faradzhovs applied to Aksu branch of Normicro for a loan to purchase more cows.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Фараджова Елмира , родилась 1949 году в село Текле.Замужем, имеет восьмирых детей. Семья уже больше 20-и лет занимаеться скотоводством. Семья слишьком большая. Дети выросли и теперь они могут помогать родительям. Фараджовы обратились в Нормикро Аксуниского филиала взять кредит чтобы купить больше коров.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of animals

loans.name: Shahin

texts.ru:
Shahin M. was born in 1968 in Agsu region. He has 3 children. Shahin has been driving a taxi for 10 years. He has been a Normicro customer over the last 3 years. Shahin has been prompt with repayment of his previous loans. Now, he needs to borrow money to repair his taxi car.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Шахин Мусаев родилься в Аксуниском районе. 1968 года рождения. Имеет троих детей. 10 лет занимаетсья водительям такси.Третий год подряд берет кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала.Без проблем возвращаеть кредит. Теперь Шахин хочеть ремонтировать свою машину.

loans.use: To repair taxi car

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mrs. Mirna Ruiz de Alarcon is 42 years old, married to Mario Alarcon (47 years old), and has four children. Of her children, the oldest is a 21 year-old who is pursuing a career in Business Administration at a private university. They both have an 18 year-old who plays soccer at a club in Asuncion, and a 14 and 13 year-old who are both in middle school.

Mirna and her husband have operated a mini-grocery store from their residence since 1994. Previously, their business was located in Market 4, Asuncion´s biggest, most popular public market. However, they decided to move the store to their home, a corner property situated at the intersection of two main streets.

Mirna and her hushand wish to invest the potential loan in the purchase of bulk merchandise such as a variety of pasta, sugar, rice, flour, and other food staples. They would also like to purchase a larger refrigerator so that they can increase the stock of cold beverages they offer to their customers.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maharram

texts.ru:
Maharram S. was born in 1958 in Agsu. He is married and has 3 children. Maharram S. has been a barber for more than 29 years. To improve the quality of his service, Maharram wants to purchase modern equipment and needs this loan to pay for it.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Салахов Магеррам родилься 1958 году в городе Аксу. Имеет троих детей.Хороший семьянин, более 29-ти лет работает парикмахером.Чтобы качественно обслуживать клиентов ему необходимо купить современного оборудования.Поэтому ему нужен кредит.

loans.use: For procurement of equipment

loans.name: Asmar

texts.ru:
Asmar N. was born in 1984. She is single and lives in Aksu. Four years ago, Asmar opened a beauty salon. Asmar’s parents helped her as much as they could to repair the salon. Now, Asmar needs to purchase new equipment including electric generator.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Новрузова Асмар родилась 1984 году.Проживает в городе Аксу. Не замужем. Четыре года назад она открыла свой бизнес. Начала активно заниматсья. Родители кое-как помогли отремонтировать парикмахерскую.Теперь ее надо обнавлять оборудования и купить электрогенератор .

loans.use: For procurement of equipment

loans.name: Fazil

texts.ru:
Fazil M. was born in 1968 in Aksu. He is married and has 2 children. For more than 10 years, he has been running a pharmacy. In 2006, he Fazil M. took $500 credit. Now, he needs another loan to purchase inventory. Fazil’s father died a long time ago. Fazil lives with his family and his mother.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Меликов Фазил родилься 1968 году в городе Аксу.Женат, имеет двоих детей. Уже больше 10-ти лет занимаеться торговли лекарством.2006 году взял вкредит 500$.Теперь ему нужен кредит чтобы купить необходимые лекарство .Отец давно умер.Он живет с семьёй и с матерью.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

texts.en: M. is member of Yamida. She is 38 years old and married with two children. She lives in Bogor, Indonesia with her husband. To supplement her husband's earnings, she began running a  small business selling food and beverages. From her business, M. gets a profit $5-$10. She has handled the business for 18 years and now she needs $125 loan to expand the business.

loans.use:
$50 will be used to buy more goods
$50 will be used to buy more food products
$25 will be used to buy beverages

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela raises chickens, which she sells at small markets in her area. She depends on the tireless daily support of her husband and children in order to successfully run her small farm. Through the diligent care and high quality feed that Mariela’s chickens receive; they grow to ideal and unmatched size and weight. Mariela and her family are very pleased with this, because thanks to the revenue from their chickens, she is able to fulfill her family’s most pressing needs. Because the number of orders that she receives has increased, Mariela would like to increase the pasture where the chickens are kept, so that she can divide them by age and by order. In order to initiate her proposal, she is asking for a $600 loan, which she has agreed to repay within 6 months. With your generous support, you can make her dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Mariela se dedica a la crianza de pollos para ofrecerlos en venta en los pequeños mercados de su localidad.para realizar esta labor cuenta con el apoyo diario e incansable de su esposo e hijos para llevar satisfactoriamente las riendas de su pequeña granja. Debido al cuidado con el que los cría y el alto índice de calidad que les otorga en sus alimentos estos alcanzan pesos y tamaños ideales e incomparable; estos hechos y la demanda de sus pollos tienen a Mariela y su familia muy contentas porque gracias a los réditos que han generado ella puede satisfacer las necesidades más urgentes de su familia. El número de pedidos se ha ido incrementando y por esta razón Mariela desea ampliar el campo en el que se encuentran sus aves a fin de poder separarlas por tiempo de permanencia y pedidos. Su solicitud es por un monto de 600 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses para iniciar su propósito. Con tu generoso apoyo podrás convertir este anhelo en realidad
