loans.use: Better permanent conditions for Marielas birds assure quality and continued top flavor on the tables of  the homes of Pucallpa.

loans.name: Cupertino

texts.es:
After moving to Pucallpa with his family, Cupertino began selling convenience items in a small store set up in his home. The excellent customer service that he offers has caused notable growth in his client base. Because of this growth he would now like to increase the size of his store, and improve the products that he stocks in order to meet the demands of his clients and to increase his family’s quality of life. Cupertino is asking for a $325 loan to begin expanding his story with the help of his family. He has committed to repay the loan within 6 months. Through your generous support, Cupertino’s family will be able to reach their goal.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer.

Cupertino, desde que se estableció junto a su familia en la localidad de Pucallpa, ha iniciado la venta de productos de primera necesidad en una pequeña bodega que ha acondicionado en las instalaciones de su hogar. Actualmente y debido a la demanda que tienen en el barrio por la excelente calidad de servicio que brindan, su cartera de clientes se ha ido incrementando notoriamente. A raíz de este hecho es que desea ampliar el lugar en el que ofrece sus productos y mejorar el stock de los mismos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes e incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia .Por esta razón Cupertino solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares para iniciar la implementación de su bodega con ayuda de toda su familia y se compromete a retornarlos en un período de 6 meses. Con tu aporte generoso la familia de Cupertino podrá llevar a cabo su propósito.

loans.use: Purchase of addtional, and more varied products can make the Cupertino's Store one of the most popular.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan is a 35 year old male. Currently he lives by himself in a small house that he owns. He has a workshop (wood kiosk) located on Carrasco avenue, here he does bicycle repairs and he also sells replacements. Juan has been working on this business for about 8 years, and now he has a solid client base because of his hard work, and his excellent customer service. He has 10 months of experience as a locksmith, he works on this 5 days a week in his home workshop, and the rest if the time he works at the bicycle shop. He is asking for a loan to increase his capital so he can buy a piece of land that is worth $1,500 USD, he has $1,000 saved from his hard work. This is the second credit with the institution and he has demonstrated to be a responsible and punctual person in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan es un señor de 35 años que vive sólo, actualmente vive en una casa pequeña propia, su taller (kiosco de madera) se encuentra ubicado sobre la avenida Carrasco, ahí se dedica a la reparación y venta de repuestos de bicicletas. Juan trabaja en este rubro aproximadamente 8 años, tiempo en el cuál logró consolidar a su clientela por su buen trabajo, cumplimiento y sobre todo su excelente trato. En cuanto a los trabajos de cerrajería cuenta con 10 meses de experiencia, mismos que los realiza 5 días a la semana en su taller que se encuentra instalado en su casa, los dos días restantes de la semana trabaja en el taller de las bicicletas. Con la presente solicitud quiere incrementar su capital para comprar un terreno que vale $us. 1,500.-, el logró juntar $us. 1,000.- por medio de su esfuerzo y trabajo. Este es su segundo crédito con la institución, en este tiempo demostró ser una persona puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Incremento Capital para Compra Terreno

loans.name: Silvina

texts.es:
Sra. Silvina, 51, is a single mother with 1 son. She owns a home-based business making headwear; she also displays and sells the products that she makes in her house. Her main customers are tourists, the faithful who flock to the Virgen de Caacupe--the image of the Virgin at the Basilica de Caacupe that is one of the main attractions of that city--every year, along with passing motorists. Silvina works with her mother and son and the three of them pull together to meet their monthly sales goals. Silvina's mother is in charge of making the headwear; her son sells their products at local festivals in Cordillera--the department in south-central Paraguay where Caacupe is located; and Silvina sells from the shop in her house.

Her main achievement--that is, to say, what has allowed her to buy her own home--has been to broaden the range of merchandise she sells which, in turn, has allowed her to increase sales. She said that starting the business was very difficult because she had to meet government regulations for starting a business at the same time that she was being mother and father to her son. Nevertheless, she has managed through perseverance to get ahead and now she's even planning to expand her business, renovating a small shop near the Basilica de Caacupe, for which she's looking to the Fundacion Paraguay to help her raise enough money to finish.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Silvina 51 años, es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo, su taller de confección está ubicado en su mismo domicilio dónde también tiene su salón de exposición y venta de sus artículos, sus principales clientes son los turistas, los fieles que visitan a la Virgen de Caacupé cada año (la imagen de la virgen se encuentra en la Basílica de Caacupé y es una de las principales atracciones de la ciudad) y los automovilistas que pasan frente a su negocio. Actualmente Silvina, trabaja con su mamá y su hijo, los tres se ayudan mutuamente para lograr sus objetivos de ventas mensuales, la encargada de confeccionar los kepis y sombreros es la madre de Silvina, su hijo sale a vender sus productos en las fiestas patronales de las principales ciudades del departamento de la Cordillera, mientras que Silvina los vende en su local.

Su principal logro dice ser el hecho de haberse comprado una casa propia, y aumentado el volumen de sus mercaderías en el negocio, lo cual le permitió aumentar sus ventas. Comenta que en sus inicios fue muy difícil ya que ella tenía que cumplir el papel de comerciante, de madre y padre para su hijo, no obstante con perseverancia logró salir adelante y hoy día está pensando inclusive ampliar su negocio habilitando una pequeña sucursal cerca de la Basílica de Caacupé, por lo cual está pensando en la nuevamente en la Fundación Paraguaya para poder tener el capital que le permita cumplir con su proyecto.

loans.use: Buy materials, threads, etc. for a headwear business.

loans.name: Rouwaida

texts.en:
Rouwayda is a 38-year-old woman, mother of five children, living in the village of Aytate in the rural area of the Chouf. Rouwayda has been a tailor since the age of 18 and is well known in her village for her embroidery work. Rouwayda has been a client of Majmoua for the past 3 years. As with her previous loan, she needs the money to buy fabrics and accessories that she will use in her work.

Rouwayda is part of a group with other women. The group consists of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions, mostly in rural areas. Group lending is based on incremental increase of the loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaborative approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards the economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: Buy fabrics for embroidery work

loans.name: Ramzieh

texts.en:
Ramzieh is a 38-year-old married woman, mother of five children, living in the city of Tripoli in the North of Lebanon. Ramzieh (in the middle in the picture) does handicraft work and specializes in the transformation of wood into pieces of art. She molds and paints the wood in a beautiful way and usually sells her products in her neighborhood or while participating in local exhibitions.

Ramzieh needs the amount of USD 1,000 to buy wood, accessories and some paint.

Ramzieh is part of a group with other women. Group lending is based on incremental increase of the loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaborative approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: Purchase of wood and special paint to use on the wood

loans.name: Jamile

texts.en:
Jamile is a 39-year-old married woman, mother of 3 children, living in the village of Baalechmey in the rural area of the Chouf. Jamile specializes in crochet work and the creation of "faux-bijoux" that she usually sells in the city of Aley, not far from her village, or while participating in local exhibitions. Her husband and her daughters love to help her when they have free time.

Jamile is part of a group with other women. Group lending is based on incremental increase of the loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaborative approach in the borrowing community. The group loan is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: Purchase of accessories for the handicraft work and material for the "crochet"

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 24-year-old self-made woman living with her parents in Dekwaneh in Beirut. She strives every day to pay her university tuition fees through the embroideries she makes for wedding and evening dresses. She learned that skill from her mother and wanted to develop it into a sustainable business.

Rania has received 2 loans from Al Majmoua prior to this one. Now she needs USD 700 to buy fabrics and accessories to continue expanding her work. Once she graduates, her dream is to transform the small business she runs from home into a registered company. For sure, Al Majmoua will do its best to help her reach this goal.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and accessories for the embroidery work

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Mr. Vidal is 55 years old, married, and the owner of a carwash in the area of Loma de Caacupé. He's had this business for more than 12 years and his main partner and assistant is his son, Javier B., with whom he starts the the very early hours of the day, attending customers. Vidal comments that he and his son divide the tasks of doing more than washing cars- they provide car maintenance service, oil changes, and sell auto tires.

Fundación Paraguaya offered him the loans, which allowed him to grow his business and buy the necessary tools and modern equipment to meet the most demanding requests of his customers. Vidal is very satisfied that his only son is the one that is helping his business succeed, since this also allows him to become closer with his son and teach him the business as well.

One of his medium term goals is to increase the variety of services, which are currently incorporated into the prices of auto spare parts that he sells. For this, he needs more capital and currently seeks a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Vidal tiene 55 años es casado y es propietario de un lavadero de autos en el barrio Loma de Caacupé, éste negocio lo tiene desde hace más de 12 años, y su principal colaborador y ayudante es su hijo Javier B., con quién a muy temprana horas de la mañana inician la atención a sus clientes. Vidal comenta que se distribuye las tareas con su hijo ya, a más del lavado de autos ellos realizan el servicio de mantenimiento, cambio de aceite, y ventas de neumáticos para autos.

Los préstamos que le otorgó la Fundación Paraguaya le permitió hacer crecer su negocio, además incorporó los accesorios y las herramientas más modernas para evacuar los más exigentes pedidos hechos por sus clientes. El señor Vidal se siente muy satisfecho por el hecho de que su único hijo sea el que cuide y le apoye a llevar adelante su pequeña empresa, ya que esto le permitió estar muy cerca de él y de esa forma transmitirles los conocimientos del oficio.

Uno de sus objetivos a mediano plazo es ir aumentando las variedades de servicios que actualmente está ofreciendo con la incorporación de ventas de repuestos para vehículos, para el efecto necesitará de un capital, para ello solicita el crédito.

loans.use: To buy car tires and motor oil

loans.name: Isaela

texts.es:
Isaela and her husband have a farm on which they raise their cattle. In spite of being 58 and 59 years old, respectively, they still have a desire to work and improve their living conditions. They have a piece of land on which they would like to plant camu-camu (a small tree with a berry-like fruit) to supply this product to many laboratories that make alternative medicines from it. Isaela’s initiative came about as a result of her asking questions about the plant's curative properties because, lately, many people are using natural medicines and they have become more lucrative. To begin this project, Isaela is requesting a loan of $800.00, which she is committed to repaying in a period of 6 months. Together, with your generous support, let’s help Isaela and her husband achieve their goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Isaela y su esposo cuentan con un fundo en el que realizan sus actividades ganaderas con mucha comodidad; a pesar de contar con 58 y 59 años respectivamente aún se sienten con muchos deseos de trabajar y mejorar su calidad de vida.En las amplias instalaciones de este lugar cuentan con un terreno amplio en el que desean sembrar camu- camu para abastecer de este producto a muchos laboratorios que fabrican medicinas alternativas a base de este fruto, la iniciativa de Isaela nació a raíz de las averiguaciones que hizo sobre sus bondades curativas ya que de un tiempo a esta parte para combatir las dolencias de muchas personas este tipo de preparados naturales se ha convertido en un boom dentro de nuestro planeta.Y para iniciar este proyecto Isaela, solicita un préstamo de 800 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses. Hagamos juntos que Isaela y su esposo logren su propósito con ayuda de tu generoso aporte.

loans.use: To plant camu-camu, a medicinal plant, for sale to alternative medicine laboratories

loans.name: Taisisi

texts.en: Taisisi has been in the trading business for quite a long time. With her grocery shop doing very well, she’s now looking at expanding into a handicraft business to help her support her existing business. With all her children working, she enjoys becoming financially independent and working hard at her business. Being a member of SPBD helps with her standard of living and earning her extra money for other commitments.

loans.use: To expand her products into handicrafts

loans.name: Lava

texts.en: Lava is one of the first SPBD members from 2005, but then she left. She rejoined again because she needed help with her five year old business which is a shop. She wanted to expand into a mini supermarket and with her profit of $140 a week after all expenses from the previous years, in order to extend her shop she needed extra cash to finish the job. So she rejoined and within two months, her profit and payments increased, making her eligible for the next loan.

loans.use: To expand shop into a mini supermarket

loans.name: Judith Esther

texts.es:
Sra. Judith belongs to the Banco Comunal Manos Unidas (United Hands Community Bank); she's 48 years old and the mother of 2 children. She lives in Jr. Oscar Benavidez in the Calleria district of Ucayali in Peru. Since separating from her husband, she's been the sole provider for her family. She decided to set up a small store in her house, with the help of her children, so that she can work at home.

With a recently-granted loan of S/.500 (500 Peruvian soles or about US$160) from Manuela Ramos, she will buy 1 bag of rice, 1 case of milk, 1 case of oil, 1 case of canned goods and 2 cases of soft drinks. Judith is a woman fulfilled and she has the great satisfaction of having made it possible for her children to finish school and get a good start in life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Judith pertenece al Banco Comunal Manos Unidas, tiene 48 años y es madre de 2 hijos. Vive en el Jr. Oscar Benavidez, del distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Desde su separación con su esposo, tuvo que enfrentar sola las necesidades básicas de la familia, por lo cual decide instalar una bodega en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de los hijos y es así que también atiende las labores de la casa.

Con el préstamo recientemente otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 500.00 (US$ 160 aprox.) comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 caja de leche, 1 caja de aceite, 1 caja de productos enlatados y 2 cajas de gaseosas. Judith es una mujer que se siente realizada, y tiene la gran satisfacción de haber logrado que sus hijos terminen sus estudio y estén bien encaminados.

loans.use: Buy basic supplies for store business.

loans.name: Suesa

texts.en: With six kids to feed and put through school, this lady had trouble making ends meet and was desperate to improve their living conditions and be able to afford her kids' education. She has a talent for making bangles, bracelets, necklaces, and earrings out of sinnet and pearls. With her husband's help, they make quantities of these which they sell to the locals and tourists at their stall down at the flea market. With the high demand of the goods, she is able to make a daily profit after all expenses of $40 which now helps her support and educate her family and pay back her loan.

loans.use: To restock inventory and to purchase supplies

loans.name: Liz Karina

texts.es:
Sra. Liz, 24, is the mother of 3 girls. She belongs to the Banco Comunal Manos Unidas (United Hands Community Bank) in the Manantay district of Ucayali in Peru. Her partner earns a living making charcoal--he burns wood to make it--but it's Liz who carries it by the sack-full to the local market where it's in demand as the most popular product for firing kitchen stoves. Her first loan was for S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$94).

With the recently granted loan of S/.1,000 (or US$319, approximately) from Manuela Ramos, she will buy 2 truckloads of wood, 15 bags of aserrin (wood shavings?) and install a new kiln for burning the wood. She and her partner jointly make a living from the business, something that at the same time allows her to educate her daughters. Both are happy working as a team where he makes the charcoal and she sells it, together providing a much-needed product.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Liz tiene 24 años y es madre de 3 niñas, pertenece al Banco Comunal Manos Unidas, del A.H. Santa Graciela Mz K. Lt 4 del distrito de Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali. Su conviviente trabaja en la elaboración de carbón (hornea la leña para obtener carbón) y Liz es quien se dedica a vender el carbón por sacos, llevando al mercado mas cercano de la población, ya que con este producto muchas personas lo utilizan como combustible para la cocina. Su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.).

Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 1,000 (US$ 319 aprox.) comprará 2 camionadas de leña, 15 sacos de aserrín e implementarán un nuevo volcán para hornear la leña. Ahora conjuntamente con su conviviente se dedican a este negocio, a la vez pueden educar a sus hijas. Ambos están contentos de trabajar en equipo, donde él elabora el carbón y ella lo vende en el mercado, atendiendo a muchas personas que lo requieren.

loans.use: Buy wood, supplies and equipment for charcoal-making business.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia V. is a mother of one who works hard out at her stall at the flea market to earn money to support her child.  Her line of business is selling clothes and handicrafts to locals and tourists, and this earns her a profit of $28 daily after all expenses and she only sells 5 times a week.  Her aim is to expand her business when she’s eligible for the next loan step.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Sra. Olga, 47, is the mother of 5 children. She belongs to the Banco Comunal Manos Unidas (United Hands Community Bank) in the district of Manantay in Ucayali in Peru. Her partner is a worker at a sawmill. There are lots of sawmill workers in this very isolated place and no restaurants within an easy distance, so Olga took the initiative to set up a business providing meals to the workers.

With a first loan of S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$94), she decided to buy kitchen utensils. With a recently-granted loan of S/.2,000 (US$639, approximately) from Manuela Ramos, she will buy 3 bags of charcoal--fuel for cooking--10 kilos of rice, 5 kilos of beans, 1 set of spoons, 1 set of plates and vegetables that she needs to prepare her meals. Olga and her partner are happy because they can be near one another despite the distance from the city and because they're generating income to cover basic household expenses. As of now, she can serve 30 workers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Olga tiene 47 años y es madre de 5 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Manos Unidas, del distrito de Manantay, Departamento de Ucayali. Su cónyuge es trabajador de un aserradero, en el lugar hay muchos trabajadores que, en condición de peón, trabajan en los aserraderos, sin embargo dada la distancia no hay restaurante cerca, por ello Olga tiene la iniciativa de cocinar y dar menú a los trabajadores del lugar.

Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) decide comprar utensilio de cocina. Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000 (US$ 639 aprox.) comprará 3 sacos de carbón (combustible para preparar los alimentos), 10 kilos de arroz, 5 kilos de frijol, 1 juego de cucharas, 1 juego de platos, y verduras que diariamente lo requiere para el menú. Olga y su cónyuge están contentos ya que ambos están cerca a pesar de la distancia de la cuidad y además ambos están generando ingresos para cubrir todas las necesitadas básicas de su hogar. A la fecha puede atender a 30 peones del lugar.

loans.use: Buy charcoal, foodstuffs and other supplies for restaurant business.

loans.name: Sindra

texts.en: Sindra is 26 years old, and has 3 kids, one in school and two young ones. She started her plantation business 2 years ago and now she has joined SPBD for a loan to help her and her family expand their business.  She sells her taro and bananas twice a week on Friday and Saturday, and they earn a profit of $140 a week. She uses it for family needs and other expenses but never forgets her loan repayment to SPBD every week.  Her husband earns $72 a week from his work.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and equipment

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Señora Rosa is 59 years old and has six children. She lives in Jr. Lima 296 and belongs to the Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes (“Courageous Women’s Community Bank”) in the district of Calleria, the department of Ucayali. Her husband is a carpenter and his earnings don’t cover the family’s daily necessities, so Rosa decided to ask for a loan of 300 Soles: with this money she set-up a small store in order to cover their household expenses.

Rosa has to take her merchandise on a daily basis to a small kiosk located in her yard. She does this with great satisfaction, and she doesn’t get bored of transporting her goods to the kiosk and vice versa.

With the recent loan from Manuela Ramos of 1500 Soles ($479 USD), she will buy 5 crates of soft drinks, 2 crates of milk, one bag of detergents and 1 crate of soaps.

Rosa and her husband are happy, because their work helps to provide their home’s basic necessities.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Rosa tiene 59 años y es madre de 6 hijos. Vive en Jr. Lima 296 y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, del distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Su esposo es carpintero y lo que gana no alcanza para las necesidades diarias, entonces Rosa decide solicitar un primer préstamo de S/ 300.00, con ese dinero instala una bodega para cubrir los gastos de la casa.

Rosa en forma diaria tiene que sacar la mercadería a un pequeño kiosco que tiene en la huerta de su casa, ella lo hace con gran satisfacción y no se agota en trasladar su mercadería al kiosco y viceversa.

Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos de S/ 1,500 (US$ 479.00 aprox.) comprará 5 cajas de gaseosas, 2 cajas de leche, una bolsa de detergentes, y 1 caja de jaboncillo.

Rosa y su esposo están contentos, porque el trabajo de ambos ayuda en atender las necesidades básicas del hogar.

loans.use: Buy different products for sale

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Señora Virginia is 57 years old and is the mother of 3 children. She lives at Guillermo Sisley 675 and belongs to the Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes (“Courageous Women’s Community Bank”) in the district of Calleria, Ucayali department. Together with her husband she owns a business selling motorcar spare parts. The town doesn’t have well-repaired tracks and the main moD. of transport is the motorcar: as a result these vehicles suffer frequent damage. Given this, Virginia and her husband decided to sell motorcar spare parts. Clients who are taxi-drivers are offered the possibility by Virginia of paying daily.

Recently, she has asked Manuela Ramos for a loan of 2.700 soles ($862 USD) which she will use to buy a dozen seals, two crates of lubricant, a dozen pull-systems and a dozen kip accessories. Virginia has the satisfaction of working together with her husband and it is he who with great care carries out the necessary motocar repairs.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Virginia tiene 57 años y es madre D. 3 hijos. Vive en el jirón Guillermo Sisley 675 y pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Valientes, del distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali. Junto a su esposo comparten el negocio D. venta D. repuestos D. Motocar, la ciudad no cuenta con pistas habilitadas y el principal medio D. transporte es el motocar, entonces estos vehículos sufren muchos desperfectos, dada esta necesidad Virginia y su esposo deciden vender repuestos para motocar. Virginia a los clientes que hacen el servicio D. Taxi les da facilidades D. pago en forma diaria.

Recientemente ha solicitado a Manuela Ramos un préstamo D. S/. 2,700 (US$ 862 aprox.), el cual será utilizado para comprar 1 docena D. retenes, 2 cajas D. rodaje, 1 docena D. sistema D. arrastre, y 1 docena D. accesorios kip. Virginia tiene la satisfacción D. trabajar conjuntamente con su esposo y es el quien revisa con detenimiento los desperfectos del motocar.

loans.use: Buy motorcar spare-parts and accessories

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina is married: her husband is self-employed and carries out residential maintenance work. She has here children, of whom two are still studying and the oldest is now working. Her younger son was born with cardiovascular problems and the income that they used to earn was neither sufficient to meet family expenses nor to pay for her son’s treatment. It was because of this that Marcelina saw the necessity of working and decided to start her own business: in this way she started selling soft drinks and snacks among her neighbours. Little by little the business has grown and she is now able to help her husband with the cost of her little boy’s treatments and interventions: because of this she wants to continue with her business and to move forward with her children.

Marcelina is asking for a loan of US $475 in order to buy merchandise for her business and thus to be able to continue her business’ growth and provide much needed help with the family’s expenses. She is offering to repay the loan in six months and she and her family thank you very much for the help that you are offering them to be able to better themselves.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Marcelina está casada y su esposo trabaja por su cuenta haciendo mantenimiento de residencias, tienen 3 hijos, de los cuales dos de ellos estudian aún y el mayor trabaja como obrero, su hijo menor nació con problemas cardiovasculares y los ingresos que percibían no les alcanzaba para los gastos familiares ni para el tratamiento de su hijo, fue por ello que se vio en la necesidad de trabajar y decidió poner su propio negocio, fue así como empezó vendiendo refrescos, frituras y golosinas entre sus vecinos, y poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su negocio a podido poder ayudar a su esposo para costear las intervenciones de su pequeño y sus tratamientos, por esto ella desea continuar con su negocio y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Marcelina solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y así poder continuar creciendo con sus negocios y ayudar a la economía familiar que tanto lo necesitan, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y tanto ella como su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: Merchandise purchase

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa is married with 3 kids who are 21, 15 and 11 years old. The eldest is a factory worker and the younger two are in high school and elementary school respectively. Her husband is also a factory worker and she had to find work in order to help her husband to cover the household costs and their kids' education. She is very hard working and knows a lot about cooking, so she decided to start selling toasted sandwiches, soft drinks and fried foods 3 years ago. Her sales have gradually risen and with her savings she was able to find a place to sell her foods to kids and teachers in a school.

Maria Teresa would now like a loan of $750 to buy more products for her canteen and more ingredients so that she can offer a wider range to her clients. She will repay this loan in 6 months. Her and her family thank you for your support which means that she can continue with her business and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

María Teresa esta casada y tiene 3 hijos D. 21, 15 y 11 años, el mayor trabaja como obrero en una fábrica los otros dos menores estudian en secundaria y primaria respectivamente, su esposo trabaja como obrero en una fábrica al igual que su hijo mayor, ella tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a su esposo a cubrir los gastos del hogar y la educación D. sus hijos, pero ella como es muy trabajadora y conoce sobre la cocina, decidió vender tortas (sándwich), refrescos y frituras hace tres años atrás. Poco a poco fue incrementando sus ventas y con sus utilidades pudo solicitar la concesión D. una cafetería en una escuela para poder vender a los alumnos y maestros D. la misma.

Ahora maría Teresa solicita un préstamo por la cantidad D. US $ 750 para poder surtir su cafetería con productos y materia prima para poder ofrecer mayor variedad D. productos y comidas para sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para poder continuar con su negocio y apoyar a su familia.

loans.use: To buy ingredients/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
Lizbeth is a very industrious woman. She is very dedicated to her work and she enjoys sales. She is divorced and has 2 kids who are 12 and 6 years old, both of whom study. She started her business because she realized her capacity as a saleswoman and she loved doing it. She also needed to support her kids. She started off selling sweets and TupperWare products, but after a while she started to sell clothes too. This went very well for her so she decided to stick to it, and little by little her business has grown.

Lizbeth would like a loan of $475 to buy fall-winter clothes so that she will have many attractive products for her clients. She will repay this loan in 4 months. Her and her kids thank you for the support that you are able to offer them as they know that the business can grow with your cooperation.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Lizbeth se considera una mujer muy emprendedora, dedicada a su trabajo y con un gusto muy grande por las ventas, ella esta divorciada y tiene dos hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad respectivamente, ambos estudiantes. Ella empezó con su negocio por que se dio cuenta de su potencial como vendedora y le encantaba hacerlo, así que por ello y por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos decidió a vender en un inicio dulces y productos Tupper Ware, pero paso el tiempo y empezó a vender ropa y eso le ha funcionado mucho mejor y hasta ahora se dedica a ello, creciendo poco a poco con su negocio.

Lizbeth esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para comprar ropa de temporada otoño-invierno y así tener productos atractivos para sus clientes y poder ampliar su cartera de clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses, ella y sus hijos te agradecen el apoyo que les brindas y por que sabe que podrá crecer con su negocio gracias a tu colaboración.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
R. is a warm and friendly homemaker who, from the time she came to live in the city of Pucallpa, has sold typical foods from the region. She prepared a small place in her home and offered a variety of food for the enjoyment of the diners. With the passage of time, R. has become well known and has received the recommendation of many of her customers, who pack this small place everyday in the company of friends and family. Seeing how business was going, it occurred to her that she could deliver food to client’s homes, with the goal of keeping them happy. Her husband offered make the deliveries so that she could tend to the customers who come to their home.

Over time, their transportation has suffered several problems that causes them losses and inconveniences. Due to this, R. is requesting a loan of $325.00, which she is committed to returning in a period of 6 months. She will buy a tricycle on which they will use to deliver the delicious food, and also soft drinks and other beverages that people request. Let’s make sure that the people in Pucallpa can continue to enjoy R.’s wonderful cooking. Let’s also help her and her husband give their family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

R. es una cariñosa y amable ama de casa que desde que vino a radicar a la ciudad de Pucallpa, se dedicó a vender comidas típicas de la región, acondicionó un pequeño espacio en su domicilio y ofrecía diversos platos para deleite de los comensales.Conforme a pasado el tiempo R. a cobrado mayor notoriedad y a acumulado muchas recomendaciones de cada uno de sus clientes que día a día abarrotan este pequeño espacio en compañía de amigos y familiares. Al observar lo que estaba pasando se le ocurrió la idea de brindarles el servicio de reparto a domicilio a sus clientes con el fin de mantenerlos más contentos; así es que su esposo se ofreció a realizar exclusivamente esta labor mientras ella atendía personalmente a los que acudían a su vivienda.Conforme ha ido pasando el tiempo la movilidad que utilizaba ha ido sufriendo algunos desperfectos que les ocasiona innumerables pérdidas e inconvenientes. A razón de este hecho es que R. hace una solicitud por un monto de 325 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un periodo de 6 meses para que pueda adquirir un triciclo en el que transportará además de sus deliciosos juanes, también gaseosas y otros potajes que les sea solicitado.Hagamos que muchas personas en Pucallpa sigan disfrutando de la deliciosa sazón de R.. Y para que ella con ayuda de su esposo pueda otorgarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: To buy a tricycle that will serve as transportation for a home food delivery business

loans.name: Anuncia

texts.es:
Anuncia is 55 years old, a single mother to two self-sufficient, independent children. She tells us she sacrificed much to enable her children to study all the while raising her children alone. 5 years ago she started a book store in her home, which is located across from a well-attended high school, resulting in her clients being teachers and students as well as those from the neighborhood. With the Paraguaya Foundation loans that Anuncia repaid previously she bought merchandise for her bookstore and a photocopier. During exam time, she makes photocopies of exams for the teachers. She is asking for a new loan to buy merchandise such as pens, pencils, erasers, rulers, books, paper, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Anuncia tiene 55 años, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos, los cuales ya trabajan de forma independiente. Ella nos cuenta que con mucho sacrificio hizo estudiar a sus hijos, ya que ella sola se encargo de la crianza de los mismos. Hace 5 años, montó una librería en su domicilio, que queda frente a un colegio muy populoso de la zona siendo sus clientes los alumnos y docentes del mismo, así como los vecinos del barrio. Con los créditos que Doña Anuncia retiró anteriormente de la Fundación Paraguaya fue comprando mercaderías para su librería y una fotocopiadora. En la época de exámenes, ella realiza las fotocopias de los exámenes para proveerlos a los profesores. Ella solicita un crédito nuevo para la compra de mercaderías tales como bolígrafos, lápices, borradores, reglas, libros, hojas etc.

loans.use: Pens, pencils, erasers, rulers, books, paper, etc.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Isabel and I dedicate myself to the sale of kitchen articles, clothing, shoes, creams, cosmetics and other things. I have had this business for three years. My customers give me their orders, I buy them and then sell them; in this way I manage to obtain a little more profit. I have two children who I help with their studies. Right now I need to invest capital since as of this month I begin to prepare for my christmas sales.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Isabel y me dedico a la venta de articulos de cocina, ropa, zapatos, cremas, cosmeticos y otros. Este negocio lo tengo desde hace tres años, mis clientes me hacen los pedidos los compro y despues se los vendo, de esta manera logro obtener un poco mas de ganancias. Tengo dos hijos a quienes he ayudado en sus estudios. En este momento necesito invertir capital para vender ya que a partir de este mes comienzo a preparme para mis ventas de navidad.

loans.use: Purchase of various items, women's clothing, shoes, jewelry, creams and other items - Compra de ollas, ropa para dama, zapatos, adornos, cremas y otros.

loans.name: Paula Marina

texts.es:
My name is Paula Marina. Everyone has called my tortilla business "Marina," since I have dedicated myself to the production and sale of corn tortillas for five years. I began on a small scale; now I have another person who collaborates in the production once there are enough orders and I can't cover them alone. With the profits that I have obtained, I have aided my family, especially my children in their studies. The area in which I live is sufficiently populated and every two months fairs are celebrated where I take the advantage to sell my tortillas to the people who arrive to sell food at these fairs, and I also sell them to my neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Paula Marina, todos han llamado a mi negocio tortillas Marina, ya que desde hace 5 años me dedico a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas de maiz, comence en menor escala, ahora tengo otra persona que me colabora en la elaboracion ya que los pedidos son bastantes y sola no puedo cubrirlo. Con las ganancias que he obtenido he ayudado a mi familia, especialmente a mis hijos en sus estudios. La zona donde vivo es bastante poblada y cada dos meses se celebran ferias es donde aprovecho venderle mis tortillas a las personas que llegan a vender comida en estas ferias, y tambien les vendo a mis vecinos.

loans.use: purchase of corn flour, water, firewood - compra de harina de maiz, agua, leña.

loans.name: Adrian Ruben

texts.es:
"I would like to have a fence around my house for added protection and security for my family, in particular for my kids. I would also like to put some bars on the windows of the house". I would like a loan of $1000.00 to be able to put this fence up and protect the house.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

"Me gustaría hace una barda en mi casa para darle más protección y seguridad a mi familia pero principalmente a mis hijos, también quiero poner unas protecciones en las ventanas de la casa”. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para hacer una barda en mi casa y poner las protecciones.

loans.use: To build a fence and protection/Construcción de una barda y protecciones

loans.name: Elsa Isabela

texts.es:
In my neighborhood they know me as Chela and I am very famous for the extremely rich flour tortillas that I make. I began my business five years ago and with experience and the good flavor of my tortillas, I also sell tortillas filled with beans, butter and cheese, which in our counrty is known as "baleadas," and that people prefer. Also I have managed to sell to the owners of general stores, who then sell them in their businesses; for that demand I need to buy a machine to help me with production, so I could produce more and obtain better earnings to better help my family.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

En mi colonia me conocen como Chela y soy muy famosa por las riquisimas tortillas de harina que elaboro, mi negocio lo comence hace cinco años y con la experiencia y buen sabor de mis tortillas, tambien vendo las tortillas acompañadas con frijolitos, mantequilla y queso en nuestro pais conocidas como baleadas, las personas las prefieren. Tambien he logrado vender a señores dueños de pulperias quienes venden en sus negocios, por la demanda necesito comprar una maquina para que me ayude con la elaboracion, asi podre producir mas y obtener mejores ganancias para ayudar mas a mi familia.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, salt, butter, soda, gas and other items - Compra de harina, sal, manteca, soda, gas y otros.

loans.name: Hector Gerardo

texts.es:
"I need to put up a concrete roof over my home as the sun beats down on us everyday and it gets extremely hot. I would like $1000.000 to build this concrete roof."

Translated from Spansh by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Tengo la necesidad de poner un techo de concreto en mi vivienda ya que el sol nos da de frente todo el día y por lo tanto provoca mucho calor. Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para la construcción de un techo de concreto.

loans.use: To put up a concrete roof/Poner techo de concreto

loans.name: Jesús Teresa

texts.es:
Until a while ago, things were difficult for Teresa and life was full of suffering. The person who became her husband and with whom she hoped to form a household that would be stable and full of love instead mistreated her, both physically and psychologically, in the presence of their children.

When she decided to end this treatment, she looked for help and left to establish herself in another town far from her hometown of Pucallpa. Little by little, and with a lot of work, Teresa’s children regained the peace and happiness that their father had taken from them for such a long time.

Because of her tireless fighting spirit, she began a small business in her home, and she never imagined it would become so popular, due to the incomparable service that she offers. Since the population is always growing from families moving into the neighborhood, the demand for the basic goods she sells at her store is also growing. She wants to increase the number of products that she has to offer, so she is requesting a loan of $275.00, which she is committed to repaying in 6 months. Let’s help her continue fighting to keep her family together and to accomplish her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Para Doña Teresa las cosas hasta hace un tiempo fueron duras y de constante sufrimiento, la persona que se convertiría en su esposo y con el que deseaba formar un hogar estable y lleno de amor, siempre la maltrató física y psicológicamente en presencia de sus hijos durante mucho tiempo. Cuando ella decidió terminar con estos actos buscó ayuda y se marchó para establecerse en otra ciudad muy lejos de su natal Pucallpa; poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo los hijos de Teresa fueron recobrando la calma y felicidad que hace mucho tiempo les arrebató el hombre que les dio la vida. El incansable espíritu luchador la hizo emprender un pequeño negocio en el interior de la vivienda que habitaba; y jamás se imaginó que con el tiempo se convertiría en una de las más concurridas por el incomparable servicio que les ofrece. Y como la población se va imcrementando cada vez más porque se establecen más familias en las zonas aledañas mayor es la demanda por los artículos de primera necesidad que ofrece en su pequeña tienda Teresa. Con el deseo de incrementar la cantidad de productos que ofrece hasta la fecha ella solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses. Hagamos que ese espíritu siga luchando por mantener a su familia unida con el cumplimiento de su anhelo.

loans.use: To buy a more varied stock for her small general store

loans.name: Delmy Yanira

texts.es:
My name is Yanira and I work hard to sell clothing and personal products like lotions, creams, cosmetics. Since I have four years experience of sales, I already have an established customer base who buy my goods when they need them. I have three children who are at school as our economic situation is still sound. I need to increase my inventory of goods since the Christmas holidays are coming. I need to buy products at good prices so my profits post-sales are increased, even if they are marginal.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Yanira y me dedico a vender ropa y productos de uso personal como lociones, cremas, cosmeticos, tengo cuatro años de vender, ya tengo mis clientes a quienes les vendo lo que ellos necesitan. Tengo tres hijos que se encuentran en escuela y colegios por lo que la situacion economica es bantante fuerte. Necesito incrementar mi inventario ya que viene la epoca navideña y necesito tener producto comprado a buen precio para poder venderlo y obtener un poco mas de ganancia.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, cosmetics, shoes, curtains, and other items

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Maria is married with 4 kids and her husband is a taxi driver. She started her business when she was young by helping out her mother selling used clothes in busy places. Little by little she started to enjoy the business and 5 years ago she went it alone. She started her own business from her house and then in popular markets. She did this as her and her husband's earnings did not cover the household costs, but now she earns a bit more than her husband. Maria now has a small stall from which she sells her products.

Maria would like a loan of $475 so that she can refurbish her shop and acquire more merchandise so that her clients see a well presented business with good products. She will repay this loan in 6 months. She thanks you for the support that you can offer so that her business can go forward and keep on improving.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

María está casada y tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es taxista, ella empezó con su negocio desde joven ayudando a su madre con la venta de ropa usada en las colonias populares, y poco a poco fue agarrándole gusto al negocio del comercio, y hace cinco años atrás ella se independizó y comenzó con su negocio propio vendiendo en su casa y luego en mercados populares, ya que lo que ganaba ella como trabajadora de ayudante de su madre y su esposo como taxista no les alcanzaba para cubrir el gasto familiar y ahora ella puede ayudar con un ingreso un poco mejor a su esposo, actualmente María ya tiene un pequeño puesto donde ofrece sus productos.

María esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para poder remodelar su local y adquirir algo más de mercadería para que sus clientes vean que el negocio tiene una buena presentación así como sus productos, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses y les agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con su negocio y mejorar cada vez más con el mismo.

loans.use: Refurbishment and to buy merchandise/Remodelación y compra de mercancía

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
"I need to build another room. It has been very hard due to lack of money but I am working very hard to do it and to extend my house." I would like a loan of $900.00 to build another room.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Necesito hacer otro cuarto, me ha sido un poco difícil por falta de dinero pero estoy trabajando mucho para lograrlo y ampliar más mi vivienda” Solicito $ 900.00 dlls para hacer otro cuarto.

loans.use: To build a room/Construccón de un cuarto

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
My name is Fausto and I dedicate myself to the sale of flavored iced drinks. My customers are people who pass in the street, since I visit various neighborhoods in the capital, especially where there may be schools because kids love iced drinks. With the earnings that I obtain from my sales I help my family, especially the studies of my children. It is for that, that I need to buy more products to better the family earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Fausto y me dedico a la venta de granizados de sabores, mis clientes son personas que transitan en las calles, ya que visito varias colonias de la capital, especialmente donde hayan escuelas porque a los niños les encantan los granizados. Con las ganancias que obtengo de mis ventas ayudo a mi familia especialmente en los estudios de mis hijos, es por eso que necesito comprar mas producto para mejorar los ingresos familiares.

loans.use: Purchase of ice, sweets, condensed milk, cups, straws, flavors, etc. - Compra de hielo, dulces, leche condensada, vasos, pajillas, sabores y otros.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
"I need to extend two rooms in my house as they are very small and there is very little room for my family." I would like a loan of $500.00 to make these rooms bigger.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

“Necesito ampliar dos cuartos de mi vivienda ya que son muy pequeños y el espacio para mi familia es muy reducido” Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para ampliar los cuartos.

loans.use: To extend 2 rooms/Ampliación de dos cuartos

loans.name: Rita Maria

texts.es:
Hello my name is Rita Maria. I am a businesswoman with a small used clothing business, called sale of American Clothes "C.." I have many years of dedication to this type of activity, the one that gives me earnings to contribute for the expenses of my family and other commercial transactions with suppliers. Thanks to the wages I pursue from this business I can cover the expenses of the education of my children and and they help me in their free time.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombres es Rita Maria, soy comerciante cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada, llamado venta de Ropa Americana "C.", tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a los ingresos que persigo de este negocio puedo cubrir los gastos de educación de mis hijos y ellos me colaboran en su tiempo libre.

loans.use: A parcel of jackets, doubles, childrens shirts - Un fardo de chumpa, cameras, blusas y de niño

loans.name: Kevin Antonio

texts.es:
My name is Kevin and for two years I have been dedicated to the sale of natural products, be they medicines, tea, or drinks. I began this business with the help of my mother; I would like to become independent. Now the earnings that I obtain from sales help me sustain myself in the university and help my mother with the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Kevin y me dedico a la venta de productos naturales, ya sean medicinas, te, o bebidas desde hace dos años. Este negocio lo inicie ayudandole a mi madre, me gusto y me logre independizar. Ahora los ingresos que obtengo de las ventas me ayudan a sotenerme en la universidad y ayudar a mi madre con los gastos de la familia.

loans.use: purchase of tea, natural medicines, etc. - compra de te, medicinas naturales y otros.

loans.name: Juana Esperanza

texts.es:
Hi, my name is Juana Esperanza. I run a small business out of my home selling chicken and sausages, which allows me to earn a living and tend to my family. Thanks to this business I'm able to help my husband with household expenses. Currently, demand for my products is growing daily and I need more capital to meet my clients' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hola Mi nonmbres es Juana Esperanza, soy comerciante, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de pollo y embutidos, ubicado en mi casa de habitación el que me permite generar ingresos y atender a mi familia, gracias a este negocio puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos familiares, actualmente la demanda cada día es mayor y necesito una mayor inversión para satisfacer a los clientes y no cuento con dicho capital.

loans.use: Purchase chicken, sausages, bologna and dairy products.

loans.name: Dora Julia

texts.es:
Dora is a selfless mother, and very entrepreneurial. When her husband decided to abandon she and their children, she had to take the reins of her home and do many of the tasks that, up until that point, he had done. Without any other help than that of her children’s, she started a business selling newspapers in a small place near an area with a lot of traffic. Little by little, and with a lot of work, she was able to buy a stand and also offer other products of the type customers want to buy when they get their daily newspaper. The improvements she has made to the stand have made it look better, however there is still much to be done. Dora is requesting a loan of $200.00, which she is committed to repaying in 6 months, so that she can fulfill this wish she has in her heart.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Dora es una madre abnegada y muy emprendedora, cuando su esposo decidió abandonarlos ella tuvo que llevar las riendas de su hogar y tuvo que suplir muchas de las funciones que hasta ahora las había realizado él.Sin otro apoyo más que el de sus hijos emprendió el negocio de la venta de periódicos en un pequeño espacio cerca de los lugares de mayor concurrencia poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo pudo adquirir un stand ofrecer también otros productos a los que ya están acostumbrados los clientes que a diario adquieren un ejemplar para informarse del acontecer nacional.Sus mejoras han contribuido a que el puesto se vea cada vez más vistoso pero aún así existen muchas reparaciones y acabados que deben ser atendidos con urgencia con el fin de brindarle comodidad y novedad a cada uno de sus lectores.Por esta razón Dora solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses para que pueda cumplir el deseo que mantiene dentro de su corazón.

loans.use: To repair and renovate her newspaper stand

loans.name: María Silvia Hermini

texts.es:
Silvia lives with her partner and they have two children, 12 and 15 years old. She started her small restaurant by selling food among neighbors to help her husband in covering the family's expenses since his salary was not sufficient to support the family. Bit by bit her sales increased since she's a great cook and her dishes were recommended by clients to others. She then stayed open longer and began serving breakfast and fried snacks. Thanks to her business she's been able to help in their kid's education, who are of school age. She started the business 15 years ago after having her first baby; since then she continues working and wishes to succeed with her business.

Silvia is asking for a 5 month US $275 loan to buy food inputs that allow her to make a greater variety of dishes. She wants to increase her sales to continue getting ahead, as she's been doing up until now. Silvia is grateful to all the people who support her in continuing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Silvia vive en unión libre con su pareja y tienen dos hijos de 12 y 15 años respectivamente, ella empezó su negocio vendiendo comidas entre sus vecinas ya que necesitaba apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar por que el sueldo de él no alcanzaban para mantener a la familia, poco a poco fue incrementando sus ventas ya que ella tiene buena sazón y sus comidas fueron siendo recomendadas, así fue ampliando su horario de atención, empezando a ofrecer desayunos y fritangas, gracias a su negocio ha podido ayudar en la educación de sus hijos, quienes están en edad escolar, tiene con su negocio cerca de 15 años, que fue cuando tuvo su primer hijo y hasta la fecha sigue trabajando y desea crecer con su negocio.

Silvia solicita un préstamo por US $ 275 para la compra de insumos que le permitan ofrecer una mayor variedad de comidas y poder incrementar sus ventas para salir adelante como lo va haciendo hasta la fecha, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses, agradeciéndoles a todas las personas que la apoyen con su negocio para poder continuar con el mismo.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of food inputs

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Gloria is married and has an 8 month baby and her husband is a shoemaker in town. He works alot and she decided to start selling the shoes he makes. Together they contribute to cover household expenses and are able to support their little girl. She started selling the shoes amongst her neighbors and friends, and upon seeing the good quality and economical price of the shoes they recommend the shoes to others, thus her clientele has grown little by little. She wants to continue her business' growth and be able to stock up with shoes to satisfy demand.

Gloria is asking for a 6 month US $475 loan to buy a sewing machine for shoes to speed up production. She and her family thank you for the support you give that allows them to increase their shoe production, fulfill their demand and expand their business.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria esta casada y tiene una bebe de 8 meses, su esposo es zapatero en su ciudad, él trabaja mucho y ella se decidió a vender los productos que hace su esposo, ya que el le da a un buen precio para que ella pueda hacer negocio con los zapatos que él elabora y así poder aportar para ambos e la economía del hogar y poder mantener a su pequeña niña. Ella empezó vendiendo los zapatos entre sus vecinos y amigos, y ellos ahora al ver la buena calidad de los zapatos que ofrece y el buen precio que les da la recomiendan y poco a poco su clientela ha ido incrementándose, por ello desea seguir creciendo y poder abastecerse de producto para cubrir su demanda.

Gloria esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para comprar una maquina de coser zapatos y así poder agilizar la producción de los mismos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que les das para poder incrementar su producción y así poder cubrir su demanda y crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Jorge Armando

texts.es:
Jorge and his partner live together and have a 16 year old son. His partner stays at home, and he started this line of work while helping his father, who also works in the moving business. After learning the business Jorge decided to go independent since before he only earned the salary of an employee. Now he earns more and can pay all his family's expenses. Jorge likes the job a lot and has more than 30 years with his own business. Due to his perserverance and effort he's managed to increase his clientele and offer his family a better quality of life.

Jorge is asking for a 4 month US $175 loan to perform maintenance on his vehicle's motor, since it is the main tool of his work. He and his family are grateful to you for the support you're giving him to continue his business and continue offering a quality job to his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva volunteer.

Jorge vive en unión libre con su pareja y tienen un hijo de 16 años de edad, su esposa se dedica al hogar, y él empezó con el negocio ayudando a su padre que tiene el mismo oficio de mudanzas, cuando aprendió el negocio decidió independizarse, ya que antes solo ganaba como empleado y ahora ya tiene mejores ingresos y poder solventar los gastos de su familia, a Jorge le gusto mucho el negocio y ya tiene mas de 30 años con su negocio y debido a su constancia y esfuerzo ha logrado incrementar su cartera de clientes y tener así una mejor calidad de vida que le ofrece a su familia.

Jorge esta solicitando un préstamo de US $ 175 para poder hacerle mantenimiento al motor de su vehículo, ya que es su principal herramienta de trabajo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 4 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen por el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y poder seguir brindando un trabajo con calidad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Norma Galdina

texts.es:
Norma is unmarried and has a 36 year old daugher. She started her business because while alone and taking care of her daughter she needed to do something to be able to raise and provide her education. When Norma was a child she worked with her mother and learned how to make hammocks, so she decided to apply this talents to start her own hammock-making budsiness. Little by little the business grew since her work is good. People go to her to buy a high quality product at a good price. With her business she has been able to raise and maintain her daughter well, and she wants to continue the business to improve her quality of life.

Norma is asking for a six month US $475 loan to improve the room where she makes the hammocks, and to buy frames for weaving. She and her family are very grateful for the support you are giving so she can continue and improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma no esta casada y tiene una hija de 36 años de edad, empezó con su negocio por que al quedarse sola al cuidado de su hija tuvo que hacer algo para poder mantenerla y educarla, así que ella desde muy joven trabajo con su madre y aprendió las técnicas para la elaboración de hamacas, así que decidió aplicar sus conocimientos y dedicarse a la elaboración de las mismas, poco a poco fue creciendo con su negocio ya que el trabajo que ella realiza es bueno y bonito por lo que la gente recurre a ella para comprar un producto a buen precio y de buena calidad, con su negocio a podido crecer y mantener a su hija sacándola adelante y desea continuar con su negocio para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Norma está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US 475 para mejorar su cuarto de trabajo en donde realiza la elaboración de las hamacas y comprar bastidores, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia están muy agradecidas por el apoyo que le brindes para continuar con su negocio y el crecimiento del mismo.

loans.use: To better her work space and buy frames for weaving hammocks

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es:
My name is Carlos Roberto. I run a small convenience store called "La Bendición" (The Blessing). I have dedicated myself to this job for three years, generating income to cover my family's expenses and meeting my obligations to suppliers. It's important to mention that this is a family business, because I tend to it together with my wife and my children help out in their free time. Thanks to the income from this business we have been able to move our family forward. Keeping in mind that our best sales period is approaching, we need to better stock our business and be able to offer our customers a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Carlos Roberto, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con una pequeña pulperia, llamado Bodequita "LA BENDICIÓN", tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos con los proveedores, es imporntante mensionar que este es un negocio familiar porque lo antendemos junto con mi esposa, y mis hijos me colaboran en su tiempo libre, gracias a los ingresos que persibimos de ente negocio hemos sacado adelante a nuestra familia Tomando en cuenta que se aproxima el tiempo de mayor venta necesitamos surtir mas nuestro negocio y poder ofrecer a nuestros clientes variedad de productos.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, lard, ham, eggs, drinks, dairy products and sausages.

loans.name: Juventino

texts.es:
Juventino is a married man with two children. He is a hard-working guy; he and his wife both work to support and educate their children. His wife sells fried snacks and Juventino helps her during weekends when he has free time.

He started his business young, first learning the work as a construction assistant. As time passed he decided to go independent, and is now self-employed. He now has many clients that he has gained through recommendations because of his good work. Juventino wants to continue improving his service and keeping his prices economical so he can increase his clientele and better his quality of life together with his wife.

He is asking for a three month US$200 loan to buy raw materials. He wants to be able to offer the best prices in his estimates to clients. He is grateful to everyone for the support that helps him improve his business and get ahead in life with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Juventino es un hombre casado tiene dos hijos, él es un hombre muy trabajador y junto con su esposa los dos trabajan arduamente para poder mantener y educar a sus dos hijos, su esposa trabaja vendiendo fritangas y él le apoya los fines de semana que tiene tiempo libre, él inicio su negocio desde muy joven, empezó a trabajar como albañil asistente y poco a poco fue aprendiendo bien el negocio y con el paso del tiempo se independizó y actualmente trabaja por su cuenta, ahora el ofrece su servicio a muchas personas que lo recomiendan por su buen trabajo y desea poder ofrecer cada día un mejor servicio y a un mejor precio para poder tener muchos clientes y mejorar su situación y calidad de vida junto con su esposa.

Juventino solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para poder comprar materia prima con tiempo y poder ofrecer mejores precios en sus presupuestos a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, agradeciendo el apoyo de todas las personas que le brindan su ayuda para poder salir adelante y continuar creciendo con su negocio para seguir mejorando su trabajo y calidad de vida junto con su familia.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his contruction business

loans.name: Luís Francisco

texts.es:
Luís is married and has a 14 year old daughter. His wife is a homemaker and he is a construction worker, which he started from a very young age. Over the years, he has learned much and gained good experience. He became an independent worker to improve his family's income and soon after, started an incursion in the shoe business. With two jobs, he was able to provide sufficiently for his family, since if he did not have one job, the other provided income. He wishes to progress and is certain that he can do this, since he is a worker and entrepreneur. He is set on continuing this arrangement to improve the quality of his family's life.

Luís seeks a loan of $200 to buy materials for his construction job and be able to offer better prices to his clients who are on a budget as well as to buy a supply of shoes since the other is a seasonal job. He will pay the loan back in 3 months. He and his family are grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Luís tiene una hija de 14 años de edad, él esta casado y su esposa se dedica a su hogar, él empezó desde muy joven en el oficio de albañil y con el tiempo aprendió bien y se independizó para poder llevar mayores ingresos a su familia y con el tiempo también incursionó en la venta de zapatos y con sus dos trabajos puede sacar adelante a su familia, le ha ido bien ya que cuando falta uno de sus trabajos tiene el otro para poder balancear esa carencia, el desea progresar y esta seguro de hacerlo debido a que es muy trabajador y emprendedor, por lo que esta dispuesto a continuar con ese empeño para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Luís esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 200 para poder comprar material para su trabajo de albañilería y poder ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes en sus presupuestos y también invertir parte en la compra de zapatos para tener surtido para esta temporada, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, él y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy shoes for business and material for construction

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Esteban S.. I sell ice cream on my bicycle, riding to the different sections and neighborhoods of my city. I've been doing this job for a number of years, and it helps me earn income to cover family expenses and fulfill my obligations to suppliers. Currently my sales have increased and I need to acquire another bicycle and more supplies so I don't have to do it on my own.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hola mi nombre es Esteban S., mi atividad principal es la venta de Ice Crean, el que destribuyo de manera ambulante en bicicleta, en los diferentes barrios y colonias de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, actualmente las ventas an aumentado por lo que necesito de mas producto y de otra bicicleta, en vista que ya no me doy abasto yo solo.

loans.use: Purchase ice cream, cones, glasses and disposable spoons.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Rosa. I run a small outdoor food stand in the center of my city. I have a good clientele, and the majority of my customers visit me in the morning. Thanks to this business I have been able to help my husband with family expenses and fulfill my obligations with suppliers.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hola mi nombre es Rosa, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un pequeño negocio de venta de Golocinas (Prodoctos para sonsumo Humano), los que distribuyo de manera ambulante en el centro de mi ciudad, cuento con buena clientela. ya que mis clientes me esperan por lo general en la mañana, gracias a este negocio puedo ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de mi familia y cumplir con otros comprimisos con los proveedores.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, lard, flour, beans, firewoord and eggs.

loans.name: Miriam Hilda

texts.es:
Miriam and her husband contribute to the family income in a very creative way. They now live only with their youngest son because the older one has started his own family. It was Miriam’s ability to relate to lots of people that caused one of her friends to suggest to her that she sell a brand of cosmetics that is well-known in their country and for which good demand existed. Her friend told her about the good benefits and incentives the company offered and she decided to get involved in the business. She began with a close circle of friends, which opened the door to many more customers. Her friendly manner made her into one of the most popular cosmetics salespeople and it was thanks to this work that she was able to improve her family’s situation.

Miriam would like to increase her capital so that she can acquire a larger quantity of products, in order to be able to offer them to her clients in the moment when they need them, without any difficulties. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $400.00, which she is committed to repaying in a period of 6 months, so she can make her wish into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Miriam y su esposo contribuyen con el ingreso familiar de manera muy ingeniosa y ahora sólo cuentan con la compañía de su hijo menor porque el mayor a adquirido obligaciones propias luego de constituir su propia familia.La habilidad que posee Miriam para relacionarse con muchas personas hizo que una de sus amigas le propusiera la posibilidad de incursionar en la venta de cosméticos de una marca muy conocida y requerida en su país, se informó sobre los beneficios e incentivos que le otorgaba esta empresa y decidió formar parte de este negocio primero con su círculo más íntimo que poco a poco se fue abriendo e incorporando a muchas personas más ; la amabilidad y prestancia la convirtió en una de las más solicitadas y gracias a este trabajo ha ido incrementando su nivel de vida familiar.La inquietud de Miriam radica en el incremento de su capital para adquirir mayor cantidad de productos para poder ofrecérselos a cada una de sus clientas cuando lo necesitan y en el momento que lo requieran sin dificultad; por ello solicita un préstamo de 400 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses para hacer de su deseo un hecho real.

loans.use: To buy a stock of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Silvestre Isabel

texts.es:
Silvestre is married and has a son, his wife works in the house. He started his business to be able to support himself and family. He used to travel to the United States for work, but always wanted to have a business in his own city to no longer have to travel and look for uncertain and temporary jobs. One time in the U.S. he noticed the opportunity that he could sell American goods in his town, and that's how he decided to sell sneakers. He first bought several pairs and did well, then he put up a small store in his city to sell the sneakers. He always travels to buy his goods, but now he is close to his family and is able to sustain his wife and son.

Silvestre is asking for a six month US$275 loan to buy merchandise for his sneaker business. He and his family are grateful for the support you give him to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan, Kiva Volunteer.

Silvestre esta casado y tiene un hijo, su esposa se dedica al hogar y empezó su negocio por que para poder obtener los recursos necesarios el viajaba a Estados Unidos por trabajo, pero siempre quiso tener un negocio en su ciudad para ya no tener que viajar a buscar trabajos inciertos y extemporáneos, así el vio la oportunidad una vez estando en Estados Unidos que podía vender mercadería americana en su pueblo, así que se decidió a vender tenis comprando sus primeras ventas unos pocos pares y le fue muy bien con sus ventas, entonces puso una pequeña tienda de venta de tenis americanos en su ciudad y siempre viaja para traer sus mercaderías, con su negocio ahora esta más cerca de su familia y ya tiene para poderles dar sustento a su esposa e hijo.

Silvestre esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, él y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que el das para salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy  merchandise for his sneaker business

loans.name: Josue Ricardo

texts.es:
Josué is married and has no children. His wife is a homemaker, and he started his own business since there were not many jobs available where he lives. He found it necessary to start his own venture. He worked as an apprentice in a mechanic workshop for more than a year. During that time, he learned the business and bought the necessary tools to be able to branch out on his own and that, he did. He has already been able to improve the quality of his life; the salary he previously earned as an employee was not sufficient to meet his living expenses. He wishes to continue his business and devote much of his energy to grow it to its maximum potential.

Josué seeks a loan of $375 to be able to buy more tools for his workshop and to offer better service to his customers. He will pay back the loan in 5 months. He and his wife are grateful for your support that contributes to the growth and improvement of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Josué esta casado y no tiene hijos, su esposa se dedica a su hogar como ama de casa, y él inicio su negocio ya que en su ciudad no hay muchas oportunidades laborales, fue por eso que se vio en la necesidad de emprender un negocio, hace mas de un año el trabajaba como ayudante en un taller mecánico y con el paso del tiempo aprendió del negocio y fue adquiriendo herramientas necesarias para poder algún día independizarse y así lo hizo, ya con esto mejoró su calidad de vida por que el sueldo que ganaba como empleado no le alcanzaba para los gastos de su hogar, y ahora el deses continuar con su negocio para el cual le invierte mucho esfuerzo y ganas con la finalidad de hacerlo crecer.

Josué solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para poder comprar más herramientas para su taller y poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Junto con su esposa te agradecen el apoyo que le brindas para el crecimiento y mejora de su negocio.

loans.use: To buy tools

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is married and her husband is a chauffeur. They have 3 children. She decided to start her own business because her older daughter was ill and she could not cover the costs of her medication and their living expenses. At the time, she had no job and was unable to obtain one due to the scarcity of jobs available. It has been more than a year and a half that Yolanda has had her own business, initially selling clothes and later on, added quilts, with which she was able to improve their family's income after pooling hers with her husband's salary. Currently, she has a dependable customer base, who in turn, recommend her to their friends. She is proud of her business.

Yolanda seeks a loan for $475 to buy more merchandise and fashionable clothes to increase her business's inventory and grow her business. She will repay the loan in 3 months. She and her family are grateful for your support that allows her to keep her business continuing.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Yolanda esta casada y su esposo trabaja como chofer, ellos tienen 3 hijos, ella decidió poner su negocio por que la mayor de sus hijas se enfermo y no podían solventar los gastos de la casa y médicos, y como ella no tenía empleo y no podía conseguir debido a lo escasos que son los empleos entonces decidió poner su propio negocio hace mas de año y medio empezando con la venta de ropa y luego adicionó edredones, con lo que ya empezó a tener mejores ingresos para así poder colaborar con los gastos a su esposo, ella actualmente ya cuenta con una cartera de clientes, quienes a su vez la recomiendan entre sus amistades y ella esta orgullosa de sus ventas.

Yolanda solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 475 para poder comprar mercadería para su negocio y así tener un mayor surtido y ropa de temporada para sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses.
