Ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo brindado para continuar con su negocio y poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Mónica Elena

texts.es:
Mónica is a young mother who works harder every day to give the best to her family. She is the mother of two small children, who receive love and care from her. Faced with an economic crisis, she received the support of her mother-in-law, who encouraged her to start a small business selling women’s clothing. She has been doing this for the past three years, and her perseverance has made her store one of the most prestigious in the area. She is now able to help out with the household expenses.

A while ago, some friends taught her how to knit shawls and hats, to which she gave beautiful finishing touches using her well-known cleverness and creativity. Mónica longs to increase the products she has in her small store, with the goal of giving a better quality of life to her little ones. Knowing that it isn’t easy to break new ground, she works diligently each day to get ahead. She is requesting a loan of $325.00, which will serve to increase her capital so that she can continue her business with more new items, which will benefit her regular customers. Let’s help her so that she can convert her dream into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Mónica es una joven madre que cada día se esfuerza por darle lo mejor a su familia, ella es madre de dos pequeños, los que a través de sus cuidados reciben su amor y cuidado. Ante la crisis económica que atravesaba recibió el apoyo de su suegra y la animó a iniciar un pequeño negocio de prendas de vestir para damas; al cual viene dedicándose desde hace tres años, su perseverancia hizo de ella una de las modistas con mayor prestigio en su localidad y en la actualidad puede sostenerse y apoyar con los ingresos de la canasta familiar, hace poco sus amigas le enseñaron a tejer chalinas y gorros a los que les brindó excelentes acabados con su ya conocido ingenio y creatividad.Mónica anhela incrementar sus productos en el pequeño taller que tiene con el deseo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus pequeños amores.Consiente de que abrirse campo no es fácil ella diligentemente trabaja cada día para salir adelante y por ello que solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares que le servirán para incrementar el capital de su negocio y así poder implementarla con más novedades a beneficio de sus asiduas clientas.Apoyémosla para que pueda convertir su anhelo en realidad.

loans.use: Mónica wishes to invest in many new items for her discerning customers

loans.name: Norma Suyapa

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Norma Suyapa. I make fried snakes at my home and then sell them at the local market in my city. I've been dong this job for a number of years, earning income to help with expenses and increasing my family's income. Thanks to God this business has helped me earn a living and allow me to take care of my daughter and tend to my husband. My greatest desire is to improve our living arrangements.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Hola mi nombres es Norma Suyapa, mi actividad principal es la elaboración de Chicharas y Chicharones, (productos para el Consumo Humano), los que elaboro en mi casa de habitación y los distribuyo en el Mercado Municipal de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos de mi familia, logrando asi mejorar los ingresos familiares. Gracias a Dios este negocio me permite generar ingresos y lo mas importante es que puedo cuidad a mi hija y atender a mi esposo, Mi mayor deseo es mejorar mi vivienda.

loans.use: Purcahse pork loins, firewood and plastic bags.

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
My name is Antonia del Carmen and my main activity is the production and sales of tortillas, which I make in my home. I have various years of working in this business, which enables me to contribute to paying my family's expenses. It is important to mention that with the income that this business has generated for me, I have given an education to my children and they are already professionals now.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Mi nombres Antonia del Carmen, mi actividad principal es la elaboración y venta de tortillas, las que elaboro en mi casa de habitación, tengo varios años de realizar esta actividad, la que me permite contribuir con los gastos de mi familia. Es importante mensionar que con los ingresos que me genera este negocio he dado educación a mis hijos y actualmente ellos ya son profesionales.

loans.use: Buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Juana Yaneth

texts.es:
Hey. My name is Juana Yaneth and I am a retailer. I have a shop of treats in the educational center of my community. For two years I have been dedicated to this type of activity, which earns me an income to cover my family expenses. I have two children that are enrolled in primary school. I need to stock my business so that I can offer a variety of products to the students.

Translate from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Hola mi nombre es Juna Yaneth, soy comerciante mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con una caseta de venta de golosinas en el centro Educativo de mi comunidad, tengo 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia. tengo 2 hijos los que estan cursando la primaria. Necesito surtir mi negocio para poder ofrecer variedad de productos a los estudiantes.

loans.use: Purchase cookies, sodas, candies, juice, meat, and tortillas.

loans.name: Zabil

texts.en: Zabil fled to Baku from the district of Khojavend in Azerbaijan. He is 33, married, and has one child. He has been engaged in his butcher business for eight years. He covers his family living expenses only from this business. He first borrowed $500 from Normicro and used it for buying sheep to expand his business. Now he wants to borrow another $500 to further expand his business.

loans.use: To buy 8 sheep

loans.name: Vilayet

texts.en: Vilayet is an internally displaced person from the Jabrail district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is 38, married, and has two children. In 1995 he started his clothing business to help meet his family's needs. He started his business with his own resources and some borrowed goods. Over time he increased the volume of his business. Now he is applying to receive $1,000 to expand his business by adding more variety and volume of goods to eventually improve his family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory

loans.name: Humay

texts.en: Humay is an internally displaced person who fled from the Zangilan district of Azerbaijan in 1993. He is 52 and married with two children. He started his business in 1996 with some private capital in the Lokbatan market. He first borrowed $1,000 from Normicro and increased his business turnover. This loan helped him to improve his business and family living conditions dramatically. He paid off all borrowed goods and earned some additional income to further enlarge his business. Now he is applying for $1,100 to invest in his business to make it more sustainable.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.en:
Muzaffar is a refugee from the Lachin district of Azerbaijan who fled to Baku in 1993.
He is married, has three children, and is 49. He started his butcher shop in 1995 with his own resources. He previously had two loans and used them for business development. Now he wants to borrow $1,200 to buy additional inventory for his profitable business to be able to meet most of his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy cattle to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Nazifa

texts.en: Nazifa is a resident of Saatli town in Azerbaijan. She is 52 years old, married and has three children. She has worked in cattle breeding, a very common business in the region, since 1992. Cattle breeding is the main occupation of the local people. She raises cattle together with her husband in the shed that they built in their yard. She sells adult livestock to earn a living for the family. She has applied for a loan of $500 to buy two more calves to increase her number of livestock. Her husband is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Balababa

texts.en: Balababa is a low-income person born in Baku. He is a young man of 25, and single. He started his food business two years ago with his own resources. He developed this business through his own efforts during this period. Now he wants to borrow $1,100 to buy assets for his business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Terana

texts.en: Terana is a resident of Saatli town in Azerbaijan. She is 33 and married with three children. Her husband is a driver, but his income is not enough for the family. She wants to contribute to sustaining the family, and since 2000 she has engaged in trading. She travels with her goods of mainly clothes, fabric, kitchen and household items and sells them. She sells goods from her house, as well. She wants to increase the amount of inventory that she sells and has applied for a loan of $500 for this purpose.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim is a low-income person from Baku district. He is married, has two daughters, and is 35. He started his car repair business 10 years ago. He is professional and uses his knowledge to give a high-level service to clients and earn sufficient money to meet his family's basic needs. He is asking to borrow $1,200 to be able to buy spare parts and earn more income to improve his living.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Ingilab

texts.en: Ingilab is a 35-year-old resident of Saatli town. He is married and has two children. He is engaged in cattle breeding. Cattle breeding is traditional in the region and Ingilab has been in this business since 2002. He has a shed in his yard. He raises cattle and sells them alive in the local market or delivers them to butchers. Now he has two adult cows and wants to buy two more calves to raise them, as well. He is applying for a loan of $500 for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Gulkhar

texts.en: Gulkhar is a low-income local from Baku. She is married with 3 children, and she is 47. She has been running her animal business for 8 years. She used her own resources to start this business. Previously she had two loans amounting to $300 and $650 from Normicro and used them for business expansion. Now she is applying for a loan of $1,100 to expand her business further to make more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy 2 cattle for breeding

loans.name: Dashgin

texts.en: Dashgin is a young 24-year-old resident of Saatli town. He is not married yet. His main business is butchery. He also breeds cattle in his family house. He sells livestock and also slaughters cattle in his butchery. He has been in this business since 2002 and has made a considerable contribution in his family income. He wants to develop his cattle breeding, increase the number of livestock and increase his income. He has applied to borrow $500 to buy two calves. His father is shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a refugee from Armenia. He fled to Azerbaijan in 1988. He is 24 years old and still single. He started his car repair business 4 years ago. During these years, he found that his car repair business helped enrich his business skills drammatically and could also earn something to help his family. Samir is a first time borrower and is requesting to borrow $1,100 to buy spare parts for serving clients flexibly without delay.

loans.use: To buy autocar spare parts

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar is a 35 year old resident of the town of Saatli in Azerbaijan. He is married and has three children. He breeds cattle, which is a traditional and common occupation in the Azerbaijani countryside. He buys cattle, raises them and sells them to local butchers while they are still alive. He currently has two cows.  He does not have any other employment, so his cattle rearing business is the only source of income for his family. He wants to develop this business by purchasing more cows and increasing his income. For this purpose, he is applying to the Saatli branch of Normicro for a $500 loan.

loans.use: to buy two more calves

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur is a 23 year old internally displaced person from the town of Khankendi in Azerbaijan. He started his own business recently with his own resources. He now wants to borrow $1000 to buy additional inventory to enlarge his business, increase his earnings and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: Tobuy inventory

loans.name: Matlab

texts.en: Matlab is a 44 year old resident of  the town of Saatli in  Azerbaijan. He is married and has two children. He sells live animals and sometimes slaughters them and delivers meat to local butcheries. Cattle breeding is very traditional in the countryside in Azerbaijan. He has been rearing cattle since 2004. He wants to develop his cattle breeding business by buying two more calves to be raised. For this purpose, he has applied to theSaatli branch of Normicro to borrow $500.

loans.use: To buy two more cattle

loans.name: Elbrus

texts.en: Elbrus is a low-income resident from Beylagan district in Azerbaijan. He first opened his small shop using his own resources. He has now been engaged in this business for 5 years. This is his first time applying to Normicro and he is asking to borrow $300 to enlarge his business since his capital volume is low.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Etimad

texts.en: Etimad is a 28 year old resident of the town of Saatli. He is single and lives with his parents. He buys cattle, raises them and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. He has been engaged in this business since 1997 and is now quite experienced in this business. As cattle breeding is traditional in the nearby region, it can bring in a good income. Etimad wants to develop his cattle rearing business by increasing the number of cows. He is requesting a $500 loan to buy two more calves to add to his livestock.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim is a low-income resident of the Belyagan district in Gahramanli village. He is married, 50 years old, and has 5 children. He has been running a cattle rearing business for 15 years. His first loan was from Normicro and he used the money to improve his business. He  is now requesting a $400 loan to expand his business further.

loans.use: To buy 1 cow

loans.name: Alizaman

texts.en:
Alizaman is a 57 year old resident of the town of Saatli in Azerbaijan. He has a wife and four children. Alizaman has been running a cattle breeding business for more than 15 years and is quite experienced in this business. He previously earned his living with carpentry but turned to cattle breeding as it is very common in Saatli. He raises cattle and then sells them alive or slaughters them and delivers meat the to local butcheries.

Alizaman wants to buy two more calves to add to his herd and to increase the income his business brings in. He is therefore applying for a $500 loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Tanzila

texts.en: Tanzila is a low-income resident from Gahramanli village in the Beylagan district of Azerbaijan. She is married and has 4 children. Tanzila has been running a cattle rearing business for several years, helped by her husband and son. She currently has two cows and is requesting a $200 loan with which she will buy a calf.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Yedigar

texts.en: Yedigar is a 28 year old resident of the town of Saatli. He is single and lives with his parents. He buys cattle, raises them in his parents' yard and sells them to the local market or to butcheries. He has been in this business for two years. As cattle breeding is traditional in  his region, it can bring in a good income. Yedigar wants to develop his business further and increase the number of cows he owns. He is therefore requesting a $500 loan with which he can buy two more calves to add to his livestock.

loans.use: To buy two calves

loans.name: Elsevar

texts.en:
Elsevar is from Gahramanli village in the Beylagan district of Azerbaijan. 
He is married with 2 children. Elsevar has been rearing cattle and sheep for a few years. He is a first time borrower, and is asking for $400 to buy a cow. He believes that this cow will help boost his business with the calves she will bear.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Kifayet

texts.en: Kifayet is a low income resident from Gahramanli village in the Beylagan district of Azerbaijan. She is a widow and the only breadwinner of the family. She has been in the cattle rearing business for several years. She has 2 cows and is applying for a $300 loan to buy a calf so as to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar is a 40 year old local resident of Saatli. He is married and has two children. He has been engaged in cattle breeding for more than 15 years and is now quite experienced in this business. He has a shed in his yard where he keeps cattle. He buys cattle, raises them, and sells them alive to the local market or to butcheries. As cattle breeding is traditional in the region, this business can be developed and it can bring good income. Ilgar wants to develop this business by increasing the number of cows. He wants to buy two more calves to add to his livestock. (His son is shown in the picture.)

loans.use: To Buy Two more Calves

loans.name: Rasid

texts.en: Rasid is a low income person from Gahramanli Village in the Beylagan District of Azerbaijan. He is married and has children. He has been running his business breeding cattle for many years. He has borrowed 2 loans from Normicro before and used them for business expansion. He gets support from family members to develop his business organically. He wants to borrow a third loan from Normicro to expand his business by buying a cow.

loans.use: To Buy a Cow

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman is a low income person from the Beylagan District, Azerbaijan. He is married, 51 years old, and has 2 children. He sells various goods in the market. He has been in this business for 6 years. He applied for $800 from Normicro to buy more inventory and increase his business volume.

loans.use: To Increase Inventory

loans.name: Ziya

texts.en: Ziya is a low-income person from Beylagan. He is 32 and married. He makes seat covers for cars. Ziya's brother helps him to run his business smoothly. He has been in this business for 15 years. He rents a car seat cover shop to run his business. He has borrowed 3 loans from Normicro to expand his business. He applied for $700 to buy raw materials to make car seat covers. This will help him to process clients' orders more quickly.

loans.use: To Buy Spare Auto Parts

loans.name: Kamran

texts.en: Kamran is a 22 year old resident of the Khachmaz Region in Northeast Azerbaijan. He is not married yet. He has a flower shop in Khachmaz and sells natural and decorative flowers. He has been engaged in this business for more than 5 years. He wants to develop his business - to buy equipment such as flower stands and decorations. He wants to renovate the shop as well. He applied to Normicro's Khachmaz branch to borrow $1,200 for this purpose.

loans.use: To Buy Equipment for His Shop

loans.name: Antiga

texts.en:
Antiga is from Beylagan, Azerbaijan. She is married and has no children.
She has been in business for 15 years. She has borrowed 5 loans from Normicro and has used them for business expansion. All loans were paid back on time. As her business is going well, she wants to borrow $1,000 from Normicro, again to improve what she sells. She wants to buy special wedding materials for wedding parties.

loans.use: To Increase Inventory

loans.name: Ruhaddin

texts.en: Ruhaddin is a 46 year old resident of the Khachmaz Region in Northeast Azerbaijan. He is a taxi driver and owns his own car. He has been engaged in this business since 2004. He is the only person earning income in his family, which means he has to work very hard. His car brakes down very often as he drives long distances every day. He wants capital to repair his vehicle. He applied to Normicro's Khachmaz branch to borrow $1,000 for this purpose.

loans.use: To Buy New Tires and Repaid His Car

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is from Beylagan, Azerbaijan. She is married and has 3 children.
She has been in this business for many years. She has borrowed 4 loans from Normicro for business expansion. All loans were paid back on time.
Now she wants to borrow $1,000 from Normicro, again to improve her business. She wants to buy seasonal lady dresses to increase the variety and volume of what she sells.

loans.use: To Buy Seasonal Dresses

loans.name: Latif

texts.en: Latif is a 36 year old local resident of the Khachmaz Region in Northeast Azerbaijan. He has been a taxi driver for more than three years. He is married. His car is old and brakes down very often. He wants capital to repair his car. He has applied to Normicro's Khachmaz branch to borrow $1000 for this business.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman is a pharmacologist who runs his own private shop. He is 57 years old, married, and has 4 children. He lives in the Beylagan District of Azerbaijan. He has run his "green chemist shop" for several years, but he has experience in the business for 35 years. He has borrowed 4 loans from Normicro and has used them to improve his business. He is one of the best clients of Normicro. Now he wants to borrow $1,000 from Normicro to buy raw matierials to make herbal drugs to sell in his store.

loans.use: To Buy Raw Materials to Make Herbal Goods

loans.name: Rabiba

texts.en: Rabiba is a 46 year old local resident of the Khachmaz Region, which is located in Northeast Azerbaijan. She has a small canteen in Khachmaz. She has been engaged in this business since 2002. In 2005 she borrowed her first loan in the amount of $200 to invest in her business. Now she wants to buy kitchen equipment for her canteen so she she has applied for a loan of $800.

loans.use: To Buy Kitchen Equipment

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur is from the Fizuli district of Azerbaijan and has been a refugee since 1993. He is single and he is 27 years old. He has been running his clothes trading business in the Beylagan Market for 7 years. He is a first time borrower, and is asking for a $900 loan from Normicro. He wants to buy dresses to increase the variety of his goods to help his business turnover.

loans.use: To Buy Clothes to Retail

loans.name: Malahat

texts.en: Melahat is 46 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz, located in north-east of Azerbaijan. She is married and has two children. She has one section in the big food market. She buys goods from Baku and sometimes from local wholesalers. Last year she borrowed her first loan in amount of $300 to invest in her business. She successfully repaid her first loan and now applies for the second loan in amount of $1000 to buy more food stuff to be sold in the shop.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en: Eldar is a local from the Beylagan district of Azerbaijan. He is married, 47 years old, has 4 children. He has been running his trading shop for 7 years. He has borrowed 4 loans from Normicro to help his business.  He is asking for $1100 loan from Normicro to expand his foodstuff business and to increase the volume and variety of goods. He intends to increase his business turnover.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is a 31 year old local resident of the town of Khachmaz located in the north-east part of Azerbaijan. He is married and has one child. Two years ago he built a small shop in Khachmaz where he sells fruit and vegetables there. He has repaired some part of the shop but he has no own funds to finish the repairing. He applies to Normicro for a loan in amount of $300 to finish repairing.

loans.use: To repair the shop

loans.name: Tamella

texts.en: Tamilla lives in the Beylagan district of Azerbaijan.  She is married and has no children. She has been running her trading counter in the market for several years. She applies for $1100 to buy goods from the wholesale market to help her business in wedding season.

loans.use: to increase volume of inventory

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en: Rahman is a 30 year old local resident of the town of Khachmaz Azerbaijan. He is not married yet. He rents a shop in Khachmaz where he sells foodstuffs. He has been in this business for more than five years. He wants to develop the business and increase the number and variety of goods sold in the shop. For this purpose he applies to Normicro Khachmaz branch for a loan in amount of $300.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Huseyin

texts.en: Huseyin is from Beylagan, Azerbaijan. He is married, 46 years old, has 2 children. He has been engaged in car repair for 15 years.  Huseyin wants to borrow his first loan of $1000 from Normicro to buy spare parts on his own expense and not be dependent on money from clients.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Nahid

texts.en:
Mr. K. is a local inhabitant of Beylagan. He is married and is 31 years old.
He has been in this business for several years. He does furniture repair and manufactures furniture for clients. He has borrowed 4 loans from Normicro and now applies for $800 now to buy materials for repair.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to do furniture

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a low-income inhabitant of Beylagan, Azerbaijan. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a taxi driver. She has her shop near her house. She has been running this business for 6 years. She wants to borrow $1000 from Normicro to increase business volume.  She hopes this investment would improve her family needs reasonably.

loans.use: to increase inventory volume

loans.name: Sahibe

texts.en: Sahibe is 41 years old lives in the Aghsu region of north-east Azerbaijan. She is married and has three children. She rents a shop in Aghsu and sells foodstuffs. She has been in this business for two years. As her business is rather new she wants to increase the variety of goods to be sold and to develop the business. She applies to Normicro to borrow $500 to invest in her business.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods

loans.name: Mehdi

texts.en:
Mehdi is a low-income resident of Beylagan. He is 44, married, and has 3 children.
He has been in business for 20 years. He is asking his first $1200 loan from Normicro to buy car tire disk removing instruments to serve the clients faster and increase his business income.

loans.use: to buy repair instruments

loans.name: Zamig

texts.en: Zamig is a 26 year old local resident of Aghsu, Azerbaijan. He has a pharmacy business for five years. He wants to invest more money in his business and to repair the shop. For this business he applies to Normicro for the first time for a $500 loan.

loans.use: To repair the pharmacy

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar is a 33 year old local resident of Aghsu. He has a small furniture workshop and has two  employees. He is married and has three children. He has been in this business since 2005. He plans to expand his business to produce more furniture. He needs new equipment for his workshop. He applies to Normicro for a $1000 loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy new equipment

loans.name: Henry Alfredo

texts.es:
My name is Henry S. and I'm dedicated to creating paintings. I have had my business for three years. My clientel is very good because I am located in the tourist zone of our community. My goal is to increase my inventory in order to make more paintings. With the increased income that I will obtain, I will be able to feed my family and pay for my children's studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Mi nombre es Henry S., me dedico a la fabricacion de cuadros de pintura, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que estoy ubicado en una zona turistica de nuestra comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para hacer mas cuadros y con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia y pagar los estudios de mis hijos.

loans.use: Purchase canvas, paint, fine and coarse brushes.

loans.name: Angela Estela

texts.es:
My name is Angela G. and I am dedicated to selling bean burritos with chorizo sausage, chicken, sodas, bottled waters, and a variety of pastries and cookies. I have had my business for two years. My clientel is excellent because my sales location is passed by many people since we are in the center of the capital and right next to my spot is the bus stop. I want to increase my inventory of products so that I can have more sales and be able to make a better income, which I need to be able to provide for my home.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Mi nombre es Angela G. me dedico a la venta de burritas de frijoles con chorizo, pollo, refrescos, agua en bolsa y variedad de confites y galletas, tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, mis clientela es muy excelente ya que mi lugar de venta pasa mucha gente porque estamos en el centro de la capital y exactamente a la par de mi puesto esta la parada de buses, deseo incrementar mi inventario de productos para tener mas ventas y asi poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales las necesito para poder sustentar mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase tortillas, chicken, chorizo, sodas, oil, beans, cheese, churros, pastries, bottled water, and cookies.

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
My name is Fermina M.. I am dedicated to making and selling "baleadas" (small burritos). I have had my business for three years. My clientel is very good because my product is a very good quality and has a very good taste. My goal is to make more baleadas and gain a better income, which I need to be able to feed my family and pay for the education of my son.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Mi nombre es Fermina M. me dedico a la produccion y venta de baleadas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que mi producto es de muy buena calidad y un muy buen sabor, mi meta es producir mas baleadas y asi obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales las necesito para poder alimentar mi familia y poder costear la educacion de mi hija.

loans.use: Purchase flour, eggs, beans, oil, margarine, and butter.

loans.name: Lorena Janeth

texts.es:
My name is Lorena P., I sell popular consumer products and I have had my own business for 2 years. My clients are excellent mainly because in my community there are only two stores, one of which is mine. I have high sales but I need to keep product variety so I can offer more to my clients and get more profit. I use the profit to buy food for my family and to maintain my household.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Lorena P. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años, mi clientes son excelentes ya que en mi comunidad solo existen dos pulperias de las cuales una de ellas es la mia, tengo muchas ventas pero necesito tener mayor variedad de productos y asi poder ofrecer mas a mis clientes y tener mayores ganancias las que necesito para poder alimentar mi familia y mantener mi hogar.

loans.use: compra de azucar, frijoles, manteca, pastillas, especias, pan, pan dulce, churros, papel higienico, jabon, arroz, aceite.

loans.name: Gloria Francisca

texts.es:
My name is Gloria T. and I'm dedicated to sell lingerie and underwear for women, men, and children. I started my business a year ago. My sales have been very good because I offer a good quality product. The best of all is that people can afford to buy it because the price can be adjusted to the needs of my customers.

My goal is to have a bigger assortment of products so I can increase my sales. With the earnings of the sales I will be able to feed my family and pay my daughter's school tuition. She is very close to graduate.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Mi nombre es Gloria T. me dedico a la venta de ropa interior par dama, caballero y niños, tengo mi negocio hace un año, mis ventas son muy buenas ya que mi producto es de buena calidad y lo mejor de todo es que la gente lo puede comprar porque el precio se ajusta a las necesidades de mis clientes, mmi meta es tener mas variedad de producto para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias poder alimentar mi familia y pagarle los estudios a mi hija que esta por salir del colegio.

loans.use: Buying lingerie and underwear for women, men, and children.

loans.name: Fanny Yamileth

texts.es:
My name is Fanny R.. I dedicate myself to selling sausages, different types of pig and chicken meats, and milk-derived products. I've had this business for two years and my clients are great because they really like my products. The products are very sanitary and taste good because they come from the Olancho department, where great meats and milk-derived products are produced. My aim is to attain more products because the demand is high and all that I manage to procure sells very fast. With the funds I obtain I will be able to buy a bigger refrigerator to not only preserve more products, but more importantly, to maintain my family.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Fanny R. me dedico a la venta de carnes de res, cerdo, pollo, chorizos, y lacteos en general, tengo mi negocio hace un par de años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que les gusta mucho mi producto, ya que es muy higienico y de muy buen sabor porque es producido en el departamento de Olancho en donde porducen muy buenos lacteos y las carnes son muy buenas, mi proposito es tener mas producto porque la demanda es muy grande y lo que ajusto a comprar se me vende rapido, con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprar un refrigerador mas grande para mantener mas producto y lo mas importante mantener mi familia.

loans.use: The purchase of chicken and pig meats, sausages, tripe, cheese, and butter

texts.id:
O. (33) is a mother of 2. After getting married, she helps her husband who operates a motorcycle taxi that earns about $5 a day. To support her family, she also sells snacks and soft drinks from a kiosk in front of her home. From this kiosk, she earns $4 profit per day. With 16 year trade experience, she is optimistic that she can grow her business. She needs a $125 loan to expand her product offering and fix her husband's motorcycle taxi.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kivva Volunteer

O. (33) adalah ibu dari 2 anak, setelah menikah dia membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai tukang ojek yang berpenghasilan $ 5. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Dia berjualan makanan ringan dan minuman di warung di depan rumahnya dan dari usahanya O. mendapat keuntungan $ 4 per hari , dengan pengalaman berjualan selama 16 tahun, dia optimis dapat mengembangkan usahanya dan sekarang yang dia butuhkan adalah pinjaman sebesar $ 125 untuk menambah produk yang dijualnya dan biaya servis.

loans.use:
$ 75 for Motorcycle taxi repair
$ 50 for kiosk refurbishment

loans.name: Karen Yulissa

texts.es:
My name is Karen O. and I deal in selling creams, lotions, and shampoo. I've been in business for a year and the sales are going well now that I sell my products out of various private and governmental offices in our capital city. I need a bit of money so that I can buy more products and increase my sales. I need the profits to be able to feed my new-born baby daughter. I don't receive any help from her father as I'm a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Karen O. me dedico a la venta de cremas, lociones, shampoo, tengo mi negocio hace un año, mis ventas son muy buenas ya que mi producto lo vento en diferentes oficinas privadas y gubernamentales de nuestra ciudad capital, necesito un poco de capital para poder comprar mas productos y tener mayores ventas las ganancias las necesito para poder alimentar mi hija recien nacida porque no tengo la ayuda del padre ya que soy madre soltera.

loans.use: For the purchase of creams, lotions, and shampoos

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
My name is Victor M., I produce and sell balconies for homes and offices. I have had my business for 5 years my clients are excellent because they like the quality of my work. Currently, I need to buy more material because I have a big project involving many houses and I have used all my capital to buy more material with the profits I will get I can feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

Mi nombre es Victor M. me dedico a la produccion y venta de balcones para casas y oficinas, tengo mi negocio hace 5 años, mis clientes son excelentes ya que les gusta la calidad de mi producto, en estos momentos necesito comprar mas material ya que tengo un proyecto de varias casas y se me ha terminado mi capital para comprar mas material, con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia

loans.use: compra de hierro, equipo de soldadura,  pintura, anticorrosivo,

loans.name: Maria Juventina

texts.es:
My name is Maria F. and I have worked buying and selling paintings for three years. My local customers are loyal because the paintings I sell are beautiful and I also sell to many tourists that come to my community. My goal is to increase my inventory of paintings in order to increase my profits. I need to increase my profits to be able to feed my family and support my household.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria F. me dedico a la compra y venta de cuadros, actividad que realizo desde hace 3 años, mis clientes son muy buenos ya que los cuadros que vendo son muy bonitos ademas que los vendo a muchos turistas que vienen a nuestra comunidad, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario de cuadros y tener mayores ganancias, las que necesito para poder alimentar mi familia y sustentar mi hogar.

loans.use: To purchase paintings.

loans.name: Karen Lisbeth

texts.es:
My name is Karen R. and I teach computer courses. I have had my business for 4 years and it is very profitable because many people in my community like to use computers and want to learn more. I now need to buy new parts for my computers, for example ram memory, power sources and hard drives, because i have numerous computers that are useless because they are in bad shape. With the profits earned because of these improvements I will be able to support my household.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Mi nombre es Karen R. me dedico a imparti cursos de computacion, tengo mi negocio hace 4 años, actividad es muy rentable en nuestra comunidad ya que hay mucha gente que le gusta la computacion y tienen muchos deseos de aprender, en estos momentos necesito comprar repuestos para mis computadoras como ser memorias ram, fuentes de poder y discos duros ya que tengo varias maquinas sin uso porque estan en mal estado, con las ganancias que obtenga poder sustentar mi hogar.

loans.use: To purchase computer parts and accessories

loans.name: Agna Azucena

texts.es:
My name is Agna R. and for a few years I have worked selling sausages. I run my business in my house and I live on the main street in my community so everyone walks by and buys sausages. With the profits from my business I am able to feed my family.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

mi nombre es Agna R. tengo varios años de dedicarme a la venta de embutidos, mi negocio lo tengo en mi casa ya que vivo en la calle principal de mi colonia y todas las personas pasan por aca comprando sus embutidos. con las ganancias que obtenga poder alimentar mi familia

loans.use: To purchase pork meat and sausages.

loans.name: Martha Mirian

texts.es:
My name is Maria del Carmen and I run a restaurant in my house. I cook a very savory tripe soup. I have run this business for many years and it already provides enough income to help cover my family's living and school costs. I need to buy ingredients for my restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Maria del Carmen cuento con un comerdor, ubicado en mi casa de habitacion, preparo una sopa de mondongo que es muy sabrosa, tengo varios años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad, la que genera ingresos para contribuir con los gastos familiares y de estudio de mi familia, necesito abastecer mi negocio.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, tripe, lard, salt and spices.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Hi, my name is Francisca H. S. and I have a small business selling used closed on the streets in my city. I have had this business for a year and a half. Through my work I have been able to help out with my family's food and medical costs. Now I am asking for help to buy more clothing because I want to provide my customers with better service. I would very much appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Hola, Me llamo Francisca H. S., yo tengo un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada en la calles de mi cuidad. Este negocio lo tengo hace un año y medio. Con este negocio he podido ayudar mi familia para gastos de alimentacion y medicamentos. Ahora necesito si me puden ayudar a comprar mas ropa ya que tengo que dar un buen servicio a mis clientes. Le agradecere mucho su ayuda.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
My name is Melania T.. I have a beauty salon, I’ve had this business for approximately 4 years. My business gets quite busy since it is the only one in the area. At present, I need to buy equipment in order to provide a better service to my clients. The profits will help me to support my family and I will be able to hire a person to help me at the beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Melania T. me dedico a mi salon de belleza, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, mi negocio es muy visitado ya que en mi comunidad solo existe un salon de belleza que es el mio, y en estos momentos necesito comprar equipo, para da un mejor servicio a mis clientes, con las ganancias que obtenga alimentar mi familia y poder contratar una persona que me ayude con mi salon.

loans.use: Buy hair dryers, brushes, shampoo, and hairpins.

loans.name: Alba Argentina

texts.es:
My business is the sales of creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo, etc. My best clients are young ladies who work at offices. At this moment, I need to buy merchandise in order to have a bigger inventory and be able to offer my clients a bigger variety and quality. I’m able to support my children’s studies and help with the family’s expenses with the income from this business.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi negocio es la venta de cremas, lociones, perfumes, shampoo, Mis mejores clientas son jovenes que trabajan en oficinas, en estos momentos necesito surtir el inventario para poder ofrecer a mis clientes variedad y calidad. Los ingresos que me genera este negocio son para ayudar a mis hijos en sus estudios y colaborar con los gastos del hogar.

loans.use: Buy creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoos, etc.

loans.name: Argentina

texts.es:
My Name is Argentina D., I have a business of sweets sales at home, and I also sell them at different offices. I have been doing this activity for several years that generates an income to cover my family’s expenses and my children education expenses. I need to invest more in order to satisfy my clients' demands.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi Nombre es Argentina D., cuento con un negocio de venta de golosinas en mi casa habitacion, y tambien lo distribuyo en las diferentes oficinas, tengo varios años de realizar esta actividad la que me genera ingresos para los gastos familiares y gastos de educacion de mis hijos, necesito invertir mas para satisfacer la demanda de clientes.

loans.use: Buy chicken, bananas, beans, oil, salt, spices, and wood.

loans.name: Mirgia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Mirgia R., I’m a merchant. I have business of selling creams, perfumes, shampoos etc. located in downtown. I have been doing this type of activity for several years, which generates an income that allows me to cover my expenses and other commitments with suppliers. I’m a single mother and I’m a senior, thanks to this business I can generate an income for my daily sustenance, which makes me quite happy because I still feel strong and I have a big desire to carry on.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Mirgia R., mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de cremas, perfumes, shampoos etc. ubicado en el centro de mi ciudad, cuento con varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir mis gastos y demas compromisos con los proveedores, soy madre soltera y de la tercera edad, gracias a este negocio puedo generar ingresos para mi sustento diario, lo que me satisface porque todavia me siento fuerte y con deseos de salir adelante.

loans.use: Buy creams, lotions, perfumes, cosmetics, shampoos

loans.name: Victoria Bertilia

texts.es:
My name is Victoria M., I’m a seamstress, my biggest strength is to make women’s clothing. I’ve had my business for 5 years and this generates an enough profit to be able to sustain my family. My goal is to increase my inventories, as well as my production and with the profit I will obtain, I will be able to buy another sewing machine in order to hire a seamstress that will help me manufacture the clothes, also I will be able to sustain my family.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Victoria M., me dedico a todo tipo de costura, mi fuerte es la fabricacion de ropa para damas, tengo 5 años de tener mi negocio y este me genera ganancias para poder sustentar mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mis inventarios asi mismo mi produccion y con las ganancias que obtenga poder comprarme otra maquina de costurar electrica para poder contratar una costurera para que me ayude en la fabricacion de la ropa, tambien poder sustentar a mi familia.

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, spare parts for sewing machine.

loans.name: Martha Lidia

texts.es:
My name is Martha and I make suits for women, blouses, and skirts. I've had my business for 4 years and have many clients because in my region, there are not too many dressmakers, so people come to me to make their clothes. My goal is to be able to increase my profits to be able to remodel my workplace (currently my home) and cover my living costs.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Martha me dedico a la costura de trajes para dama, blusas, faldas, tengo mi negocio hace unos 4 años, tengo muchos clientes ya que en mi vecindario no hay muchas costureras entonces la gente me busca a mi para que les haga sus ropas, mi meta es poder generar mas ganancias para poder remodelar mi lugar de trabajo (casa de habitacion) y cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, sewing machine spare parts

loans.name: Fatou Seye

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the eleven members of the Sant ak Kooluté group, represented by Ms. Fatou Sèye D.. Located in the traditional fishing village of Yoff, Sant ak Kooluté has long specialized in producing the batiks and other vibrant hand-dyed fabrics that are used to make traditional clothing here in Senegal. In addition to their main occupation of cloth-dyeing, the members of Sant ak Kooluté group collaborate in a wide variety of modest income-generating activities, from raising chickens and vegetable gardening to sewing and crafting artisanal dolls. The funding from this loan will be used to expand the Sant ak Kooluté cloth-dyeing business, including the purchase of a greater variety of blank fabrics and dye colors.

This is the Sant ak Kooluté group group's second Kiva loan. They have recently reimbursed their previous loan in full and have applied for a larger loan to continue to expand their cloth-dyeing business. Check out this group's previous journal entries.

Background: Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural micro-enterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance. Visit our website at www.sem-fund.org to learn more!

loans.use: Purchase materials for traditional cloth-dyeing business

texts.id:
T. (23) is an active client of Yamida. She owns a kiosk that sells snacks and soft drinks. T. has been running her business since 6 years ago. Now she lives with her only child and husband who is a goat trader who earns $90 per month. T.'s kiosk earns about $30 to $40 per day. However, she wants to grow her business by getting a $150 loan to expand her kiosk's offering.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

T. (23) adalah client aktif dari Yamida yang memiliki usaha warung yang menjual makanan, minuman ringan dan beberapa kebutuhan pokok, T. menjalankan usahanya sejak 6 tahun yang lalu, sekarang dia tinggal bersama satu orang anak dan suaminya yang juga memiliki usaha jual beli kambing dengan keuntungan setiap bulan $ 90, dari bisnis warungnya tersebut T. mendapat keuntungan sebesar $30 - $ 40 per hari namun dia ingin usahanya itu meningkat dengan pinjaman sebesar $150 untuk memenuhi stok warungnya.

loans.use: Purchase food and drink items to be sold

loans.name: Nuong

texts.en: Mrs. Nuong is 28 years old and her husband is 12 years older. They have two children, one of whom is mute and the other is a student in 8th grade.  Mrs. Nuong has no land for cultivation.  She operates a grocery store from her home, which is the main source of income for her famiL.. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to operate the grocery store. She will repay the loan on a monthL. basis.

loans.use: to run her grocery store
